10295||||||false||||||
<body TEXT="#000000" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" >
<img src=p10295.jpg align=right><h2>Problem A:  Hay Points</h2>
Each employee of a bureaucracy has a <i>job description</i> - a few paragraphs
that describe the responsibilities of the job.  The employee's job description,
combined with other factors, such as seniority, is used to determine his or
her salary.
<p>
The <i>Hay Point</i> system frees the Human Resources department from
having to make an intelligent judgement as to the value of the employee;
the job description is merely scanned for words and phrases that indicate
responsibility.  In particular, job descriptions that indicate control
over a large budget or management over a large number of people yield
high Hay Point scores.
<p>
You are to implement a simplified Hay Point system.  You will be given
a Hay Point dictionary and a number of job descriptions.  For each job
description you are to compute the salary associated with the job, 
according to the system.
<p>
The first line of input contains 2 positive integers:  <i>m &lt;= 1000</i>,
the number of words in the Hay Point dictionary, and <i>n &lt;= 100</i>,
the number of job descriptions.  <i>m</i> lines follow; each contains
a word (a string of up to 16 lower-case letters) and a dollar value
(a real number between 0 and 1,000,000).  Following the dictionary are
the <i>n</i> job descriptions.  Each job description consists of one or more
lines of text; for your convenience the text has been converted to lower case
and has no characters other than letters, numbers, and spaces.  Each job
description is terminated by a line containing a period.
<p>
For each job description, output the corresponding salary computed as
the sum of the Hay Point values for all words that appear in the description.
Words that do not appear in the dictionary have a value of 0.
<h3>Sample Input</h3>
<pre>
7 2
administer 100000
spending 200000
manage 50000
responsibility 25000
expertise 100
skill 50
money 75000
the incumbent will administer the spending of kindergarden milk money
and exercise responsibility for making change he or she will share
responsibility for the task of managing the money with the assistant
whose skill and expertise shall ensure the successful spending exercise
.
this individual must have the skill to perform a heart transplant and
expertise in rocket science
.
</pre>
<h3>Output for Sample Input</h3>
<pre>
700150
150
</pre>

______________________________________________________
10296||||||false||||||
<body TEXT="#000000" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" >
<img src=p10296.jpg align=right>
<h2>Problem B:  Jogging Trails</h2>
Gord is training for a marathon.  Behind his house is a park with a large
network of jogging trails connecting water stations.  Gord wants to find the
shortest jogging route that travels along every trail at least once.
<p>
Input consists of several test cases.
The first line of input for each case contains two positive integers:
<i>n &lt;= 15</i>, the number of water stations, and <i>m &lt 1000</i>, the 
number of trails.  For each trail, there is one subsequent line of
input containing three positive integers:  the first two, between 
1 and <i>n</i>, indicating the water stations at the end points of the trail; 
the third indicates the length of the trail, in cubits.  There may be more
than one trail between any two stations; each different trail is given only 
once in the input; each trail can be travelled in either direction.
It is possible to reach any trail from any other trail by visiting a
sequence of water stations connected by trails.  Gord's route may start 
at any water station, and must end at the same station.  A single line containing 0 follows the last test 
case.
<p>
For each case, there should be one line of output giving the length of
Gord's jogging route.
<h3>Sample Input</h3>
<pre>
4 5
1 2 3
2 3 4
3 4 5
1 4 10
1 3 12
0
</pre>
<h3>Output for Sample Input</h3>
<pre>
41
</pre>

______________________________________________________
10297||||||false||||||
<body TEXT="#000000" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" >
<title>Problem C: Beavergnaw </title>

<h2>Problem C: Beavergnaw </h2>

When chomping a tree the beaver cuts a very specific shape out of the
tree trunk.  What is left in the tree trunk looks like two frustums
of a cone joined by a cylinder with the diameter the same as its
height.  A very curious beaver tries not to demolish a tree but rather
sort out what should be the diameter of the cylinder joining the
frustums such that he chomped out certain amount of wood.  You
are to help him to do the calculations.
<p>
<img align="right" src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/102/p10297a.jpg"  hspace=10 vspace=10>
<img align="left" src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/102/p10297a.jpg"  hspace=10 vspace=10>
We will consider an idealized beaver chomping an idealized tree.  Let
us assume that the tree trunk is a cylinder of diameter <b>D</b> and
that the beaver chomps on a segment of the trunk also of height
<b>D</b>.  What should be the diameter <b>d</b> of the inner cylinder
such that the beaver chmped out <b>V</b> cubic units of wood?  <p>
Input contains multiple cases each presented on a separate line.  Each
line contains two integer numbers <b>D</b> and <b>V</b> separated by
whitespace. <b>D</b> is the linear units and <b>V</b> is in cubic
units. <b>V</b> will not exceed the maximum volume of wood that the
beaver can chomp.  A line with <b>D</b>=0 and <b>V</b>=0 follows the
last case.
<p>
For each case, one line of output should be produced
containing one number rounded to three fractional digits giving
the value of <b>d</b> measured in linear units.

<h3>Sample input</h3>
<pre>
10 250
20 2500
25 7000
50 50000
0 0
</pre>


<h3>Output for sample input</h3>
<pre>
8.054
14.775
13.115
30.901
</pre>


______________________________________________________
10298||||||false||||||
<body TEXT="#000000" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" >
<img align=right src=p10298.jpg>
<h2>Problem D: Power Strings</h2>
Given two strings <i>a</i> and <i>b</i> we define <i>a*b</i> to be
their concatenation.  For example, if <i>a = "abc"</i> and <i>b = "def"</i>
then <i>a*b = "abcdef"</i>.  If we think of concatenation as multiplication,
exponentiation by a non-negative integer is defined in the normal way:
<i>a^0 = " </i> (the empty string) and <i>a^(n+1) = a*(a^n)</i>.
<p>
Each test case is a line of input
representing <i>s</i>, a string of printable characters.
For each <i>s</i> you should print the largest <i>n</i> such that
<i>s = a^n</i> for some string <i>a</i>.  The length of <i>s</i> will
be at least 1 and
will not exceed 1 million characters.  A line containing a period follows the
last test case.
<h3>Sample Input</h3>
<pre>
abcd
aaaa
ababab
.
</pre>
<h3>Output for Sample Input</h3>
<pre>
1
4
3
</pre>

______________________________________________________
10299||||||false||||||
<body TEXT="#000000" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" >
<img src=p10299.jpg align=right>
<h2>Problem E:  Relatives</h2>

Given <i>n</i>, a positive integer, how many positive integers
less than <i>n</i> are relatively prime to <i>n</i>?  Two integers
<i>a</i> and <i>b</i> are relatively prime if there are no integers
<i>x > 1, y > 0, z > 0</i> such that <i>a = xy</i> and <i>b = xz</i>.
<p>
There are several test cases.  For each test case, standard input
contains a line with <i>n &lt;= 1,000,000,000</i>.  A line containing
0 follows the last case.
<p>
For each test case there should be single line of output answering the
question posed above.
<h3>Sample Input</h3>
<pre>
7
12
0
</pre>
<h3>Output for Sample Input</h3>
<pre>
6
4
</pre>

______________________________________________________

<body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=blue style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Problem A<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:24.0pt'>Ecological Premium<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'>Input: </span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
13.5pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>standard input<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'>Output: </span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
13.5pt'>standard output<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'>Time Limit:</span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
13.5pt'> 1 second<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'>Memory Limit: </span></b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'>32 MB</span><span style='font-size:13.5pt'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>German farmers are given a premium depending on
the conditions at their farmyard. Imagine the following simplified regulation:
you know the size of each farmer's farmyard in square meters and the number of
animals living at it. We won't make a difference between different animals,
although this is far from reality. Moreover you have information about the
degree the farmer uses environment-friendly equipment and practices, expressed
in a single integer greater than zero. The amount of money a farmer receives
can be calculated from these parameters as follows. First you need the space a
single animal occupies at an average. This value (in square meters) is then
multiplied by the parameter that stands for the farmer's
environment-friendliness, resulting in the premium a farmer is paid per animal
he owns. To compute the final premium of a farmer just multiply this premium
per animal with the number of animals the farmer owns. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Input</span><o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>The
first line of input contains a single positive integer <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>n (&lt;20)</b>, the number of test cases. Each test case starts with a
line containing a single integer <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>f
(0&lt;f&lt;20)</b>, the number of farmers in the test case. This line is
followed by one line per farmer containing three positive integers each: the
size of the farmyard in square meters, the number of animals he owns and the
integer value that expresses the farmers environment-friendliness. Input is
terminated by end of file. No integer in the input is greater than <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>100000 </b>or less than <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>0</b>.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>For
each test case output one line containing a single integer that holds the
summed burden for Germany's budget, which will always be a whole number. Do not
output any blank lines.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Input</span><o:p></o:p></b></p>

<pre><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>3<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>5<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span style='font-size:
11.0pt'>1 1 1<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>2 2 2<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>3 3 3<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>2 3 4<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>8 9 2<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>3<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span style='font-size:
11.0pt'>9 1 8<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>6 12 1<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>8 1 1<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>3<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span style='font-size:
11.0pt'>10 30 40<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>9 8 5<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>100 1000 70<o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'><!-- ===================== SAMPLE OUTPUT ============================== -->Sample
Output<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:windowtext'>38<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:windowtext'>86<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:windowtext'>7445</span><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Courier;color:windowtext'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Courier;color:windowtext'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</span></div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
color:windowtext'>(The Joint Effort Contest, Problem setter: Frank Hutter)<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Courier;color:windowtext'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

</div>

</body>

</html>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Problem B<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:24.0pt'>Rings and Glue </span><o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>Input: </span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>standard input<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>Output: </span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt'>standard output<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>Time Limit:</span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt'> 1 second<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>Memory Limit: </span></b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>32 MB<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'>Little
John is in big trouble. Playing with his different-sized (and colored!) rings and
glue seemed such a good idea. However, the rings now lay on the floor, glued
together with some-thing that will definitely not come off with water.
Surprisingly enough, it seems like no rings are actually glued to the floor,
only to other rings. How about that!<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'>You
must help Little John to pick the rings off the floor before his mom comes home
from work. Since the glue is dry by now, it seems like an easy enough task.
This is not the case. Little John is an irrational kid of numbers, and so he
has decided to pick up the largest component (most rings) of glued-together
rings first. It is the number of rings in this largest component you are asked
to find. Two rings are glued together if and only if they overlap at some point
but no rings will ever overlap in only a single point. All rings are of the
doughnut kind (with a hole in them). They can however, according to Little
John, be considered &#8220;infinitely thin&#8221;.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt;color:windowtext'>Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'>Input
consists of a number <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>(&gt;0)</b> of
problems. Each problem starts with the number of rings, <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>n</b>, where <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>0 </b></span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;color:windowtext'>&pound; </span></b><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
color:windowtext'>n </span></b><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;
color:windowtext'>&lt; </span></b><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'>100</span></b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'>. After that, <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>n</b> rows follow, each containing a
ring&#8217;s physical attributes. That is, <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>3</b>
floating point numbers, with an arbitrary number of spaces between them,
describing the <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>x</b> coordinate and <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>y</b> coordinate for its center and its
radius. All floating point numbers fit into the standard floating point type of
your favorite programming language<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>
(e.g., </b></span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Courier;mso-bidi-font-family:Courier;
color:windowtext'>float </span></b><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'>for C/C++)</span></b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'>. Input ends with a single
row with the integer <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>-1</b>. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt;color:windowtext'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'>Output
consists of as many grammatically correct answers as there were problems, each
answer, on a separate line, being <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>&#8216;The
largest component contains X ring(s).&#8217;</b> where <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>X</b> is the number of rings in the largest component.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Input</span><o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:Courier;mso-bidi-font-family:Courier;
color:windowtext'>4<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:Courier;mso-bidi-font-family:Courier;
color:windowtext'>0.0 0.0 1.0<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:Courier;mso-bidi-font-family:Courier;
color:windowtext'>-1.5 -1.5 0.5<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:Courier;mso-bidi-font-family:Courier;
color:windowtext'>1.5 1.5 0.5<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:Courier;mso-bidi-font-family:Courier;
color:windowtext'>-2.0 2.0 3.5<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:Courier;mso-bidi-font-family:Courier;
color:windowtext'>3<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:Courier;mso-bidi-font-family:Courier;
color:windowtext'>3.0 2.0 2.0<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:Courier;mso-bidi-font-family:Courier;
color:windowtext'>0.0 -0.5 1.0<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:Courier;mso-bidi-font-family:Courier;
color:windowtext'>0.0 0.0 2.0<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:Courier;mso-bidi-font-family:Courier;
color:windowtext'>5<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:Courier;mso-bidi-font-family:Courier;
color:windowtext'>-2.0 0.0 1.0<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:Courier;mso-bidi-font-family:Courier;
color:windowtext'>1.0 -1.0 1.0<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:Courier;mso-bidi-font-family:Courier;
color:windowtext'>0.0 1.0 0.5<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:Courier;mso-bidi-font-family:Courier;
color:windowtext'>2.0 0.0 1.0<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:Courier;mso-bidi-font-family:Courier;
color:windowtext'>-1.0 1.0 1.0<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:Courier;mso-bidi-font-family:Courier;
color:windowtext'>-1</span><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
color:windowtext'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Output</span><o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Courier;mso-bidi-font-family:Courier;
color:windowtext'>The largest component contains 4 rings.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Courier;mso-bidi-font-family:Courier;
color:windowtext'>The largest component contains 2 rings.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Courier;mso-bidi-font-family:Courier;
color:windowtext'>The largest component contains 3 rings.</span><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</span></div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>(Joint Effort Contest, Problem Source: Swedish
National Programming Contest, arranged by department of Computer Science at
Lund Institute of Technology.)</b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
color:windowtext'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

</div>

</body>

</html>

<title>Problem C - GWCF Contest 2 - Joint Effort Contest</title>

<!--[if gte mso 10]>

<body lang=EN-US link="#772222" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='margin-left:9.0pt;text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Problem C<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='margin-left:9.0pt;text-align:center'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:24.0pt'>Summation of
Polynomials<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='margin-left:9.0pt;text-align:center'><b>Input:
</b>standard input</p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='margin-left:9.0pt;text-align:center'><b>Output:
</b>standard output</p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='margin-left:9.0pt;text-align:center'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Time Limit: </b>1 second<b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'> <o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='margin-left:9.0pt;text-align:center'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Memory Limit: </b>32 MB</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p>The following text was taken from a book of mathematics: </p>

<p style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>The
antidifference of a function <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>f(x)</b> is
the function <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>g(x)</b> such that <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>f(x) = g(x+1)-g(x)</b>. So, if we have a
summation of <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>f(x)</b>, it can be
simplified by the use of its antidifference in the following way: <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-style:
italic'>f(k)+f(k+1)+f(k+2)+...+f(k+n) = <br>
g(k+1)-g(k)+g(k+2)-g(k+1)+g(k+3)-g(k+2)+...+g(k+n+1)-g(k+n) = <br>
g(k+n+1)-g(k) <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p><span style='mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>A factorial polynomial is expressed
as <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>k<span class=GramE>^{</span>n}</b>
meaning the following expression: <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>k *
(k-1) * (k-2) * (k-(n-1))</b>. The antidifference of a factorial polynomial <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>k<span class=GramE>^{</span>n}</b> is <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>k^{n+1}/(n+1)</b>. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p><span style='mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>So, if you want to calculate <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>S_n = p(1)+p(2)+p(3)+...+p(n)</b>, where
p(i) is a polynomial of degree <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>k</b>, we
can express <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>p(i)</b> as a sum of various
factorial polynomials and then, find out the<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>antidifference <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>P(i)</b>. So, we
have <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>S_n = <span class=GramE>P(</span>n+1)
- P(1)</b>. </span></p>

<p><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Example:
<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>S = 2*3 + 3*5 + 4*7 + 5*9 + 6*11 +
... + (n+1)*(2n+1) = <br>
p(1) + p(2) + p(3) + p(4) + p(5) + ... + p(n), where p(i) = (i+1)(2i+1) <br>
</b><br>
Expressing <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>p(i)</b> as a factorial
polynomial, we have: <br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>p(i) = 2(i)^{2} + 5i + 1</b>. <br>
<br>
<span class=GramE><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>P(</b></span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>i) = (2/3) (i)^{3} + (5/2) (i)^{2} + i</b>.
Calculating <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>P(n+1) - P(1)</b> we have <br>
<br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>S = (n/6) * (4n^2 + 15n + 17)</b> </p>

<p>Given a number <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>1 &lt;= x &lt;= 50,000</b>,
one per line of input, calculate the following summation: </p>

<p><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>1 + 8 + 27 + ... + x^3 <o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>

<p style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Input and
Output<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<pre style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'><!-- ===================== INPUT ====================================== -->Input file contains several lines of input. Each line <span
class=GramE>contain</span> a single number which denotes the value of <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>x</b>. Input is terminated by end of file.<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre
style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></pre><pre
style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>For each line of input produce one line of output which is the desired summation value.<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></pre><pre><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt;font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>1<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span style='font-size:
11.0pt'>2<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>3<o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample
Output<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<pre><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>1<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>9<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span style='font-size:
11.0pt'>36<o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>(The Joint Effort Contest, Problem setter: <span
style='color:black;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><a
href="mailto:shahriar@neksus.com?subject=Problem%20F%20(Coupons)%20Clarification"><span
style='color:black;text-decoration:none;text-underline:none'>Rodrigo Malta
Schmidt</span></a></span>)<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<title>Problem D - GWCF Contest 2 - Joint Effort Contest</title>

<body lang=EN-US link="#772222" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Problem D</span></b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:24.0pt'>How Many Trees?<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b>Input: </b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>standard input</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b>Output: </b>standard
output</p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>Memory Limit: </b>32 MB</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='color:black'>&nbsp;</span></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>A binary search tree is a binary tree with root <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>k</b> such that any node <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>v</b> in the left subtree of k has <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>label (v)</b> &lt;<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>label (k)</b> and any node <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>w</b>
in the right subtree of k has <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>label (w)
&gt; label (k)</b>.</p><p> When using binary search trees, one can easily look for a
node with a given label x: After we compare x to the label of the root, either we
found the node we seek or we know which subtree it is in. For most binary search
trees the average time to find one of its n nodes in this way is O(log n).</p>

<p>Given a number <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>n</b>, can you tell
how many different binary search trees may be constructed with a <b>set</b> of
numbers of size <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>n</b> such that each
element of the set will be associated to the label of exactly one node in a
binary search tree? </p>

<p><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Input
and Output<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p>The input will contain a number <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>1
&lt;= i &lt;= 1000</b> per line representing the number of elements of the set.
You have to print a line in the output for each entry with the answer to the
previous question. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample
Input</span></b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<pre><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></pre><pre><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>1<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>2<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span style='font-size:
11.0pt'>3<o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
style='font-size:14.0pt'>&nbsp;</span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Output</span></b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<pre><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>1<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>2<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span style='font-size:
11.0pt'>5<o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>(The Joint Effort Contest, Problem setter: <span
style='color:black;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><a
href="mailto:shahriar@neksus.com?subject=Problem%20F%20(Coupons)%20Clarification"><span
style='color:black;text-decoration:none;text-underline:none'>Rodrigo Malta
Schmidt</span></a></span>)<o:p></o:p></b></p>

</div>

</body>

</html>

10304||||||false||||||
<html xmlns:v="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:vml"
xmlns:o="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office"
xmlns:w="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:word"
xmlns:st1="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags"

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Problem E<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:24.0pt'>Optimal Binary Search Tree<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'>Input: </span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
13.5pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>standard input<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'>Output: </span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
13.5pt'>standard output<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'>Time Limit:</span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
13.5pt'> 30 seconds<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'>Memory Limit:</span></b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'> 32 MB<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>Given a set <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>S
= (e<sub>1</sub>, e<sub>2</sub>, ..., e<sub>n</sub>)</b> of <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>n</b> distinct elements such that <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>e<sub>1</sub> &lt; e<sub>2</sub> &lt; ...
&lt; e<sub>n</sub></b> and considering a binary search tree (see the previous
problem) of the elements of <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>S</b>, it is
desired that higher the query frequency of an element, closer will it be to the
root. </p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>The cost of accessing an element <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>e<sub>i</sub> </b>of <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>S</b> in a tree (<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>cost(e<sub>i</sub>)</b>)
is equal to the number of edges in the path that connects the root with the
node that contains the element. Given the query frequencies of the elements of <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>S</b>, <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>(f(e<sub>1</sub>),
f(e<sub>2</sub>, ..., f(e<sub>n</sub>))</b>, we say that the total cost of a
tree is the following summation: </p>

<p style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>f(e<sub>1</sub>)*cost(e<sub>1</sub>)
+ f(e<sub>2</sub>)*cost(e<sub>2</sub>) + ... + f(e<sub>n</sub>)*cost(e<sub>n</sub>)
<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>In this manner, the tree with the lowest total
cost is the one with the best representation for searching elements of <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>S</b>. Because of this, it is called the
Optimal Binary Search Tree. </p>

<h2>Input</h2>

<p style='text-align:justify'>The input will contain several instances, one per
line. </p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>Each line will start with a number <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>1 &lt;= n &lt;= 250</b>, indicating the
size of <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>S</b>. Following <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>n</b>, in the same line, there will be <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>n</b> non-negative integers representing
the query frequencies of the elements of S: <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>f(e<sub>1</sub>), f(e<sub>2</sub>), ..., f(e<sub>n</sub>). 0 &lt;= <span
class=GramE>f(</span>e<sub>i</sub>) &lt;= 100.</b><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Input is terminated by end of file.</p>

<h2>Output</h2>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>For each instance of the input,
you must print a line in the output with the total cost of the Optimal Binary
Search Tree.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<h2>Sample Input</h2>

<pre><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>1 5<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>3 10 10 10<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>3 5 10 20<o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Courier;color:windowtext'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<h2 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>Sample
Output</h2>

<pre><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>0<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>20<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span style='font-size:
11.0pt'>20<o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</span></div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
color:windowtext'>(The Joint Effort Contest, Problem setter: Rodrigo </span></b><st1:country-region><st1:place><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
  color:windowtext'>Malta</span></b></st1:place></st1:country-region><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
color:windowtext'> Schmidt)<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

</div>

</body>

</html>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Problem F</span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:24.0pt'>Ordering Tasks<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b>Input: </b>standard
input</p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b>Output: </b>standard
output</p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b>Time Limit: </b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>1</span> second<b> </b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b>Memory Limit: </b>32
MB</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='color:black'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>John has n tasks to do.
Unfortunately, the tasks are not independent and the execution of one task is only
possible if other tasks have already been executed. </p>

<p style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>The input will consist of several instances of
the problem. Each instance begins with a line containing two integers, <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>1 &lt;= n &lt;= 100</b> and <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>m</b>. <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>n</b>
is the number of tasks (numbered from <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>1</b>
to <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>n</b>) and <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>m</b> is the number of direct precedence relations between tasks. After
this, there will be <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>m</b> lines with two
integers <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>i</b> and <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>j</b>, representing the fact that task <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>i</b> must be executed before task <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>j</b>.
An instance with <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>n = m = 0</b> will
finish the input. </p>

<p style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<h3><span style='font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>For each instance,
print a line with </span>n<span style='font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'> integers representing the tasks in a possible order of execution. <o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<h3><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<pre>5 4</pre><pre>1 2</pre><pre>2 3</pre><pre>1 3</pre><pre>1 5</pre><pre>0 0</pre>

<h3 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Output<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<pre>1 4 2 5 3</pre>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>(The Joint Effort Contest, Problem setter:
Rodrigo </b><st1:country-region><st1:place><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Malta</b></st1:place></st1:country-region><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'> Schmidt)<o:p></o:p></b></p>

</div>

</body>

</html>

<title>Problem G - GWCF Contest 2 - Joint Effort Contest</title>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoTitle>Problem G</p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:24.0pt'>e-Coins<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'>Input: </span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
13.5pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>standard input<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'>Output: </span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
13.5pt'>standard output<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'>Time Limit:</span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
13.5pt'> 10 seconds<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'>Memory Limit: </span></b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'>32 MB</span></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>At the Department for Bills and Coins, an
extension of today's monetary system has newly been proposed, in order to make it
fit the new economy better. A number of new so called e-coins will be produced,
which, in addition to having a value in the normal sense of today, also have an
InfoTechnological value. The goal of this reform is, of course, to make justice
to the economy of numerous dotcom companies which, despite the fact that they
are low on money surely have a lot of <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>IT</b>
inside. All money of the old kind will keep its conventional value and get zero
InfoTechnological value. </p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>To successfully make value comparisons in the new
system, something called the e-modulus is introduced. This is calculated as <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>SQRT(X*X+Y*Y)</b>, where <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>X</b> and <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>Y</b> hold the sums of the conventional and InfoTechnological values
respectively. For instance, money with a conventional value of <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>$3</b> altogether and an InfoTechnological
value of <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>$4</b> will get an e-modulus of
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>$5</b>. Bear in mind that you have to
calculate the sums of the conventional and InfoTechnological values separately
before you calculate the e-modulus of the money. </p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>To simplify the move to e-currency, you are
assigned to write a program that, given the e-modulus that shall be reached and
a list of the different types of e-coins that are available, calculates the
smallest amount of e-coins that are needed to exactly match the e-modulus.
There is no limit on how many e-coins of each type that may be used to match
the given e-modulus. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Input</span><o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'>A
line with the number of problems <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>n
(0&lt;n&lt;=100)</b>, followed by <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>n</b>
times: <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<ul type=disc>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='color:windowtext;mso-margin-top-alt:auto;
     mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo3;tab-stops:list .5in'><span
     style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>A line with the integers <b
     style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>m (0&lt;m&lt;=40)</b> and <b
     style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>S (0&lt;S&lt;=300)</b>, where <b
     style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>m</b> indicates the number of
     different e-coin types that exist in the problem, and <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
     normal'>S</b> states the value of the e-modulus that shall be matched
     exactly. <o:p></o:p></span></li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='color:windowtext;mso-margin-top-alt:auto;
     mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo3;tab-stops:list .5in'><b
     style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>m</span></b><span
     style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'> lines, each consisting of one pair of
     non-negative integers describing the value of an e-coin. The first number
     in the pair states the conventional value, and the second number holds the
     InfoTechnological value of the coin. <o:p></o:p></span></li>
</ul>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt;color:windowtext'>When more than one number is present on a line, they
will be separated by a space. Between each problem, there will be one blank
line. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt;color:windowtext'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>The output consists of <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>n</b> lines. Each line contains either a
single integer holding the number of coins necessary to reach the specified
e-modulus <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>S</b> or, if <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>S</b> cannot be reached, the string <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>&quot;not possible&quot;</b>.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Input:</span><o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
color:windowtext'>3</span><span style='font-size:11.0pt;color:windowtext'> <br>
</span><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:windowtext'>2
5</span><span style='font-size:11.0pt;color:windowtext'> <br>
</span><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:windowtext'>0
2</span><span style='font-size:11.0pt;color:windowtext'> <br>
</span><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:windowtext'>2
0</span><span style='font-size:11.0pt;color:windowtext'> <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:windowtext'>3 20</span><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;color:windowtext'> <br>
</span><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:windowtext'>0
2</span><span style='font-size:11.0pt;color:windowtext'> <br>
</span><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:windowtext'>2
0</span><span style='font-size:11.0pt;color:windowtext'> <br>
</span><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:windowtext'>2
1</span><span style='font-size:11.0pt;color:windowtext'> <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:windowtext'>3 5</span><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;color:windowtext'> <br>
</span><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:windowtext'>3
0</span><span style='font-size:11.0pt;color:windowtext'> <br>
</span><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:windowtext'>0
4</span><span style='font-size:11.0pt;color:windowtext'> <br>
</span><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:windowtext'>5
5</span><span style='font-size:11.0pt;color:windowtext'> <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Output:</span></b><b><span style='font-size:
10.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><tt><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>not possible</span></tt><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>
<br>
</span><tt><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>10</span></tt><span style='font-size:
11.0pt'> <br>
</span><tt><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>2</span></tt><span style='font-size:
11.0pt;font-family:Courier;color:windowtext'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Courier;color:windowtext'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</span></div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>(Joint Effort Contest, Problem Source:
Swedish National Programming Contest, arranged by department of Computer
Science at Lund Institute of Technology.)</b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt;color:windowtext'><o:p></o:p></span></p>
<br>

<style>
 /* Style Definitions */
 table.MsoNormalTable
	{mso-style-name:"Table Normal";
	mso-tstyle-rowband-size:0;
	mso-tstyle-colband-size:0;
	mso-style-noshow:yes;
	mso-style-parent:" ;
	mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;
	mso-para-margin:0in;
	mso-para-margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	font-size:10.0pt;
	font-family:"Times New Roman";}
</style>
<![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="13314"/>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->
</head>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Problem H</span></b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:24.0pt'>Killing Aliens in Borg Maze<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b>Input: </b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>standard input</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b>Output:<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span></b>standard output</p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>Time Limit: </b>3 seconds</p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>Memory Limit: </b>32 MB</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='color:black'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>The Borg is an immensely powerful race of
enhanced humanoids from the delta quadrant of the galaxy. The Borg collective
is the term used to describe the group consciousness of the Borg civilization.
Each Borg individual is linked to the collective by a sophisticated subspace
network that insures each member is given constant supervision and guidance. </p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>Your task is to help the Borg (yes, really) by
developing a program which helps the Borg to estimate the minimal cost of
scanning a maze for the assimilation of aliens hiding in the maze, by moving in
north, west, east, and south steps. The tricky thing is that the beginning of the
search is conducted by a large group of over <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>100</b> individuals. Whenever an alien is assimilated, or at the
beginning of the search, the group may split in two or more groups (but their
consciousness is still collective.). The cost of searching a maze is defined as
the total distance covered by all the groups involved in the search together.
That is, if the original group walks five steps, then splits into two groups
each walking three steps, the total distance is <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>11=5+3+3</b>. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Input</span></b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>On the first line of input there is one integer, <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>N</span></b>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>&lt;= 50</b>, giving the number of test
cases in the input. Each test case starts with a line containing two integers <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>x</span>,
<span style='mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>y</span></b> such that <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>1 &lt;= x, <i>y</i> &lt;= 50</b>. After
this, <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-style:
italic'>y</span></b> lines follow, each which <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>x</span></b> characters. For
each character, a space `` '' stands for an open space, a hash mark <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>``#''</b> stands for an obstructing wall,
the capital letter ``<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>A''</b> stand for
an alien, and the capital letter <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>``S''</b>
stands for the start of the search. The perimeter of the maze is always closed,
i.e., there is no way to get out from the coordinate of the <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>``S''</b>. At most <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>100</b> aliens are present in the maze, and everyone is reachable. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Output</span></b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>For every test case, output one
line containing the minimal cost of a successful search of the maze leaving no
aliens alive.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample
Input</span></b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<pre><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>2<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>6 5<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>##### <o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>#A#A##<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'># # A#<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>#S<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>##<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>##### <o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>7 7<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>#####<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span><o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>#AAA###<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>#<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>    </span>A#<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'># S ###<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>#<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>     </span>#<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>#AAA###<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>#####<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span><o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
style='font-size:14.0pt'>&nbsp;</span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Output</span></b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>8<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>11<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
color:black'>(Joint Effort Contest, Problem Source: Swedish National
Programming Contest, arranged by department of Computer Science at Lund
Institute of Technology.)</span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

</div>

</body>

<title>Problem I - GWCF Contest 2 - Joint Effort Contest</title>

<!--[if gte mso 10]>

 table.MsoNormalTable

	mso-tstyle-rowband-size:0;
	mso-tstyle-colband-size:0;

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Problem I</span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:24.0pt'>Roads in the North<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b>Input: </b>standard
input</p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b>Output: </b>standard
output</p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b>Time Limit: </b>2
seconds<b> </b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b>Memory Limit: </b>32
MB</p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Building and maintaining roads
among communities in the far North is an expensive business. With this in mind,
the roads are built in such a way that there is only one route from a village
to a village that does not pass through some other village twice. </p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>Given is an area in the far North comprising a
number of villages and roads among them such that any village can be reached by
road from any other village. Your job is to find the road distance between the
two most remote villages in the area. </p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>The area has up to <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>10,000</b> villages connected by road segments. The villages are
numbered from <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>1</b>. </p>

<p><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Input</span></b></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>The input contains several sets of input. Each
set of input is a sequence of lines, each containing three positive integers:
the number of a village, the number of a different village, and the length of
the road segment connecting the villages in kilometers. All road segments are
two-way. Two consecutive sets are separated by a blank line.</p>

<p><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Output</span></b></p>

<h3 style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-weight:normal;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>For each set of input, you are to output a single
line containing a single integer: the road distance between the two most remote
villages in the area. <o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<h3><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Input</span></h3>

<pre><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>5 1 6<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>1 4 5<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>6 3 9<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>2 6 8<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>6 1 7<o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<h3 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Output<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<pre><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>22<o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<pre><b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'>(Joint Effort Contest, Source: University of Alberta Local Contest)</span></b></pre></div>

</body>

</html>

<!--[if gte mso 10]>

	{mso-style-name:"Table Normal";
	mso-tstyle-rowband-size:0;
	mso-tstyle-colband-size:0;
