<![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="9218"/>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->
</head>

<body lang=EN-US link="#772222" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Problem J<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-size:24.0pt'>Turn the Lights Off</span></b><span style='font-size:
24.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b>Input: </b>standard
input</p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b>Output: </b>standard
output</p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>Time Limit: </b>3 seconds<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'> <o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>Memory Limit: </b>32 MB</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>Since we all rely on mother earth, it's our duty
to save her. Therefore, you're now asked to save energy by switching lights
off. <o:p></o:p></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'><!-- ===================== PROBLEM ==================================== -->A
friend of yours has the following problem in his job. There's a grid of size <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>10x10</b>, where each square has a light
bulb and a light switch attached to it. Unfortunately, these lights don't work
as they are supposed to. Whenever a switch is pressed, not only its own bulb is
switched, but also the ones left, right, above and under it. Of course if a
bulb is on the edge of the grid, there are fewer bulbs switched.</p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>When a light switches it means it's now on if it
was off before and it's now off if it was on before. Look at the following
examples, which show only a small part of the whole grid. They show what
happens if the middle switch is pressed. &quot;<code><span style='font-size:
10.0pt'>O</span></code>&quot; stands for a light that's on, &quot;<code><span
style='font-size:10.0pt'>#</span></code>&quot; stands for a light that's off.</p>

<pre>###<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>      </span>#O#</pre><pre>###<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>-&gt;<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>OOO</pre><pre>###<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>      </span>#O#</pre><pre><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></pre><pre>###<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>    </span><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>#O#</pre><pre>OOO<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>-&gt;<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>###</pre><pre>###<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>      </span>#O#</pre>

<p style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>Your
friend loves to save energy and asks you to write a program that finds out if
it is possible to turn all the lights off and if possible then how many times
he has to press switches in order to turn all the lights off.<o:p></o:p></p>

<h3 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
lang=EN-GB style='font-size:18.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:
EN-GB'><!-- ===================== INPUT ====================================== -->Input<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<h3 style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>There are several test cases in the input. Each test case is preceded by
a single word that gives a name for the test case. After that name there follow
</span><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman"'>10</span><span
style='font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'> lines, each of which contains a 10-letter string consisting of </span><span
style='font-family:"Times New Roman"'>&quot;</span><code><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>#</span></code><span
style='font-family:"Times New Roman"'>&quot;</span><span style='font-family:
"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'> and </span><span
style='font-family:"Times New Roman"'>&quot;</span><code><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>O</span></code><span
style='font-family:"Times New Roman"'>&quot;</span><span style='font-family:
"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>. The end of
the input is reached when the name string is </span><span style='font-size:
12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>&quot;<code><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:
12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>end</span></code>&quot;</span><span
style='font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>. <o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<h3 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
lang=EN-GB style='font-size:18.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:
EN-GB'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<p style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>For
every test case, print one line that consists of the test case name, a single
space character and the minimum number of times your friend has to press a switch.
If it is not possible to switch off all the lights or requires more than <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>100</b> presses then the case name should
be followed by space and then a <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>-1</b>. <o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB style='font-size:18.0pt;
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><!-- ===================== SAMPLE INPUT =============================== -->Sample
Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<pre><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>all_off<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>##########<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>##########<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>##########<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>##########<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>##########<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>##########<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>##########<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>##########<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>##########<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>##########<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>all_on<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>OOOOOOOOOO<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>OOOOOOOOOO<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>OOOOOOOOOO<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>OOOOOOOOOO<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>OOOOOOOOOO<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>OOOOOOOOOO<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>OOOOOOOOOO<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>OOOOOOOOOO<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>OOOOOOOOOO<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>OOOOOOOOOO<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>simple<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>#O########<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>OOO#######<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>#O########<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>####OO####<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>###O##O###<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>####OO####<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>##########<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>########O#<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>#######OOO<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>########O#<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>end<o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<!-- ===================== SAMPLE OUTPUT ============================== -->

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB style='font-size:18.0pt;
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>Sample Output<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<pre><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>all_off 0<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>all_on 44<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>simple 4<o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>(The Joint Effort Contest, Problem setter: <span
style='color:black;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Stefan</span> Pochmann)<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-family:"Courier New"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

</body>

<body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=blue style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Problem K<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:24.0pt'>Dog and Gopher<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b>Input: </b>standard
input</p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b>Output: </b>standard
output</p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>Time Limit: </b>1 second<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'> <o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>Memory Limit: </b>32 MB</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>A large field has a gopher and a
dog. The dog wants to eat the gopher, while the gopher wants to run to safety
through one of several gopher holes dug in the surface of the field. </p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>Neither the dog nor the gopher is a math major;
however, neither is entirely stupid. The gopher decides on a particular gopher
hole and heads for that hole in a straight line at a fixed speed. The dog, which
is very good at reading body language, anticipates which hole the gopher has
chosen, and heads at double the speed of the gopher to the hole, where it
intends to gobble up the gopher. If the dog reaches the hole first, the gopher
gets gobbled; otherwise, the gopher escapes. </p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>You have to select a hole for the gopher through
which it can escape, if such a hole exists. </p>

<p style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
lang=EN style='font-size:18.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>The input file contains several sets of input.
The first line of each set contains one integer and four floating point
numbers. The integer <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>n</b> denotes how
many holes are in the set and the four floating point numbers denote the <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>(x,y)</b> coordinates of the gopher
followed by the <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>(x,y)</b> coordinates of
the dog. Subsequent <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>n</b> lines of input
each contain two floating point numbers: the <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>(x, y)</b> coordinates of a gopher hole. All distances are in meters;
to the nearest <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>mm</b>. Input is
terminated by end of file. There is a blank line between two consecutive sets.</p>

<p style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
lang=EN style='font-size:18.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'><a name=SECTION00011000000000000000>Your should
output a single line for each set of input. For each set, if the gopher can
escape the output line should read <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>&quot;The
gopher can escape through the hole at (<i>x</i></b></a><span class=GramE><span
style='mso-bookmark:SECTION00011000000000000000'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>,<i>y</i></b></span></span><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION00011000000000000000'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>).&quot;</b> identifying the appropriate
hole to the nearest mm. Otherwise the output line should read <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>&quot;The gopher cannot escape.&quot;</b>
If the gopher may escape through more than one hole, report the one that
appears first in the input. There are not more than <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>1000</b> gopher holes in a set of input and all coordinates are between
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>-10000</b> and <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>+10000</b>. </span></p>

<h2><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION00011000000000000000'><span lang=EN
style='mso-ansi-language:EN'>Sample Input:</span></span><span lang=EN
style='mso-ansi-language:EN'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<pre><a name=SECTION00012000000000000000><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>1 1.000 1.000 2.000 2.000<o:p></o:p></span></a></pre><pre><span
style='mso-bookmark:SECTION00012000000000000000'><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>1.500 1.500<o:p></o:p></span></span></pre><pre><span
style='mso-bookmark:SECTION00012000000000000000'><span style='font-size:11.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></span></pre><pre><span
style='mso-bookmark:SECTION00012000000000000000'><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>2 2.000 2.000 1.000 1.000<o:p></o:p></span></span></pre><pre><span
style='mso-bookmark:SECTION00012000000000000000'><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>1.500 1.500<o:p></o:p></span></span></pre><pre><span
style='mso-bookmark:SECTION00012000000000000000'><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>2.500 2.500<o:p></o:p></span></span></pre>

<h2 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='mso-bookmark:SECTION00012000000000000000'><span lang=EN
style='mso-ansi-language:EN'>Sample Output</span></span><span lang=EN
style='mso-ansi-language:EN'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<pre><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>The gopher cannot escape.<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>The gopher can escape through the hole at (2.500,2.500).<o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
lang=EN style='mso-ansi-language:EN'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</span></div>

<pre><b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'>(Joint Effort Contest, Source: Waterloo ACM Programming Contest)</span></b></pre>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

</div>

</body>

</html>

<body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=blue style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Problem L<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:24.0pt'>Goldbach and Euler<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'>Input: </span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
13.5pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>standard input<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'>Output: </span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
13.5pt'>standard output<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'>Time Limit:</span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
13.5pt'> 40 seconds</span><span style='font-size:13.5pt'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>Memory Limit: </b>40 MB</p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>That every number which is
resolvable into two prime numbers can be resolved into as many prime numbers as
you like, can be illustrated and confirmed by an observation which you have
formerly communicated to me, namely that every even number is a sum of two
primes, and since <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>(<var><span
style='font-style:normal;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>n</span></var>-2)</b> is
also a sum of two prime numbers, <var><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-style:normal;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>n</span></b></var> must be
a sum of three, and also four prime numbers, and so on. If, however, <var><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-style:normal;mso-bidi-font-style:
italic'>n</span></b></var> is an odd number, then it is certainly a sum of
three prime numbers, since <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>(<var><span
style='font-style:normal;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>n</span></var>-1)</b> is a
sum of two prime numbers, and can therefore be resolved into as many prime
numbers as you like. However, that every number is a sum of two primes, I
consider a theorem which is quite true, although I cannot demonstrate it.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><cite><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></b></cite></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><cite><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>-- Euler to Goldbach, 1742<o:p></o:p></b></cite></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>The above conjecture about all numbers being the
sum of two primes (where <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>1</b> counts as
a prime) is not always true, but it is more true for even numbers. Your task is
to test the conjecture for specified integers, considering that prime numbers
are the numbers which are positive and divisible by exactly two positive
integers. Your program must be very efficient.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Input</span><o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>The input file contains <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>100000</b> lines of input. Each line contains a single integer <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>n (0&lt;n&lt;=100000000)</b>. Input is
terminated by end of file.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>For
each line of input produce one line of output. This line should be of one of
the following types:</p>
<br>
<pre>
n is not the sum of two primes!
n is the sum of p1 and p2.
</pre>
<pre><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>For the second case, always make sure that <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>(p2-p1)</b> is positive and minimized.<o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Input</span><o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:windowtext'>11<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:windowtext'>12<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Output<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<pre>
11 is not the sum of two primes!
12 is the sum of 5 and 7.
</pre>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Courier;color:windowtext'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</span></div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
color:windowtext'>(The Joint Effort Contest, Problem setter: Shahriar Manzoor,
idea from a </span></b><st1:City><st1:place><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
  normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'>Waterloo</span></b></st1:place></st1:City><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
color:windowtext'> Problem)<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

</div>

</body>

</html>

______________________________________________________

<style>
<!--

	{margin:0in;

	text-align:justify;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	font-size:12.0pt;
	mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
	font-family:"Times New Roman";

	mso-bidi-font-weight:bold;}

	{mso-bidi-font-style:normal;}

	{mso-margin-top-alt:auto;
	margin-right:0in;
	mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
	margin-left:0in;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	font-size:12.0pt;
	font-family:"Times New Roman";
	mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";}
pre
	{margin:0in;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt;
	font-size:10.0pt;
	font-family:"Courier New";
	mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";}
tt
	{font-family:"Courier New";
	mso-ascii-font-family:"Courier New";
	mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
	mso-hansi-font-family:"Courier New";
	mso-bidi-font-family:"Courier New";}
p.Preformatted, li.Preformatted, div.Preformatted
	{mso-style-name:Preformatted;
	margin:0in;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;

</style>
<!--[if gte mso 10]>
<style>
 /* Style Definitions */
 table.MsoNormalTable
	{mso-style-name:"Table Normal";
	mso-tstyle-rowband-size:0;
	mso-tstyle-colband-size:0;
	mso-style-noshow:yes;
	mso-style-parent:" ;

	{mso-style-name:"Table Grid";

  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->
</head>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Problem A<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:24.0pt'>Expression Bracketing</span><o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>Input: </span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>standard input<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>Output: </span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt'>standard output<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>Time Limit:</span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt'> 1 second<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>Memory Limit: </span></b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>32 MB<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'>In
this problem you will have to find in how many ways <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>n</b> letters can be bracketed so that the bracketing is non-binary
bracketing. For example <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>4</b> letters
have <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>11</b> possible bracketing:<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'>xxxx, (xx)xx, x(xx)x, xx(xx),
(xxx)x, x(xxx), ((xx)x)x, (x(xx))x, (xx)(xx), x((xx)x), x(x(xx))</span></b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'>. Of these the first six
bracketing are not binary. Given the number of letters you will have to find
the total number of non-binary bracketing. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt;color:windowtext'>Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'>The
input file contains several lines of input. Each line contains a single integer
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>n (0&lt;n&lt;=26)</b>. Input is
terminated by end of file.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt;color:windowtext'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt;color:windowtext'>For each line of input produce one line of output
which denotes the number of non binary bracketing with <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>n</b> letters. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Input</span><o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>3<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>4<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>5<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>10<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Output</span><o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:windowtext'>1<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:windowtext'>6<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:windowtext'>31<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:windowtext'>98187<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</span></div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
color:windowtext'>(The Decider Contest, Problem setter: Shahriar Manzoor)<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Problem B<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:24.0pt'>Pay the Price </span><o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>Input: </span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>standard input<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>Output: </span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt'>standard output<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>Time Limit:</span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt'> 2 seconds<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>Memory Limit: </span></b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>32 MB<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'>In
ancient days there was a country whose people had very interesting habits. Some
of them were lazy, some were very rich, some were very poor and some were
miser. Obviously, some of the rich were miser (A poor was never miser as he had
little to spend) and lazy but the poor were lazy as well (As the poor were lazy
they remained poor forever). The following things were true for that country<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.25in;
mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2;tab-stops:list .5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><![if !supportLists]><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
color:windowtext'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>a)<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
color:windowtext'>As the rich were miser, no things price was more than <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>300</b> dollars (Yes! their currency was
dollar).<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.25in;
mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2;tab-stops:list .5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><![if !supportLists]><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
color:windowtext'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>b)<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
color:windowtext'>As all people were lazy, the price of everything was integer
(There were no cents and so beggars always earned at least one dollar)<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.25in;
mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2;tab-stops:list .5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><![if !supportLists]><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
color:windowtext'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>c)<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
color:windowtext'>The values of the coins were from <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>1</b> to <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>300</b> dollars, so
that the rich (who were idle) could pay any price with a single coin.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'>Your
job is to find out in how many ways one could pay a certain price using a limited
number of coins (Note that the number of coins paid is limited but not the
value or source. I mean there was infinite number of coins of all values). For
example, by using three coins one can pay six dollars in <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>3</b> ways, <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>1+1+4</b>, <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>1+2+3</b>, <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>and 2+2+2</b>. Similarly, one can pay <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>6</b> dollars using <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>6</b> coins
or less in <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>11</b> ways.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt;color:windowtext'>Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'>The
input file contains several lines of input. Each line of input may contain <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>1</b>, <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>2</b>
or <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>3</b> integers. The first integer is
always <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>N (0&lt;=N&lt;=300)</b>, the
dollar amount to be paid. All other integers are less than <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>1001</b> and non-negative.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;</span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt;color:windowtext'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'>For
each line of input you should output a single integer.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'>When
there is only one integer <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>N</b> as
input, you should output in how many ways <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>N</b>
dollars can be paid.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'>When
there are two integers <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>N</b> and <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>L1</b> as input, then you should output in
how many ways <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>N</b> dollars can be paid
using <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>L1</b> or less coins.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'>When
there are three integers <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>N</b>, <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>L1</b> and <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>L2</b> as input, then you should output in how many ways <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>N</b> dollars can be paid using <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>L1</b>, <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>L1+1</b> &#8230;, <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>L2</b> coins (summing
all together). Remember that <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>L1</b> is not
greater than <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>L2</b>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Input</span><o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>6<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>6 3<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>6 2 5<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>6 1 6<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Output</span><o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:windowtext'>11<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:windowtext'>7<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:windowtext'>9<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:windowtext'>11<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</span></div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
color:windowtext'>(The Decider Contest, Problem setter: Shahriar Manzoor)<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

</div>

<title>Problem C - GWCF Contest 4 - The Decider</title>

<body lang=EN-US link="#772222" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='margin-left:9.0pt;text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Problem C<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='margin-left:9.0pt;text-align:center'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:24.0pt'>Three Pigs<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='margin-left:9.0pt;text-align:center'><b>Input:
</b>standard input</p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='margin-left:9.0pt;text-align:center'><b>Output:
</b>standard output</p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='margin-left:9.0pt;text-align:center'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Time Limit: </b>2 seconds<b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'> <o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='margin-left:9.0pt;text-align:center'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Memory Limit: </b>32 MB</p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>One day three pigs decide to go to their friend -
Patachok. As their custom they want to give a present to Patachok. Because they
live in forest, three pigs decide to take as much acorns as they can on their
way to Patachok. But a wicked wolf finds out the pigs' plan. So the wolf puts
traps on the pigs' way. You are asked to help the pigs. Note that the forest is
a square <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>(MxM, 1&lt;=M&lt;=11)</b>.
Pigs' house is the leftmost and uppermost cell, Patachok's house in the
rightmost and bottom most cell. <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>&quot;0&quot;</b>
means that there is nothing in the cell, <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>&quot;1&quot;</b>
means that there is one acorn in the cell, <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>&quot;2&quot;</b>
means that there is a trap in the cell. Pig can go from one cell to other if
they have a common side. A pig can't &quot;visit&quot; the same cell twice.
Path of different pigs can be different. Any path begins in cell <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>(1, 1)</b> and ends in cell <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>(N, N)</b>.</p>

<p style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<pre style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'><!-- ===================== INPUT ====================================== -->The first line of input contains a single number <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>N</b> - number of test. The next lines are tests. The first line of each test contains a single number <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>M</b>. The next <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>M</b> lines each contains <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>M</b> numbers (the number found on the <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>j</b>-th position on the <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>i</b>-th line represent a cell <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>(i, j)</b>).<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt;font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre
style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>You should output a single number on a single line for each test - the maximum possible amount of acorns or <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>&quot;-1&quot;</b> (without the quote) if the wolf catch the pigs.<b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><o:p></o:p></b></span></pre><pre><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt;font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>2<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span style='font-size:
11.0pt'>3<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>0 0 1<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>0 1 0<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>0 2 0<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>4<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span style='font-size:
11.0pt'>0 0 0 0<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>2 1 0 0<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>2 1 2 0<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>2 1 2 0<o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample
Output<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<pre><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>2<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>1<o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>(The Decider Contest, Problem setter:
Andreev Konstantin, Nazarov Denis)</b><o:p></o:p></p>

</body>

</html>

 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->
</head>

<body lang=EN-US link="#772222" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Problem D</span></b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:24.0pt'>Poker Hands<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b>Input: </b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>standard input</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b>Output: </b>standard
output</p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>Time Limit: </b>2 seconds</p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>Memory Limit: </b>32 MB</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='color:black'>&nbsp;</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>A poker deck contains <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>52</b> cards - each card has a suit which
is one of clubs, diamonds, hearts, or spades (denoted <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>C</b>, <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>D</b>, <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>H</b>, and <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>S</b> in the input data). Each card also has a value which is one of <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>2</b>, <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>3</b>,
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>4</b>, <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>5</b>, <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>6</b>, <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>7</b>, <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>8</b>,
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>9</b>, <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>10</b>, <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>jack</b>, <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>queen</b>, <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>king</b>, <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>ace</b> (denoted <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, T, J, Q, K, A</b>).
For scoring purposes, the suits are unordered while the values are ordered as
given above, with 2 being the lowest and ace the highest value. </p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>A poker hand consists of <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>5</b> cards dealt from the deck. Poker hands are ranked by the
following partial order from lowest to highest </p>

<ul type=disc>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
     text-align:justify;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo3;tab-stops:list .5in'><b
     style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>High Card:</b> Hands which do not fit
     any higher category are ranked by the value of their highest card. If the
     highest cards have the same value, the hands are ranked by the next
     highest, and so on. </li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
     text-align:justify;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo3;tab-stops:list .5in'><b
     style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Pair:</b> <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
     normal'>2</b> of the <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>5</b> cards in
     the hand have the same value. Hands which both contain a pair are ranked
     by the value of the cards forming the pair. If these values are the same,
     the hands are ranked by the values of the cards not forming the pair, in
     decreasing order. </li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
     text-align:justify;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo3;tab-stops:list .5in'><b
     style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Two Pairs:</b> The hand contains <b
     style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>2</b> different pairs. Hands which
     both contain <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>2</b> pairs are ranked
     by the value of their highest pair. Hands with the same highest pair are
     ranked by the value of their other pair. If these values are the same the
     hands are ranked by the value of the remaining card. </li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
     text-align:justify;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo3;tab-stops:list .5in'><b
     style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Three of a Kind:</b> Three of the
     cards in the hand have the same value. Hands which both contain three of a
     kind are ranked by the value of the <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>3</b>
     cards. </li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
     text-align:justify;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo3;tab-stops:list .5in'><b
     style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Straight:</b> Hand contains <b
     style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>5</b> cards with consecutive values.
     Hands which both contain a straight are ranked by their highest card. </li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
     text-align:justify;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo3;tab-stops:list .5in'><b
     style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Flush:</b> Hand contains <b
     style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>5</b> cards of the same suit. Hands
     which are both flushes are ranked using the rules for High Card. </li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
     text-align:justify;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo3;tab-stops:list .5in'><b
     style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Full House:</b> <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
     normal'>3</b> cards of the same value, with the remaining <b
     style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>2</b> cards forming a pair. Ranked by
     the value of the <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>3</b> cards. </li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
     text-align:justify;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo3;tab-stops:list .5in'><b
     style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Four of a kind:</b> <b
     style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>4</b> cards with the same value.
     Ranked by the value of the <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>4</b>
     cards. </li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
     text-align:justify;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo3;tab-stops:list .5in'><b
     style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Straight flush:</b> <b
     style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>5</b> cards of the same suit with
     consecutive values. Ranked by the highest card in the hand. </li>
</ul>

<p style='text-align:justify'>Your job is to compare several pairs of poker
hands and to indicate which, if either, has a higher rank. </p>

<p><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>The input file contains several
lines, each containing the designation of <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>10</b>
cards: the first <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>5</b> cards are the
hand for the player named <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>&quot;Black&quot;</b>
and the next <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>5</b> cards are the hand
for the player named <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>&quot;White&quot;</b>.
</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal>For each line of input, print a line containing one of the
following three lines:</p>

<pre><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></pre><pre><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>   </span>Black wins.</pre><pre><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>   </span>White wins.</pre><pre><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>   </span>Tie.</pre>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Input</span></b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<pre><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></pre><pre><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>2H 3D 5S 9C KD 2C 3H 4S 8C AH<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>2H 4S 4C 2D 4H 2S 8S AS QS 3S<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>2H 3D 5S 9C KD 2C 3H 4S 8C KH<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>2H 3D 5S 9C KD 2D 3H 5C 9S KH<o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
style='font-size:14.0pt'>&nbsp;</span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Output</span></b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<pre><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>White wins.<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>Black wins.<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>Black wins.<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>Tie.<o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
style='color:black'>(The Decider Contest, Source: Waterloo ACM Programming
Contest)</span></b></p>

</div>

</body>

</html>

</xml><![endif]--><!--[if !mso]><object
 classid="clsid:38481807-CA0E-42D2-BF39-B33AF135CC4D" id=ieooui></object>
<style>
st1\:*{behavior:url(#ieooui) }
</style>
<![endif]-->
<style>
<!--
 /* Font Definitions */

	{font-family:Courier;
	panose-1:2 7 4 9 2 2 5 2 4 4;

	{mso-style-next:Normal;

	mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";}
pre
	{margin:0in;

	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt;

<!--[if gte mso 10]>
<style>
 /* Style Definitions */
 table.MsoNormalTable
	{mso-style-name:"Table Normal";
	mso-tstyle-rowband-size:0;
	mso-tstyle-colband-size:0;
	mso-style-noshow:yes;
	mso-style-parent:" ;
	mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;
	mso-para-margin:0in;
	mso-para-margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	font-size:10.0pt;
	font-family:"Times New Roman";}
table.MsoTableGrid
	{mso-style-name:"Table Grid";
	mso-tstyle-rowband-size:0;
	mso-tstyle-colband-size:0;
	border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
	mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
	mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;
	mso-border-insideh:.5pt solid windowtext;
	mso-border-insidev:.5pt solid windowtext;
	mso-para-margin:0in;
	mso-para-margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	font-size:10.0pt;
	font-family:"Times New Roman";}

 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="20482"/>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->
</head>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Problem E<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:24.0pt'>Airline Hub<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'>Input: </span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
13.5pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>standard input<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'>Output: </span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
13.5pt'>standard output<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'>Time Limit:</span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
13.5pt'> 2 seconds<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'>Memory Limit:</span></b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'> 32 MB<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h2><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-weight:normal'>World Wide Flyer </span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt'>(WWF)</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-weight:
normal'> has landing rights at several airports throughout the world. They wish
to place their central hub at the airport that minimizes the maximum direct
flying distance from the hub to any other airport in the world. <o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></h2>

<h2>Input</h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-weight:normal'>Input file contains
several sets of input. Each set consists of a line containing </span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt'>n &lt;= 1000</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-weight:normal'>, the number of airports. </span><span style='font-size:
12.0pt'>n</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-weight:normal'> lines
follow, each giving the latitude (between </span><span style='font-size:12.0pt'>-90</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-weight:normal'> and </span><span style='font-size:
12.0pt'>+90</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-weight:normal'> degrees)
and longitude (between </span><span style='font-size:12.0pt'>-180</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-weight:normal'> and </span><span style='font-size:
12.0pt'>+180</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-weight:normal'> degrees)
of an airport. The input floating point numbers will not have more than two
digits after the decimal point. Input is terminated by end of file.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></h2>

<h2>Output</h2>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>For each set of input print the
latitude and longitude of the airport that best serves as a hub in a single
line. If there is more than one airport that best serves as a hub print the one
that appears last in the input of the corresponding input set. Your output
should always contain two digits after the decimal point. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<h2>Sample Input</h2>

<pre><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>3<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>3.2 -15.0<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>20.1 -175<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>-30.2 10<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>3<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span style='font-size:
11.0pt'>3.2 -15.0<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>20.1 -175<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>-30.2 10<o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Courier;color:windowtext'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<h2 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>Sample
Output</h2>

<pre><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>3.20 -15.00<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>3.20 -15.00<o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</span></div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>(The Decider Contest, Source: </span></b><st1:City><st1:place><b><span
  style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>Waterloo</span></b></st1:place></st1:City><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'> ACM Programming Contest)</span></b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

</div>

</body>

</html>

w\:* {behavior:url(#default#VML);}
.shape {behavior:url(#default#VML);}

<title>Problem F - GWCF Contest 4 - The Decider</title>
<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <w:WordDocument>
  <w:View>Print</w:View>
  <w:Zoom>90</w:Zoom>
  <w:GrammarState>Clean</w:GrammarState>
  <w:BrowserLevel>MicrosoftInternetExplorer4</w:BrowserLevel>
 </w:WordDocument>
</xml><![endif]-->
<style>
<!--
 /* Style Definitions */
 p.MsoNormal, li.MsoNormal, div.MsoNormal
	{mso-style-parent:" ;
	margin:0in;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	font-size:12.0pt;
	font-family:"Times New Roman";
	mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";}
h2
	{mso-margin-top-alt:auto;
	margin-right:0in;
	mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
	margin-left:0in;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	mso-outline-level:2;
	font-size:18.0pt;
	font-family:"Times New Roman";
	font-weight:bold;}
h3
	{mso-margin-top-alt:auto;
	margin-right:0in;
	mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
	margin-left:0in;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	mso-outline-level:3;
	font-size:13.5pt;
	font-family:"Times New Roman";
	font-weight:bold;}
p
	{mso-margin-top-alt:auto;
	margin-right:0in;
	mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
	margin-left:0in;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	font-size:12.0pt;
	font-family:"Times New Roman";
	mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";}
pre
	{margin:0in;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt;
	font-size:10.0pt;
	font-family:"Courier New";
	mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";}

<!--[if gte mso 10]>
<style>
 /* Style Definitions */
 table.MsoNormalTable
	{mso-style-name:"Table Normal";
	mso-tstyle-rowband-size:0;
	mso-tstyle-colband-size:0;
	mso-style-noshow:yes;
	mso-style-parent:" ;
	mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;
	mso-para-margin:0in;
	mso-para-margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	font-size:10.0pt;
	font-family:"Times New Roman";}
</style>

</head>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Problem F</span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:24.0pt'>Equating Equations<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b>Input: </b>standard
input</p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b>Output: </b>standard
output</p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b>Time Limit: </b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>6</span> seconds<b> </b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b>Memory Limit: </b>32
MB</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='color:black'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal>Read equations with up to <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>16</b> terms and <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>+</b> and <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'></b> operators (not unary) and reorder the
terms (but not the operators) so that the equations hold. For example </p>

<pre><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span></pre><pre><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>   </span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>1 + 2 = 4 - 5 + 6<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>is
not a correct equation but the terms can be rearranged thus so it is: </p>

<pre><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span></pre><pre><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>   </span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>6 + 2 = 4 - 1 + 5<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre>

<p style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>Standard
input consists of several pseudo-equations, one per line. Each pseudo-equation
has up to <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>16</b> integer terms and each
term is less than <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>100</b>. Adjacent
terms are separated by one operator, and spaces always appear surrounding the
terms. There is exactly one = operator in the equation</p>

<p style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>Your
output will consist of one line per input line, with the same operators and the
same terms. The order of the operators must be preserved, but the terms can be
reordered so the equation holds. Any ordering such that the equation holds is
correct. If there is more than one ordering any one of the orderings will do.
If no ordering exists, a line containing </p>

<pre><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>   </span><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>no solution<o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<h3 style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>should be
printed. One space should appear on either side of each operator and there
should be no other spaces. <o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<h3 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<pre><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>1 + 2 = 4 - 5 + 6<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>1 + 5 = 6 + 7<o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<h3 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Output<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<pre><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>6 + 2 = 4 - 1 + 5<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>no solution<o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
style='color:black'>(The Decider Contest, Source: Waterloo ACM Programming
Contest)</span></b></p>

</div>

</body>

</html>
