<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoTitle>Problem G</p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:24.0pt'>Security Panel<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'>Input: </span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
13.5pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>standard input<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'>Output: </span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
13.5pt'>standard output<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'>Time Limit:</span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
13.5pt'> 2 seconds<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'>Memory Limit: </span></b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'>32 MB<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt;color:windowtext'>Advanced Control Mechanisms <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>(ACM)</b> produces sophisticated electronic locks and security devices.
<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'>The
company's most recent invention is a panel of illuminated buttons in <b>r</b>
rows and <b>c</b> columns. The buttons are numbered left-to-right,
top-to-bottom, starting at <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>1</b> in the
upper-left corner. Each button has two states: lit and unlit. Initially, all
buttons are unlit. Pressing a button switches the state of some buttons from
lit to unlit (or vice-versa) according to a <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>3x3</b> pattern. Pressing a button on a panel applies the pattern
centered on that button. To unlock the panel, the buttons must be pressed in
such a way so as to light all of them. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'>For
example, consider the following pattern where pressing a button switches the
state of the button pressed, as well as the button above and the buttons to the
upper and lower left. <o:p></o:p></span></p>
<br><center>
<img width=207 height=210 src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/103/p10318a.jpg" >
</center>
<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>If we use this pattern on a <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>2x3</b> panel, then pressing buttons <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>2</b>, <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>5</b>,
and <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>6</b> will light all the buttons. If
pressed in that order, the state changes of the panel are: (Light green means
lights are off and vice versa)</p>
<center>
<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>
<img width=509 height=127
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/103/p10318a.jpg" >
</center>
<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>


<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Input</span><o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt;color:windowtext'>Each input case will begin with the number of rows and
columns on the panel, <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>1 &lt;= <span
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>r</span>,<span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'> c</span> &lt;= 5</b> alone on a line. The next three lines describe how
pressing a button will affect the nearby lights. This description consists of a
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>3x3</b> character grid, where the
character <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>&quot;*&quot;</b> indicates
that the light in that position switches state (from lit to unlit or from unlit
to lit) while <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>&quot;.&quot;</b> means
its state remains unchanged. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'>Input
ends with <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>0 0</b> alone on a line. <o:p></o:p></span></p>
<br>
<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>For each input case, output <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>&quot;Case #&quot;</b> followed by the
number of the case. If there is no way to turn on all the lights, print <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>&quot;Impossible.&quot;</b> If it is
possible to turn on the lights, output the buttons to be pressed in increasing
order, separated by single space. Output the answer that requires the fewest
number of buttons possible to be pressed. If there is more than one correct
solution, anyone will do.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Input</span><o:p></o:p></b></p>

<pre><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>2 3<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>**.<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>.*.<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>*..<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>4 5<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>.*.<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>***<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>.*.<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>2 2<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>...<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>.**<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>...<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>4 3<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>*.*<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>...<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>..*<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>0 0</span></pre>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Output</span></b><b><span style='font-size:
10.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<pre><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>Case #1<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>2 5 6<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>Case #2<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>2 3 4 7 9 12 14 17 18 19 <o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>Case #3<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>1 3 <o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>Case #4<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>Impossible.<o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Courier;color:windowtext'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</span></div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>(The Decider Contest, Source: </span></b><st1:place><st1:PlaceType><b><span
  style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>University</span></b></st1:PlaceType><b><span
 style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'> of </span></b><st1:PlaceName><b><span
  style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>Alberta</span></b></st1:PlaceName></st1:place><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'> Local Contest)</span></b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Courier;color:windowtext'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

</div>

</body>

<body lang=EN-US link="#772222" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Problem H</span></b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></p>
<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-size:24.0pt'>Manhattan</span></b><span style='font-size:24.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></p>


<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b>Input: </b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>standard input</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b>Output:<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span></b>standard output</p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>Time Limit: </b>1 second</p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>Memory Limit: </b>32 MB</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='color:black'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>You are the mayor of a city with severe traffic problems.
To deal with the situation, you have decided to make a new plan for the street grid.
As it is impossible to make the streets wider, your approach is to make them
one-way (only traffic in one direction is allowed on a street), thus creating a
more efficient flow of traffic.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>The streets in the city form an orthogonal grid - like on <st1:City><st1:place>Manhattan</st1:place></st1:City>
avenues run in north-south-direction, while streets run in east-west-direction.
Your mission is to make all the streets and avenues one-way, i.e. fix the
direction in which traffic is allowed, while maintaining a short driving
distance between some ordered pairs of locations. More specifically, a route in
the city is defined by two street-avenue crossings, the start and goal
location. On a one-way street grid, a route has a legal path if it is possible
to drive from the start location to the goal location along the path passing
streets and avenues in their prescribed direction only. A route does not define
a specific path between the two locations - there may be many possible paths
for each route. A legal path in a one-way street grid is considered simple if
it requires at most one turn, i.e. a maximum of one street and one avenue need
to be used for the path.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>When traveling by car from one location to another, a
simple path will be preferred over a non-simple one, since it is faster.
However, as each street in the grid is one-way, there may always be routes for
which no simple path exists. On your desk lies a list of important routes which
you want to have simple paths after the re-design of the street grid.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>Your task is to write a program that determines if it is
possible to fix the directions of the one-way streets and avenues in such a way
that each route in the list has at least one simple path.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><b><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></b></p>
<center>
<img width=563 height=224 src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/103/p10319.jpg" >
</center>
<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Input</span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>On the first line of the input, there is a single integer <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>n</b>, telling how many city descriptions
that follows. Each city description begins with a line containing three
integers: the number of streets <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>0&lt;S&lt;=30</b>
and avenues <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>0&lt;A&lt;=30</b> in the
street grid, and the number of routes <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>0&lt;m&lt;=200</b>
that should have at least one simple path. The next <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>m</b> lines define these routes, one on each line. Each route
definition consists of four integers, <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>s1</b>,
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>a1</b>, <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>s2</b>, <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>a2</b>, where the start
location of the route is at the crossing of street <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>s1</b> and avenue <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>a1</b>, and
the goal location is at the crossing of street <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>s2</b> and avenue <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>a2</b>. Obviously,
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>0&lt;s1, s2&lt;=S</b> and <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>0&lt;a1, a2&lt;=A</b>.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Output</span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>For each city, your program should output <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>'Yes'</b> on a single line if it is
possible to make the streets and avenues one-way, so that each route has at
least one simple path. Otherwise the text <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>'No'</b>
should be printed on a line of its own.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample
Input</span></b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>3 <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>6 6 2<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>1 1 6 6<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>6 6 1 1<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>7 7 4<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>1 1 1 6<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>6 1 6 6<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>6 6 1 1<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>4 3 5 1<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>9 8 6<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>2 2 4 4<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>4 5 3 2<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>3 4 2 2<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>3 2 4 4<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>4 5 2 2<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>2 1 3 4<b><o:p></o:p></b></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>&nbsp;</span></b><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Output</span></b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>Yes<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>No<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>No<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
color:black'>(The Decider Contest, Problem Source: Swedish National Programming
Contest, arranged by department of Computer Science at Lund Institute of
Technology.)</span></b></p>

</div>

<title>Problem I - GWCF Contest 4 - The Decider</title>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Problem I</span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:24.0pt'>Cow Trouble! Help Please!!<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b>Input: </b>standard
input</p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b>Output: </b>standard
output</p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b>Time Limit: </b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>1</span> second<b> </b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b>Memory Limit: </b>32
MB</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>There are many classic problem
with cows/goats and grass field in the world of mathematics. One of such
problems is shown in the picture (left one) below. A goat is tied at point <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>C</b> which is on the edge of a round field
with a rope of length <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>R</b>. One has to
determine the length <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>R</b> when the cow
can eat <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>50%</b> grass of the round field.
But in this problem we will consider a slightly different scenario which is
shown in the second figure. In a field of infinite area there is a house <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>ABDC</b>. A cow is tied with pillar <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>B</b> of the house with a rope of length <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>R</b>. The length and width of the house is
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>l</b> and <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>w</b>. If the house was not there the cow could eat all the grass in
the round green field (The round green field is a circle of radius <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>R</b>). But the presence of the house will
certainly reduce his ability as the cow cannot enter the house nor can any part
of the rope. You will have to determine the area the cow can now roam around
and eat grass.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>
<center>
<table class=MsoTableGrid border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-layout-alt:fixed;border:none;
 mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-yfti-tbllook:480;mso-padding-alt:
 0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;mso-border-insideh:.5pt solid windowtext;mso-border-insidev:
 .5pt solid windowtext'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0'>
  <td width=295 valign=top style='width:221.4pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
<center><img width=276 height=270
  src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/103/p10320a.jpg" ></center>
  </td>
  <td width=343 valign=top style='width:257.4pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-alt:
  solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
<center><img width=294 height=294
  src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/103/p10320a.jpg" ></center>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:1;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=295 valign=top style='width:221.4pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  border-top:none;mso-border-top-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Fig 1: A classic Problem with a
  Goat</p>
  </td>
  <td width=343 valign=top style='width:257.4pt;border-top:none;border-left:
  none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-right:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-top-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Fig 2: The Current Classic
  Problem with Cow</p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table></center>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Input</span></b></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>The input file contains several lines of input.
Each line contains three floating point numbers <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>l</b>, <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>w</b> and <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>R</b> as described in the problem
statement. All numbers are less than <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>10000</b>.
Input is terminated by end of file. </p>

<br>
<p><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Output</span></b></p>

<h3 style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-weight:normal;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>For each line of input produce one line of output.
This output denotes the area that the cow can cover by not entering the house.
This value should contain ten digits after the decimal point. Output will be
checked with special judge. So you should not worry about very small precision
errors. <o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<h3 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Input<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span><o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<pre><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>10 5 5<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>10 4 8<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></pre><pre><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt;font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Sample Output<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>58.9048622548<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>163.3628179867<o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>(The Decider Contest, Problem setter:
Shahriar Manzoor)<o:p></o:p></b></p>

</div>

</body>

</html>

______________________________________________________
10321||||||false||||||

<body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=blue style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Problem K<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><a
name=SECTION00010000000000000000><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
lang=EN style='font-size:24.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>Polygon intersection</span></b></a><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN style='font-size:24.0pt;
mso-ansi-language:EN'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b>Input: </b>standard
input</p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b>Output: </b>standard
output</p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>Time Limit: </b>1 second<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'> <o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>Memory Limit: </b>32 MB</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p><span lang=EN style='mso-ansi-language:EN'>Given any two arbitrary polygons,
determine their intersection if it exists. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'><a name=30></a><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN style='font-size:18.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN style='mso-ansi-language:EN'>The
input file contains several sets of input.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN style='mso-ansi-language:EN'>Each
set will consist of two polygon description. Each polygon description begins
with a positive integer <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>n</span></b> corresponding to the number of
vertices, followed by <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>n</span></b> lines with each line containing
a pair of integer <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>(<span
style='mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>x</span>,<span style='mso-bidi-font-style:
italic'>y</span>)</b> representing the <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>x</span></b> and <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>y</span></b> coordinates of a
polygon vertex. The vertices will be given in clockwise traversal order and no
two polygon edges would overlap. You should terminate your program if <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i>n</i> &lt; 3</b>. You may assume all
integer input is less than or equal to <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>100</b>.
<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
lang=EN style='font-size:18.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'><a name=SECTION00011000000000000000><span
lang=EN style='mso-ansi-language:EN'>For each set of input follow the follow
the output description below.<o:p></o:p></span></a></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION00011000000000000000'><span
lang=EN style='mso-ansi-language:EN'>If the two convex polygons do not
intersect then print out <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>0</b>.
Otherwise, print out the number of intersecting points of the input polygons,
followed by the points. The output must begin with the bottom leftmost point
and must be listed in lexicographical ordering. Your answers must be rounded up
to two digits after the decimal point<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<h2><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION00011000000000000000'><span lang=EN
style='mso-ansi-language:EN'>Sample Input:</span></span><span lang=EN
style='mso-ansi-language:EN'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<pre><a name=SECTION00012000000000000000><span lang=EN style='font-size:11.0pt;
mso-ansi-language:EN'>3 <o:p></o:p></span></a></pre><pre><span
style='mso-bookmark:SECTION00012000000000000000'><span lang=EN
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>0 0 <o:p></o:p></span></span></pre><pre><span
style='mso-bookmark:SECTION00012000000000000000'><span lang=EN
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>0 2 <o:p></o:p></span></span></pre><pre><span
style='mso-bookmark:SECTION00012000000000000000'><span lang=EN
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>2 2<o:p></o:p></span></span></pre><pre><span
style='mso-bookmark:SECTION00012000000000000000'><span lang=EN
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>4 <o:p></o:p></span></span></pre><pre><span
style='mso-bookmark:SECTION00012000000000000000'><span lang=EN
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>5 5 <o:p></o:p></span></span></pre><pre><span
style='mso-bookmark:SECTION00012000000000000000'><span lang=EN
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>5 10 <o:p></o:p></span></span></pre><pre><span
style='mso-bookmark:SECTION00012000000000000000'><span lang=EN
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>10 10 <o:p></o:p></span></span></pre><pre><span
style='mso-bookmark:SECTION00012000000000000000'><span lang=EN
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>10 5<o:p></o:p></span></span></pre><pre><span
style='mso-bookmark:SECTION00012000000000000000'><span lang=EN
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>4 <o:p></o:p></span></span></pre><pre><span
style='mso-bookmark:SECTION00012000000000000000'><span lang=EN
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>1 1 <o:p></o:p></span></span></pre><pre><span
style='mso-bookmark:SECTION00012000000000000000'><span lang=EN
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>5 1 <o:p></o:p></span></span></pre><pre><span
style='mso-bookmark:SECTION00012000000000000000'><span lang=EN
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>5 5 <o:p></o:p></span></span></pre><pre><span
style='mso-bookmark:SECTION00012000000000000000'><span lang=EN
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>1 5<o:p></o:p></span></span></pre><pre><span
style='mso-bookmark:SECTION00012000000000000000'><span lang=EN
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>4 <o:p></o:p></span></span></pre><pre><span
style='mso-bookmark:SECTION00012000000000000000'><span lang=EN
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>3 0 <o:p></o:p></span></span></pre><pre><span
style='mso-bookmark:SECTION00012000000000000000'><span lang=EN
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>6 3 <o:p></o:p></span></span></pre><pre><span
style='mso-bookmark:SECTION00012000000000000000'><span lang=EN
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>3 6 <o:p></o:p></span></span></pre><pre><span
style='mso-bookmark:SECTION00012000000000000000'><span lang=EN
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>0 3<o:p></o:p></span></span></pre><pre><span
style='mso-bookmark:SECTION00012000000000000000'><span lang=EN
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>0<o:p></o:p></span></span></pre>

<h2 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='mso-bookmark:SECTION00012000000000000000'><span lang=EN
style='mso-ansi-language:EN'>Sample Output</span></span><span lang=EN
style='mso-ansi-language:EN'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<pre><span lang=EN style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>0<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
lang=EN style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>8 <o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
lang=EN style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>1.00 2.00<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
lang=EN style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>1.00 4.00 <o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
lang=EN style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>2.00 1.00 <o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
lang=EN style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>2.00 5.00 <o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
lang=EN style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>4.00 1.00 <o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
lang=EN style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>4.00 5.00 <o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
lang=EN style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>5.00 2.00 <o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
lang=EN style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>5.00 4.00<o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
lang=EN style='mso-ansi-language:EN'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</span></div>

<pre><b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'>(The Decider Contest, Source: </span></b><st1:place><b><span
 style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'>Queens</span></b></st1:place><b><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'> Univ &amp; Univ of </span></b><st1:City><st1:place><b><span
  style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'>Toronto</span></b></st1:place></st1:City><b><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'> Local Contest)</span></b></pre>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

	font-family:"Courier New";
	mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
	mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";}
@page Section1
	{size:8.5in 11.0in;
	margin:.9in .9in .9in .9in;
	mso-header-margin:.5in;
	mso-footer-margin:.5in;
	mso-paper-source:0;}
div.Section1
	{page:Section1;}
 /* List Definitions */
 @list l0
	{mso-list-id:313947855;
	mso-list-type:hybrid;
	mso-list-template-ids:833801734 67698711 67698713 67698715 67698703 67698713 67698715 67698703 67698713 67698715;}

	{mso-level-number-format:alpha-lower;
	mso-level-text:"%1\)";

	mso-level-number-position:left;
	text-indent:-.25in;}
@list l0:level2
	{mso-level-tab-stop:1.0in;
	mso-level-number-position:left;

@list l0:level3
	{mso-level-tab-stop:1.5in;
	mso-level-number-position:left;
	text-indent:-.25in;}

	{mso-level-tab-stop:2.0in;
	mso-level-number-position:left;
	text-indent:-.25in;}

	mso-level-number-position:left;
	text-indent:-.25in;}

	{mso-level-tab-stop:4.5in;
	mso-level-number-position:left;
	text-indent:-.25in;}
ol
	{margin-bottom:0in;}
ul
	{margin-bottom:0in;}
-->
</style>
<!--[if gte mso 10]>
<style>
 /* Style Definitions */
 table.MsoNormalTable
	{mso-style-name:"Table Normal";
	mso-tstyle-rowband-size:0;
	mso-tstyle-colband-size:0;
	mso-style-noshow:yes;
	mso-style-parent:" ;
	mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;
	mso-para-margin:0in;
	mso-para-margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;

	font-family:"Times New Roman";}
table.MsoTableGrid
	{mso-style-name:"Table Grid";
	mso-tstyle-rowband-size:0;
	mso-tstyle-colband-size:0;

	mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
	mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;
	mso-border-insideh:.5pt solid windowtext;
	mso-border-insidev:.5pt solid windowtext;

 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="32770"/>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->
</head>

<body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=blue style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Problem L<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:24.0pt'>The Four in One Stadium<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'>Input: </span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
13.5pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>standard input<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'>Output: </span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
13.5pt'>standard output<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'>Time Limit:</span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
13.5pt'> 3 seconds</span><span style='font-size:13.5pt'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>Memory Limit: </b>32 MB</p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>You all know by now who are
playing the World Cup <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>2002</b> Soccer
Final. The matches of World Cup are held in beautiful stadiums. You can see
some beautiful stadiums below (From Korea, <st1:country-region><st1:place>Japan</st1:place></st1:country-region>,
<st1:country-region><st1:place>Italy</st1:place></st1:country-region> and <st1:country-region><st1:place>Germany</st1:place></st1:country-region>)</p>
<center>
<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>
<img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/103/p10322a.jpg" >
</center><br>
<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>You know that last two matches of
a group are played at the same time to prevent the teams from taking any unfair
advantages. But still there remain some other problems:</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.25in;
mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2;tab-stops:list .5in'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>a)<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span><![endif]>If the last two matches of the same group are played in
two different places they might end in two different times, so last few minutes
of the match which ends later may become excitement free.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.25in;
mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2;tab-stops:list .5in'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>b)<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span><![endif]>Often the team that is certain to go to next round may
willfully want to lose a match to avoid a great opponent (like Brazil, Italy,
Germany etc). In future world cups, teams may also like to avoid the host
nations.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>To solve these problems <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>FIFA</b> wants to make stadiums where
actually three matches can take place. The structure of the stadium is shown
below:</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>
<center><img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/103/p10322a.jpg"  ></center>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>As you can see that there are three small
circular stadiums within a large circular stadium. There is also a small
scoreboard zone (shown as a small green circle touching the three smaller
stadiums) which is also circular. The three smaller stadiums touch one another
in point <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>A</b>, <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>B</b>, and <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>C</b>. The triangular
zone <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>ABC</b> is known as the neutral
zone where the <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>FIFA</b> officials will
sit and they will watch all three matches and enjoy the statistics in the
scoreboard zone. No one will be allowed to go out of the stadium as the match
starts and only the <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>FIFA</b> officials
are allowed to carry communication devices. Given the area of the smaller three
stadiums (<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Ar1</b>, <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>Ar2</b> and <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Ar3</b>) you will
have to find out the radius of the largest stadium (<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>R</b>) or radius of the stadium that contains the smaller three
stadiums, radius of the scoreboard zone (<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Sr</b>)
and area of the neutral zone (<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>An</b>)<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Input</span><o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>The input file contains several lines of
input. Each line contains three floating point numbers <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>Ar1</b>, <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Ar2</b> and <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Ar3</b> as described in the problem
statement. Input is terminated by end of file. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>For
each line of input produce one line of output. This line contains three
floating point numbers <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>R</b>, <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Sr</b> and <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>An</b> as explained in the problem statement. All the numbers should
have ten digits after the decimal point. Output will be judged with special
correction program, so you need not worry about very small precision errors.</p>
<br>
<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Input</span><o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:windowtext'>0.3183098862
0.3183098862 0.3183098862<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:windowtext'>0.3183098862
0.3183098862 0.3183098862<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Output<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>0.6858624831
0.0492427108 0.0438733595<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>0.6858624831
0.0492427108 0.0438733595<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Courier;color:windowtext'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</span></div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
color:windowtext'>(The Decider Contest, Problem setter: Shahriar Manzoor)<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

</div>

<!--[if gte mso 10]>
<style>
 /* Style Definitions */
 table.MsoNormalTable
	{mso-style-name:"Table Normal";
	mso-tstyle-rowband-size:0;
	mso-tstyle-colband-size:0;
	mso-style-noshow:yes;
	mso-style-parent:" ;
	mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;
	mso-para-margin:0in;
	mso-para-margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	font-size:10.0pt;
	font-family:"Times New Roman";}
table.MsoTableGrid
	{mso-style-name:"Table Grid";
	mso-tstyle-rowband-size:0;
	mso-tstyle-colband-size:0;
	border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
	mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
	mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;
	mso-border-insideh:.5pt solid windowtext;
	mso-border-insidev:.5pt solid windowtext;
	mso-para-margin:0in;
	mso-para-margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	font-size:10.0pt;
	font-family:"Times New Roman";}
</style>
<![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="27650"/>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->
</head>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Problem M<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:24.0pt'>Factorial! You Must be Kidding!!! </span><o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>Input: </span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>standard input<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>Output: </span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt'>standard output<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>Time Limit:</span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt'> 1 second<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>Memory Limit: </span></b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>32 MB<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'>Arif
has bought a super computer from Bongobazar. Bongobazar is a place in </span><st1:place><span
 style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'>Dhaka</span></st1:place><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'> where second hand goods are
found in plenty. So the super computer bought by him is also second hand and
has some bugs. One of the bugs is that the range of unsigned long integer of
this computer for <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>C/C++</b> compiler has
changed. Now its new lower limit is <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>10000</b>
and upper limit is <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>6227020800</b>. Arif
writes a program in <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>C/C++</b> which
determines the factorial of an integer. Factorial of an integer is defined
recursively as:<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Factorial (0) = 1<o:p></o:p></b></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Factorial (n) = n*factorial
(n-1).<o:p></o:p></b></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'>Of
course one can manipulate these expressions. For example, it can be written as<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Factorial (n) =n*(n-1)*factorial
(n-2)<o:p></o:p></b></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'>This
definition can also be converted to an iterative one.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'>But
Arif knows that his program will not behave rightly in the super computer. You
are to write program which will simulate that changed behavior in a Normal
Computer.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt;color:windowtext'>Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'>The
input file contains several lines of input. Each line contains a single integer
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>n</b>. No integer has more than six
digits. Input is terminated by end of file.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt;color:windowtext'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'>For
each line of input you should output a single line. This line will contain a
single integer <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>n!</b> if the value of <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>n!</b> fits within the unsigned long
integer of Arif&#8217;s computer. Otherwise the line will contain one of the
following two words<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Overflow! //</b>(When n! &gt; 6227020800)<b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><o:p></o:p></b></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span>Underflow! //</span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
color:windowtext'>(When n! &lt; 10000)<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><o:p></o:p></b></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Input</span><o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>2<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>10<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>100<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Output</span><o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:windowtext'>Underflow!<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:windowtext'>3628800<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:windowtext'>Overflow!<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</span></div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
color:windowtext'>(The Decider Contest, Problem setter: Shahriar Manzoor)</span></b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

</div>

</body>

 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="27650"/>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->
</head>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Problem N<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:24.0pt'>Zeros and Ones </span><o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>Input: </span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>standard input<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>Output: </span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt'>standard output<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>Time Limit:</span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt'> 2 seconds<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>Memory Limit: </span></b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>32 MB<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt;color:windowtext'>Given a string of <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>0's</b>
and <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>1's</b> up to <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>1000000</b> characters long and indices <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>i</span></b> and <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>j</span></b>,
you are to answer a question whether all characters between position <span
class=GramE><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-style:
italic'>min(</span></b></span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>i,j)</span></b> and position <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>max(i,j)</span></b>
(inclusive) are the same. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt;color:windowtext'>Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'>There
are multiple cases on input. The first line of each case gives a string of <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>0's</b> and <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>1's</b>. The next line contains a positive integer <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>n</span></b> giving the number
of queries for this case. The next <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>n</span></b> lines contain queries, one per
line. Each query is given by two non-negative integers, <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>i</span></b> and <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>j</span></b>.
For each query, you are to print </span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:windowtext'>Yes</span></b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'> if all characters in the
string between position <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>min(i,j)</span></b> and position <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>max(i,j)</span></b>
are the same, and </span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:windowtext'>No</span></b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'> otherwise.</span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt;color:windowtext'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt;color:windowtext'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'>Each
case on output should start with a heading as in the sample below. The input
ends with an empty string that is a line containing only the new line
character, this string should not be processed. The input may also with end of
file. So keep check for both.</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-size:18.0pt;color:windowtext'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Input</span><o:p></o:p></b></p>

<pre>0000011111</pre><pre>3</pre><pre>0 5</pre><pre>4 2</pre><pre>5 9</pre><pre>01010101010101010101010101111111111111111111111111111111111110000000000000000</pre><pre>5</pre><pre>4 4</pre><pre>25 60</pre><pre>1 3</pre><pre>62 76</pre><pre>24 62</pre><pre>1</pre><pre>1</pre><pre>0 0</pre><pre><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></pre>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Output</span><o:p></o:p></b></p>

<pre>Case 1:</pre><pre>No</pre><pre>Yes</pre><pre>Yes</pre><pre>Case 2:</pre><pre>Yes</pre><pre>Yes</pre><pre>No</pre><pre>Yes</pre><pre>No</pre><pre>Case 3:</pre><pre>Yes</pre>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</span></div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>(The Decider Contest, Source: </span></b><st1:place><st1:PlaceType><b><span
  style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>University</span></b></st1:PlaceType><b><span

  style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>Alberta</span></b></st1:PlaceName></st1:place><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'> Local Contest)</span></b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Courier;color:windowtext'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

</div>
