style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>Set #3:<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
class=GramE><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>tiz</span></span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'> 3<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
class=GramE><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>tisk</span></span><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'> 3<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b

<title>Problem A - September 2002 Monthly Contest</title>
<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <w:WordDocument>
  <w:GrammarState>Clean</w:GrammarState>
  <w:BrowserLevel>MicrosoftInternetExplorer4</w:BrowserLevel>
 </w:WordDocument>

<!--

<!--[if gte mso 10]>
<style>
 /* Style Definitions */
 table.MsoNormalTable
	{mso-style-name:"Table Normal";
	mso-tstyle-rowband-size:0;
	mso-tstyle-colband-size:0;
	mso-style-noshow:yes;

<body lang=EN-US link="#6633CC" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt;color:windowtext'>Problem A</span></b><span
style='color:windowtext'><br>
</span><b><span style='font-size:24.0pt;color:windowtext'>Circles in Hexagon :-)</span></b><span
style='color:windowtext'><br>
</span><b>Input:</b> standard input<br>
<b>Output:</b> standard output<br>
<b>Time Limit:</b> 5 seconds<br>
<b>Memory Limit:</b> 32 MB</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>It is often very difficult to
find exact answers for some geometric problems with a straight forward formula.
Often it is better to use iterative processes to solve these difficult
problems. In this problem you are asked to find the minimum possible length of
a side of a regular hexagon which can hold five and eight circles of equal
radius. But you don&#8217;t have to discover the way. The following image shows
how you can place five circles and eight of equal radius optimally in a regular
hexagon. The arrangement of the circles in both the pictures is symmetric along
AB.</p>
<center>
<img width=447 height=184 src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/103/p10353.jpg" >
<br><b>Fig: Placing five
and eight circles in a regular hexagon</b>
</center>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>


<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt;color:windowtext'>Input</span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>The first line of the input file
contains a single integer <b>N (0&lt;N&lt;=10000) </b>which denotes the number
of inputs. Each of the next <b>N</b> lines contains a floating point number <b>r</b>
which denotes the radius of five circles.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt;color:windowtext'>Output</span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>For each line of input you should
produce one line of output. This output should contain two floating point
numbers. They indicate the minimum possible length of a side of the regular
hexagon in which five circles and eight circles of radius r can be kept without
overlapping. All the output numbers should have 12 digits after the decimal
point. You don&#8217;t need to worry about small precision errors (less than <b>max
(0.0000001%, 1e-9)</b>)</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt;color:windowtext'>Sample
Input</span></b><span style='color:windowtext'><br>
<font face="courier" size=3>
2<br>
0.0000000001<br>
0.0000000002<br>
</font>
<br>
<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt;color:windowtext'>Sample
Output</span></b></p>

<font face="courier" size=3>
0.000000000300 0.000000000371<br>
0.000000000600 0.000000000742<br>
</font>
<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</span></div>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='color:windowtext'>Shahriar Manzoor</span></b></p>

</div>

</div>

</body>

</html>

______________________________________________________

<title>Problem B - September 2002 Monthly Contest</title>
<o:SmartTagType namespaceuri="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags"
 name="City"/>
<o:SmartTagType namespaceuri="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags"
 name="place"/>
<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <w:WordDocument>
  <w:View>Print</w:View>
  <w:Zoom>BestFit</w:Zoom>

 </w:WordDocument>

	{margin:0in;

<body bgcolor=white lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Problem B</span></b><br>
<b><span style='font-size:24.0pt'>Avoiding Your Boss</span></b><br>
<b>Input:</b> standard input<br>
<b>Output:</b> standard output<br>
<b>Time Limit:</b> 4 seconds<br>
<b>Memory Limit:</b> 32 MB</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Imagine that like me you are also
an idle but reasonably good programmer. On one fine morning you wake up from
sleep and discover that your bed is such a lovely place and you must not leave
it for the miserable place called office. So you just pick up your mobile
phone, call your boss with a gloomy voice and tell him that you are quite sick.
Your boss is a very strict but sympathetic person and so he grants you leave
via phone. As the day grows old you discover that you must go out for shopping.
But you are afraid that your boss might see you. So you need to know if there
is any safe option to reach the market. You know that your boss stays only in
two places, his residence and the office. While going from one place to another
he uses a path that does not cost more than any other path. So you must avoid
such paths and even places that your boss may reach. Your boss must not see you
outside your home. You can assume that the cost of reaching another location in
the same place is zero and you must go outside your home to reach market and
your boss must come outside to reach home (from office) or office (from home).
As your job is at stake so you cannot take any chances. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>&nbsp;</span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Input</span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>The input file contains several
sets of input. Each set of input starts with six integers P, R, BH, OF, YH and
M. Here </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
P = Total number of places. (0&lt;P&lt;=100)</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<span style='color:black'>R = Total number of connecting roads.
(0&lt;=R&lt;=4950)</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
BH = The Place where your boss lives. (0&lt;BH&lt;=P)</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
OF = The place where your office is situated. (0&lt;OF&lt;=P)</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
YH = The place where your home is situated. (0&lt;YH&lt;=P)</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
M = The place where the market is situated. (0&lt;M&lt;=P)</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Next R lines contain description
of the city. Each line contains three integers p1, p2 and d. These three
integers denote that place p1 and place p2 is connected by a road whose cost is
d. Here (0&lt;p1, p2&lt;=P) and d is a positive integer less than 101. Streets
are all bi-directional. <span style='color:black'>You can assume that two
different places are connected by only one road.<b><i> </i></b></span>Input is
terminated by end of file.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Output</span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>For each set of input produce one
line of output. This line contains the cost of going from your home to the
market. If it is not possible for you to go to the market avoiding your boss
print the line <b></b><st1:City><st1:place><b>MISSION</b></st1:place></st1:City><b>
IMPOSSIBLE.</b> (Without the quotes).</p>

<p class=MsoNormal>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Input</span></b><br>
<span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>3 2 2 3 1 3</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>1 2
4</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>2 3
4</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>3 2
2 3 3 3</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>1 2
4</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>2 3
4</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>4 3
2 3 1 4</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>1 2
4</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>2 3
4</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>1 4
10</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><br>
<b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Output</span></b><br>
<st1:City><st1:place><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>MISSION</span></st1:place></st1:City><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'> IMPOSSIBLE.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><st1:City><st1:place><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
  font-family:"Courier New"'>MISSION</span></st1:place></st1:City><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'> IMPOSSIBLE.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>10</span></p>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<pre style='text-align:justify'><b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Shahriar Manzoor</span></b></pre>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:12.0pt;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>&nbsp;</p>

</div>

</body>

</html>

______________________________________________________

<![endif]-->
<style>
<!--
 /* Font Definitions */
 @font-face
	{font-family:Courier;
	panose-1:2 7 4 9 2 2 5 2 4 4;
	mso-font-alt:"Courier New";
	mso-font-charset:0;
	mso-generic-font-family:modern;
	mso-font-format:other;
	mso-font-pitch:fixed;
	mso-font-signature:3 0 0 0 1 0;}
 /* Style Definitions */
 p.MsoNormal, li.MsoNormal, div.MsoNormal
	{mso-style-parent:" ;
	margin:0in;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	font-size:12.0pt;
	font-family:"Times New Roman";
	mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";}
h2
	{mso-margin-top-alt:auto;
	margin-right:0in;
	mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
	margin-left:0in;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	mso-outline-level:2;
	font-size:18.0pt;
	font-family:"Times New Roman";
	font-weight:bold;}

	{mso-margin-top-alt:auto;
	margin-right:0in;
	mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
	margin-left:0in;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	mso-outline-level:3;
	font-size:13.5pt;
	font-family:"Times New Roman";
	font-weight:bold;}

	{mso-margin-top-alt:auto;
	margin-right:0in;
	mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;

	font-family:"Times New Roman";
	mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";}

	{margin:0in;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;

	{size:8.5in 11.0in;

	mso-header-margin:.5in;
	mso-footer-margin:.5in;
	mso-paper-source:0;}
div.Section1
	{page:Section1;}
 /* List Definitions */
 @list l0
	{mso-list-id:691876952;
	mso-list-template-ids:-178734032;}
@list l0:level1
	{mso-level-number-format:bullet;
	mso-level-text:\F0B7;

	mso-ansi-font-size:10.0pt;
	font-family:Symbol;}
@list l1
	{mso-list-id:1878080553;
	mso-list-template-ids:-451477534;}
@list l1:level1
	{mso-level-number-format:bullet;
	mso-level-text:\F0B7;
	mso-level-tab-stop:.5in;
	mso-level-number-position:left;
	text-indent:-.25in;
	mso-ansi-font-size:10.0pt;
	font-family:Symbol;}

	{mso-level-tab-stop:1.0in;
	mso-level-number-position:left;
	text-indent:-.25in;}

	mso-level-number-position:left;
	text-indent:-.25in;}

	{mso-level-tab-stop:2.0in;
	mso-level-number-position:left;
	text-indent:-.25in;}

	mso-level-number-position:left;
	text-indent:-.25in;}

	{mso-level-tab-stop:3.0in;

	{margin-bottom:0in;}

<!--[if gte mso 10]>
<style>
 /* Style Definitions */
 table.MsoNormalTable
	{mso-style-name:"Table Normal";
	mso-tstyle-rowband-size:0;
	mso-tstyle-colband-size:0;
	mso-style-noshow:yes;
	mso-style-parent:" ;
	mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;
	mso-para-margin:0in;
	mso-para-margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	font-size:10.0pt;
	font-family:"Times New Roman";}
</style>
<![endif]-->
</head>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Problem C</span></b><br>
<b><span style='font-size:24.0pt'>Superman</span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b>Input:</b>
standard input<br>
<b>Output:</b> standard output<br>
<b>Time Limit:</b> 1 second<br>
<b>Memory Limit:</b> 32 MB</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Superman, with his incredible
power, can fly faster than rockets! He can even pierce the Great Wall if it is in
his path, and this doesn't affect his speed. But he is facing an unbearable
problem in large cities now a days. Some regions of these cities are covered
with polluted air. When flying through these regions, he can hardly breathe and
his speed reduces significantly. He wants to find out whether he could pass
through such regions by finding out the length of his path through these
regions.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Superman knows that each regions
of polluted air have the shape of a sphere. He also knows where the polluted
regions are located. But he doesn't know how to calculate the path length
inside a sphere. So, he requests you to do that for him.</p>

<h3><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Input </span><span style='font-size:18.0pt;
font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>There are multiple datasets.
Input is terminated by EOF. Each dataset consists of the followings (All
numbers are integers &lt; 21 in absolute value):</p>

<ul type=disc>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
     text-align:justify;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo3;tab-stops:list .5in'>City name
     (consisting of 1 to 8 alphanumeric characters) in the first line.</li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
     text-align:justify;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo3;tab-stops:list .5in'>Starting
     and ending points' coordinates (x<sub>1</sub>, y1, z1, x2, y2, z2) of
     Superman's path (separated by space(s)). He always flies in a straight
     line.</li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
     text-align:justify;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo3;tab-stops:list .5in'>Number
     (between 1 and 10 inclusive) of polluted regions in the third line.</li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
     text-align:justify;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo3;tab-stops:list .5in'>Center and
     radius (x, y, z, r) of each region (separated by space(s)), one line per
     region. No two regions intersect each other.</li>
</ul>

<h3><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<h3 style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-weight:normal;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>For each dataset, print the city name in a line
followed by the percentage of his path inside polluted regions. The result
should be correct to 2 places after the decimal point.<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<h3><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<pre><st1:place><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>Dhaka</span></st1:place><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span style='font-size:
11.0pt'>10 10 10 30 10 10<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span style='font-size:
11.0pt'>2<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>15 10 10 5<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>25 10 10 5<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><st1:place><span
 style='font-size:11.0pt'>Rio</span></st1:place><span style='font-size:11.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>10 10 10 30 10 10<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>1<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span style='font-size:
11.0pt'>20 10 5 10<o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<h3 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Output <o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<pre><st1:place><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>Dhaka</span></st1:place><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span style='font-size:
11.0pt'>100.00<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><st1:place><span style='font-size:
 11.0pt'>Rio</span></st1:place><span style='font-size:11.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>86.60</span></pre>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Mustaq Ahmed</b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-family:Courier'><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span></span></p>

</div>

</body>

</html>

</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>

 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt;color:black'>Problem D<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:24.0pt;color:black'>Rough Roads</span></b><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='color:black'>Input: </span></b><span style='color:black;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>standard input<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='color:black'>Output: </span></b><span style='color:black'>standard
output<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='color:black'>Time Limit:</span></b><span style='color:black'> 18 seconds<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='color:black'>Memory Limit: </span></b><span
style='color:black'>32 MB<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>After he bought the tri-cycle
last year, Shaon went to visit his grandfather's house in a remote part of <st1:country-region><st1:place>Bangladesh</st1:place></st1:country-region>.
He wanted to ride the cycle in quiet, rush-free rural roads. But when he
reached the gate of the village of his grandfather, his found his plan useless.
The roads are too rough to ride the cycle comfortably. If he rides the cycle
from one junction to another, his toe would become too tired to push the
paddles in the next part of his journey. He just has to carry the cycle on his
back to reach next junction. After that, he will be able to ride the bike
again. This would go on until he reaches his grandfather's house. But he
doesn't want to knock his grandfather's door with a cycle on his back. So he
must travel the last road <i>riding</i> the cycle. He also decided to start his
journey by carrying the cycle on his back, not by riding it.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Can you find out the shortest way
to reach his grandfather's house?</p>

<h3 style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:18.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
13.5pt'>The Input<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>Input consists of several datasets and is terminated by
end of file. The first line of each test case contains two integers: <i>n</i>
(the number of junctions, 1 &lt; <i>n</i> &lt; 501) and <i>r</i> (the number of
bi-directional roads connecting these junctions). The junctions are numbered
with 0, 1, ..., <i>n</i>-1. The gate of the village and the grandfather's house
is situated at junctions 0 and <i>n</i>-1 respectively. Each of the next <i>r</i>
lines (one for each road) contains three non-negative integers: two
junction-numbers that the corresponding road connects and the length of the
road in kilometers. A road always connects two different junctions. Length of a
road is not more than 20km and not less than 1km.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
none'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>The
Output<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<h3 style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-weight:normal;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>For each dataset, print the set number (1, 2,...) in
a line followed by the length of the shortest path. However, if it is not
possible to reach there in the specified way, print a '?'.<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<h3><span style='font-size:18.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'>Sample Input <o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>3 3<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>0 1 10<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>0 2 10<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>1 2 10<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>4 4<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>0 1 10<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>0 2 10<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>1 2 10<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>2 3 10<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h3 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:18.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'>Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>Set #1<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>20<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>Set #2<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>20<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Mustaq Ahmed<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<pre><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></pre></div>

</body>

</html>

 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="5122"/>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>

  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt;color:black'>Problem E<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:24.0pt;color:black'>Playball !!!<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span></span></b><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='color:black'>Input: </span></b><span style='color:black;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>standard input<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='color:black'>Output: </span></b><span style='color:black'>standard
output<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='color:black'>Time Limit:</span></b><span style='color:black'> 1 second<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='color:black'>Memory Limit: </span></b><span
style='color:black'>32 MB<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>While on a trip to the <st1:country-region><st1:place>US</st1:place></st1:country-region>,
you decide to stop by <st1:City><st1:place>Atlanta</st1:place></st1:City> and
get to the baseball stadium where the Braves are playing a decisive baseball
game against the NY Mets. </p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>According to the players' position on the field,
they may catch the balls that are hit by the batters, if they can get there on time
before the ball touches the ground. The ball's position follows the following
simple mathematical equations:<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span></p>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellpadding=0 width="100%"
 style='width:100.0%;mso-cellspacing:1.5pt;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td style='padding:.75pt .75pt .75pt .75pt'>
<img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/103/p10357.jpg" >  
  </td>
  <td style='padding:.75pt .75pt .75pt .75pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal>&nbsp; <b><i><u>For the ball:</u></i> <o:p></o:p></b></p>
  <p><b>&nbsp; z = at<sup>2</sup>+bt + c <br>
  </b><b><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;-&nbsp; z is the
  height of the ball above the ground.</span> <br>
  &nbsp; x = dt+e <br>
  </b><b><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;-&nbsp; x is the
  position along the x-axis.</span> <br>
  &nbsp; y = ft+g <br>
  </b><b><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;-&nbsp; y is the
  position along the y-axis. <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p><b><span style='font-size:10.0pt'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;-&nbsp; a,b,..,g are
  constants given for each ball hit.<br>
  &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;-&nbsp; t is the time elapsed since the ball was hit.</span></b>
  </p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style='text-align:justify'>Each player has an individual starting position
(x<sub>o</sub>, y<sub>o</sub>) he always returns to before a new ball is hit. The
players, each starting to run as soon as the ball is hit towards the correct
position where the ball will eventually touch the ground, all theoretically
have a chance to catch the ball. So you must verify all of them since the
distance they can run is dependant on their individual speed. Well, after all,
we assume that these players always run as fast as possible given the good
paychecks they are given, so the variation of their position is always the same
throughout the match, e.g. they run at the same speed. </p>

<p style='text-align:justify'><b><i>Important notes:</i></b> </p>

<ul type=disc>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
     text-align:justify;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo3;tab-stops:list .5in'>A ball
     that ends up touching the ground n the negative side of
     the ground axis (x or y) is said to be &quot;foul&quot; and can not be
     caught. These cases are trivial but must be taken care of. </li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
     text-align:justify;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo3;tab-stops:list .5in'>The time
     the ball takes to travel (t) is the smallest integer that satisfies the
     equation of the height of the ball, i.e. t is the first positive integer
     for which z becomes zero or negative. This integer is the time when the
     ball is considered to hit the ground. </li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
     text-align:justify;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo3;tab-stops:list .5in'>A ball
     &quot;not caught&quot; before it touches the ground is said to be
     &quot;safe&quot;. </li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
     text-align:justify;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo3;tab-stops:list .5in'>The
     maximum number of players is less than 20 players, but could be any number
     below that limit. </li>
</ul>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>&nbsp;</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB
style='font-size:18.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>Input</span></b><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p>The format of the input is the following (where all parameters are integer
values): </p>

<p>PLAYERS=#&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
// number of players/lines to read <br>
x y
v&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
// x,y - startup position of the player; v - the speed of the player <br>
...&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
// for each player <br>
BALLS=#&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
// Number of balls that are hit <br>
a b c d e f
g&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
// Parameters according to the ball equations <br>
...&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
// for each ball </p>

<h3><span lang=EN-GB style='font-size:18.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>Output</span><span style='font-size:18.0pt;font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<p style='text-align:justify'>The output should consist of one line per ball
following the format:</p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>&quot;Ball i was ??? at (xkor,ykor)&quot;, where
i is the ball number, ??? is one of caught, safe, or foul, and (xkor,ykor) is
the coordinates where the ball hit the ground. Look at the example below! </p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB
style='font-size:18.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>Sample Input</span></b><span
lang=EN-GB style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p>

<pre><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>PLAYERS=9<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>0 <span class=SpellE>0</span> 3<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>16 <span class=SpellE>16</span> 2<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>30 0 4<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>36 24 4<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>0 30 3<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>24 36 5<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>24 75 7<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>75 24 6<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>60 <span class=SpellE>60</span> 7<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>BALLS=12<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>-1 3 1 21 3 14 5<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>-1 1 <span class=SpellE>1</span> 11 3 2 5<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>-3 4 0 8 5 11 2<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>-1 2 1 -4 1 6 7<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>-1 1 0 9 3 14 5<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>-2 4 1 32 3 12 5<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>-1 1 <span class=SpellE>1</span> 11 1 19 5<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>-4 5 0 18 5 20 5<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>-1 2 1 24 5 6 7<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>-1 1 0 9 3 4 1<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>-2 2 1 2 5 22 5<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>-1 6 1 10 5 13 5<o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
lang=EN-GB style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB style='font-size:18.0pt;
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>Sample Output</span></b><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-ansi-language:
EN-GB'>&nbsp;</span><o:p></o:p></b></p>

<pre><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>Ball 1 was caught at (87<span class=GramE>,61</span>)<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>Ball 2 was safe at (25<span class=GramE>,9</span>)<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>Ball 3 was safe at (21<span class=GramE>,24</span>)<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>Ball 4 was foul at (-11<span class=GramE>,25</span>)<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>Ball 5 was safe at (12<span class=GramE>,19</span>)<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>Ball 6 was safe at (99<span class=GramE>,41</span>)<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>Ball 7 was caught at (23<span class=GramE>,43</span>)<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>Ball 8 was safe at (41<span class=GramE>,45</span>)<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>Ball 9 was caught at (77<span class=GramE>,25</span>)<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>Ball 10 was safe at (12<span class=GramE>,5</span>)<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>Ball 11 was safe at (9<span class=GramE>,49</span>)<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>Ball 12 was caught at (75<span class=GramE>,96</span>)<o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
class=SpellE><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Ghyslain</b></span><b

</div>

<title>Problem F - September 2002 Monthly Contest</title>
<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt;color:black'>Problem F<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:24.0pt;color:black'>Matrix </span></b><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='color:black'>Input: </span></b><span style='color:black;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>standard input<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='color:black'>Output: </span></b><span style='color:black'>standard
output<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='color:black'>Time Limit:</span></b><span style='color:black'> 4 seconds<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='color:black'>Memory Limit: </span></b><span
style='color:black'>32 MB<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>The year is close to 2200 and machines with
supreme artificial intelligence have conquered the world. Fortunately, the humans
are still kept alive since they provide a good energy source for the machines.
However, in order to keep mankind neutralized, most people are trapped in a
computer program called the Matrix designed to simulate the 20th century, and
thereby unaware of the 'real' world. Still, a few people like <span
class=GramE>yourself</span> have been released from the Matrix and others have
even been born free. Together we try to fight the machines. The Oracle has
spoken about one man who will save mankind, and the people outside the Matrix
must enter it from time to time in order to try to find this chosen one. It is
hazardous to enter though. The only way out of the Matrix is by being phoned
from the outside on a stationary phone inside and there are supernatural agents
in the Matrix who try to eliminate all trespassers. Everyone who has been
caught by an agent so far has died, so the best thing to do when you encounter
one is to run. Since the Matrix is a computer program, the agents know of your
whereabouts all the time when you are inside it. On the other hand you know the
location of the agents too, since the people helping you from outside the
Matrix scan it and tell you what they see. You move at the same speed as the
agents since you have learned to control the laws of the program. You want to
know for a few scenarios if you would be able to escape the Matrix or if you
would be caught by the agents, so you design a program. For simplicity, the
Matrix is modelled by a two-player boardgame on an 8 by 8 square board with you
and two agents as pieces. There are three kinds of squares: floor squares, wall
squares and phone squares. A piece may be located on any square except the wall
squares, even if the square is already occupied by another piece. The
simulation begins by a move by you. Then the two agents move and after that it
is your turn to move again. This moving scheme continues to alternate until
either your piece gets to a vacant phone square which means that you succeed in
escaping the Matrix, or until at least one of the agent pieces is on the same
square as your piece, in which case you are captured, and thereby eliminated. A
third outcome is possible if neither of the two breaking conditions mentioned
above occurs. In that case you are said to be trapped in the Matrix. A move of
a piece constitutes of moving the piece located at square (x,y) to one of
(x,y),(x+1,y),(x-1,y),(x,y-1), or (x,y+1) that is not a wall square. </p>

<h3 style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Input<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<h3 style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-weight:normal;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>The input consists of several scenarios. For each
scenario you are to determine whether the agent pieces cannot be sure to
prevent you from escaping the Matrix despite how hard they try, or whether you
cannot be certain to stop the agents from eliminating you. The first line of
input is a positive number <i>n</i>. Then follow <i>n</i> scenarios, each
consisting of 8 rows of 8 characters each from the set {'.','#','P','A','M'}
describing the Matrix board. <span class=GramE>A '.'</span>-<span class=GramE>character</span>
symbolizes a floor square, a '#'-character a wall square and a 'P'-character a
phone square. There are exactly two 'A'-characters in each scenario indicating
the starting positions of the two agents, and exactly one 'M'-character giving
your position in the Matrix. The initial squares of the three pieces are all
floor squares. At least half of the 64 squares are wall squares for all
scenarios. All scenarios, including the last one, end with a blank line. <o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<h3 style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<div>

<h3 style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-weight:normal;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>For each scenario, there should be one line of
output. If your piece can escape the Matrix regardless of the efforts made by
the agents to stop you, the text 'You can escape.' should be printed. If the
agent pieces may capture you whatever moves your piece make, you are eliminated
and the text 'You are eliminated.' should be printed. If neither of the two
conditions described above are true, the text 'You are trapped in the Matrix.'
should be printed. <o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<h3><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<pre><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>3<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>#####.##<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>#####.##<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>#####.##<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>AA.M...P<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>#####.##<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>#####.##<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>#####.##<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>#####.##<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>########<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>#..<span class=GramE>P...#</span><o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>#.####.#<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>#P#M<span class=GramE>.#</span>P#<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>#.####.#<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>#..<span class=GramE>P...#</span><o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>#A....<span class=GramE>A#</span><o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>########<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>########<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>#...A.P#<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>#.######<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>#..<span class=GramE>M...#</span><o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>#.####.#<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>..####..<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>#....A<span class=GramE>.#</span><o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>########<o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<h3 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Output<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

</div>

<pre><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>You can escape.<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>You are trapped in the Matrix.<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre>You are eliminated.</pre><pre
style='text-align:center'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</pre>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Andreas Bj&ouml;rklund<o:p></o:p></b></p>

</div>

</body>

</html>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt;color:black'>Problem G<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:24.0pt;color:black'>Tiling</span></b><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='color:black'>Input: </span></b><span style='color:black;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>standard input<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='color:black'>Output: </span></b><span style='color:black'>standard
output<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='color:black'>Time Limit:</span></b><span style='color:black'> 2 seconds<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='color:black'>Memory Limit: </span></b><span
style='color:black'>32 MB<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
style='color:black'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>In how many ways can you tile a
2x<em>n</em> rectangle by 2x1 or 2x2 tiles? </p>
<center>
<p style='text-align:justify'>Here is a sample tiling of a 2x17 rectangle. </p>
<img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/103/p10359.gif" >
</center>
<p style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Input and Output<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>Input is a sequence of lines, each line
containing an integer number <em>0 &lt;= n &lt;= 250</em>. For each line of
input, output one integer number in a separate line giving the number of
possible tilings of a 2x<em>n</em> rectangle. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<pre><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>2<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>8<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span style='font-size:
11.0pt'>12<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>100<o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>200<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample
Output<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<pre><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>3<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>171<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>2731<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>845100400152152934331135470251<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>1071292029505993517027974728227441735014801995855195223534251<o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><st1:place><st1:PlaceType><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>University</b></st1:PlaceType><b
 style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'> of </b><st1:PlaceName><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Alberta</b></st1:PlaceName></st1:place><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'> Local Contest<o:p></o:p></b></p>

</div>

</body>

</html>

______________________________________________________

<title>Problem H - September 2002 Monthly Contest</title>
<o:SmartTagType namespaceuri="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags"
 name="City"/>
<o:SmartTagType namespaceuri="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags"
 name="place"/>

 /* Style Definitions */

 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->
</head>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt;color:black'>Problem H<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:24.0pt;color:black'>Rat Attack </span></b><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='color:black'>Input: </span></b><span style='color:black;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>standard input<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='color:black'>Output: </span></b><span style='color:black'>standard
output<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='color:black'>Time Limit:</span></b><span style='color:black'> 7 seconds<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='color:black'>Memory Limit: </span></b><span
style='color:black'>32 MB<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>Baaaam! Another deadly gas bomb explodes in <st1:City><st1:place>Manhattan</st1:place></st1:City>&#8217;s
underworld. Rats have taken over the sewerage and the city council is doing everything
to get the rat population under control.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>As you know, <st1:City><st1:place>Manhattan</st1:place></st1:City>
is organized in a regular fashion with streets and avenues arranged like a
rectangular grid. Waste water drains run beneath the streets in the same
arrangement and the rats have always set up their nests below street
intersections. The only viable method to extinguish them is to use gas bombs
like the one which has just exploded. However, gas bombs are not only dangerous
for rats. The skyscrapers above the explosion point have to be evacuated in
advance and so the point of rat attack must be chosen very carefully.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>The gas bombs used are built by a company called American
Catastrophe Management (ACM) and they are sold under the heading of
&#8220;smart rat gas&#8221;. They are smart because &#8212; when fired &#8212;
the gas spreads in a rectangular fashion through the under street canals. The
strength of a gas bomb is given by a number d which specifies the rectangular
&#8220;radius&#8221; of the gas diffusion area. For example, Figure 2 shows
what happens when a bomb with d = 1 explodes.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>
<center>
<img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/103/p10360.jpg" >
</center>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>The Problem<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>The area of interest consists of a discrete grid of 1025
&times; 1025 fields. Rat exterminator scouts have given a detailed report on
where rat populations of different sizes have built their nests. You are given
a gas bomb with strength d and your task is to find an explosion location for
this gas bomb which extinguishes the largest number of rats.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>The best position is determined by the following criteria:</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>&#8226; The sum of all rat population sizes within the
diffusion area of the gas bomb (given by d) is maximal. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>&#8226; If there is more than one of these best positions
then the location with the &#8220;minimal&#8221; position will be chosen.
Positions are ordered first by their x coordinate and second by their y
coordinate.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>Formally, given a location (x1, y1) on the grid, a point
(x2, y2) is within the diffusion area of a gas bomb with strength d if the
following equation holds: </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;mso-layout-grid-align:
none;text-autospace:none'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>max (abs(x2 -
x1), abs (y2 - y1)) &lt;= d<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<h3 style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Input<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>The first line contains the number of scenarios in the
input.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>For each scenario the first line contains the strength <span
style='font-family:CMMI10;mso-bidi-font-family:CMMI10'>d </span>of the gas bomb
in the scenario <span style='font-family:CMR10;mso-bidi-font-family:CMR10'>(1
&lt;=</span><span style='font-family:CMSY10;mso-bidi-font-family:CMSY10'> </span><span
style='font-family:CMMI10;mso-bidi-font-family:CMMI10'>d &lt;=</span><span
style='font-family:CMSY10;mso-bidi-font-family:CMSY10'> </span><span
style='font-family:CMR10;mso-bidi-font-family:CMR10'>5</span>0). The second
line contains the number <span style='font-family:CMMI10;mso-bidi-font-family:
CMMI10'>n </span><span style='font-family:CMR10;mso-bidi-font-family:CMR10'>(1
&lt;=</span><span style='font-family:CMSY10;mso-bidi-font-family:CMSY10'> </span><span
style='font-family:CMMI10;mso-bidi-font-family:CMMI10'>n &lt;=</span><span
style='font-family:CMSY10;mso-bidi-font-family:CMSY10'> </span><span
style='font-family:CMR10;mso-bidi-font-family:CMR10'>2000</span>0) of rat
populations. Then for every rat population follows a line containing three
integers separated by spaces for the position <span style='font-family:CMMI10;
mso-bidi-font-family:CMMI10'>(x, </span><span style='font-family:CMR10;
mso-bidi-font-family:CMR10'>y) </span>and &#8220;size&#8221; <span
style='font-family:CMMI10;mso-bidi-font-family:CMMI10'>i </span>of the
population <span style='font-family:CMR10;mso-bidi-font-family:CMR10'>(1 &lt;=</span><span
style='font-family:CMSY10;mso-bidi-font-family:CMSY10'> </span><span
style='font-family:CMMI10;mso-bidi-font-family:CMMI10'>i &lt;=</span><span
style='font-family:CMSY10;mso-bidi-font-family:CMSY10'> </span><span
style='font-family:CMR10;mso-bidi-font-family:CMR10'>25</span>5). It is
guaranteed that position coordinates are valid (i.e., in the range between 0
and 1024) and no position is given more than once.</p>

<h3 style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>For every problem print a line containing the x and y
coordinate of the chosen location for the gas bomb, followed by the sum of the
rat population sizes which will be extinguished. The three numbers must be
separated by a space.</p>

<h3><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:Courier;mso-bidi-font-family:Courier'>1<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:Courier;mso-bidi-font-family:Courier'>1<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:Courier;mso-bidi-font-family:Courier'>2<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:Courier;mso-bidi-font-family:Courier'>4 4
10<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:Courier;mso-bidi-font-family:Courier'>6 6
20<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h3 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Output<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>5 5
30</span></p>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>TUD Programming
Contest<o:p></o:p></b></p>

</div>

</div>

</body>

</html>

______________________________________________________
10361||||||false||||||

<title>Problem I - September 2002 Monthly Contest</title>
<o:SmartTagType namespaceuri="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags"
 name="City"/>
<o:SmartTagType namespaceuri="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags"
 name="place"/>
<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:DocumentProperties>
  <o:Author>Shahriar Manzoor</o:Author>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt;color:black'>Problem I<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:24.0pt;color:black'>Automatic Poetry </span></b><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='color:black'>Input: </span></b><span style='color:black;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>standard input<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='color:black'>Output: </span></b><span style='color:black'>standard
output<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='color:black'>Time Limit:</span></b><span style='color:black'> 2 seconds<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='color:black'>Memory Limit: </span></b><span
style='color:black'>32 MB<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>&#8220;Oh God&#8221;, Lara Croft exclaims, &#8220;<span
class=GramE>it&#8217;s</span> one of these dumb riddles again!&#8221;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>In Tomb Raider XIV, Lara is, as ever, gunning her way through
ancient Egyptian pyramids, prehistoric caves and medival hallways. Now she is
standing in front of some important Germanic looking doorway and has to solve a
linguistic riddle to pass. As usual, the riddle is not very intellectually
challenging.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>This time, the riddle involves poems containing a
&#8220;Schuttelreim&#8221;. An example of a Schuttelreim is the following short
poem:</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>Ein Kind <span class=GramE>halt</span> seinen Schnabel
nur,</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span class=GramE>wenn</span> es hangt an der
Nabelschnur.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>/*German contestants please forgive me. I had to modify
something as they were not appearing correctly in plain text format*/</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>A Schuttelreim seems to be a typical German invention. The
funny thing about this strange type of poetry is that if somebody gives you the
first line and the beginning of the second one, you can complete the poem
yourself. Well, even a computer can do that, and your task is to write a
program which completes them automatically. This will help Lara concentrate on
the &#8220;action&#8221; part of Tomb Raider and not on the &#8220;intellectual&#8221;
part.</p>

<h3 style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Input<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>The input will begin with a line containing a single
number n. After this line follow n pairs of lines containing Schuttelreims. The
first line of each pair will be of the form</p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;mso-layout-grid-align:
none;text-autospace:none'>s<sub>1</sub>&lt;s<sub>2</sub>&gt;s<sub>3</sub>&lt;s<sub>4</sub>&gt;s<sub>5</sub></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span class=GramE>where</span> the s<sub>i</sub> are
possibly empty, strings of lowercase characters or blanks. The second line will
be a string of lowercase characters or blanks ending with three dots
&#8220;...&#8221;. Lines will <span class=GramE>we</span> at most 100
characters long.</p>

<h3 style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<h3 style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-weight:normal;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>For each pair of Schuttelreim lines l<sub>1</sub>
and l<sub>2</sub> you are to output two lines c<sub>1</sub> and c<sub>2</sub>
in the following way: c<sub>1</sub> is the same as l<sub>1</sub> only that the
bracket marks &#8220;&lt;&#8221; and &#8220;&gt;&#8221; are removed. Line c<sub>2</sub>
is the same as <span class=GramE>l<sub>2</sub> ,</span> except that instead of
the three dots the string s<sub>4</sub>s<sub>3</sub>s<sub>2</sub>s<sub>5</sub>
should appear.<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<div>

<h3><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>3<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
class=GramE><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>ein</span></span><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'> kind haelt seinen
&lt;schn&gt;abel &lt;n&gt;</span><st1:City><st1:place><span style='font-size:
  11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>ur</span></st1:place></st1:City><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
class=GramE><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>wenn</span></span><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'> es haengt an der ...<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
class=GramE><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>weil</span></span><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'> wir zu spaet zur
&lt;&gt;oma &lt;k&gt;amen<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
class=GramE><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>verpassten</span></span><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'> wir das ...<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>&lt;d&gt;u &lt;b&gt;<span
class=GramE>ist</span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>...<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h3 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Output<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
class=GramE><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:Courier;mso-bidi-font-family:
Courier'>ein</span></span><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:Courier;
mso-bidi-font-family:Courier'> kind haelt seinen schnabel nur<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
class=GramE><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:Courier;mso-bidi-font-family:
Courier'>wenn</span></span><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:Courier;
mso-bidi-font-family:Courier'> es haengt an der nabel schnur<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
class=GramE><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:Courier;mso-bidi-font-family:
Courier'>weil</span></span><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:Courier;
mso-bidi-font-family:Courier'> wir zu spaet zur oma kamen<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
class=GramE><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:Courier;mso-bidi-font-family:
Courier'>verpassten</span></span><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:
Courier;mso-bidi-font-family:Courier'> wir das koma amen<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
class=GramE><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:Courier;mso-bidi-font-family:
Courier'>du</span></span><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:Courier;
mso-bidi-font-family:Courier'> bist<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
class=GramE><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:Courier;mso-bidi-font-family:
Courier'>bu</span></span><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:Courier;
mso-bidi-font-family:Courier'> dist</span><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
font-family:"Courier New"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>TUD Programming Contest<o:p></o:p></b></p>

</div>
