<body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Problem E</span></b><br>
<b><span style='font-size:24.0pt'>Connect the Campus</span></b><br>
<b>Input:</b> standard input<br>
<b>Output:</b> standard output<br>
<b>Time Limit:</b> 2 seconds</p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>Many new buildings are under construction on the
campus of the <st1:place><st1:PlaceType>University</st1:PlaceType> of <st1:PlaceName>Waterloo</st1:PlaceName></st1:place>.
The university has hired bricklayers, electricians, plumbers, and a computer
programmer. A computer programmer? Yes, you have been hired to ensure that each
building is connected to every other building (directly or indirectly) through
the campus network of communication cables.</p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>We will treat each building as a point specified
by an x-coordinate and a y-coordinate. Each communication cable connects
exactly two buildings, following a straight line between the buildings.
Information travels along a cable in both directions. Cables can freely cross
each other, but they are only connected together at their endpoints (at
buildings).</p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>You have been given a campus map which shows the
locations of all buildings and existing communication cables. You must not
alter the existing cables. Determine where to install new communication cables
so that all buildings are connected. Of course, the university wants you to
minimize the amount of new cable that you use.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'>
<img width=596 height=303
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/103/p10397.jpg"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1025"></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b>Fig: </b><st1:place><st1:PlaceType><b>University</b></st1:PlaceType><b>
 of </b><st1:PlaceName><b>Waterloo</b></st1:PlaceName></st1:place><b> Campus <o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Input</span></b></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>The input file describes several test case.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>The description of each test case is given
below:</p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>The first line of each test case contains the
number of buildings <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>N (1&lt;=N&lt;=750)</b>.
The buildings are labeled from <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>1</b> to <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>N</b>. The next <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>N</b> lines give the <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>x</b> and <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>y</b> coordinates of the buildings. These
coordinates are integers with absolute values at most <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>10000</b>. No two buildings occupy the same point. After that there is
a line containing the number of existing cables <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>M (0 &lt;= M &lt;= 1000)</b> followed by <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>M</b> lines describing the existing cables. Each cable is represented
by two integers: the building numbers which are directly connected by the
cable. There is at most one cable directly connecting each pair of buildings.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Output</span></b></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>For each set of input, output in a single line
the total length of the new cables that you plan to use, rounded to two decimal
places. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>4<br>
103 104<br>
104 100<br>
104 103<br>
100 100<br>
1<br>
4 2<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>4<br>
103 104<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>104
100<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>104
103<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>100
100<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>1<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>4 2<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Output</span></b><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'><br>
</span></b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>4.41<br>
4.41</span></p>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>(Problem-setters: G.
Kemkes &amp; G. V. Cormack, CS Dept, </b><st1:place><st1:PlaceType><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>University</b></st1:PlaceType><b
 style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'> of </b><st1:PlaceName><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Waterloo</b></st1:PlaceName></st1:place><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>)</b></p>

<p align=center style='margin-top:5.0pt;margin-right:91.45pt;margin-bottom:
5.0pt;margin-left:1.5in;text-align:center'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p align=center style='margin-top:5.0pt;margin-right:82.45pt;margin-bottom:
5.0pt;margin-left:99.0pt;text-align:center'><span style='font-size:14.0pt;
font-family:"Monotype Corsiva"'>A man running away from a tiger need not run
faster than the tiger but run faster than the friend.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p align=center style='text-align:center'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

</div>

</body>

<meta content=document name=resource-type>
<meta content=global name=distribution>
<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="28674"/>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Problem F</span></b><br>
<b><span style='font-size:24.0pt'>The Golden Pentagon </span></b><br>
<b>Input:</b> This program has no input<br>
<b>Output:</b> standard output<br>
<b>Time Limit:</b> 8 seconds<br style='mso-special-character:line-break'>
<![if !supportLineBreakNewLine]><br style='mso-special-character:line-break'>
<![endif]></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>The
plane can be tiled by a geometric progression of equilateral triangles, with a
polynomial characteristic equation, as shown in the figure below. You can
assume the following things:</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.25in;
mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2;tab-stops:list .5in left 45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>a)<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span><![endif]>The width of the black borders of the triangles are
negligible</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.25in;
mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2;tab-stops:list .5in left 45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>b)<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span><![endif]>The geometric progression of the triangles is forming
pentagons of different sizes. </p>

<h2 align=center style='text-align:center'><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shapetype
 id="_x0000_t75" coordsize="21600,21600" o:spt="75" o:preferrelative="t"
 path="m@4@5l@4@11@9@11@9@5xe" filled="f" stroked="f">
 <v:stroke joinstyle="miter"/>
 <v:formulas>
  <v:f eqn="if lineDrawn pixelLineWidth 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 1 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum 0 0 @1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @2 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 0 1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @6 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @8 21600 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @10 21600 0"/>
 </v:formulas>
 <v:path o:extrusionok="f" gradientshapeok="t" o:connecttype="rect"/>
 <o:lock v:ext="edit" aspectratio="t"/>
</v:shapetype><v:shape id="_x0000_i1025" type="#_x0000_t75" style='width:377.25pt;
 height:214.5pt'>
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/103/p5_files/image001.png"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=503 height=286
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/103/p5_files/image001.png"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1025"><![endif]><span lang=EN
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>You can see in the picture above that the triangles are numbered <b>1, 2,
3 
</b> etc. In this problem your job is two fold:<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:51.0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:
-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo4;tab-stops:list 51.0pt'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>a)<span
style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><![endif]><span
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Find out the length of a side of the <b>I</b>-th
triangle if the length is less than <b>1000000000</b> and print its nearest
smaller round number (<b>L</b>).<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:51.0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:
-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo4;tab-stops:list 51.0pt'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>b)<span
style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><![endif]><span
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>If the length of a side of the <b>I</b>-th
triangle is greater than or equal to <b>1000000000</b> then print how many
digits <b>L</b> has in decimal number system. The meaning of <b>L</b> is given
above.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Input</span></b></p>

<h2 style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-ansi-language:EN;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>The input
file contains </span><span lang=EN style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-ansi-language:
EN'>N (N&lt;=7300)</span><span lang=EN style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-ansi-language:
EN;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'> lines of input. Each line
contains a floating point number </span><span lang=EN style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-ansi-language:EN'>S(0&lt;=S&lt;=10000)</span><span lang=EN
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'> which is the length of a side of the first triangle, and an integer </span><span
lang=EN style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>I(1&lt;=I&lt;100000000)</span><span
lang=EN style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN;font-weight:normal;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>. The meaning of </span><span lang=EN
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>I</span><span lang=EN
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'> is described before. Input is terminated by end of file.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>For each line of input produce one
line of output. This line contains a single integer <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>L</b> or <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>D</b>. Here <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>L</b> indicates the length of a side of <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>I</b>-th triangle rounded down to the nearest
integer. If <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>L</b> is not less than <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>1000000000</b> then you should output <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>D</b> instead of <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>L</b>, where <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>D</b> is the no of
digit in <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>L</b>.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>1 1<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>1 2<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>1 3<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>1 4<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>1 5<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>1 10<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>1 25<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>1 10000<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Output</span></b><br>
<span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>1<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>1<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>1<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>2<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>3<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>12<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>853<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>1222<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>(Problem Setter:
Shahriar Manzoor, CSE Dept, </b><st1:place><st1:PlaceName><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
  normal'>Southeast</b></st1:PlaceName><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'> </b><st1:PlaceType><b

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<body bgcolor=white lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Problem G</span></b><br>
<b><span style='font-size:24.0pt'>Optimus Prime</span></b><br>
<b>Input:</b> standard input<br>
<b>Output:</b> standard output<br>
<b>Time Limit:</b> 30 seconds</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>Joe Uncool is a long-time fan of the online games
&quot;Ultima Online&quot; and &quot;Everquest&quot;. However, Joe has decided
that they have become too watered down of late, and that they no longer satisfy
his requirements for utter wastage of time.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>He has invented a new game that he hopes will eliminate all productive
activity from the entire world by <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>2010</b>.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>This game is rather predictably titled
&quot;Primes&quot;.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>(Countless years of
gaming have eroded Joe's creativity)</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>To play the game, an integer <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>n</b> is chosen, greater than 1.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>A counter <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>c</b> is started at 0.
The first player to play (let's call him player <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>A</b>) names a number from <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>1</b>
to <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>n</b>, and this is added to <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>c</b>.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>The other player (Player <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>B</b>) can
then name a number from <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>1</b> to <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>n</b>, which is again added to <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>c</b>, and so on. The loser is the first
person to make <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>c</b> nonprime. The
winner is the first person to, er, not be the loser.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Note that 1 is NOT prime.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>For example, a typical game (with n=5) played by very
stupid people might <span class=GramE>Be</span>:</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>A: 3</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>B: 2</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>A: 5</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>Since 10 <span class=GramE>is</span> not prime, B is now
the winner.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>A certain group, however, called the mathematicians, are
achieving godlike status among their fellow humans by always being able to win
the game.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Your job is to include
yourself among their ranks, by solving the game's opening.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Input</span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span class=GramE>An integer G, where G is the number of
games to be considered.</span><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Following
this are G integers, one to a line, containing the value of n for each game to
be considered. (1&lt;n&lt;=1000)</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Output</span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>With one game to a line, you are to print out who will win
the game (A or B) assuming both play perfectly.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>If it is A, you must also print out which number A must choose first to
ensure his win.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Input</span></b><br>
<span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>4<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>3<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>4<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>10<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>500</span><br
style='mso-special-character:line-break'>
<![if !supportLineBreakNewLine]><br style='mso-special-character:line-break'>
<![endif]></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Output</span></b><br>
<span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>A 3<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>B<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>A 7<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>A
157</span></p>

<div class=MsoNormal>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=left>

</div>

<pre><b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>(World Finals Warm-up Contest, Problem setter: Derek Kisman)<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:12.0pt;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:14.0pt;font-family:"Monotype Corsiva"'><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span>The point of the problem is NOT to optimize a
few seconds here or there, <br>
it's to prevent it from taking years or centuries. :)<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

</div>

</body>

</html>

______________________________________________________
10363||||||false||||||
<body TEXT="#000000" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" >
<img src=p10363.jpg align=right>
<h2>Problem B:  Tic Tac Toe</h2>
Tic Tac Toe is a child's game played on a 3 by 3 grid.  One player, X, 
starts by placing an X at an unoccupied grid position.  Then the other player,
O, places an O at an unoccupied grid position.  Play alternates between X and O  until the
grid is filled or one player's symbols occupy an entire line (vertical,
horizontal, or diagonal) in the grid.
<p>
We will denote the initial empty Tic Tac Toe grid with nine dots.  Whenever
X or O plays we fill in an X or an O in the appropriate position.  The
example below illustrates each grid configuration from the beginning to
the end of a game in which X wins.
<pre>
...  X..  X.O  X.O  X.O  X.O  X.O  X.O
...  ...  ...  ...  .O.  .O.  OO.  OO.
...  ...  ...  ..X  ..X  X.X  X.X  XXX
</pre>
Your job is to read a grid and to determine whether or not it could
possibly be part of a valid Tic Tac Toe game.  That is, is there a series
of plays that can yield this grid somewhere between the start and end of
the game?
<p>
The first line of input contains N, the number of test cases.  4N-1 lines
follow, specifying N grid configurations separated by empty lines.  For each 
case print "yes" or
"no" on a line by itself, indicating whether or not the configuration could
be part of a Tic Tac Toe game.
<h3>Sample Input</h3>
<pre>
2
X.O
OO.
XXX

O.X
XX.
OOO
</pre>
<h3>Output for Sample Input</h3>
<pre>
yes
no
</pre>

______________________________________________________
10364||||||false||||||
<body TEXT="#000000" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" >
<img src=p10364.jpg align=right><h2>Problem C:  Square</h2>
Given a set of sticks of various lengths, is it possible to join them
end-to-end to form a square?
<p>
The first line of input contains N, the number of test cases.  Each
test case begins with an integer 4 &lt;= M &lt;= 20, the number of
sticks.  M integers follow; each gives the length of a stick - an integer
between 1 and 10,000.
<p>
For each case, output a line containing "yes" if is is possible to form
a square; otherwise output "no".
<h3>Sample Input</h3>
<pre>
3
4 1 1 1 1
5 10 20 30 40 50
8 1 7 2 6 4 4 3 5
</pre>
<h3>Output for Sample Input</h3>
<pre>
yes
no
yes
</pre>

______________________________________________________

	font-family:"Courier New";
	mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
	mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";}
span.GramE
	{mso-style-name:" ;
	mso-gram-e:yes;}
@page Section1
	{size:8.5in 11.0in;
	margin:1.0in 1.0in 1.0in 1.0in;
	mso-header-margin:.5in;
	mso-footer-margin:.5in;
	mso-paper-source:0;}
div.Section1
	{page:Section1;}
 /* List Definitions */
 @list l0
	{mso-list-id:257098515;
	mso-list-template-ids:-661366988;}
@list l0:level1
	{mso-level-number-format:bullet;
	mso-level-text:\F0B7;
	mso-level-tab-stop:.5in;
	mso-level-number-position:left;
	text-indent:-.25in;
	mso-ansi-font-size:10.0pt;
	font-family:Symbol;}
@list l0:level2
	{mso-level-number-format:bullet;
	mso-level-text:o;
	mso-level-tab-stop:1.0in;
	mso-level-number-position:left;
	text-indent:-.25in;
	mso-ansi-font-size:10.0pt;
	font-family:"Courier New";
	mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";}
@list l0:level3
	{mso-level-tab-stop:1.5in;
	mso-level-number-position:left;
	text-indent:-.25in;}
@list l0:level4
	{mso-level-tab-stop:2.0in;
	mso-level-number-position:left;
	text-indent:-.25in;}
@list l0:level5
	{mso-level-tab-stop:2.5in;
	mso-level-number-position:left;
	text-indent:-.25in;}
@list l0:level6
	{mso-level-tab-stop:3.0in;
	mso-level-number-position:left;
	text-indent:-.25in;}
@list l0:level7
	{mso-level-tab-stop:3.5in;
	mso-level-number-position:left;
	text-indent:-.25in;}

	{mso-level-tab-stop:4.0in;
	mso-level-number-position:left;
	text-indent:-.25in;}

	{mso-level-tab-stop:4.5in;
	mso-level-number-position:left;
	text-indent:-.25in;}
ol
	{margin-bottom:0in;}
ul
	{margin-bottom:0in;}
-->
</style>
<!--[if gte mso 10]>
<style>
 /* Style Definitions */
 table.MsoNormalTable
	{mso-style-name:"Table Normal";
	mso-tstyle-rowband-size:0;
	mso-tstyle-colband-size:0;
	mso-style-noshow:yes;
	mso-style-parent:" ;
	mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;
	mso-para-margin:0in;
	mso-para-margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	font-size:10.0pt;
	font-family:"Times New Roman";}
</style>
<![endif]-->
</head>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Problem H</span></b><br>
<b><span style='font-size:24.0pt'>Game Show Math</span></b><br>
<b>Input:</b> standard input<br>
<b>Output:</b> standard output<br>
<b>Time Limit:</b> 15 seconds<br style='mso-special-character:line-break'>
<![if !supportLineBreakNewLine]><br style='mso-special-character:line-break'>
<![endif]></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>A game show in <st1:country-region><st1:place>Britain</st1:place></st1:country-region>
has a segment where it gives its contestants a sequence of positive numbers and
a target number. The contestant must make a mathematical expression using all
of the numbers in the sequence and only the operators: <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>+</b>, <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>-</b>, <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>*</b>, and, <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>/</b>. Each number in the sequence must be used exactly once, but each
operator may be used zero to many times. The expression should be read from
left to right, without regard for order of operations, to calculate the target
number. It is possible that no expression can generate the target number. It is
possible that many expressions can generate the target number.</p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>There are three restrictions on the composition
of the mathematical expression:</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
margin-left:27.0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-9.0pt;mso-list:l0 level2 lfo2;
tab-stops:list 27.0pt 1.0in'><![if !supportLists]><span style='font-size:10.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Courier New"'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>o<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]>the numbers in the expression must appear in the
same order as they appear in the input file </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
margin-left:27.0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-9.0pt;mso-list:l0 level2 lfo2;
tab-stops:list 27.0pt 1.0in'><![if !supportLists]><span style='font-size:10.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Courier New"'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>o<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]>since the target will always be an integer value
(a positive number), you are only allowed to use / in the expression when the
result will give a remainder of zero. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
margin-left:27.0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-9.0pt;mso-list:l0 level2 lfo2;
tab-stops:list 27.0pt 1.0in'><![if !supportLists]><span style='font-size:10.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Courier New"'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>o<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span class=GramE>you</span> are only allowed to
use an operator in the expression, if its result after applying that operator
is an integer from (<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>-32000</b> .. <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>+32000</b>).</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Input</span></b></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>The input file describes multiple test cases. The
first line contains the number of test cases <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>n</span></b>.</p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>Each subsequent line contains the number of
positive numbers in the sequence <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>p</span></b>, followed by <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>p</span></b>
positive numbers, followed by the target number. Note that <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>0 &lt; <span style='mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>p</span> </b><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:Symbol'>£</span>
100</b>. There may be duplicate numbers in the sequence. But all the numbers are
less than <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>32000</b>.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Output</span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>The output file should contain an
expression, including all <i>k</i> numbers and <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>(<i>k</i>-1)</b> operators plus the equals sign and the target. Do not
include spaces in your expression. Remember that order of operations does not
apply here. <span class=GramE>If there is no expression possible output <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>&quot;</b><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>NO EXPRESSION</span>&quot;
</b>(without the quotes).</span> If more than one expression is possible, any
one of them will do.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;color:black'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>3<br>
3 5 7 4 3<br>
2 1 1 2000<br>
5 12 2 5 1 2 4<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Output</span></b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'><br>
</span><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>5+7/4=3 <br>
NO EXPRESSION<br>
12-2/5*1*2=4<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</b></div>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>(Problem-setter:
Sandy Graham, CS Dept, </b><st1:place><st1:PlaceType><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
  normal'>University</b></st1:PlaceType><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>
 of </b><st1:PlaceName><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Waterloo</b></st1:PlaceName></st1:place><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>)<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

</div>

</body>

</html>

 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="24578">
  <o:colormru v:ext="edit" colors="#602000"/>
 </o:shapedefaults></xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>

 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->

<body lang=EN-US link="#6633CC" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt;color:windowtext'>Problem I</span></b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><br>
</span><b><span style='font-size:24.0pt;color:windowtext'>Injured Queen Problem</span></b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><br>
<b>Input:</b> standard input<br>
<b>Output:</b> standard output<br>
<b>Time Limit:</b> 6 seconds<br>
<b>Memory Limit:</b> 32 MB<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shapetype id="_x0000_t75"
 coordsize="21600,21600" o:spt="75" o:preferrelative="t" path="m@4@5l@4@11@9@11@9@5xe"
 filled="f" stroked="f">
 <v:stroke joinstyle="miter"/>
 <v:formulas>
  <v:f eqn="if lineDrawn pixelLineWidth 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 1 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum 0 0 @1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @2 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 0 1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @6 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @8 21600 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @10 21600 0"/>
 </v:formulas>
 <v:path o:extrusionok="f" gradientshapeok="t" o:connecttype="rect"/>
 <o:lock v:ext="edit" aspectratio="t"/>
</v:shapetype><v:shape id="_x0000_s1031" type="#_x0000_t75" style='position:absolute;
 left:0;text-align:left;margin-left:220.05pt;margin-top:13.1pt;width:234pt;
 height:173.7pt;z-index:1' o:allowoverlap="f">
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p8_files/image001.png"  o:title=" />
 <w:wrap type="square"/>
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=312 height=232
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p8_files/image001.png"  align=left hspace=12 v:shapes="_x0000_s1031"><![endif]>Chess
is a two-player board game believed to have been played in <st1:country-region><st1:place>India</st1:place></st1:country-region>
as early as the sixth century. However, in this problem we will not discuss
about chess, rather we will talk about a modified form of the classic n-queen
problem. I know you are familiar with plotting n-queens on a chess board with
the help of a classic backtracking algorithm. If you write that algorithm now
you will find that there are <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>92</b> ways
of plotting <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>8</b> queens in an <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>8x8</b> board provided no queens attack
each other. <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt'>In this problem we will talk about injured queens who can move only
like a king in horizontal and diagonal direction from current position but can
reach any row from current position like a normal chess queen. You will have to
find the number of possible arrangements with such injured queens in a
particular <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>(n x n)</b> board (with some
additional constraints), such that no two queens attack each other. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<div align=center>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=0 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='border-collapse:collapse;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;height:249.6pt'>
  <td width=453 valign=top style='width:339.9pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;
  height:249.6pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape id="_x0000_i1025"
   type="#_x0000_t75" style='width:294pt;height:255.75pt'>
   <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p8_files/image001.png"  o:title=" />
  </v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=392 height=341
  src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p8_files/image001.png"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1025"><![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:1;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes;height:6.9pt'>
  <td width=453 valign=top style='width:339.9pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;
  height:6.9pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
  normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>Fig:</span></b><span
  style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'> Injured Queen at <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
  normal'>a6</b> can reach the adjacent grey squares. Queen at <b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>e4</b> can reach adjacent grey squares.
  The injured queen positions are black and the reachable places are grey. <o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt;
color:windowtext'>Input</span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
color:windowtext'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Input file contains several lines
of input. Each line expresses a certain board status. The length of these
status string is the board dimension <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>n
(0&lt;n&lt;=15)</b>. The first character of the string denotes the status of
first column, the second character of the string denotes the status of the
second column and so on. So if the first character of the status string is <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>2</b>, it means that we are looking for
arrangements (no two injured queen attack each other) which has injured queen
in column <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>a, </b>row <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>2</b>. The possible numbers for rows are <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>1, 2, 3&#8230; D, E, F</b> which indicates
row <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>1, 2, 3&#8230; 13, 14, 15</b>. If
any column contains &#8216;<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>?&#8217;</b>
it means that in that column the injured queen can be in any row. So a status
string <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>1?4??3</b> means that you are
asked to find out total number of possible arrangements in a <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>(6x6)</b> chessboard which has three of its
six injured queens at <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>a1</b>, <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>c4</b> and <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>f3</b>. Also note that there will be no invalid inputs. For example <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>&#8220;1?51&#8221;</b> is an invalid input
because a <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>(4x4) </b>chessboard does not
have a fifth row.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt;color:windowtext'>Output</span></b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>For each line of input produce
one line of output. This line should contain an integer which indicates the
total number of possible arrangements of the corresponding input status string.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:12.0pt'><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt;
color:windowtext'>Sample Input</span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
color:windowtext'><br>
</span><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:windowtext'>??????<br>
??????????????? <br>
???8?????<br>
43?????<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:12.0pt'><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt;
color:windowtext'>Sample Output</span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
color:windowtext'><br>
</span><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:windowtext'>2642<br>
22696209911206174 <br>
2098208<br>
0</span><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Courier;color:windowtext'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='margin-bottom:12.0pt;text-align:center'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Courier;color:windowtext'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</span></div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:12.0pt'><b>(Problem setter: Shahriar
Manzoor, CSE Dept, Southeast University, Dhaka)</b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt;font-family:Courier;color:windowtext'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<div style='margin-bottom:12.0pt'>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:1.25in;
margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:81.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:center'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:1.25in;
margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:81.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:center'>&#8220;Sometimes
we must get hurt in order to grow, we must fail in order to know, sometimes our
vision clears only after our eyes are washed away with tears.&quot;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Courier;color:windowtext'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

</div>

</div>

</body>

</html>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Problem J</span></b><br>
<b><span style='font-size:24.0pt'>Triangle Covering</span></b><span
style='font-size:24.0pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b>Input:</b>
standard input<br>
<b>Output:</b> standard output<br>
<b>Time Limit:</b> 5 seconds<br>
<b>Memory Limit:</b> 32 MB</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt;color:black'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='color:black'>Triangle
covering problem is a very interesting. Some people</span> have done interesting
research on this topic. In this problem you are asked to solve some elementary
covering problems. The basic idea of covering problem is to find out the
smallest size of a particular shape that can entirely cover another particular
shape. Covering problems have many practical applications such as finding
smallest possible square sized covers for a round table. In some ways covering
problems are similar to packing problems but they have significant differences
also. In this problem you are asked to find out the maximum possible size of an
equilateral triangle which can be covered by <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>2</b>, <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>3</b>, <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>4</b> or <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>6</b> squares of equal size. The following pictures show how these
coverings can be done. You can assume that </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.25in;
mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2;tab-stops:list .5in'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>a)<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span><![endif]>When a picture looks exactly symmetric along a certain
axis they are actually symmetric. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.25in;
mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2;tab-stops:list .5in'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>b)<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span><![endif]>When three or more lines appear coincident they are
actually coincident </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.25in;
mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2;tab-stops:list .5in'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>c)<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span><![endif]>When a part of a figure looks exactly similar to
another part they are actually similar.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:16.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:16.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=0 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='border-collapse:collapse;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0'>
  <td width=319 valign=top style='width:239.4pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:24.0pt'><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shapetype
   id="_x0000_t75" coordsize="21600,21600" o:spt="75" o:preferrelative="t"
   path="m@4@5l@4@11@9@11@9@5xe" filled="f" stroked="f">
   <v:stroke joinstyle="miter"/>
   <v:formulas>
    <v:f eqn="if lineDrawn pixelLineWidth 0"/>
    <v:f eqn="sum @0 1 0"/>
    <v:f eqn="sum 0 0 @1"/>
    <v:f eqn="prod @2 1 2"/>
    <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelWidth"/>
    <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelHeight"/>
    <v:f eqn="sum @0 0 1"/>
    <v:f eqn="prod @6 1 2"/>
    <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelWidth"/>
    <v:f eqn="sum @8 21600 0"/>
    <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelHeight"/>
    <v:f eqn="sum @10 21600 0"/>
   </v:formulas>
   <v:path o:extrusionok="f" gradientshapeok="t" o:connecttype="rect"/>
   <o:lock v:ext="edit" aspectratio="t"/>
  </v:shapetype><v:shape id="_x0000_i1025" type="#_x0000_t75" alt="  style='width:204.75pt;
   height:257.25pt'>
   <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10402a.gif"  o:href="file:///D:\Documents%20and%20Settings\Administrator\Desktop\Math\selected3\Squares%20Covering%20Triangles_files\sct2.gif"/>
  </v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=273 height=343
  src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10402a.gif"  align=abscenter v:shapes="_x0000_i1025"><![endif]></span><span
  style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
  <td width=312 valign=top style='width:3.25in;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:24.0pt'><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape
   id="_x0000_i1026" type="#_x0000_t75" alt="  style='width:220.5pt;height:233.25pt'>
   <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10402a.gif"  o:href="file:///D:\Documents%20and%20Settings\Administrator\Desktop\Math\selected3\Squares%20Covering%20Triangles_files\sct3.gif"/>
  </v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=294 height=311
  src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10402a.gif"  align=abscenter v:shapes="_x0000_i1026"><![endif]></span><span
  style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:1'>
  <td width=319 valign=top style='width:239.4pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
  color:black'>Fig 1: Covering with two squares<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width=312 valign=top style='width:3.25in;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
  color:black'>Fig 2: Covering with three squares<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:2'>
  <td width=319 valign=top style='width:239.4pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:24.0pt'><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape
   id="_x0000_i1027" type="#_x0000_t75" alt="  style='width:218.25pt;height:234pt'>
   <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10402a.gif"  o:href="file:///D:\Documents%20and%20Settings\Administrator\Desktop\Math\selected3\Squares%20Covering%20Triangles_files\sct4.gif"/>
  </v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=291 height=312
  src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10402a.gif"  align=abscenter v:shapes="_x0000_i1027"><![endif]></span><span
  style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
  <td width=312 valign=top style='width:3.25in;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:24.0pt'><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape
   id="_x0000_i1028" type="#_x0000_t75" alt="  style='width:227.25pt;height:234pt'>
   <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10402a.gif"  o:href="file:///D:\Documents%20and%20Settings\Administrator\Desktop\Math\selected3\Squares%20Covering%20Triangles_files\sct6.gif"/>
  </v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=303 height=312
  src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10402a.gif"  align=abscenter v:shapes="_x0000_i1028"><![endif]></span><span
  style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:3;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=319 valign=top style='width:239.4pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
  color:black'>Fig 3: Covering with four squares<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width=312 valign=top style='width:3.25in;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
  color:black'>Fig 4: Covering with six squares<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Input</span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt;color:black'>First line of the input file contains a single integer <span
class=GramE><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>N(</b></span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>N&lt;=5000)</b> which indicates how many
sets of input are there in the input file. Each of the next <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>N</b> lines makes a set of input.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt;color:black'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt;color:black'>Each line contains a single floating point number <span
class=GramE><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>S(</b></span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>0&lt;=S&lt;=10000)</b> which indicates the
side of the squares that will cover the equilateral triangle. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt;color:black'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Output</span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='color:black'>For
each set <span class=GramE>of<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>input</span>
produce one line of output. So the output file contains <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>N</b> lines of output.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='color:black'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='color:black'>Each
line contains four floating point numbers <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>T<sub>2</sub></b>,
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>T<sub>3</sub></b>, <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>T<sub>4</sub></b> and <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>T<sub>6</sub></b>.
Each floating point number has ten digits after the decimal point. </span><st1:place><st1:City><span
  style='color:black'>Here</span></st1:City><span style='color:black'> </span><st1:State><span
  class=GramE><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='color:black'>T<sub>x</sub></span></b></span></st1:State></st1:place><span
style='color:black'> means the side of the largest triangle that can be covered
by <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>x</b> squares of side <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>S</b>. You dont need to worry about small
precision errors as small precision errors will be ignored (<b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>max(1e-7, 0.00001%)</b>). All the floating
point numbers in the output should have ten digits after the decimal point.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;color:black'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Input</span></b><br>
<span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>5<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>0.000000001<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>0.000000002<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>0.000000003<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>0.000000004<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>0.000000005<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:Courier'><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Sample Output</span></b><br>
<span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>0.0000000013
0.0000000021 0.0000000023 0.0000000032<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>0.0000000026
0.0000000042 0.0000000046 0.0000000063<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>0.0000000039
0.0000000063 0.0000000069 0.0000000095<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>0.0000000053
0.0000000084 0.0000000092 0.0000000127<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>0.0000000066
0.0000000105 0.0000000115 0.0000000158<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-outline-level:1'><b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt;color:black'>(Problem setter: Shahriar Manzoor, CSE Dept, </span></b><st1:place><st1:PlaceName><b><span
  style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;color:black'>Southeast</span></b></st1:PlaceName><b><span

  style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;color:black'>University</span></b></st1:PlaceType></st1:place><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;color:black'>, </span></b><st1:place><b><span
 style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;color:black'>Dhaka</span></b></st1:place><b><span

and David Cantrell for their wonderful research works.)</p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:55.45pt;
margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.75in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:center'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:55.45pt;
margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.75in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:center'>Everyone
in this world is different, but the people who are truly brave</p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:55.45pt;
margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.75in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:center'><span
class=GramE>enough</span> to show their differences are considered embarassing </p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:55.45pt;
margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.75in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:center'><span
class=GramE>or</span> not normal. Maybe, the 'normal' people in this world </p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:55.45pt;
margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.75in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:center'><span
class=GramE>are</span> just scared to show who they really are.</p>

10403||||||false||||||
<html>
<title>Problem A: Escape from Tut's Tomb</title>

<h2>Problem A: Escape from Tut's Tomb</h2>

<img align="right" src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10403.jpg" >

<P> Congratulations Indiana: You have successfully penetrated Tut's inner
chamber and bask in untold fortune and glory.  But alas, your clumsy
sidekick has tripped a booby trap and the only way to save both of
your lives is to solve the following puzzle quickly.

<P> Before you sit <b>n</b> gold sphinxes of distinct integer weights
<b>1...n</b>.  In order to escape you must place them in the proper
order on the <b>n</b> stones in front of you.  Your awkward but clever
sidekick has deciphered some hieroglyphs on the wall next to you and
discovered that they contain various weighings of the sphinxes.  Use
this information to deduce the proper order.

<h3> Input </h3>
<p>Input file contains several sets of input. The description of each set is given below: </p>
<P> The first line contains two numbers <b>n</b> and <b>m</b> (1 &lt;=
<b>n</b> &lt;= 26, 1 &lt;= <b>m</b> &lt;= 10000) where <b>n</b> is
the number of sphinxes and <b>m</b> is the number of weighings.  The
next <b>m</b> lines are the weighings.  For convenience, the stones
have been labelled alphabetically.  Each line contains <b>n</b>
letters divided by a <b>&lt;</b>, <b>=</b>, or <b>&gt;</b> where the
separator indicates the sphinxes that go on the lettered stones on the
left are less, equal to, or greater than in weight than the sphinxes
on the right respectively.</p>
<p>
Input is terminated by end of file.
</p>

<h3> Output </h3>

<P> If there is no solution print <tt>No solution possible!</tt> and
prepare to die.  Otherwise, print <tt>Solution:</tt> followed by the
weight of the sphinxs that go on the stones ordered alphabetically.
If more than one solution exists, find the solution that minimizes the
weight on the first stone, then the second stone, etc.

<h3> Sample Input </h3>
<PRE>
3 5
a c = b
a c = b
b c > a
a c = b
c < a b
3 5
a c = b
a c = b
b c > a
a c = b
c < a b
</PRE>

<h3> Sample Output </h3>
<PRE>
Solution: 1 3 2
Solution: 1 3 2
</PRE>
<hr>
<b>Problem Setter: Jonathan Backer
</b>
</html>
______________________________________________________
10404||||||false||||||
<html>
<title>Problem B: Bachet's Game</title>

<h2>Problem B: Bachet's Game</h2>

<img align="right" src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10404.jpg" >

Bachet's game is probably known to all but probably not by this name.
Initially there are <b>n</b> stones on the table. There are two
players Stan and Ollie, who move alternately.  Stan always starts. The
legal moves consist in removing at least one but not more than
<b>k</b> stones from the table.  The winner is the one to take the
last stone.
<p>
Here we consider a variation of this game.  The number of stones
that can be removed in a single move must be a member of a certain
set of <b>m</b> numbers.  Among the <b>m</b> numbers there is
always 1 and thus the game never stalls.

<h3>Input</h3>
The input consists of a number of lines.  Each line describes one game
by a sequence of positive numbers. The first number is
<b>n</b> &lt;= 1000000 the number of stones on the table; the second
number is <b>m</b> &lt;= 10 giving the number of numbers that follow;
the last <b>m</b> numbers on the line specify how many stones
can be removed from the table in a single move.

<h3>Input</h3>
For each line of input, output one line saying either <tt>Stan wins</tt>
or <tt>Ollie wins</tt> assuming that both of them play perfectly.

<h3>Sample input</h3>
<pre>
20 3 1 3 8
21 3 1 3 8
22 3 1 3 8
23 3 1 3 8
1000000 10 1 23 38 11 7 5 4 8 3 13
999996 10 1 23 38 11 7 5 4 8 3 13
</pre>

<h3>Output for sample input</h3>
<pre>
Stan wins
Stan wins
Ollie wins
Stan wins
Stan wins
Ollie wins
</pre>
<hr>
<b>Problem Setter: Piotr Rudnicki
</b>
</html>
______________________________________________________
10405||||||false||||||
<html>
<title>Problem C: Longest Common Subsequence</title>

<h2>Problem C: Longest Common Subsequence</h2>

<p>Sequence 1: <img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10405b.gif"  align="middle"></img>
<img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10405b.gif"  align="middle"></img>
<img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10405b.gif"  align="middle"></img>
<img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10405b.gif"  align="middle"></img>
<img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10405b.gif"  align="middle"></img>
<img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10405b.gif"  align="middle"></img>
<img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10405b.gif"  align="middle"></img>
<img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10405b.gif"  align="middle"></img>
<img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10405b.gif"  align="middle"></img>
<img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10405b.gif"  align="middle"></img>
<img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10405b.gif"  align="middle"></img>
<img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10405b.gif"  align="middle"></img>
<img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10405b.gif"  align="middle"></img>
<img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10405b.gif"  align="middle"></img>
<img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10405b.gif"  align="middle"></img> <br>

<p>Sequence 2: <img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10405b.gif"  align="middle"></img>
<img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10405b.gif"  align="middle"></img>
<img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10405b.gif"  align="middle"></img>
<img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10405b.gif"  align="middle"></img>
<img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10405b.gif"  align="middle"></img>
<img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10405b.gif"  align="middle"></img>
<img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10405b.gif"  align="middle"></img>
<img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10405b.gif"  align="middle"></img>
<img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10405b.gif"  align="middle"></img>
<img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10405b.gif"  align="middle"></img>
<img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10405b.gif"  align="middle"></img>
<img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10405b.gif"  align="middle"></img>
<img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10405b.gif"  align="middle"></img>
<img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10405b.gif"  align="middle"></img>
<img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10405b.gif"  align="middle"></img>
<br><br><br>

Given two sequences of characters, print the
length of the longest common subsequence of both sequences.  For
example, the longest common subsequence of the following two
sequences:
<pre>
abcdgh
aedfhr
</pre>
is <tt>adh</tt> of length 3.
<p>
Input consists of pairs of lines. The first line of a pair contains
the first string and the second line contains the second string.  Each
string is on a separate line and consists of at most 1,000 characters
<p>
For each subsequent pair of input lines, output a line containing one
integer number which satisfies the criteria stated above.


<h3>Sample input </h3>
<pre>
a1b2c3d4e
zz1yy2xx3ww4vv
abcdgh
aedfhr
abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz
a0b0c0d0e0f0g0h0i0j0k0l0m0n0o0p0q0r0s0t0u0v0w0x0y0z0
abcdefghijklmnzyxwvutsrqpo
opqrstuvwxyzabcdefghijklmn
</pre>

<h3>Output for the sample input </h3>
<pre>
4
3
26
14
</pre>
<hr>
<b>Problem Setter: Piotr Rudnicki
</b>

</html>
