<body lang=EN-US link="#6633cc" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt;color:windowtext'>Problem D</span></b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><br>
</span><b><span style='font-size:24.0pt;color:windowtext'>Closest Sums</span></b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><br>
<b>Input:</b> standard input<br>
<b>Output:</b> standard output<br>
<b>Time Limit:</b> 3 seconds<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Given is a set of integers and
then a sequence of queries. A query gives you a number and asks to find a sum of
two distinct numbers from the set, which is closest to the query number. <span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt'>Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>Input contains multiple cases. </p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>Each case starts with an integer n
(1&lt;n&lt;=1000), which indicates, how many numbers are in the set of integer.
Next n lines contain n numbers. Of course there is only one number in a single
line. The next line contains a positive integer <em>m</em> giving the number of
queries, 0 &lt; <em>m</em> &lt; 25. The next <em>m</em> lines contain an
integer of the query, one per line.</p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>Input is terminated by a case whose n=0. Surely,
this case needs no processing. </p>

<p style='text-align:justify'><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>Output should be organized as in the sample
below. For each query output one line giving the query value and the closest
sum in the format as in the sample. Inputs will be such that no ties will occur.
</p>

<h3><span style='font-size:18.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'>Sample input<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:"Courier New"'>5 <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<pre><span style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>3<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>12<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>17<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>33<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>34<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>3<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>1<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>51<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>30<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>3<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>1<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>2<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>3<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>3<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>1<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>2<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>3<o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>3 <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<pre><span style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>1<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>2<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>3<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>3<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>4<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>5<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>6<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>0<o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<h3 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:18.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'>Sample output<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<pre><span style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>Case 1:<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>Closest sum to 1 is 15.<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>Closest sum to 51 is 51.<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>Closest sum to 30 is 29.<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>Case 2:<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>Closest sum to 1 is 3.<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>Closest sum to 2 is 3.<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>Closest sum to 3 is 3.<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>Case 3:<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>Closest sum to 4 is 4.<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>Closest sum to 5 is 5.<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>Closest sum to 6 is 5.<o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</span></div>


<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Piotr Rudnicki</b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><br
style='mso-special-character:line-break'>
<![if !supportLineBreakNewLine]><br style='mso-special-character:line-break'>
<![endif]><span style='font-size:14.0pt;font-family:"Monotype Corsiva"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

</div>

<title>Problem E:Swimming gopher</title>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<h2 align=center style='text-align:center'>Problem E<span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt'><br>
</span><span style='font-size:24.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>A Swimming
Gopher</span><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'><br>
</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt'>Input: </span><span style='font-size:
12.0pt;font-weight:normal'>standard input</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt'><br>
Output: </span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-weight:normal'>standard
output</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt'><br>
Time Limit: </span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-weight:normal'>2 seconds</span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shapetype id="_x0000_t75" coordsize="21600,21600"
 o:spt="75" o:preferrelative="t" path="m@4@5l@4@11@9@11@9@5xe" filled="f"
 stroked="f">
 <v:stroke joinstyle="miter"/>
 <v:formulas>
  <v:f eqn="if lineDrawn pixelLineWidth 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 1 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum 0 0 @1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @2 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 0 1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @6 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @8 21600 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @10 21600 0"/>
 </v:formulas>
 <v:path o:extrusionok="f" gradientshapeok="t" o:connecttype="rect"/>
 <o:lock v:ext="edit" aspectratio="t"/>
</v:shapetype><v:shape id="_x0000_s1026" type="#_x0000_t75" alt="  style='position:absolute;
 margin-left:0;margin-top:0;width:261.75pt;height:216.75pt;z-index:1;
 mso-wrap-distance-left:0;mso-wrap-distance-top:0;mso-wrap-distance-right:0;
 mso-wrap-distance-bottom:0;mso-position-horizontal:left;
 mso-position-horizontal-relative:text;mso-position-vertical-relative:line'
 o:allowoverlap="f">
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10488a.jpg" />
 <w:wrap type="square"/>
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=349 height=289
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10488a.jpg"  align=left v:shapes="_x0000_s1026"><![endif]>A gopher
lives in the flatlands of Northern Saskatchewan and travels frequently to see
his cousins. After years and years of drought, there was a period of unusually
heavy rains which resulted in all the ditches on the way of the gopher's travel
being flooded with water. The ditches run in the West-East direction and each
ditch is of a constant width. The gopher still wants to make his travels but being
not a very good swimmer, he wants to minimize the distance that he has to swim
through the ditches and with this requirement satisfied, he also wants to walk
as little as possible on the dry land. Your task is to find the length of the
gopher's route which minimizes his swimming and then his walking. </p>

<p><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape id="_x0000_s1027" type="#_x0000_t75" alt=" 
 style='position:absolute;margin-left:298pt;margin-top:0;width:189pt;height:165.75pt;
 z-index:2;mso-wrap-distance-left:0;mso-wrap-distance-top:0;
 mso-wrap-distance-right:0;mso-wrap-distance-bottom:0;
 mso-position-horizontal:right;mso-position-horizontal-relative:text;
 mso-position-vertical-relative:line' o:allowoverlap="f">
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10488a.jpg" />
 <w:wrap type="square"/>
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=252 height=221
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10488a.jpg"  align=right v:shapes="_x0000_s1027"><![endif]>We are
given a system of orthogonal coordinates, where the <em>x</em> axis is directed
from West to East and the <em>y</em> axis is directed from South to North.
Given are real numbers: <em>D</em> and <em>L</em>, 0 &lt; <em>L</em>, <em>L+L</em>
&lt; <em>D</em>, such that a point (<em>x</em>, <em>y</em>) is on dry land if
and only if there exists an integer <em>n</em> such that </p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><em>n*D+L</em> &lt;= <em>y</em>
&lt;= <em>(n+1)*D-L</em>. </p>

<p>Given is the starting point of the gopher (<em>x<sub>s</sub>, y<sub>s</sub></em>)
and its target point (<em>x<sub>t</sub>, y<sub>t</sub></em>). Both these points
are on dry land. </p>

<p>Each line of input contains six real numbers: <em>D</em>, <em>L</em>, <em>x<sub>s</sub>,
y<sub>s</sub></em>, <em>x<sub>t</sub>, y<sub>t</sub></em>. For each line of
input, output one line with the needed information in the format shown in the
sample output. </p>

<h3>Sample input</h3>

<pre>100.0 10.0 0.0 50.0 100.0 50.0</pre><pre>100.0 10.0 0.0 50.0 100.0 150.0</pre><pre>100.0 10.0 0.0 -50.0 100.0 50.0</pre><pre>100.0 10.0 0.0 -50.0 100.0 150.0</pre>

<h3>Output for sample input</h3>

<pre>The gopher has to swim 0.00 meters and walk 100.00 meters.</pre><pre>The gopher has to swim 20.00 meters and walk 128.06 meters.</pre><pre>The gopher has to swim 20.00 meters and walk 128.06 meters.</pre><pre>The gopher has to swim 40.00 meters and walk 188.68 meters.</pre>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>


<p class=MsoNormal><b>Piotr Rudnicki</b> </p>

</div>

</body>

</html>

<title>Problem F: Boxes of Chocolates</title>
<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:DocumentProperties>

  <o:Words>261</o:Words>

  <o:Version>9.2720</o:Version>
 </o:DocumentProperties>
</xml><![endif]-->

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<h1 align=center style='text-align:center'><span style='font-size:18.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt'>Problem F</span><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt'><br>
Boxes of Chocolates<br>
</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt'>Input: </span><span style='font-size:
12.0pt;font-weight:normal'>standard input</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt'><br>
Output: </span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-weight:normal'>standard
output</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt'><br>
Time Limit: </span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-weight:normal'>5 seconds</span></h1>

<p style='text-align:justify'>Little <i>Pippy</i> has got a lot of chocolates
on her 6<sup>th</sup> birthday. She is a very good and charming girl and always
shares his belongings with her friends (and she has lots of friends). Now she
wants to share all the chocolate with her friends. She will try her best to
give all her friend equal number of chocolates but in case she fails, she will
give her pet cat <i>Kittu</i> the residue number of chocolates. The chocolates
she has got are in boxes wrapped with beautiful papers. Sometimes a box do not
contain chocolates but have smaller boxes inside them. Even sometimes the
smaller boxes do not contain any chocolates but have further smaller boxes
inside them. Only the smallest boxes always contain some chocolates.</p>

<h2>Input</h2>

<p style='text-align:justify'>Input will start with an integer <b>T</b>.
Following lines will contain descriptions for <b>T</b> test cases. First line
of each test case will contain two integers <b>N</b> and <b>B</b> indicating
the number of friends <i>Pippy</i> has and the number of box of chocolates she
has got respectively. Each of the next <b>B</b> lines will contain a
description of a single box. These lines will start with an integer <b>K</b>
followed by <b>K</b> integers identified as <b>a<sub>1</sub>, a<sub>2</sub>, a<sub>3</sub>,
... ... ... a<sub>k</sub></b>. Here <b>a<sub>i</sub></b> indicates the number
of boxes the <b>i</b>-th box contains within it where (<b>0 &lt; i &lt; K</b>).
The last number of the line indicates the number of chocolates contained in
each of the smallest box. All the numbers will be positive and <b>T</b>, <b>B</b>,
<b>K</b> will be less than <b>101</b> and <b>N</b>, <b>a<sub>i</sub></b> will
be less than <b>10001</b>.</p>

<h2>Output</h2>

<p style='text-align:justify'>For each test case, print an integer on a single
line indicating the number of extra chocolates <i>Kittu</i> will get after
dividing all of them equally among <i>Pippy</i>'s friends.</p>

<h2>Sample Input</h2>

<pre>2</pre><pre>5 2</pre><pre>3 2 3 4</pre><pre>4 5 2 3 1</pre><pre>6 1</pre><pre>4 5 6 7 8</pre>

<h2 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>Sample
Output</h2>

<pre>4</pre><pre>0</pre>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>


<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b>Tanveer
Ahsan</b></p>

</div>

</body>

</html>

<body lang=EN-US link="#6633cc" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt;color:windowtext'>Problem G</span></b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><br>
</span><b><span style='font-size:24.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>Mr. Azad and
His Son!!!!!</span></b><b><span style='font-size:23.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'>Input:</span></b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'> standard input<br>
<b>Output:</b> standard output<br>
<b>Time Limit:</b> 4 seconds<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN style='mso-ansi-language:
EN'>There are a lot of Abul Kalam Azad in Bangladesh. But, why is he so
special? Not that he is my dad is the only reason. He can wonderfully do some
calculation. If anyone gives him any positive integer, he amazingly can say the
relative perfect number using the formula 2^(k-1)*(2^k-1) without using neither
calculator nor computer. Say, I have told him to find out the relative perfect
number of 2, he replies 6 which is a perfect number. But perfect is not
possible for all the integers. I have asked him the process, but he says that I
should find this thing out by myself how an integer is related to a perfect
number. Anyway, I have challenged him that it is very possible for me to do the
same calculation using a computer. Although I could not figure out how he can
do this, I know that the next ACM Online Programming Contest is near at hand
and World's top programmers are available to solve my very simple problem.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN style='mso-ansi-language:
EN'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN style='mso-ansi-language:
EN'>Now, you are to write a program for me to win over my dad, which will take
input <b>n</b>, and determine the perfect number <b>p</b>.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:143.25pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<h2>Input</h2>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><span lang=EN
style='mso-ansi-language:EN'>An integer <b>1&lt;n&lt;=31</b> is given in each input
line. Input is terminated by a zero in a single line. This input should not be
processed. All the output numbers will fit in 64 bit signed integer.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt'>Output<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'> <o:p></o:p></i></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:143.25pt'><span lang=EN style='mso-ansi-language:
EN'>Output will be in the following format:<br>
<br>
If perfect number is possible -<b><br>
Perfect: p!</b><br>
<br>
If perfect number is not possible, but given number is prime -<br>
<b>Given number is prime. But, NO perfect number is available.</b><br>
<br>
If perfect number is not possible and given number is not prime -<br>
<b>Given number is NOT prime! NO perfect number is available.<o:p></o:p></b></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><b><span
lang=EN style='mso-ansi-language:EN'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<h2>Sample Input</h2>

<pre><span lang=EN style='mso-ansi-language:EN'>2<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
lang=EN style='mso-ansi-language:EN'>3<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
lang=EN style='mso-ansi-language:EN'>6<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
lang=EN style='mso-ansi-language:EN'>0<o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<h2>Sample Output</h2>

<pre><span lang=EN style='mso-ansi-language:EN'>Perfect: 6!<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
lang=EN style='mso-ansi-language:EN'>Perfect: 28!<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
lang=EN style='mso-ansi-language:EN'>Given number is NOT prime! NO perfect number is available.<o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>


<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Tanzim Saqib </b></p>

</div>

</body>

</html>

<o:SmartTagType namespaceuri="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags" name="place"/><o:SmartTagType namespaceuri="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags" name="country-region"/><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>

 </u5:shapelayout>
</xml><![endif]--><u7:SmartTagType namespaceuri="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags" name="place"/><u7:SmartTagType namespaceuri="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags" name="PlaceName"/><u7:SmartTagType namespaceuri="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags" name="PlaceType"/>

<body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt;color:black'>Problem H</span></b><span
style='color:black'><br>
</span><b><span style='font-size:24.0pt;color:black'>Cows and Cars</span></b><span
style='color:black'><br>
<b>Input:</b> standard input<br>
<b>Output:</b> standard output<br>
<b>Time Limit:</b> 4 seconds<br style='mso-special-character:line-break'>
<![if !supportLineBreakNewLine]><br style='mso-special-character:line-break'>
<![endif]></span><o:p></o:p></p>

<u7:p></u7:p>

<p class=MsoBodyText2><span lang=EN style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN'>In television
contests, participants are often asked to choose one from a set of or doors for
example, one or several of which lead to different prizes. In this problem we
will deal with a specific kind of such a contest. Suppose you are given the
following challenge by the contest presenter:<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN style='mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'><br>
In front of you there are three doors. Two of them hide a cow, the other one
hides your prize - a car.<br>
After you choose a door, but before you open it, I will give you an hint, by
opening one of the doors which hides a cow (I'll never open the door you have
chosen, even if it hides a cow). You will then be able to choose if you want to
keep your choice, or if you wish to change to the other unopened door. You will
win whatever is behind the door you open.<br>
<br>
In this example, the probability you have of winning the car is 2/3 (as hard as
it is to believe), assuming you always switch your choice when the presenter
gives you the opportunity to do so (after he shows you a door with a cow). The
reason of this number (2/3) is this - if you had chosen one of the two cows,
you would surely switch to the car, since the presenter had shown you the other
cow. If you had chosen the car, you would switch to the remaining cow,
therefore losing the prize. Thus, in two out of three cases you would switch to
the car. The probability to win if you had chosen to stick with your initial
choice would obviously be only 1/3, but that isn't important for this problem.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN style='mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'><br>
In this problem, you are to calculate the probability you have of winning the
car, for a generalization of the problem above:<br>
<br>
- The number of cows is variable<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN style='mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>- The number of cars is variable (number of cows +
number of cars = total number of doors)<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN style='mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>- The number of doors hiding cows that the
presenter opens for you is variable (several doors may still be open when you
are given the opportunity to change your choice)<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN style='mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'><br>
<br>
You should assume that you always decide to switch your choice to any other of
the unopen doors after the presenter shows you some doors with cows behind it.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial;
color:black'>Input<u7:p></u7:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;mso-ansi-language:
EN'>There are several test cases for your program to process. Each test case
consists of three integers on a line, separated by whitespace. Each line has
the following format:<br>
<br>
NCOWS NCARS NSHOW<br>
<br>
Where NCOWS is the number of doors with cows, NCARS is the number of doors with
cars and NSHOW is the number of doors the presenter opens for you before you
choose to switch to another unopen door.<br>
<br>
The limits for your program are:<br>
<br>
1 &lt;= NCOWS &lt;= 10000<br>
<br>
1 &lt;= NCARS &lt;= 10000<br>
<br>
0 &lt;= NSHOW &lt; NCOWS<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:18.0pt;mso-bidi-font-family:
Arial;color:black'>&nbsp;<u7:p></u7:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial;
color:black'>Output<u7:p></u7:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText2><span lang=EN style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN'>For each of the
test cases, you are to output a line containing just one value - the
probability of winning the car assuming you switch to another unopen door,
displayed to 5 decimal places.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN style='mso-bidi-font-family:
Arial;color:black;mso-ansi-language:EN'><span style="mso-spacerun:
yes"> </span><span style="mso-spacerun: yes"> </span><u7:p></u7:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial;
color:black'>Sample input<u7:p></u7:p></span></b></p>

<pre><span lang=EN style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
mso-ansi-language:EN'>2 1 1<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span lang=EN
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>5 3 2<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span
lang=EN style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;mso-ansi-language:
EN'>2000 2700 900</span><span lang=EN style='mso-ansi-language:EN'><o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<h1 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></h1>

<h1 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>Sample
output</h1>

<pre><span lang=EN style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
mso-ansi-language:EN'>0.66667<o:p></o:p></span></pre><pre><span lang=EN
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>0.52500<o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
lang=EN style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
mso-ansi-language:EN'>0.71056</span><span style='color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></p>


<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='color:black'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</span></div>


<address style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
lang=EN style='font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN;font-style:
normal'>Ricardo Barreira - <a href="mailto:fontes@fe.up.pt">fontes@fe.up.pt</a><o:p></o:p></span></b></address>

<address style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
lang=EN style='font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN;font-style:
normal'>Rui Ferreira - <a href="mailto:rui.andre@fe.up.pt">rui.andre@fe.up.pt</a><o:p></o:p></span></b></address>

<address style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
lang=EN style='font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN;font-style:
normal'>Faculdade de Engenharia da Universidade do Porto<o:p></o:p></span></b></address>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

</div>

<title>Problem A: Optimal Mastermind Strategy</title>
<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:DocumentProperties>
  <o:Author>Shahriar Manzoor</o:Author>

<!--

<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="1029"/>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]--><o:SmartTagType name="place" namespaceuri="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags"></o:SmartTagType><o:SmartTagType name="PlaceName" namespaceuri="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags"></o:SmartTagType><o:SmartTagType name="PlaceType" namespaceuri="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags"></o:SmartTagType>
</head>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Problem A</span></b><br>
<b><span style='font-size:24.0pt'>Optimal Mastermind Strategy</span></b><br>
<b>Input:</b> standard input<br>
<b>Output:</b> standard output<br>
<b>Time Limit:</b> 10 seconds <span style='font-family:"Arial Unicode MS"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>Mastermind is a classic two-player game between a
codemaker and a codebreaker. The codemaker secretly selects a <i>n</i>-digit
code, where each digit is between 1 and <i>m</i>. The codebreaker then tries to
guess the code by repeatedly guessing a valid code (<i>n</i> digits, each digit
between 1 and <i>m</i>). After each guess, the codemaker tells the codebreaker
two numbers, (<i>b</i>, <i>w</i>): the number of correct digits in the correct
position (<i>b</i>) and the number of digits that are part in the code but not
in the correct position (<i>w</i>). For example, if the code is 1233 and the
codebreaker's guess is 3243, then the codemaker's response would be b=2,w=1,
since the codebreaker has guessed the '2' and the second '3' correctly and in
the correct positions, while having guessed the first '3' correctly but in the
wrong position. </p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>A <i>deterministic</i> Mastermind strategy is
when you, as codebreaker, make the same first guess every time you play, and
depending on the answer, always make the same second guess, etc. Such a
strategy can be depicted as a selection tree: </p>
<p>
<center><img width=400 height=150 src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10492.gif" ></center></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>In this strategy, the codebreaker starts with the
guess 112. If the reply from the codemaker is 2,0, the codebreaker tries 122.
If the reply is 1,0, the codebreaker knows the answer is 111, which will be his
third and final guess. Note that in the picture above, all 8 states should have
an extra edge (3,0) in case this is the final state.</p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>An <i>optimal</i> Mastermind strategy is a
deterministic strategy that minimizes the number of guesses, on average,
assuming all codes have the same probability of being selected by the
codemaker. The picture above shows the selection tree for one optimal strategy
with <i>n</i> = 2 and <i>m</i> = 3. </p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>Write a program that, given <i>n</i> and <i>m</i>,
calculates an optimal Mastermind strategy. The program should output the total
number of guesses required for this strategy if the game is played <i>m<sup>n</sup></i>
times (each time with a distinct code; that is, all different codes are used),
as well as the whole selection tree. In the strategy in the picture above, the
total number of guesses is 1+2+2+2+3+2+3+3 = 18. The program should also be
able to handle a fixed first guess. That is, finding the optimal strategy with
the constraint that the first guess is given. </p>

<h2>Input</h2>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify'>Each line in the
input contains three integers: <i>n</i> (1 &#8804; n &#8804; 4), the length of
the code, <i>m</i> (1 &#8804; m &#8804; 6), the highest valid digit in a code (the
lowest valid digit will always be 1) and <i>k</i>, the fixed first guess. If <i>k</i>
= 0, the first guess isn't fixed. Otherwise <i>k</i> will be a valid guess,
containing exactly <i>n</i> digits, all of them between 1 and <i>m</i>. Also, <i>n</i>*<i>m</i>
&#8804; 12 for all input cases. The input is terminated with end of file. There
will be at most 30 sets of input. </p>

<h2>Output</h2>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify'>The first line
in the output for each input set should contain an integer, the total number of
guesses required with the optimal strategy. Then follows <i>m<sup>n</sup></i>
lines, each line corresponding to the sequence of guesses for each possible
code. The guesses must form a legal selection tree as stated above. The format
of each line should be:</p>

<pre style='text-align:justify'>guess:b,w guess:b,w ... guess:b,w</pre>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>Where
guess is a code and b and w have the meaning mentioned earlier. The last guess
in each row should be the correct code. The first guess in each line should be <i>k</i>,
if <i>k</i> is not equal to 0. No special ordering of these rows are necessary; any one
will do as long as all possible codes are covered. Since there exist many
different strategies yielding the same total number of guesses, any such
strategy will be accepted. Output a blank line after each set of input. </p>

<h2 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>Sample
input</h2>

<pre>3 2 0</pre><pre>3 2 222</pre><pre>1 4 3</pre>

<h2 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>Sample
output</h2>

<pre>18</pre><pre>112:0,2 221:3,0</pre><pre>112:1,0 222:3,0</pre><pre>112:1,2 121:1,2 211:3,0</pre><pre>112:1,2 121:3,0</pre><pre>112:2,0 122:1,0 111:3,0</pre><pre>112:2,0 122:1,2 212:3,0</pre><pre>112:2,0 122:3,0</pre><pre>112:3,0</pre><pre><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></pre><pre>21</pre><pre>222:0,0 111:3,0</pre><pre>222:1,0 112:1,2 121:1,2 211:3,0</pre><pre>222:1,0 112:1,2 121:3,0</pre><pre>222:1,0 112:3,0</pre><pre>222:2,0 122:1,2 212:1,2 221:3,0</pre><pre>222:2,0 122:1,2 212:3,0</pre><pre>222:2,0 122:3,0</pre><pre>222:3,0</pre><pre><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></pre><pre>10</pre><pre>3:0,0 1:0,0 2:0,0 4:1,0</pre><pre>3:0,0 1:0,0 2:1,0</pre><pre>3:0,0 1:1,0</pre><pre>3:1,0</pre>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><i>/*Note:</i>
The first case in the sample output corresponds to the strategy in the picture.
This line is not a part of output*/</p>


<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>


<address style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
style='font-family:"Times New Roman";font-style:normal'>Problemsetter: Jimmy
Mårdell, Member of Elite Problemsetters' Panel<o:p></o:p></span></b></address>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

</div>

</body>

</html>

<title>Problem B: Cats, with or without Hats</title>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<div align=center>

<table border=0 cellpadding=0 width="100%" style='width:100.0%;mso-cellspacing:
 1.5pt;mso-padding-alt:0in 0in 0in 0in'>
 <tr>
  <td style='padding:.75pt .75pt .75pt .75pt'>
  <h1>Problem B</h1>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
  style='font-size:24.0pt'>Cats, with or without Hats</span></b><br>
  <b>Time Limit:</b> 2 seconds<br>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;mso-layout-grid-align:
none;text-autospace:none'><b><span style='color:black'>Input:</span></b><span
style='color:black'> standard input<br>
<b>Output:</b> standard output<o:p></o:p></span></p>

  <div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'>
  <hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>
  </div>
  <table border=0 cellspacing=10 cellpadding=0 style='mso-cellspacing:7.5pt;
   mso-padding-alt:0in 0in 0in 0in'>
   <tr>
    <td valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'>
    <p class=MsoNormal>A cat wears a hat if and only if it has <b>N</b> cats in
    it's hat. There is exactly one cat that is not inside any other cat's
    hat. If
    there are <b>M</b> cats without hats, how many cats are there? </p>
    <h3>Input</h3>
    <p>Input consists of several test cases. For each case, there would be two
    integers, <b>N</b> and <b>M</b>, where <b>1&lt;=N&lt;100000</b> and <b>1&lt;=M&lt;100000</b>.
    The input ends with a case where <b>N=0</b>. You must not process this test
    case.</p>
    <h3>Output</h3>
    <p>For each test case, print <b>N</b> and <b>M</b>. Then if the total number of cats can
    be expressible uniquely in an integer, print the number. If the case is
    impossible print the word &quot;<b>Impossible</b>&quot; without quotes. If
    there are multiple answers, print the word &quot;<b>Multiple</b>&quot;
    without the quotes.</p>
    </td>
    <td style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'>
    <p class=MsoNormal><img width=193 height=236 id="_x0000_i1026"
    src=p10493.jpg></p>
    </td>
   </tr>
  </table>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='display:none;mso-hide:all'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <table border=0 cellspacing=10 cellpadding=0 style='mso-cellspacing:7.5pt;
   mso-padding-alt:0in 0in 0in 0in'>
   <tr>
    <td valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'>
    <h3>Sample Input</h3>
    <pre><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></pre><pre>2 5</pre><pre>3 4</pre><pre>3 3</pre><pre>0 0</pre></td>
    <td width=386 valign=top style='width:289.45pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'>
    <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>
    </td>
   </tr>
  </table>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='display:none;mso-hide:all'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <table border=0 cellspacing=10 cellpadding=0 style='mso-cellspacing:7.5pt;
   mso-padding-alt:0in 0in 0in 0in'>
   <tr>
    <td width=386 valign=top style='width:289.45pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'>
    <h3 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>Sample
    Output</h3>
    <pre><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></pre><pre>2 5 9</pre><pre>3 4 Impossible</pre><pre>3 3 4</pre></td>
   </tr>
  </table>
  <div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'>
  <hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>
  </div>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b>Problemsetter: K M Hasan, Member of Elite Problemsetters'
  Panel</b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

</div>

</body>

<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="1035"/>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt;color:black'>Problem C</span></b><span
style='color:black'><br>
</span><b><span style='font-size:24.0pt;color:black;mso-font-kerning:18.0pt'>If
We Were a Child Again</span></b><b><span style='font-size:24.0pt;color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;mso-layout-grid-align:
none;text-autospace:none'><b><span style='color:black'>Input:</span></b><span
style='color:black'> standard input<br>
<b>Output:</b> standard output<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;mso-layout-grid-align:
none;text-autospace:none'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='color:black'>Time Limit: </span></b><span style='color:black;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>7</span><span style='color:black'> seconds</span><span style='font-size:
1.0pt;font-family:Arial;color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:18.0pt;
color:black'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<table border=0 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width=671 style='width:503.6pt;
 border-collapse:collapse;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='height:158.65pt'>
  <td width=355 colspan=2 valign=top style='width:3.7in;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;
  height:158.65pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='color:black'>Oooooooooooooooh!<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='color:black'>If I
  could do the easy mathematics like my school days!!<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='color:black'>I can
  guarantee, that Id not make any mistake this time!!<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='color:black'>Says
  a smart university student!!<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='color:black'>But
  his teacher even smarter  Ok! Id assign you such projects in your software
  lab. Dont be so sad.<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='color:black'>Really!!
  - the students feels happy. And he feels so happy that he cannot see the
  smile in his teachers face.<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='color:black'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><span
  style='color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
  <td width=316 valign=top style='width:237.2pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;
  height:158.65pt'>
<img width=204 height=213
  src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10494.gif" >  
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style='height:117.0pt'>
  <td width=671 colspan=3 valign=top style='width:503.6pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;
  height:117.0pt'>
  <p class=MsoHeading7><span style='color:black'>The Problem<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='color:black'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='color:black'>The
  first project for the poor student was to make a calculator that can just
  perform the basic arithmetic operations.<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='color:black'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='color:black'>But
  like many other university students he doesnt like to do any project by
  himself. He just wants to collect programs from here and there. As you are a
  friend of him, he asks you to write the program. But, you are also
  intelligent enough to tackle this kind of people. </span>You agreed to write
  only the (integer) division and mod (% in C/C++) operations for him.<span
  style='font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width=671 colspan=3 valign=top style='width:503.6pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:black'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoHeading7><span style='color:black'>Input</span><span
  style='font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p style='text-align:justify'><span style='color:black'>Input is a sequence
  of lines. Each line will contain an input number. One or more spaces. A sign
  (division or mod). Again spaces. And another input number. Both the input
  numbers are non-negative integer. The first one may be arbitrarily long. The
  second number <b>n</b> will be in the range (0 &lt; n &lt; 2<sup>31</sup>).<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width=671 colspan=3 valign=top style='width:503.6pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:14.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:black'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <h5 style='text-align:justify'><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
  12.0pt;color:black'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></b></h5>
  <h5 style='text-align:justify'><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
  12.0pt;color:black'>Output</span></b><span style='color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></h5>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='color:black'>A
  line for each input, each containing an integer. See the sample input and
  output. Output should not contain any extra space.</span><span
  style='font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style='height:4.0pt'>
  <td width=263 valign=top style='width:197.35pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;
  height:4.0pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='color:black'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <h6><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:black'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></b></h6>
  <h6><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:black'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></b></h6>
  <h6><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:black'>Sample
  Input</span></b><span style='color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></h6>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:black'>110 / 100<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:black'>99 % 10<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:black'>2147483647 /
  2147483647<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-line-height-alt:4.0pt'><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
  color:black'>2147483646 % 2147483647</span><span style='color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
  <td width=408 colspan=2 valign=top style='width:306.25pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;
  height:4.0pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:14.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:black'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='color:black'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='color:black'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-line-height-alt:4.0pt'><span
  style='color:black'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style='height:4.0pt'>
  <td width=263 valign=top style='width:197.35pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;
  height:4.0pt'>
  <h6><span style='color:black'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></h6>
  <h6><span style='color:black'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></h6>
  <h6><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:black'>Sample
  Output</span></b><span style='color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></h6>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:black'>1<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:black'>9<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:black'>1<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-line-height-alt:4.0pt'><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
  color:black'>2147483646</span><span style='color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
  <td width=408 colspan=2 valign=top style='width:306.25pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;
  height:4.0pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-line-height-alt:4.0pt'><span
  style='color:black'>&nbsp;</span><span style='font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
  12.0pt;color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width=263 style='width:197.35pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><span
  style='font-size:1.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial Unicode MS";
  color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
  <td width=92 style='width:69.05pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>

  </td>

<title>Problem D: Conic distance</title>

	{font-family:"\@Arial Unicode MS";
	mso-font-charset:128;

	mso-font-pitch:variable;
	mso-font-signature:16792199 151977984 16 0 4129023 0;}
 /* Style Definitions */

	{mso-style-parent:" ;
	margin:0in;

	{margin-right:0in;

	{margin:0in;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt;
	font-size:10.0pt;
	font-family:"Courier New";
	mso-fareast-font-family:"Courier New";}
@page Section1
	{size:8.5in 11.0in;
	margin:1.0in 1.25in 1.0in 1.25in;
	mso-header-margin:.5in;
	mso-footer-margin:.5in;
	mso-paper-source:0;}
div.Section1
	{page:Section1;}
-->
</style>
</head>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<h3 align=center style='text-align:center'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Problem
D</span><br>
<span style='font-size:24.0pt'>Conic Distance</span><br>
<span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'>Input: </span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt;font-weight:normal'>standard
input<br>
</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'>Output: </span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt;font-weight:normal'>standard
output</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'><br>
Time Limit: </span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt;
font-weight:normal'>2 seconds</span></h3>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>A cone is located in 3D such that
its base of radius <i>r</i> is in the <i>z</i> = 0 plane with the center at
(0,0,0). The tip of the cone is located at (0, 0, <i>h</i>). Two points are
given on the cone surface in conic coordinates. The conic coordinates of a
point <i>p</i> lying on the surface of the cone are two numbers: the first, <i>d</i>,
is the distance from the tip of the cone to <i>p</i> and the second, <i>A</i>
&lt; 360, is the angle in degrees between the plane <i>y</i> = 0 and the plane
through points (0,0,0), (0,0,<i>h</i>) and <i>p</i>, measured counterclockwise
from the direction of the x axis. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><img width=289
height=317 id="_x0000_i1025" src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10495.gif" ></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>Given are two points <i>p<sub>1</sub></i> = (<i>d<sub>1</sub>,
A<sub>1</sub></i>) and <i>p<sub>2</sub></i> = (<i>d<sub>2</sub>, A<sub>2</sub></i>)
in the conic coordinates. What is the (shortest) distance between <i>p<sub>1</sub></i>
and <i>p<sub>2</sub></i> measured on the surface of the cone? </p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>The input is a sequence of lines. Each line
contains 6 floating point numbers giving values of: <i>r</i>, <i>h</i>, <i>d<sub>1</sub></i>,
<i>A<sub>1</sub></i>, <i>d<sub>2</sub></i>, and <i>A<sub>2</sub></i> </p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>For each line of input, output the (shortest)
distance between points <i>p<sub>1</sub></i> and <i>p<sub>2</sub></i> on the
surface of the cone with the fraction rounded to 2 decimal places. </p>

<h3><span style='font-size:18.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'>Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<pre>3.0 4.0 2.0 0.0 4.0 0.0</pre><pre>3.0 4.0 2.0 90.0 4.0 0.0</pre><pre>6.0 8.0 2.14 75.2 9.58 114.3</pre><pre>3.0 4.0 5.0 0.0 5.0 90.0</pre>

<h3><span style='font-size:18.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'>Sample Output<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<pre>2.00</pre><pre>3.26</pre><pre>7.66</pre><pre>4.54</pre>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>


<address><b><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman";font-style:normal'>Problemsetter: Piotr Rudnicki, University of Alberta<o:p></o:p></span></b></address>

<pre><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></pre></div>

</body>

</html>

<title>Problem E: Collecting Beepers</title>
<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:DocumentProperties>
  <o:Author>Shahriar Manzoor</o:Author>
  <o:LastAuthor>Shahriar Manzoor</o:LastAuthor>
  <o:Revision>18</o:Revision>
  <o:TotalTime>20</o:TotalTime>
  <o:Created>2003-04-23T13:17:00Z</o:Created>
  <o:LastSaved>2003-05-13T04:00:00Z</o:LastSaved>
  <o:Pages>2</o:Pages>
  <o:Words>294</o:Words>
  <o:Characters>1678</o:Characters>
  <o:Company>ACM/ICPC</o:Company>
  <o:Lines>13</o:Lines>
  <o:Paragraphs>3</o:Paragraphs>
  <o:CharactersWithSpaces>2060</o:CharactersWithSpaces>
  <o:Version>9.2720</o:Version>
 </o:DocumentProperties>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <w:WordDocument>
  <w:View>Print</w:View>
 </w:WordDocument>
</xml><![endif]-->
<style>
<!--
 /* Style Definitions */

<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="1031"/>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">

 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>Problem E</span></b><br>
<b><span style='font-size:24.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>Collecting Beepers</span></b><br>
<b>Input: </b>standard input<b><br>
Output: </b>standard output<b><br>
Time Limit: </b>2 seconds</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>Karel is a robot who lives in a rectangular coordinate
system where each place is designated by a set of integer coordinates <i>(x </i>and
y). Your job is to design a program that will help Karel pick up a number of
beepers that are placed in her world. To do so you must direct Karel to the
position where each beeper is located. Your job is to write a computer program that
finds the length of the shortest path that will get Karel from her starting
position, to each of the beepers, and return back again to the starting
position.<o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>Karel can only move along the <i>x </i>and <i>y </i>axis,
never diagonally. Moving from one position <i>(</i>i, <span style='font-size:
1.0pt;font-family:Arial'>j) </span>to an adjacent position (i, j + 1<span
style='font-size:1.0pt;font-family:Arial'>1</span>), (i, j-1 ), (i-1, j), or (i+1,
j), <span style='font-size:1.0pt;font-family:Arial'>j) </span>has a cost of
one. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>You can assume that Karels world is never larger than 20 x
<span style='font-size:1.0pt;font-family:Arial'>_ </span>20 squares and that
there will never be more than 10 beepers to pick up. Each coordinate will be
given as a pair <i>(</i>x, y) <span style='font-size:1.0pt;font-family:Arial'>)
</span>where each value will be in the range 1 through the size of that
particular direction of the coordinate system.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<h1>Input</h1>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>First there will be a line containing the number of
scenarios you are asked to help Karel in. For each scenario there will first be
a line containing the size of the world. This will be given as two integers <i>(</i>x-size
and y-size). Next there will be one line containing two numbers giving the
starting position of Karel. On the next line there will be one number giving
the number of beepers. For each beeper there will be a line containing two numbers
giving the coordinates of each beeper.</p>

<h3><span style='font-size:18.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'>Output</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'><o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<p class=MsoBodyText>The output will be one line per scenario, giving the
minimum distance that Karel has to move to get from her starting position to
each of the beepers and back again to the starting position.</p>

<h3><span style='font-size:18.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'>Sample Input</span><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'><o:p></o:p></span></h3>
<font size=3 face="Courier New, Courier">
1<br>
10 10<br>
1 1<br>
4<br>
2 3<br>
5 5<br>
9 4<br>
6 5<br>
</font>
<h3 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:18.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt'>Sample Output</span><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt;font-family:"Courier New"'><o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<pre><span style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:1.0pt'>The shortest path has length 24</span></pre>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>


<p class=MsoCaption>A Swedish Problem </p>

</div>

</body>

</html>

<title>Problem F: Sweet Child Makes Trouble </title>
<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:DocumentProperties>
  <o:Author>Shahriar Manzoor</o:Author>
  <o:LastAuthor>Shahriar Manzoor</o:LastAuthor>
  <o:Revision>26</o:Revision>
  <o:TotalTime>40</o:TotalTime>
  <o:Created>2003-04-21T02:23:00Z</o:Created>
  <o:LastSaved>2003-05-23T06:08:00Z</o:LastSaved>
  <o:Pages>2</o:Pages>
  <o:Words>224</o:Words>
  <o:Characters>1278</o:Characters>
  <o:Company>ACM/ICPC</o:Company>
  <o:Lines>10</o:Lines>
  <o:Paragraphs>2</o:Paragraphs>
  <o:CharactersWithSpaces>1569</o:CharactersWithSpaces>
  <o:Version>9.2720</o:Version>
 </o:DocumentProperties>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <w:WordDocument>
  <w:View>Print</w:View>
  <w:Zoom>BestFit</w:Zoom>
 </w:WordDocument>
</xml><![endif]-->
<style>
<!--

	mso-font-signature:-1 -369098753 63 0 4129023 0;}

	{font-family:"\@Arial Unicode MS";
	mso-font-charset:128;

	mso-font-pitch:variable;
	mso-font-signature:-1 -369098753 63 0 4129023 0;}
 /* Style Definitions */

	{mso-style-parent:" ;
	margin:0in;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	font-size:12.0pt;
	font-family:"Times New Roman";
	mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";}

	mso-margin-top-alt:auto;
	mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;

	mso-fareast-font-family:"Courier New";}

	{page:Section1;}

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<h1 align=center style='text-align:center'><span style='font-size:18.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt'>Problem F</span><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt'><br>
</span>Sweet Child Makes Trouble<span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'><br>
</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt'>Input: </span><span style='font-size:
12.0pt;font-weight:normal'>standard input</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt'><br>
Output: </span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-weight:normal'>standard
output</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt'><br>
Time Limit: </span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-weight:normal'>8 seconds</span></h1>

<p style='text-align:justify'>Children are always sweet but they can sometimes
make you feel bitter. In this problem, you will see how Tintin, a five years
old boy, creates trouble for his parents. Tintin is a joyful boy and is always
busy in doing something. But what he does is not always pleasant for his
parents. He likes most to play with household things like his fathers
wristwatch or his mothers comb. After his playing he places it in some other
place. Tintin is very intelligent and a boy with a very sharp memory. To make
things worse for his parents, he never returns the things he has taken for
playing to their original places.<span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Arial Unicode MS"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>Think about a morning when Tintin has managed to
steal three household objects. Now, in how many ways he can place those
things such that nothing is placed in their original place. Tintin does not
like to give his parents that much trouble. So, he does not leave anything in a
completely new place; he merely permutes the objects.</p>

<h2>Input</h2>

<p style='text-align:justify'>There will be several test cases. Each will have
a positive integer less than or equal to 800 indicating the number of things
Tintin has taken for playing. Each integer will be in a line by itself. The input
is terminated by a 1 (minus one) in a single line, which should not be
processed.</p>

<h2>Output</h2>

<p style='text-align:justify'>For each test case print an integer indicating in
how many ways Tintin can rearrange the things he has taken. </p>

<h2>Sample Input</h2>

<pre>2</pre><pre>3</pre><pre>4</pre><pre>-1</pre>

<h2 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>Sample
Output</h2>

<pre>1</pre><pre>2</pre><pre>9</pre>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>


<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b>Problemsetter: Tanveer
Ahsan (Idea from Shamsul Alam)</b></p>

</div>

</body>

</html>

______________________________________________________

<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="1027"/>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]--><o:SmartTagType 
name="place" 
namespaceuri="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags"></o:SmartTagType><o:SmartTagType 
name="PlaceName"

name="PlaceType"

<BODY lang=EN-US style="tab-interval: .5in" vLink=purple link=#6633cc>
<DIV class=Section1>
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" align=center><B><SPAN 
style="FONT-SIZE: 18pt; COLOR: windowtext">Problem G</SPAN></B><SPAN 
style="COLOR: windowtext; mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"><BR></SPAN><B><SPAN 
style="FONT-SIZE: 24pt; mso-bidi-font-size: 10.0pt">Happiness!</SPAN></B><B><SPAN 
style="FONT-SIZE: 23pt; mso-bidi-font-size: 10.0pt"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></B></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" align=center><B><SPAN 
style="COLOR: windowtext; mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">Input:</SPAN></B><SPAN 
style="COLOR: windowtext; mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"> standard 
input<BR><B>Output:</B> standard output<BR><B>Time Limit:</B> 3 
seconds<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" align=center><SPAN 
style="COLOR: windowtext; mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"><![if !supportEmptyParas]><![endif]>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN 
style="mso-ansi-language: EN">Prof. Kaykobad has given Nasa the duty of buying 
some food for the ACM contestents. Nasa decided to buy <B>n</B> different items. 
He then asked each of the <B>m</B> contestents how much of each item they want 
to eat. They could not give any logical answer, they only want as much as they 
wish! Nasa knows quite well that they would only waste their food if they get as 
much as they want. He was determined not to let that happen. 
<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN 
style="mso-ansi-language: EN"><![if !supportEmptyParas]><![endif]>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN 
style="mso-ansi-language: EN">So he tactfully found out from each of the 
contestents how much 'happiness' one gets from each piece of each item and what 
is the 'total happiness' over which one wastes food. It may be the case that 
someone gets 'zero' 'happiness' on some item(s). He decided that he would never 
let anyone have such amount of food that exceeds his 'total happiness'. He 
planned that he would give someone even a fraction of a piece of item, but never 
give anyone more than he needed! <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN 
style="mso-ansi-language: EN"><![if !supportEmptyParas]><![endif]>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN 
style="mso-ansi-language: EN">He also decided that each would get exactly the 
same amount of each item so that no one can complain against him. 
<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN 
style="mso-ansi-language: EN"><![if !supportEmptyParas]><![endif]>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN 
style="mso-ansi-language: EN">After planning all these, he finally realized that 
he has an infinite amount of money and hence, he would spend as much money as he 
can.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN lang=EN 
style="mso-ansi-language: EN"><![if !supportEmptyParas]><![endif]>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>
<H2>Input</H2>
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; tab-stops: 143.25pt"><SPAN 
lang=EN style="mso-ansi-language: EN">Input contains data collected by Nasa on 
several days. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; tab-stops: 143.25pt"><SPAN 
lang=EN style="mso-ansi-language: EN">For each day, <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; tab-stops: 143.25pt"><SPAN 
lang=EN style="mso-ansi-language: EN"><SPAN 
style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN>The first line contains the 
integers n(3<=n<=20) and m(3<=m<=20). <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; tab-stops: 143.25pt"><SPAN 
lang=EN style="mso-ansi-language: EN"><SPAN 
style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN>The next line contains n 
real numbers, the per unit price of each item. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; tab-stops: 143.25pt"><SPAN 
lang=EN style="mso-ansi-language: EN"><SPAN 
style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN>Each of the next m lines 
contain data (n+1 real numbers) of each contestents: first n are 'happiness' got 
from each item and the last one is the 'total happiness'. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; tab-stops: 143.25pt"><SPAN 
lang=EN 
style="mso-ansi-language: EN"><![if !supportEmptyParas]><![endif]>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; tab-stops: 143.25pt"><B 
style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><SPAN 
style="FONT-SIZE: 18pt; mso-bidi-font-size: 10.0pt">Output<I 
style="mso-bidi-font-style: normal"> <o:p></o:p></I></SPAN></B></P>
<P class=MsoBodyText2 style="tab-stops: 143.25pt"><SPAN lang=EN 
style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal; mso-ansi-language: EN">For the data 
collected in each day print in a single line the maximum amount of money Nasa 
can spend in taka rounded up to nearest integer. You can assume that there will be no such input which may cause
serious floating point errors.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; tab-stops: 143.25pt"><![if !supportEmptyParas]><![endif]>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></P>
<H2>Sample Input</H2><PRE><SPAN lang=EN style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt; mso-bidi-font-size: 10.0pt; mso-ansi-language: EN">3 3<o:p></o:p></SPAN></PRE><PRE><SPAN lang=EN style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt; mso-bidi-font-size: 10.0pt; mso-ansi-language: EN">1 0.67 1.67<o:p></o:p></SPAN></PRE><PRE><SPAN lang=EN style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt; mso-bidi-font-size: 10.0pt; mso-ansi-language: EN">1 2 1 430<o:p></o:p></SPAN></PRE><PRE><SPAN lang=EN style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt; mso-bidi-font-size: 10.0pt; mso-ansi-language: EN">3 0 2 460<o:p></o:p></SPAN></PRE><PRE><SPAN lang=EN style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt; mso-bidi-font-size: 10.0pt; mso-ansi-language: EN">1 4 0 420</SPAN><SPAN lang=EN style="mso-ansi-language: EN"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></PRE>
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; tab-stops: 143.25pt"><![if !supportEmptyParas]><![endif]>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></P>
<H2>Sample Output</H2><PRE><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt; mso-bidi-font-size: 10.0pt">Nasa can spend 1354 taka.</SPAN><SPAN lang=EN style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt; mso-bidi-font-size: 10.0pt; mso-ansi-language: EN"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></PRE>
<DIV class=MsoNormal 
style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; tab-stops: 45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt" 
align=center>
<HR align=center width="100%" SIZE=2>
</DIV>
<P class=MsoNormal 
style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; tab-stops: 45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt"><B 
style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal">Problemsetter: Mustaq Ahmed, University of 
Waterloo </B></P></DIV></BODY></HTML>
