 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="1029"/>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]--><o:SmartTagType namespaceuri="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags" name="place"/><o:SmartTagType namespaceuri="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags" name="country-region"/><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <u1:DocumentProperties>
  <u1:Author>Administrator</u1:Author>
  <u1:LastAuthor>SHAHRIAR MANZOOR</u1:LastAuthor>
  <u1:Revision>180</u1:Revision>
  <u1:TotalTime>1629</u1:TotalTime>
  <u1:LastPrinted>2002-10-25T13:01:00Z</u1:LastPrinted>
  <u1:Created>2001-06-30T12:55:00Z</u1:Created>
  <u1:LastSaved>2003-01-10T18:14:00Z</u1:LastSaved>
  <u1:Pages>2</u1:Pages>
  <u1:Words>337</u1:Words>
  <u1:Characters>1922</u1:Characters>
  <u1:Company>BUET</u1:Company>
  <u1:Lines>16</u1:Lines>
  <u1:Paragraphs>3</u1:Paragraphs>
  <u1:CharactersWithSpaces>2360</u1:CharactersWithSpaces>
  <u1:Version>9.2720</u1:Version>
 </u1:DocumentProperties>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <u2:WordDocument>
  <u2:View>Print</u2:View>
  <u2:Zoom>BestFit</u2:Zoom>
  <u2:BrowserLevel>MicrosoftInternetExplorer4</u2:BrowserLevel>
  <u2:GrammarState>Clean</u2:GrammarState>
 </u2:WordDocument>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <u3:shapedefaults u4:ext="edit" spidmax="1027"/>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <u5:shapelayout u6:ext="edit">
  <u5:idmap u6:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </u5:shapelayout>
</xml><![endif]--><u7:SmartTagType namespaceuri="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags" name="place"/><u7:SmartTagType namespaceuri="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags" name="PlaceName"/><u7:SmartTagType namespaceuri="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags" name="PlaceType"/>
<meta content="No Title" name=description>
<meta content=puzzle name=keywords>
<meta content=document name=resource-type>
<meta content=global name=distribution>
</head>

<body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt;color:black'>Problem H</span></b><span
style='color:black'><br>
</span><b><span style='font-size:24.0pt;color:black'>The Land of Justice</span></b><span
style='color:black'><br>
<b>Input:</b> standard input<br>
<b>Output:</b> standard output<br>
<b>Time Limit:</b> 4 seconds<br style='mso-special-character:line-break'>
<![if !supportLineBreakNewLine]><br style='mso-special-character:line-break'>
<![endif]></span><o:p></o:p></p>

<u7:p></u7:p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>In the Land of Justice the
selling price of everything is fixed all over the country. Nobody can buy a thing
and sell it in double price. But, that created problems for the businessmen.
They left their business and went to the production. So, after some days
everybody was in production and nobody in business. And the people didnt get
their necessary things though the country was self-sufficient in every sector.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>The government became very much
anxious. But, they were intelligent enough to call the mathematicians.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>The mathematicians gave a
solution.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">  </span>They suggested setting the
surface area of an object as its selling-unit instead of its volume. Actually
the clever mathematicians were very much interested to establish their own
business.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Now, the government asks the
programmers to build the software that would calculate the profit things.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Here your job is to calculate the
business profit for a solid sphere. A businessman buys a complete sphere and to
maximize his profit he divides it in <b>n</b> equal parts. All cut should go
through the axis of the sphere. And every part should look like the picture
below:</p>
<center>
<p>
<img width=486 height=277
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/104/p10499.gif"  ></p>
</center>
<p class=MsoNormal><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial;
color:black'>Input<u7:p></u7:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>You are given a sequence of
integers N (0 &lt; N &lt; 2<sup>31</sup>), indicating the numbers of parts of
the sphere. The input file is terminated with a negative number. This number
should not be processed.<span lang=EN style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
mso-ansi-language:EN'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:18.0pt;mso-bidi-font-family:
Arial;color:black'>&nbsp;<u7:p></u7:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial;
color:black'>Output<u7:p></u7:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText2>Calculate the profit over the sold pieces. The result
should be in percentage and rounded to the nearest integer.<span lang=EN
style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-ansi-language:EN'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN style='mso-bidi-font-family:
Arial;color:black;mso-ansi-language:EN'><span style="mso-spacerun:
yes"> </span><span style="mso-spacerun: yes"> </span><u7:p></u7:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:18.0pt;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial;
color:black'>Sample input<u7:p></u7:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>2<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>2<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>-1</span></p>

<h1 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></h1>

<h1 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>Sample
output</h1>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>50%<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>50%</span><span
style='color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></p>


<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='color:black'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</span></div>


<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none'><b><span
style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Arial Unicode MS";color:black'>Problemsetter:
&nbsp;</span></b><b><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Arial Unicode MS"'>Tazrian
Khan<span style='color:black'>, University of Dhaka</span></span><span
style='color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<address style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
lang=EN style='font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN;font-style:
normal'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></b></address>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

</div>

</body>

original version by:  Nikos Drakos, CBLU, University of Leeds

<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>Hendrie Sequence</TITLE>
<META NAME="description" CONTENT="Hendrie Sequence">
<META NAME="keywords" CONTENT="htmlatex">
<META NAME="resource-type" CONTENT="document">
<META NAME="distribution" CONTENT="global">

<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
<META NAME="Generator" CONTENT="LaTeX2HTML v2K.1beta">
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Style-Type" CONTENT="text/css">

<LINK REL="STYLESHEET" HREF="htmlatex.css">

</HEAD>

<BODY LANG="EN" BGCOLOR=#FFFFFF>

<H1><BR CLEAR=ALL><CENTER><TABLE BGCOLOR=#0060F0><TR><TD><B><FONT SIZE=5 COLOR=#C0FFFF>&nbsp;<A NAME="SECTION0001000000000000000000">
Hendrie Sequence</A>&nbsp;</FONT></B></TABLE></CENTER>
</H1>

<P>
The Hendrie Sequence ``H"  is a self-describing sequence defined as follows:

<UL>
<LI>H(1) = 0
</LI>
<LI>If we expand every number <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>x</I></SPAN> in H to a subsequence containing <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>x</I></SPAN> 0's followed by the
         number <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>x</I> + 1</SPAN>, the resulting sequence is still H (without its first element).
</LI>
</UL>

<P>
Thus, the first few elements of H are:

<P>

<P>
<BR>
0,1,0,2,1,0,0,3,0,2,1,1,0,0,0,4,1,0,0,3,0,...

<P>

<P>
<BR>
You must write a program that, given <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>n</I></SPAN>, calculates the <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>n</I></SPAN>th element of H.

<P>

<H2><FONT COLOR=#0070E8><A NAME="SECTION0001001000000000000000">
Input</A>&nbsp;</FONT>
</H2>
Each test case consists of a single line containing the integer <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>n</I></SPAN> (<!-- MATH
 $0 < n < 2^{63}$
 -->
<SPAN CLASS="MATH">0 &lt; <I>n</I> &lt; 2<SUP>63</SUP></SPAN>) .
Input is terminated with a line containing the number `<TT>0</TT>' which of course should not be processed.

<P>

<H2><FONT COLOR=#0070E8><A NAME="SECTION0001002000000000000000">
Output</A>&nbsp;</FONT>
</H2>
For each test case, output the <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>n</I></SPAN>th element of H on a single line.

<P>

<H2><FONT COLOR=#0070E8><A NAME="SECTION0001003000000000000000">
Sample Input</A>&nbsp;</FONT>
</H2>
<PRE>
4
7
44
806856837013209088
0
</PRE>

<P>

<H2><FONT COLOR=#0070E8><A NAME="SECTION0001004000000000000000">
Sample Output</A>&nbsp;</FONT>
</H2>
<PRE>
2
0
3
16
</PRE>

<P>


<P>
<BR><HR>
<ADDRESS>
Problem setter: Derek Kisman, University of Waterloo, Canada
</ADDRESS>
</BODY>
</HTML>
</HTML>

<title>Robot maps</title>

<body lang=ES style='tab-interval:35.4pt'>

<div class=Section1>

<div align=center>

<table border=0 cellpadding=0 bgcolor="#0060f0" style='mso-cellspacing:1.5pt;
 background:#0060F0;mso-padding-alt:0cm 0cm 0cm 0cm'>
 <tr>
  <td style='padding:0cm 0cm 0cm 0cm'>
  <h1><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>Problem A<o:p></o:p></span></h1>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b><span lang=EN-GB style='font-size:18.0pt;color:#C0FFFF;
  mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><span style="mso-spacerun: yes">  </span>&nbsp;
  Robot maps<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">   </span></span></b><b><span
  lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>&nbsp;</span></b><span lang=EN-GB
  style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<h2><span lang=EN-GB style='color:#0070E8;mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>The Problem</span><span
lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<p style='margin:0cm;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:35.4pt'><span
lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>The ACM factory produces and stores
very dangerous products. This is why no human operator is allowed to enter the
store room and only specialised robots can access the place to store new
products or to retrieve them for their sell. The ACM factory is testing a movil
robot which is able to build a partial map of the continuously changing
environment of the store. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='margin:0cm;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:
EN-GB'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='margin:0cm;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:35.4pt'><span
lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>The robot can be initially placed at
any position of the store. Before starting moving, the robot initialises every
cell of its map as a ?, which means unknown cell. In the beginning, the robot knows that
its starting cell is empty and records this information into its map. Then, the robot reads its
four sensors, which will return the state (X if occupied, 0 if empty) of
the four cells around it: NORTH, EAST, SOUTH, WEST. This information is
properly recorded in the robots map. Then it will move to the first* unvisited
free cell and repeat the process until it can not move any further because all
the cells around it are occupied or have already been visited. Then the robot
outputs its partial map of the store. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='margin:0cm;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:
EN-GB'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='margin:0cm;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:
EN-GB'>(*) The order used by the robot to select its movements is clockwise,
starting from the North orientation.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h2><span lang=EN-GB style='color:#0070E8;mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>The Input</span><span
lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<p style='margin:0cm;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:35.4pt'><span
lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>The input file consists of a series
of sets each containig 2+<b>N</b> lines. First line specifies the size of the
map, i.e. two integers<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">  </span>N and M<span
style="mso-spacerun: yes">  </span>separated by one space, where<span
style="mso-spacerun: yes">  </span><b>0 &lt; N &lt;= 10 </b>and<span
style="mso-spacerun: yes">  </span><b>0 &lt; M &lt;= 10</b>. The second line
specifies the starting point of the robot in the map, i.e. two integers<span
style="mso-spacerun: yes">  </span>x_ini and y_ini separated by one space,
where<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">  </span><b>1 &lt;= x_ini<span
style="mso-spacerun: yes">  </span>&lt;= N </b>and <b>1 &lt;= y_ini &lt;= M </b>.
In each of the next <b>N</b> lines there must be <b>M</b> characters X or 0
separated by one space, where X represents obstacles and 0 represents empty
squares. The map must be a correct one, which means the initial position of the
robot must be always an empty cell. The end of the file is reached the size of
the next map is N=0 and M=0.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h2><span lang=EN-GB style='color:#0070E8;mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>The Output</span><span
lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<p style='margin:0cm;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:
EN-GB'>The<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">  </span>application outputs an empty
line, followed by the robot map, an empty line, and a line containing a message
of the movements needed to reach that map.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='margin:0cm;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:
EN-GB'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='margin:0cm;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:
EN-GB'>The robot map must be<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">  </span>shown
using the next format:<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoPlainText><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-fareast-font-family:"MS Mincho";
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoPlainText><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-fareast-font-family:"MS Mincho";
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>|---|---| 
 M 
 |---|<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoPlainText><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-fareast-font-family:"MS Mincho";
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>| s | s | 
 M 
 | s |<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoPlainText><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-fareast-font-family:"MS Mincho";
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>|---|---| 
 M 
 |---|<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoPlainText><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-fareast-font-family:"MS Mincho";
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>| s | s | 
 M 
 | s |<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoPlainText><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-fareast-font-family:"MS Mincho";
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>|---|---| 
 M 
 |---|<span style='mso-tab-count:2'>        </span>s
</span><span lang=EN-GB style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Courier New";
mso-fareast-font-family:"MS Mincho";mso-hansi-font-family:"Courier New";
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB;mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'><span
style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>Î</span></span><span
lang=EN-GB style='mso-fareast-font-family:"MS Mincho";mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>
{X, 0, ?}<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoPlainText><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-fareast-font-family:"MS Mincho";
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>
 N 
<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoPlainText><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-fareast-font-family:"MS Mincho";
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>|---|---| 
 M 
 |---|<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoPlainText><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-fareast-font-family:"MS Mincho";
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>| s | s | 
 M 
 | s |<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoPlainText><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-fareast-font-family:"MS Mincho";
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>|---|---| 
 M 
 |---|<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h2><span lang=EN-GB style='color:#0070E8;mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>Sample Input
</span><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

</div>

<span lang=EN-GB style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:
"MS Mincho";mso-ansi-language:EN-GB;mso-fareast-language:ES;mso-bidi-language:
AR-SA'><br clear=all style='page-break-before:auto;mso-break-type:section-break'>
</span>

<div class=Section2>

<p class=MsoPlainText><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-fareast-font-family:"MS Mincho";
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>5 5<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoPlainText><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-fareast-font-family:"MS Mincho";
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>1 3<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoPlainText><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-fareast-font-family:"MS Mincho";
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>X X 0 0 X<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoPlainText><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-fareast-font-family:"MS Mincho";
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>X X 0 0 X<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoPlainText><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-fareast-font-family:"MS Mincho";
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>X 0 X 0 X<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoPlainText><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-fareast-font-family:"MS Mincho";
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>X 0 0 0 X<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoPlainText><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-fareast-font-family:"MS Mincho";
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>X X X X X<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none'><span lang=EN-GB
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Courier;mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>5 5<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none'><span lang=EN-GB
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Courier;mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>1 1<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none'><span lang=EN-GB
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Courier;mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>0 0 X X X<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none'><span lang=EN-GB
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Courier;mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>X X 0 0 X<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none'><span lang=EN-GB
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Courier;mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>X 0 0 0 X<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none'><span lang=EN-GB
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Courier;mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>X 0 0 0 X<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none'><span lang=EN-GB
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Courier;mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>X X X X X<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none'><span lang=EN-GB
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Courier;mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>0 0<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none'><span lang=EN-GB
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Courier;mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h2><span lang=EN-GB style='color:#0070E8;mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>Sample
Output</span><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>|---|---|---|---|---|<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoPlainText><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-fareast-font-family:"MS Mincho";
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>| ? | X | 0 | 0 | X |<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoPlainText><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-fareast-font-family:"MS Mincho";
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>|---|---|---|---|---|<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoPlainText><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-fareast-font-family:"MS Mincho";
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>| ? | X | 0 | 0 | X |<o:p></o:p></span></p>

mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>|---|---|---|---|---|<o:p></o:p></span></p>

mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>|---|---|---|---|---|<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<body lang=ES style='tab-interval:62.5pt;line-break:strict'>

<div class=Section1>

<table border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 bgcolor="#3366ff" style='margin-left:
 152.35pt;background:#3366FF;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:
 solid windowtext .5pt;mso-padding-alt:0cm 3.5pt 0cm 3.5pt'>
 <tr>
  <td width=265 valign=top style='width:7.0cm;border:none;padding:0cm 3.5pt 0cm 3.5pt'>
  <h1><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>Problem B<o:p></o:p></span></h1>
  <h1><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>Simplified Shisen-Sho<o:p></o:p></span></h1>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-GB style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>Shisen-Sho is a chinese tile game similar to Mahjongg.
You start with a square table with tiles with different pictures. You have to
match them in pairs and the game ends when there is no tile left in the table.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>Shisen-Sho has different rules than Mahjongg. You
remove tiles of the same picture if you can connect them using at most three
connected lines in horizontal or vertical, not diagonal. The lines can only be
drawn alongside the bounds of the board and through empty spaces left by
previously removed tiles, but not through tiles. (As a side effect, this also
means that you can remove two tiles of the same picture that are next to each
other in horizontal or diagonal.</span><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:
EN-GB'>)<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>You have to
write a program that resolves a Shisen-Sho table given as an input, giving as
output the set of pairs made in order, or &quot;No solution&quot; in a line by
itself if the table cannot be solved.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left'><span lang=EN-GB style='color:#3366FF;
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>The Input<o:p></o:p></span></h1>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>The input
starts with a line with two integers (n and m), indicating the dimensions of
the board (n columns and m rows). Next, the board as m lines of n characters
each. The different tiles are represented with different ASCII characters, and
there is no limit on the number of different tiles. The board can have a
maximum of 20 rows by 20 columns. Each tile in the board is labeled after its
position in the board, being (1,1) the upper left corner and (n,m) the lower
left.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left'><span lang=EN-GB style='color:#3366FF;
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>The Output<o:p></o:p></span></h1>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>The output
must be either &quot;No solution&quot; if the board has no solution or a
sequence of pairs of tile positions, each pair in a different line:<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal>(x,y),(x',y')</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>where (x,y)
and (x',y') are the positions of the tiles. The sequence must lead to an empty
board following the Shisen-Sho rules shown above.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left'><span lang=EN-GB style='color:#3366FF;
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>Sample input</span><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:
EN-GB;font-weight:normal'><o:p></o:p></span></h1>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB
style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='font-family:"Courier New";
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>4 4<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='font-family:"Courier New";
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>#%@%<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='font-family:"Courier New";
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>%@$@<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='font-family:"Courier New";
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>%#$$<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='font-family:"Courier New";
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>#$@#<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='font-family:"Courier New";
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left'><span lang=EN-GB style='color:#3366FF;
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>Sample output<o:p></o:p></span></h1>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB
style='font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>(2,1),(4,1)<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>(1,2),(1,3)<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>(4,2),(3,1)<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>(3,2),(3,3)<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>(2,2),(3,4)<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>(1,1),(1,4)<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>(2,3),(4,4)<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>(2,4),(4,3)<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

</div>

</body>

</html>

______________________________________________________
10502||||||false||||||
<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0 Transitional//EN">
<!-- saved from url=(0031)http://acm.uva.es/p/v1/100.html --><!--Converted with LaTeX2HTML 96.1 (Feb 5, 1996) by Nikos Drakos (nikos@cbl.leeds.ac.uk), CBLU, University of Leeds --><HTML><HEAD><TITLE>Counting rectangles</TITLE>
<META content="text/html; charset=windows-1252" http-equiv=Content-Type>
<META content="Counting rectangles" name=description>
<META content=htmlatex name=keywords>
<META content=document name=resource-type>
<META content=global name=distribution><LINK 
href="CountingRectangles_archivos/htmlatex.css" rel=STYLESHEET>
<META content="Microsoft FrontPage 4.0" name=GENERATOR></HEAD>
<BODY bgColor=#ffffff lang=EN>
<H1><BR clear=all>
</H1><CENTER>
<TABLE bgColor=#0060f0>
  <TBODY align=CENTER>
  <TR>
    <TD><b><font color="#c0ffff" size="5">Problem C<BR>Counting rectangles</font>&nbsp;</b></TD></TR></TBODY></TABLE></CENTER>
<P>In some tests there appears the problem of finding the number of rectangles (or
circles, or triangles, ...) of different sizes in a figure. We consider the
problem of counting rectangles (including squares) in a rectangular board.
<P>Given a rectangular board with n rows and m columns, with valid possitions
marked with 1 and non valid possitions marked with 0,&nbsp; we want to 
count the number of rectangles (including squares) in the board formed by
squares marked with 1.</P>
<H2><FONT color=#0070e8><A name=SECTION0001003000000000000000>The 
Input</A></FONT></H2>
<P>The input will consist of a series of problems, with each problem in a serie of
lines. In the first and second lines the rows (n) and columns (m) of the board are
indicated, in the next n lines the board in represented, with a row of the board
in each line, and m 0 or 1 (without spaces) in each line. When the input of a problem finishes the next problem begins in the next line. 
The input finishes when 0 appears as the dimension of the board. Both dimensions
of the board are less than or equal to 100. 
<H2><FONT color=#0070e8><A name=SECTION0001004000000000000000>The 
Output</A></FONT></H2>
<P>The solution of each problem appears in a line, without separation between
lines. For example, in the board
<P>&nbsp;
<P style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; MARGIN-TOP: 0px">11<P style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; MARGIN-TOP: 0px">01<P>the
rectangles are:
<P style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; MARGIN-TOP: 0px">&nbsp;
<P style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; MARGIN-TOP: 0px">1-<P style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; MARGIN-TOP: 0px">--
<P style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; MARGIN-TOP: 0px">&nbsp;<P style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; MARGIN-TOP: 0px">-1<P style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; MARGIN-TOP: 0px">--
<P style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; MARGIN-TOP: 0px">&nbsp;
<P style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; MARGIN-TOP: 0px">--
<P style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; MARGIN-TOP: 0px">-1
<P style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; MARGIN-TOP: 0px">&nbsp;<P style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; MARGIN-TOP: 0px">11<P style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; MARGIN-TOP: 0px">--
<P style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; MARGIN-TOP: 0px">&nbsp;
<P style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; MARGIN-TOP: 0px">-1
<P style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; MARGIN-TOP: 0px">-1
<P style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; MARGIN-TOP: 0px">&nbsp; 
<H2><FONT color=#0070e8><A name=SECTION0001005000000000000000>Sample 
Input</A></FONT></H2>
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 100%; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; MARGIN-TOP: 0px">2
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 100%; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; MARGIN-TOP: 0px">2&nbsp;</P>
<P style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; MARGIN-TOP: 0px">11<P style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; MARGIN-TOP: 0px">01
<P style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; MARGIN-TOP: 0px">4
<P style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; MARGIN-TOP: 0px">3
<P style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; MARGIN-TOP: 0px">110<P style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; MARGIN-TOP: 0px">101<P style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; MARGIN-TOP: 0px">111<P style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; MARGIN-TOP: 0px">011&nbsp;
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 100%; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; MARGIN-TOP: 0px">0</P>
<H2><FONT color=#0070e8><A name=SECTION0001006000000000000000>Sample 
Output</A></FONT></H2>
<P style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; MARGIN-TOP: 0px">5
<P style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; MARGIN-TOP: 0px">22
<P style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; MARGIN-TOP: 0px">&nbsp;
<P style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; MARGIN-TOP: 0px">&nbsp;</P>
<P></P></BODY></HTML>

______________________________________________________
10503||||||false||||||
<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0 Transitional//EN">
<!-- saved from url=(0031)http://acm.uva.es/p/v1/100.html -->
<!--Converted with LaTeX2HTML 96.1 (Feb 5, 1996) by Nikos Drakos (nikos@cbl.leeds.ac.uk), CBLU, University of Leeds --><HTML><HEAD><TITLE>The dominoes solitaire</TITLE>
<META content="text/html; charset=windows-1252" http-equiv=Content-Type>
<META content="The dominoes solitaire" name=description>
<META content=htmlatex name=keywords>
<META content=document name=resource-type>
<META content=global name=distribution><LINK 
href="The dominoes solitaire_archivos/htmlatex.css" rel=STYLESHEET>
<META content="Microsoft FrontPage 4.0" name=GENERATOR></HEAD>
<BODY bgColor=#ffffff lang=EN>
<H1><BR clear=all></h1>
<CENTER>

<TABLE bgColor=#0060f0>
  <TBODY align=CENTER>
  <TR>
    <TD><B><FONT color=#c0ffff size=5>&nbsp;<A 
      name=SECTION0001000000000000000000>Problem D<br>The dominoes solitaire</A></FONT>&nbsp;</B></TR></TBODY></TABLE></CENTER>
<P>A man used to play dominoes with some friends in a small town. Some families
have left the town and at present the only residents in the town are the man and
his wife. This man would like to continue playing dominoes, but his wife does
not like plaing. He has invented a game to play alone. Two pieces are
picked out and are put at the two extremes of a row with a number (n) of spaces.
After that, other pieces (m) are picked out to fill the spaces. The
number of pieces is greater than or equal to the number of spaces (m&gt;=n), and the
number of pieces is less than or equal to 14 (m&lt;=14). The spaces are filled
by putting one piece in each space, accoding to the rules of dominoes: the
number of adjacent dots on two different dominoes must coincide. Pieces with repeated values are
placed in
the same way as the other pieces, and not at right angels.
<p>The problem consists in the design of a program which, given a number of
spaces (n), a number of pieces (m), the two initial pieces (i1,i2) and (d1,d2),
and the m pieces (p1,q1), (p2,q2), ..., (pm,qm), decides if it is possible to
fill the n spaces between the two initial pieces using the m pieces and with the
rules of dominoes. For example, with n=3, m=4, initial pieces (0,1) and (3,4),
and pieces (2,1), (5,6), (2,2) and (3,2), the answer is YES, because there is a
solution: (0,1), (1,2), (2,2), (2,3), (3,4). With n=2, m=4, pieces in the
extremes (0,1) and (3,4), and (1,4), (4,4), (3,2) and (5,6), the answer is NO.</p>
<H2><FONT color=#0070e8><A name=SECTION0001003000000000000000>The 
Input</A></FONT></H2>
<P>The input will consist of a series of problems, with each problem described in a series of
lines: in the first line the number of spaces (n) is indicated, in the second
line the number of pieces (m) used to fill the spaces, in the next line the
piece to be placed on the left, with the two values in the piece separated by a space
and in the same way that the numbers appear in the row, in the following lines the piece
to be placed on the right, with the two values in the piece separated by a space
and in the same way that the numbers appear in the row, and the other m pieces appear in&nbsp;
consecutive lines, one in each line, with the two values separated by a space.
Different problems appear in the input successively without separation, and
the input finishes when 0 appears as the number of spaces.
<H2><FONT color=#0070e8><A name=SECTION0001004000000000000000>The 
Output</A></FONT></H2>
<P>For each problem in the input a line is written, with YES if the problem has
a solution, and NO if it has no solution.
<H2><FONT color=#0070e8><A name=SECTION0001005000000000000000>Sample 
Input</A></FONT></H2>

<p style="line-height: 100%; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">

3<p style="line-height: 100%; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">4&nbsp;</p>
<p style="line-height: 100%; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">
0 1&nbsp;</p>
<p style="line-height: 100%; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">
3 4&nbsp;</p>
<p style="line-height: 100%; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">
2 1&nbsp;</p>
<p style="line-height: 100%; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">
5 6&nbsp;</p>
<p style="line-height: 100%; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">
2 2&nbsp;</p>
<p style="line-height: 100%; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">
3 2&nbsp;</p>
<p style="line-height: 100%; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">
2&nbsp;</p>
<p style="line-height: 100%; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">
4&nbsp;</p>
<p style="line-height: 100%; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">
0 1&nbsp;</p>
<p style="line-height: 100%; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">
3 4&nbsp;</p>
<p style="line-height: 100%; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">
1 4&nbsp;</p>
<p style="line-height: 100%; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">
4 4&nbsp;</p>
<p style="line-height: 100%; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">
3 2&nbsp;</p>
<p style="line-height: 100%; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">
5 6&nbsp;</p>
<p style="line-height: 100%; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">
0</p>
<H2><FONT color=#0070e8><A name=SECTION0001006000000000000000>Sample 
Output</A></FONT></H2>
<p style="margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">
YES&nbsp;
<p style="margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">
NO</p>
<P></P></BODY></HTML>

______________________________________________________
10504||||||false||||||
<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0 Transitional//EN">
<!-- saved from url=(0031)http://acm.uva.es/p/v1/100.html -->
<!--Converted with LaTeX2HTML 96.1 (Feb 5, 1996) by Nikos Drakos (nikos@cbl.leeds.ac.uk), CBLU, University of Leeds --><HTML><HEAD><TITLE>Hidden Squares</TITLE>
<META content="text/html; charset=windows-1252" http-equiv=Content-Type>
<META content="Hidden squares" name=description>
<META content=htmlatex name=keywords>
<META content=document name=resource-type>
<META content=global name=distribution><LINK 
href="Hidden squares_archivos/htmlatex.css" rel=STYLESHEET>
<META content="Microsoft FrontPage 4.0" name=GENERATOR></HEAD>
<BODY bgColor=#ffffff lang=EN>
<H1><BR clear=all>
</h1><CENTER>

<TABLE bgColor=#0060f0>
  <TBODY align=center>
  <TR>
    <TD><b><font color="#c0ffff" size="5">Problem E<br>Hidden squares</font>&nbsp;</b></TR></TBODY></TABLE></CENTER>
<P>The typical Hidden words game can be modified to generate other problems. In
particular, geometric figures can be found in them.<p>Given n rows and columns of capital letters, and a capital letter, we want to
count the number of squares in the grid&nbsp; with vertices in positions in the
grid where that letter appears.</p>
<H2><FONT color=#0070e8><A name=SECTION0001003000000000000000>The 
Input</A></FONT></H2>
<P>The input will consist of a series of problems, with each problem in a series of
lines. In the first line the dimension of the grid (n) is indicated, in the second
line appears the number of letters (m) for which we want to calculate the number of squares, and in consecutive lines the n rows of letters, each row in a
line, and without separation between letters in the same row. When the input of
a problem finishes the next problem begins in the next line. The input finishes when 0 appears as the
dimension of the grid. The number of rows of each grid is less than or equal to 100.
<H2><FONT color=#0070e8><A name=SECTION0001004000000000000000>The 
Output</A></FONT></H2>
<P>The solutions of the different problems are separated by a black line.
For each problem in the input and each letter in the input of the problem a line
is written with the letter and the number of squares for this letter, separated
by a space. For example, in the grid<P>&nbsp;<P style="margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">AAA<P style="margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">AAA<P style="margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">BAB<P>the
squares with vertices in A are:<P style="margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">&nbsp;<P style="margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">AA-<P style="margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">AA-<P style="margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">---<P style="margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">&nbsp;<P style="margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">-AA<P style="margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">-AA<P style="margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">---<P style="margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">&nbsp;<P style="margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">-A-<P style="margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">A-A<P style="margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">-A-
<H2><FONT color=#0070e8><A name=SECTION0001005000000000000000>Sample 
Input</A></FONT></H2>

<p style="line-height: 100%; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">

3<p style="line-height: 100%; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">2&nbsp;</p>
<P style="margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">AAA<P style="margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">AAA<P style="margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">BAB<P style="margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">A<P style="margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">B<P style="margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">4<P style="margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">2<P style="margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">ABBA<P style="margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">BBBB<P style="margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">ABBB<P style="margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">ABBA&nbsp;
<p style="line-height: 100%; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">
A</p>
<p style="line-height: 100%; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">
B</p>
<p style="line-height: 100%; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">
0</p>
<H2><FONT color=#0070e8><A name=SECTION0001006000000000000000>Sample 
Output</A></FONT></H2>
<p style="margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">A 3<p style="margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">B
0<p style="margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">&nbsp;<p style="margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">A
1<p style="margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">B 8
<p style="margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0">
&nbsp;</p>
<P></P></BODY></HTML>

______________________________________________________
10505||||||false||||||
<!--Converted with LaTeX2HTML 98.1 release (February 19th, 1998)
originally by Nikos Drakos (nikos@cbl.leeds.ac.uk), CBLU, University of Leeds
* revised and updated by:  Marcus Hennecke, Ross Moore, Herb Swan
* with significant contributions from:
  Jens Lippmann, Marek Rouchal, Martin Wilck and others -->
<html>

<head>
<meta http-equiv="Content-Type"
content="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
<meta name="description" content="The Game">
<meta name="keywords" content="htmlatex">
<meta name="resource-type" content="document">
<meta name="distribution" content="global">
<meta name="GENERATOR" content="Microsoft FrontPage Express 2.0">
<title>Montesco vs Capuleto</title>
<link rel="STYLESHEET" href="htmlatex.css">
</head>

<body bgcolor="#FFFFFF" lang="EN">

<h1 align="center"><br clear="all">
</h1>
<div align="center"><center>

<table border="0" bgcolor="#0060F0">
    <tr align=center>
        <td><a
        name="SECTION0001000000000000000000"><font
        color="#C0FFFF" size="5"><b> </b></font></a><font
        color="#C0FFFF" size="5"><b>Problem F<br>Montesco vs Capuleto </b></font></td>
    </tr>
</table>
</center></div>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<h2><a name="SECTION0001001000000000000000"><font color="#0070E8">Background</font></a></h2>

<p>Romeo and Juliet have finally decided to get married. But
preparing the wedding party will not be so easy, as it is
well-known that their respective families --the Montesco and the
Capuleto-- are bloody enemies. In this problem you will have to
decide which person to invite and which person not to invite, in
order to prevent a slaugther.</p>

<h2><font color="#0070E8">The Problem</font></h2>

<p>We have a list of <em>N</em> people who can be invited to the
party or not. For every person <em>i</em>, we have a list of his
enemies: <em>E1</em>, <em>E2</em>, ..., <em>Ep</em>. The
&quot;enemy&quot; relationship has the following properties:</p>

<p>- <strong>Anti-transitive</strong>. If <em>a</em> is an enemy
of <em>b</em>, and <em>b</em> is an enemy of <em>c</em>, then <em>a</em>
is a friend of <em>c</em>. Also, the enemies of the friends of <em>a</em>
are his enemies, and the friends of the friends of <em>a</em> are
his friends.</p>

<p><strong>- Symmetrical.</strong> If <em>a</em> is an enemy of <em>b</em>,
then <em>b</em> is an enemy of <em>a</em> (although it may not be
indicated in his list of enemies).</p>

<p>One person will accept an invitation to the party if, and only
if, he is invited, all his friends are invited and none of his
enemies is invited. You have to find the maximum number of people
that can be invited, so that all of them accept their invitation.</p>

<p>For instance, if <em>N</em>=5, and we know that: 1 is enemy of
3, 2 is enemy of 1, and 4 is enemy of 5, then we could invite a
maximum of 3 people. These people could be 2, 3 and 4, but for
this problem we only want the number of people invited.</p>

<h2><a name="SECTION0001001000000000000000"><font color="#0070E8">Input</font></a><font
color="#0070E8">&nbsp;</font> </h2>

<p>The first line of the input file contains the number <em>M</em>
of test cases in this file. A blank line follows this number, and
a blank line is also used to separate test cases. The first line
of each test case contains an integer <em>N</em>, indicating the
number of people who have to be considered. You can assume that <em>N</em>&lt;=200.
For each of these <em>N</em> people, there is a line with his
list of enemies. The first line contains the list of enemies of
person 1, the second line contains the list of enemies of person
2, and so on. Each list of enemies starts with an integer <em>p</em>
(the number of known enemies of that person) and then, there are <em>p</em>
integers (the <em>p</em> enemies of that person). So, for
example, if a person's enemies are 5 and 7, his list of enemies
would be: &quot;2 5 7&quot;.</p>

<h2><a name="SECTION0001002000000000000000"><font color="#0070E8">Output</font></a></h2>

<p>For each test case, the output should consist of a single line
containing an integer, the maximum number of people who can be
invited, so that all of them accept their invitation.</p>

<h2><a name="SECTION0001003000000000000000"><font color="#0070E8">Sample
Input</font></a><font color="#0070E8">&nbsp;</font> </h2>

<pre>3

5
1 3
1 1
0
1 5
0

8
2 4 5
2 1 3
0
0
0
1 3
0
1 5

3
2 2 3
1 3
1 1
</pre>

<h2><a name="SECTION0001004000000000000000"><font color="#0070E8">Sample
Output</font></a><font color="#0070E8">&nbsp;</font> </h2>

<pre>3
5
0
</pre>

<hr>

</body>
</html>

______________________________________________________

<style>
<!--
 /* Font Definitions */

	{font-family:"Arial Unicode MS";
	panose-1:2 11 6 4 2 2 2 2 2 4;
	mso-font-charset:128;
	mso-generic-font-family:swiss;
	mso-font-pitch:variable;
	mso-font-signature:-1 -369098753 63 0 4129023 0;}
@font-face
	{font-family:Thorndale;
	mso-font-alt:"Times New Roman";
	mso-font-charset:0;
	mso-generic-font-family:roman;
	mso-font-pitch:variable;
	mso-font-signature:0 0 0 0 0 0;}
@font-face
	{font-family:"HG Mincho Light J";
	mso-font-charset:0;
	mso-generic-font-family:auto;
	mso-font-pitch:variable;
	mso-font-signature:0 0 0 0 0 0;}
@font-face
	{font-family:"\@Arial Unicode MS";
	mso-font-charset:128;
	mso-generic-font-family:swiss;
	mso-font-pitch:variable;
	mso-font-signature:-1 -369098753 63 0 4129023 0;}
 /* Style Definitions */
p.MsoNormal, li.MsoNormal, div.MsoNormal
	{mso-style-parent:" ;
	margin:0cm;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	mso-pagination:none;
	mso-hyphenate:none;
	font-size:12.0pt;
	mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
	font-family:Thorndale;
	mso-fareast-font-family:"HG Mincho Light J";
	mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
	color:black;}
h1
	{mso-style-next:Normal;
	margin:0cm;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	text-align:center;
	mso-pagination:none;
	page-break-after:avoid;
	mso-outline-level:1;
	mso-hyphenate:none;
	font-size:16.0pt;
	mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
	font-family:"Times New Roman";
	mso-fareast-font-family:"HG Mincho Light J";
	color:aqua;
	mso-font-kerning:0pt;
	mso-bidi-font-weight:normal;}
h2
	{mso-style-next:Normal;
	margin:0cm;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	mso-pagination:none;
	page-break-after:avoid;
	mso-outline-level:2;
	mso-hyphenate:none;
	font-size:12.0pt;
	mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
	font-family:Thorndale;
	mso-fareast-font-family:"HG Mincho Light J";
	color:#3366FF;}
pre
	{margin:0cm;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	font-size:10.0pt;
	font-family:"Arial Unicode MS";}
 /* Page Definitions */
@page
	{mso-footnote-position:beneath-text;}
@page Section1
	{size:595.25pt 841.85pt;
	margin:2.0cm 2.0cm 2.0cm 2.0cm;
	mso-header-margin:36.0pt;
	mso-footer-margin:36.0pt;
	mso-paper-source:0;}
div.Section1
	{page:Section1;}
-->
</style>
</head>

<body lang=ES style='tab-interval:62.5pt;line-break:strict'>

<div class=Section1>

<table border=0 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 bgcolor="#3366ff" style='margin-left:
 166.55pt;background:#3366FF;border-collapse:collapse;mso-padding-alt:0cm 3.5pt 0cm 3.5pt'>
 <tr>
  <td width=170 valign=top style='width:127.55pt;padding:0cm 3.5pt 0cm 3.5pt'>
  <h1><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>Problem G<o:p></o:p></span></h1>
  <h1><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>Ouroboros<o:p></o:p></span></h1>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;
font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>T</span><span
lang=EN-GB style='mso-bidi-font-size:18.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>his symbol appears principally among the Gnostics and
is depicted as a dragon, snake or serpent biting its own tail. In the broadest
sense, it is symbolic of time and the continuity of life. </span><span
lang=EN-GB style='font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>Similarly,
we can make a &quot;digital ouroboros&quot; in the shape of a ring with a
property: if you take M adjacent digits, they form a different permutation of M
digits, without an established order, but including every legal permutation.
The number is represented in a given base N.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>The minimum value for N and M is 1, and the maximum
value for both of them is 10. N^M should be less than 65536.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>For example:<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>With M=2 and<span style="mso-spacerun: yes"> 
</span>N=3, a possible solution is: 001122102 from which you can obtain (00,
01, 11, 12, 22, 21, 10, 02, 20) by taking the first two digits, the second and
the third, and so on. The last number is built by linking the last and first
digits of the string.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h2><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>The Input<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>The input
consists on a list of pairs of numbers (M, N), where M is the amount of digits we
are going to deal with, and N the base of the numbers.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h2><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>The Output<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>The output
must be a string with one of the possible ouroboros.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h2><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB;mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Sample
input<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB
style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='font-family:"Courier New";
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>3 3<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='font-family:"Courier New";
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>4 2<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='font-family:"Courier New";
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB
style='font-family:"Times New Roman";color:#3366FF;mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>Sample
output<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-GB
style='font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>000111222121102202101201002<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Courier New"'>1111000010100110<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

</div>

</body>

</html>

<body lang=ES style='tab-interval:35.4pt'>

<div class=Section1>

<div align=center>

<table border=0 cellpadding=0 bgcolor="#0060f0" style='mso-cellspacing:1.5pt;
 background:#0060F0;mso-padding-alt:0cm 0cm 0cm 0cm'>
 <tr>
  <td style='padding:.75pt .75pt .75pt .75pt'>
  <h2><span lang=EN-GB>Problem H</span></h2>
  <h2><span lang=EN-GB>Waking up brain</span><span lang=EN-GB style='font-size:
  12.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p class=MsoBodyText><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>Most
recent researches on Neuroanatomy have permitted us of identifying a series of
large electric signal transmision route connecting different areas of the
brain. Even more, it has been found that if one slept area <i>X</i> of the brain
is directly connected to at least three awake areas for a year, the <i>X</i>
area will wake up. There is evidence of when an area X of the brain wakes up,
it remains awake. Let <i>A, B, C</i>... the different areas of the brain and
let´s imagine a brain with some initially slept areas, interconnected one
another. If three of these areas wake up by direct stimulation according to the
previous researches, how many years will all the slept areas take to wake up?<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB
style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<table border=0 cellpadding=0 style='mso-cellspacing:1.5pt;mso-padding-alt:
 0cm 0cm 0cm 0cm'>
 <tr>
  <td style='padding:.75pt .75pt .75pt .75pt'><span lang=EN-GB
  style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-font-family:
  "Times New Roman";color:#3366FF;mso-ansi-language:EN-GB;mso-fareast-language:
  ES;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA'><br clear=all style='page-break-before:always'>
  </span>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><span lang=EN-GB
  style='font-size:18.0pt;color:#3366FF;mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>Input&nbsp;</span></b><span
  lang=EN-GB style='color:#3366FF;mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>
The input file contains several test cases, each of them as described below.
There is a blank line between two consecutive inputs.

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:18.0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:
-18.0pt;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2;tab-stops:list 18.0pt 54.0pt'><![if !supportLists]><span
lang=EN-GB style='font-size:8.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Symbol;
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span><![endif]><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>The first
line of the input is an integer, 3 </span><span lang=EN-GB style='font-family:
Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB;mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'><span
style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>£</span></span><span
lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'> <i>N</i> </span><span lang=EN-GB
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-GB;mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>£</span></span><span
lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'> 26, that indicates the number of
slept areas.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:18.0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:
-18.0pt;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2;tab-stops:list 18.0pt 54.0pt'><![if !supportLists]><span
lang=EN-GB style='font-size:8.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Symbol;
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span><![endif]><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>The
second line of the input is an integer <i>M</i> </span><span lang=EN-GB
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-GB;mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>³</span></span><span
lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'> 0, that indicates the number of
connections (if <i>A</i> is connected to <i>B</i>, then <i>B</i> is connected
to <i>A</i>, but it counts only once).<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:18.0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:
-18.0pt;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2;tab-stops:list 18.0pt 54.0pt'><![if !supportLists]><span
lang=EN-GB style='font-size:8.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Symbol;
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span><![endif]><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>The
third line consists of three characters that indicate which areas have wake up
by direct stimulation.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:18.0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:
-18.0pt;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo2;tab-stops:list 18.0pt 54.0pt'><![if !supportLists]><span
lang=EN-GB style='font-size:8.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Symbol;
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span><![endif]><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>The
remaining <i>M</i> lines consist of two characters each one, that indicate the
different conections between areas of the brain, one line per conection.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB
style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h1><b><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB
style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>The output is only one line with one of the
following text messages:<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB
style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:54.0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:
-18.0pt;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo4;tab-stops:list 54.0pt'><![if !supportLists]><span
lang=EN-GB style='font-size:8.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Symbol;
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span><![endif]><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>THIS
BRAIN NEVER WAKES UP<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:54.0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:
-18.0pt;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo4;tab-stops:list 54.0pt'><![if !supportLists]><span
lang=EN-GB style='font-size:8.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Symbol;
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span><![endif]><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>WAKE
UP IN,</span><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-fareast-font-family:"MS Mincho";
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'> </span><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:
EN-GB'> n </span><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-fareast-font-family:"MS Mincho";
mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>, YEARS</span><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:
EN-GB'>, where n is the number of the years all the brain has taken to wake
up.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB
style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h1><b><span lang=EN-GB style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB
style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>6<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB
style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>11<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB
style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>HAB<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB
style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>AB<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB
style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>AC<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB
style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>AH<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB
style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>BD<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB
style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>BC<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB
style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>BF<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB
style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>CH<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB
style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>DF<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB
style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>FH<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-GB

<title>WORD MORPHING</title>

<body lang=ES style='tab-interval:35.4pt'>

<div class=Section1>

<table border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width=204 style='width:153.0pt;
 margin-left:138.5pt;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
 mso-padding-alt:0cm 3.5pt 0cm 3.5pt'>
 <tr>
  <td width=204 valign=top style='width:153.0pt;border:none;background:#3366FF;
  padding:0cm 3.5pt 0cm 3.5pt'>
  <h1 align=center style='margin-top:0cm;text-align:center;text-indent:0cm'><span
  lang=EN-GB style='font-family:"Times New Roman";color:aqua;mso-ansi-language:
  EN-GB'>Problem I<o:p></o:p></span></h1>
  <h1 align=center style='margin-top:0cm;text-align:center;text-indent:0cm'><span
  lang=EN-GB style='font-family:"Times New Roman";color:aqua;mso-ansi-language:
  EN-GB'>Word Morphing</span><span lang=EN-GB style='color:aqua;mso-ansi-language:
  EN-GB'><o:p></o:p></span></h1>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<h2><span lang=EN-GB style='color:#3366FF'>Background<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>Orlando was looking at his soup while his
mother was in the kitchen. He was playing with the letters in his soup, and
suddenly, he noticed that had a secret power. He could change the words
morphing one word to another replacing the letter in a mysterious order.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h2><span lang=EN-GB style='color:#3366FF'>Problem<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>Orlando has changed the letters of some words,
you have to find an algorithm that find out the morphing order from the
original word to the morphed one. The rules are simple:<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>1.- In each step you just can change one letter
from the previous word.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>2.- A letter can be changed just once<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>3.- All the letters in the word must change.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h2><span lang=EN-GB style='color:#3366FF'>The</span><span lang=EN-GB
style='color:aqua'> </span><span lang=EN-GB style='color:#3366FF'>Input</span><span
lang=EN-GB style='color:aqua'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

  <p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>The input is a file containing several unordered 
    morphing series. For each one you have a line with the number of words, the 
    number of letters in each word, next line is the first word, third line is 
    the morphed one. The rest are the intermediate words unordered. The number 
    of words are unlimited and all the words in each set have the same size. You 
    can assume that all the characters are letters (capital or not).<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h2><span lang=EN-GB style='color:#3366FF'>The</span><span lang=EN-GB
style='color:aqua'> </span><span lang=EN-GB style='color:#3366FF'>Output</span><span
lang=EN-GB style='color:aqua'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>For each morphing you should print all the
words in the correct order to convert the first one in the morphed one<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h2><span lang=EN-GB style='color:#3366FF'>Sample</span><span lang=EN-GB
style='color:aqua'> </span><span lang=EN-GB style='color:#3366FF'>Input</span><span
lang=EN-GB style='color:aqua'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-GB style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>6 5<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0cm'><span lang=EN-GB style='font-size:
11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-ansi-language:
EN-GB'>remar<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0cm'><span lang=EN-GB style='font-size:
11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-ansi-language:
EN-GB'>pitos<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0cm'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>remas<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0cm'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>remos<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0cm'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>retos<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0cm'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>ritos</span><span
style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0cm'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>5 4<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0cm'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>pato<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0cm'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>lisa<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0cm'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>pata<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0cm'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>pita<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0cm'><span lang=EN-GB style='font-size:
11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>pisa<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h2><span lang=EN-GB style='color:#3366FF'>Sample</span><span lang=EN-GB
style='color:aqua'> </span><span lang=EN-GB style='color:#3366FF'>Output</span><span
lang=EN-GB style='color:aqua'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0cm'><span lang=EN-GB style='font-size:
11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'>remar<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0cm'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>remas<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0cm'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>remos<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0cm'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>retos<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0cm'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>ritos<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0cm'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>pitos<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0cm'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>pato<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0cm'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>pata<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0cm'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>pita<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0cm'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>pisa<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0cm'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>lisa</span><span
lang=EN-GB style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ansi-language:
