<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times"><!--mstheme--></font>
<H1 align=center><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033"><font color="#800080"><i>THE SAMS' CONTEST</i></font><!--mstheme--></font></H1>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times"><!--mstheme--></font>
<H1 align=center><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033"><FONT color=#008080><B><SPAN 
style="FONT-SIZE: 18pt; FONT-STYLE: italic">Problem 0</SPAN></B></FONT><BR 
clear=all><!--mstheme--></font></H1>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
<CENTER>
<!--mstheme--></font>
<TABLE bgColor=#0060f0>
  <TBODY>
  <TR>
    <TD><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
    <p align="justify"><B><FONT color=#c0ffff size=5><SPAN 
      style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #008080">&nbsp;!! REALLY STRANGE !!</SPAN></FONT><SPAN 
      style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #008080">&nbsp;</SPAN></B><!--mstheme--></font></TD></TR></TBODY></TABLE>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times"></CENTER>
<!--mstheme--></font>
<H1 align="justify"><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033">
<!--mstheme--></font></H1>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
<P align="justify"></P>
<P align="justify"></P>
<P align="justify"></P>
<!--mstheme--></font>
<H2 align="justify"><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033"><FONT color=#008080>BACKGROUND</FONT><!--mstheme--></font></H2>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
<P align="justify">Raju has recently passed BSc. Engineering in Computer Science &amp; Engineering 
from BUET ( Bangladesh University of Extraordinary Talents), the best university 
of Bangladesh. After passing, he has been appointed manager of BCS ( Bangladesh 
Calculation Society ). His first project is to visit a district and then to 
report the total number of distinct regions there. But, going there, he is 
astonished to see a very strange phenomena of the local people. He discovered 
that, the people make their area circular. Every two area have exactly two 
points to intersect and no three circles intersect in a common point. There 
are so many people so that it's very hard to calculate total number of distinct 
regions for Raju. So, only in this case he seeks for your help.</P>
<P align="justify"><img border="0" src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/105/p10519.gif"  width="682" height="418"></P>
<P align="justify">
<!--mstheme--></font>
<H2 align="justify"><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033"><FONT color=#008080><A 
name=SECTION0001001000000000000000>Input</A></FONT><!--mstheme--></font></H2>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
<P align="justify">The problem contains multiple test cases. You are given total number of 
circular area <b>n</b> in separate lines (<b>n&lt;=10<sup>100</sup></b>). And you know the number houses in the world 
can't be fraction or negative. Input is terminated by end of file.<!--mstheme--></font><H2 align="justify">
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033"><FONT color=#008080><A 
name=SECTION0001002000000000000000>Output</A></FONT><!--mstheme--></font></H2>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
<P align="justify">For each line of the input, your correct program should output the value of 
the total number of regions in separate lines for each value of <b>n</b>.
<P align="justify">
<P align="justify">
<P align="justify">
<!--mstheme--></font>
<H2 align="justify"><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033"><FONT color=#008080><A name=SECTION0001003000000000000000>Sample 
Input</A></FONT><!--mstheme--></font></H2>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
<P align="justify">
<div align="justify">
  <!--mstheme--></font><PRE>3
4</PRE>
  <!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
</div>
<P align="justify">
<!--mstheme--></font>
<H2 align="justify"><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033"><FONT color=#008080><A name=SECTION0001004000000000000000>Sample 
Output</A></FONT><!--mstheme--></font></H2><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
<div align="justify">
  <!--mstheme--></font><PRE>8
14</PRE>
  <!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
</div>
<!--msthemeseparator--><p align="center"><img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/105/p10519.gif" ></p>


<P align="center"><font color="#008080"><I><B>Anupam Bhattacharjee ( BUET PESSIMISTIC )</B></I></font></P>


<P align="center"><i><b>Small is a relative term and it is very hard to 
define...</b></i></P>
<!--mstheme--></font></BODY></HTML>

<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0 Transitional//EN">
<!-- saved from url=(0044)http://in.geocities.com/shihabbd81/problem1/ --><HTML><HEAD><TITLE>Problem 1</TITLE>
<META http-equiv=Content-Type content="text/html; charset=windows-1252">
<META content="Microsoft FrontPage 5.0" name=GENERATOR>
<meta name="Microsoft Theme" content="expeditn 011">
</HEAD>
<BODY bgColor=#FFFFFF background="images/exptextb.jpg" text="#000000" link="#993300" vlink="#666600" alink="#CC3300">
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times"><!--mstheme--></font>
<H1 align="center"><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033"><font color="#800080"><i>THE SAMS' CONTEST</i></font><!--mstheme--></font></h1>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times"><!--mstheme--></font>
<H1 align="center"><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033"><FONT color=#008080><B><SPAN 
style="FONT-SIZE: 18pt; FONT-STYLE: italic">Problem 1</SPAN></B></FONT><!--mstheme--></font></h1>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
<CENTER>
<!--mstheme--></font>
<TABLE bgColor=#0060f0>
  <TBODY>
  <TR>
    <TD><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
    <p align="justify"><i><B><FONT color=#c0ffff size=5>
    <span style="background-color: #008080">Determine it</span></FONT></B></i><!--mstheme--></font></TD></TR></TBODY></TABLE>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times"></CENTER>
<!--mstheme--></font>
<h1 align="justify"><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033">
<!--mstheme--></font></H1>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
<P align="justify">
<!--mstheme--></font>
<H2 align="justify"><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033"><FONT color=#008080>The Problem</FONT><!--mstheme--></font></H2>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
<P align="justify"><b><i>a</i><SUB><I>i,j</I></SUB></b> is defined as: 
<P align="justify"><IMG height=170 src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/105/p10520.gif"  width=810></IMG> 
<P align="justify">You are to calculate the value of <b>a<SUB><I>1,n</I></SUB></b> on the basis 
of the values of <B><I>n</I></B> and a<SUB><I>n,1</I></SUB>.<P align="justify">
<!--mstheme--></font>
<H2 align="justify"><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033"><font color="#008080">The Input</font><!--mstheme--></font></H2>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
<P align="justify">The input consists of several test cases. Each Test case consists of two 
integers <B><I>n</I></B> ( <b>0 &lt; <I>n</I> &lt; 20</b> ) and 
<B>a<SUB><I>n,1</I></SUB></B> ( <b>0 &lt; a<SUB><I>n,1</I></SUB> &lt; 500 </b>). 
<P align="justify">
<!--mstheme--></font>
<H2 align="justify"><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033"><font color="#008080">The Output</font><!--mstheme--></font></H2>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
<P align="justify">For each test case your correct program should print the value of
<b><i>a</i><SUB><I>1,n</I></SUB></b> in a separate line. 
<P align="justify">
<!--mstheme--></font>
<H2 align="justify"><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033"><font color="#008080">Sample Input</font><!--mstheme--></font></H2>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
<P align="justify">
<div align="justify">
  <!--mstheme--></font><PRE>5 10
4 1
6 13
</PRE>
  <!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
</div>
<P align="justify">
<!--mstheme--></font>
<H2 align="justify"><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033"><font color="#008080">Sample Output</font><!--mstheme--></font></H2>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
<P align="justify">
<div align="justify">
  <!--mstheme--></font><PRE>1140
42
3770
</PRE>
  <!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
</div>
<!--msthemeseparator--><p align="center"><img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/105/p10520.gif" ></p>

<div align="center">
  <!--mstheme--></font>
<PRE><I><B><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=3 color="#008080">Hasan Shihab Uddin ( BUET PESSIMISTIC )</FONT></B></I></PRE>
  <!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
</div>
<!--mstheme--></font></BODY></HTML>

10521||||||false||||||
<HTML xmlns:v="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:vml" xmlns:o="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40">
<HEAD>

<TITLE>C_F</TITLE>
<style>
<!--
 table.MsoNormalTable
	{mso-style-parent:" ;
	font-size:10.0pt;
	font-family:"Times New Roman"}
-->
</style>
<meta name="Microsoft Theme" content="expeditn 011">
</HEAD>
<BODY LANG="EN" BGCOLOR=#FFFFFF background="images/exptextb.jpg" text="#000000" link="#993300" vlink="#666600" alink="#CC3300">
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times"><!--mstheme--></font>
<H1 align=center><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033"><font color="#800080"><i>THE SAMS' CONTEST</i></font><!--mstheme--></font></H1>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times"><!--mstheme--></font>
<H1 align=center><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033"><FONT color=#008080><B><SPAN 
style="FONT-SIZE: 18pt; FONT-STYLE: italic">Problem 2</SPAN></B></FONT><BR CLEAR=ALL>
<!--mstheme--></font></H1>
 <!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
 <CENTER><!--mstheme--></font><TABLE BGCOLOR=#0060F0><TR><TD><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
   <p align="justify"><B>
   <i>
   <FONT SIZE=6 COLOR=#C0FFFF><A NAME="SECTION0001000000000000000000">
   <span style="background-color: #008080">Continuously</span></A><span style="background-color: #008080"> Growing <A NAME="SECTION0001000000000000000000">
   Fractions  </A></span></FONT></i></B><!--mstheme--></font></TABLE>
 <!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times"></CENTER>
 <!--mstheme--></font>
 <H1 align="justify"><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033">&nbsp;<!--mstheme--></font></H1>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
<P align="justify">

<!--mstheme--></font>

<H2 align="justify"><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033"><u><FONT COLOR=#009999><A NAME="Height to Area">Problem</A></FONT></u><!--mstheme--></font></H2>
 <!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
 <p class="MsoNormal" align="justify"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman">Though many 
 programming languages dont support Recursion, it is still very important 
 topic in programming theories. I think the idea of Recursion came from the 
 iterative process which is playing a major role in the chapters of Numerical 
 Methods! &nbsp;</span></p>
 <p class="MsoNormal" align="justify"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman">
 Now lets see its application in number theory  especially in the field of 
 Continued Fractions (CF). </span></p>
 <p class="MsoNormal" align="justify"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman">The origin of 
 continued fractions is very difficult to pinpoint as we can find examples of 
 these fractions throughout mathematics in the last 2000 years, but its true 
 foundations were not laid until the late 1600's, early 1700's. But 
 traditionally its origin is said to be occurred at the time of the great 
 geometrician Euclid. For more than a thousand years, any work that used 
 continued fractions was restricted to specific examples. The Indian 
 mathematician Aryabhata used a continued fraction to solve a linear </span>
 <a href="http://archives.math.utk.edu/articles/atuyl/confrac/intro.html#def9" style="color: #006633; text-decoration: underline; text-underline: single">
 <span style="font-family: Times New Roman; color: windowtext; text-decoration: none">
 indeterminate equation.</span></a><span style="font-family: Times New Roman"> 
 Throughout the history of Greek and Arab mathematical writings we can also find 
 examples and traces of continued fractions. But its use was also limited to 
 specifics. </span></p>
 <p class="MsoNormal" align="justify"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman">
 A formal definition of CF:&nbsp;</span></p>
 <p class="MsoNormal" align="justify"><a name="def1"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman">
 An expression of the form </span></a></p>
 <p class="MsoNormal" align="justify"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman"><br>
 <img border="0" src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/105/p10521a.gif"  width="181" height="110"></span></p>
 <p class="MsoNormal" align="justify"><font face="Times New Roman"><br>
 is said to be a </font><span style="font-family: Verdana"><em>
 <span style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-style: normal">continued 
 fraction.</span></em></span><font face="Times New Roman"> The values of a<sub>1</sub>, 
 a<sub>2</sub>, a<sub>3</sub>,... and b<sub>1</sub> , b<sub>2</sub>, b<sub>3</sub>,... 
 can be either real or complex values. There can be either an infinite or a 
 finite number of terms. A continued fraction can be created from any number 
 alpha by using the following recursive algorithm.</font><span style="font-family: Times New Roman">&nbsp;</span></p>
 <p class="MsoNormal" align="center" style="text-align: justify">
 <img border="0" src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/105/p10521a.gif"  width="66" height="17"></p>
 <p align="center" style="text-align: justify">
 <img border="0" src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/105/p10521a.gif"  width="95" height="24"></p>
 <p class="MsoNormal" align="justify"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman">where alpha<sub>1</sub> 
 = alpha. The sequences of a<sub>i</sub>'s are the terms of the continued 
 fraction.</span></p>
 <p class="MsoNormal" align="justify"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman">There are four 
 kinds of continued fractions. &nbsp;Infinite, where the terms just go on for ever, 
 and finite continued fraction, where there are only a fixed number of terms. 
 &nbsp;And those two can be of one of two types, regular (sometimes called simple), 
 and irregular (sometimes called complex). &nbsp;The regular type always has a one in 
 the numerator. &nbsp;The irregular type can have other whole numbers there.</span></p>
 <p class="MsoNormal" align="justify"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman">Here we are 
 talking about the regular finite continued fraction that can be said as:</span></p>
 <div align="justify">
 <!--mstheme--></font>
 <pre style="tab-stops: 45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt; font-family: Courier New; margin-left: 0in; margin-right: 0in; margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman"><font size="3">A continued fraction is an expression of the form,</font></span></pre>
 <!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
 </div>
 <div align="justify">
 <!--mstheme--></font>
 <pre style="tab-stops: 45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt; font-family: Courier New; margin-left: 0in; margin-right: 0in; margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman"><font size="3">&nbsp;</font></span></pre>
 <!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
 </div>
 <div align="justify">
 <!--mstheme--></font>
 <pre style="tab-stops: 45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt; font-family: Courier New; margin-left: 0in; margin-right: 0in; margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman"><font size="3">&nbsp;<b> A = a_0 + 1/c_0</b></font></span></pre>
 <!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
 </div>
 <div align="justify">
 <!--mstheme--></font>
 <pre style="tab-stops: 45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt; font-family: Courier New; margin-left: 0in; margin-right: 0in; margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman"><font size="3">&nbsp;</font></span></pre>
 <!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
 </div>
 <div align="justify">
 <!--mstheme--></font>
 <pre style="tab-stops: 45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt; font-family: Courier New; margin-left: 0in; margin-right: 0in; margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman"><font size="3">where</font></span></pre>
 <!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
 </div>
 <div align="justify">
 <!--mstheme--></font>
 <pre style="tab-stops: 45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt; font-family: Courier New; margin-left: 0in; margin-right: 0in; margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman"><font size="3">&nbsp;</font></span></pre>
 <!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
 </div>
 <div align="justify">
 <!--mstheme--></font>
 <pre style="tab-stops: 45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt; font-family: Courier New; margin-left: 0in; margin-right: 0in; margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman"><font size="3">&nbsp;<b> c_0 = a_1 + 1/c_1</b></font></span></pre>
 <!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
 </div>
 <div align="justify">
 <!--mstheme--></font>
 <pre style="tab-stops: 45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt; font-family: Courier New; margin-left: 0in; margin-right: 0in; margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-weight:700"><font size="3">&nbsp;</font></span></pre>
 <!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
 </div>
 <div align="justify">
 <!--mstheme--></font>
 <pre style="tab-stops: 45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt; font-family: Courier New; margin-left: 0in; margin-right: 0in; margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-weight:700"><font size="3">&nbsp; c_1 = a_2 + 1/c_2</font></span></pre>
 <!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
 </div>
 <div align="justify">
 <!--mstheme--></font>
 <pre style="tab-stops: 45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt; font-family: Courier New; margin-left: 0in; margin-right: 0in; margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-weight:700"><font size="3">&nbsp;</font></span></pre>
 <!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
 </div>
 <div align="justify">
 <!--mstheme--></font>
 <pre style="tab-stops: 45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt; font-family: Courier New; margin-left: 0in; margin-right: 0in; margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-weight:700"><font size="3">&nbsp;&nbsp; .</font></span></pre>
 <!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
 </div>
 <div align="justify">
 <!--mstheme--></font>
 <pre style="tab-stops: 45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt; font-family: Courier New; margin-left: 0in; margin-right: 0in; margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-weight:700"><font size="3">&nbsp;&nbsp; .&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </font></span></pre>
 <!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
 </div>
 <div align="justify">
 <!--mstheme--></font>
 <pre style="tab-stops: 45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt; font-family: Courier New; margin-left: 0in; margin-right: 0in; margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-weight:700"><font size="3">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;.</font></span></pre>
 <!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
 </div>
 <div align="justify">
 <!--mstheme--></font>
 <pre style="tab-stops: 45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt; font-family: Courier New; margin-left: 0in; margin-right: 0in; margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-weight:700"><font size="3">&nbsp;</font></span></pre>
 <!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
 </div>
 <div align="justify">
 <!--mstheme--></font>
 <pre style="tab-stops: 45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt; font-family: Courier New; margin-left: 0in; margin-right: 0in; margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman"><font size="3">If the process stopped at, say,</font></span></pre>
 <!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
 </div>
 <div align="justify">
 <!--mstheme--></font>
 <pre style="tab-stops: 45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt; font-family: Courier New; margin-left: 0in; margin-right: 0in; margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman"><font size="3">&nbsp;</font></span></pre>
 <!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
 </div>
 <div align="justify">
 <!--mstheme--></font>
 <pre style="tab-stops: 45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt; font-family: Courier New; margin-left: 0in; margin-right: 0in; margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-weight:700"><font size="3">&nbsp; c_n = a_(n+1) + 1/c_(n+1)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </font></span></pre>
 <!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
 </div>
 <div align="justify">
 <!--mstheme--></font>
 <pre style="tab-stops: 45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt; font-family: Courier New; margin-left: 0in; margin-right: 0in; margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman"><font size="3">&nbsp;</font></span></pre>
 <!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
 </div>
 <div align="justify">
 <!--mstheme--></font>
 <pre style="tab-stops: 45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt; font-family: Courier New; margin-left: 0in; margin-right: 0in; margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: .0001pt"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman"><font size="3">then we would have regular a finite continued fraction.</font></span></pre>
 <!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
 </div>
 <p class="MsoNormal" align="justify"><font face="Times New Roman"><span style="color: black">
 Now for any fraction of the form <b> <sup>P</sup>/<sub>Q</sub></b> (P and Q are whole 
 numbers) expressing it in the form of a regular finite continued fraction 
 as follows: </span></font></p>
 <p class="MsoNormal" align="justify">
 <img border="0" src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/105/p10521a.gif"  width="656" height="176"></p>
 <p class="MsoNormal" align="justify"><font face="Times New Roman"><span style="color: black">
 where a, b, c, d, e, etc are all whole numbers.</span></font></p>
 <!--mstheme--></font>
 <H2 align="justify"><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033"><u><FONT COLOR=#009999>Input &amp; Output</FONT></u><!--mstheme--></font></H2>
 <!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
 <p class="MsoNormal" align="justify"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman">In every line 
 of input you are given the integers P and Q and as output you have to present 
 the regular finite continued fraction of P/Q in the following format. There may 
 be at most 2000 digits in both P and Q.</span></p>
 <p class="MsoNormal" align="justify">
 <span style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-weight:700">
 P/Q = a+1/{b+1/{c+1/{d+...}}}</span></p>

<!--mstheme--></font>

<H2 align="justify"><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033"><u><FONT COLOR=#009999>Sample Input</FONT></u><!--mstheme--></font></H2>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
<P align="justify">
<P align="justify">
<P align="justify">
<P align="justify">
<P align="justify">
<P align="justify">
103 24<br>
021 73<br>
&nbsp;<!--mstheme--></font><H2 align="justify"><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033"><u><FONT COLOR=#009999>Sample Output</A></FONT></u><!--mstheme--></font></H2>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
<P align="justify">
<P align="justify">
<span style='mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt;color:windowtext'>103/24 = 
4+1/{3+1/{2+1/{3}}}<br>
21/73 = 0+1/{3+1/{2+1/{10}}}<br>
&nbsp;</span><P align="center">
&nbsp;<span style="color: windowtext"><!--msthemeseparator--><p align="center">
<img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/105/p10521a.gif" ></p>

 </span>
 <!--mstheme--></font>
 <h4 align="center"><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033"><font color="#00CC99" size="4"><i>Enamul Haque</i></font><!--mstheme--></font></h4>
 <!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
 <span style="color: windowtext"><!--msthemeseparator--><p align="center">
<img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/105/p10521a.gif" ></p>

 <p align="justify">&nbsp;</p>
 </span>
 <p class="MsoNormal" align="justify"><i><font face="Verdana" color="#0070E8">
 &quot;</font><font face="Verdana">It was once said that God invented the 
 integers and man invented everything else. It might be added God probably 
 invented continued fractions as well.</font><font face="Verdana" color="#0070E8">&quot;</font></i></p>
 <p class="MsoNormal" align="justify"><i><font face="Verdana">
 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 
 ~~~  </font></i><font face="Comic Sans MS"><i>Mark Herkommer</i></font><i><font face="Verdana">.</font></i></p>
 <span style="color: windowtext"><!--msthemeseparator--><p align="center">
<img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/105/p10521a.gif" ></p>

 </span>
 <p class="MsoNormal" align="justify"><span style="font-size: 14.0pt; font-family: Romantic">&nbsp;</span></p>
<!--mstheme--></font>

<!--mstheme--></font>
<h1 align=center><!--mstheme--><font color="#660033"><font color="#800080"><i>THE SAMS&#39; CONTEST</i></font><!--mstheme--></font></h1>
<P align=center><I><B><FONT color=#008080 size=6>Problem 3</FONT></B></I></P>
<CENTER>
<!--mstheme--></font>
<TABLE bgColor=#0060f0>
  <TBODY>
  <TR>
    <TD><B><i><font color="#c0ffff" size="5">
    <span style="background-color: #008080"><A
      name=SECTION0001000000000000000000><SPAN
      style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #008080">Height to Area</SPAN></A><SPAN
      style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #008080">&nbsp;</SPAN></span></font></i></B><!--mstheme--></font></TD></TR></TBODY></TABLE></CENTER>
<!--mstheme--></font>
<H1><!--mstheme--><font color="#660033"><!--mstheme--></font></H1>
<P>
<!--mstheme--></font>
<H2><!--mstheme--><font color="#660033"><U><FONT color=#008080><A name="Height to Area">Problem</A></FONT></U><!--mstheme--></font></H2>
<!--mstheme--></font>
<H2><!--mstheme--><font color="#660033"><SPAN style="FONT-WEIGHT: 400"><FONT size=3>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; It's an easy
geometry problem. For any triangle ABC we
know that the height from A to the line BC (or it's extension) is Ha, from B to
the line AC (or it's extension) is Hb and from C to the line AB (or it's
extension) is Hc. Now you are given these three values and you have to figure
out the area of the ABC
.</FONT></SPAN><!--mstheme--></font></H2>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<IMG border=0 height=455 src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/105/p10522.jpg"  width=595></P>
<!--mstheme--></font>
<H2><!--mstheme--><font color="#660033"><U><FONT color=#008080>Input</FONT></U><!--mstheme--></font></H2>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; At first the input will be an integer n. Which denotes the
number of invalid inputs after which the input will terminate. Then there will
be three real numbers Ha, Hb and Hc per line.
<!--mstheme--></font>
<H2><!--mstheme--><font color="#660033"><U><FONT color=#008080>Output</FONT></U><!--mstheme--></font></H2>
<P>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; For each input block there should be one output line. For
valid inputs the line contains the area of the <SPAN
style="FONT-WEIGHT: 400">ABC
up to 3 decimal places after the decimal point and for invalid inputs there will
be a line "These are invalid inputs!". After n invalid input sets the program
will terminate.</FONT></SPAN>
<!--mstheme--></font>
<H2><!--mstheme--><font color="#660033"><U><FONT color=#008080>Sample Input</FONT></U><!--mstheme--></font></H2>
<P>
<P>
<P>
<P>
<P>
<P>1<BR>31.573 22.352 63.448<BR>46.300 50.868 86.683<BR>22.005 24.725
22.914<BR>5.710 25.635 32.805<BR>&nbsp;
<!--mstheme--></font>
<H2><!--mstheme--><font color="#660033"><U><FONT color=#008080>Sample Output</A></FONT></U><!--mstheme--></font></H2>
<P>
<P><SPAN
style="COLOR: windowtext; mso-bidi-font-size: 13.5pt">
1517.456<br>
2219.941<br>
311.804<br>
These are invalid inputs!</SPAN>

<hr>

<H4 align="center"><!--mstheme--><font color="#660033"><FONT color=#008080 size=4><I>Enamul Haque</I></FONT><!--mstheme--></font></H4>

<hr>

<P align=center class=MsoNormal><I><FONT color=#008080 face=Verdana
size=2>Triangle is a very fine geometrical shape,</FONT></I></P>
<P align=center class=MsoNormal><I><FONT color=#008080 face=Verdana
size=2>&nbsp;you can't say this is bad;</FONT></I></P>
<P align=center class=MsoNormal><I><FONT color=#008080 face=Verdana size=2>But
if you familiar with "Triangle Love",</FONT></I></P>
<P align=center class=MsoNormal><I><FONT color=#008080 face=Verdana
size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
you must know that will make you sad.</FONT></I></P>
<P align=center class=MsoNormal><I><FONT color=#008080 face=Verdana
size=2>

--- Moni.</FONT></I></P><!--mstheme--></font></BODY></HTML>

<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0 Transitional//EN">
<!--Converted with LaTeX2HTML 96.1 (Feb 5, 1996) by Nikos Drakos (nikos@cbl.leeds.ac.uk), CBLU, University of Leeds --><HTML><HEAD><TITLE>Very Easy!!!</TITLE>
<META http-equiv=Content-Type content="text/html; charset=windows-1252">
<META content="Spade trump" name=description>
<META content=htmlatex name=keywords>
<META content=document name=resource-type>
<META content=global name=distribution><LINK href="htmlatex.css" rel=STYLESHEET>
<META content="Microsoft FrontPage 5.0" name=GENERATOR>
<meta name="Microsoft Theme" content="expeditn 011">
</HEAD>
<BODY lang=EN bgColor=#FFFFFF background="images/exptextb.jpg" text="#000000" link="#993300" vlink="#666600" alink="#CC3300">
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times"><!--mstheme--></font>
<H1 align=center><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033"><font color="#800080"><i>THE SAMS' CONTEST</i></font><!--mstheme--></font></H1>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times"><!--mstheme--></font>
<H1 align=center><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033"><FONT color=#008080><B><SPAN 
style="FONT-SIZE: 18pt; FONT-STYLE: italic">Problem 4</SPAN></B></FONT><BR 
clear=all><!--mstheme--></font></H1>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
<CENTER>
<!--mstheme--></font>
<TABLE bgColor=#0060f0>
  <TBODY>
  <TR>
    <TD><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
    <p align="justify"><B><FONT color=#c0ffff size=5><SPAN 
      style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #008080">&nbsp;VERY EASY !!!</SPAN></FONT><SPAN 
      style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #008080">&nbsp;</SPAN></B><!--mstheme--></font></TD></TR></TBODY></TABLE>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times"></CENTER>
<!--mstheme--></font>
<H1 align="justify"><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033">
<!--mstheme--></font></H1>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
<P align="justify"></P>
<P align="justify"></P>
<P align="justify"></P>
<!--mstheme--></font>
<H2 align="justify"><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033"><FONT color=#008080>BACKGROUND</FONT><!--mstheme--></font></H2>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
<p align="justify">Most of the times, the students of Computer Science &amp; Engineering of BUET 
deal with bogus, tough and very complex formulae. That is why, sometimes, even 
for a easy problem they think very hard and make the problem much complex to 
solve. But, the team members of the team &quot;<i><b>BUET PESSIMISTIC</b></i>&quot;&nbsp; 
are the only exceptions. Just like the opposite manner, they treat every hard 
problem as easy and so cannot do well in any contest. Today, they try to solve a 
series but fail for treating it as hard. Let them help.</p>
<P align="justify">
<!--mstheme--></font>
<H2 align="justify"><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033"><FONT color=#008080><A 
name=SECTION0001001000000000000000>Input</A></FONT><!--mstheme--></font></H2>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
<P align="center">Just try to determine the answer for the following series<br>
<img border="0" src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/105/p10523.gif"  width="100" height="100"><P align="justify">You are given the value of 
<i><b>N </b>and<b> A</b></i> (<i><b>integer, 1&lt;=N&lt;=150&nbsp; &amp;&nbsp; 
integer, 0&lt;=A&lt;=15</b></i>) respectively.<P align="justify">
<!--mstheme--></font>
<H2 align="justify"><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033"><FONT color=#008080><A 
name=SECTION0001002000000000000000>Output</A></FONT><!--mstheme--></font></H2>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
<P align="justify">For each line of the input, your correct program should output the <i>integer</i> value of 
the sum in separate lines for each pair of values of <b>N</b> &amp; <b>A</b>.<P align="justify">
<P align="justify">
<P align="justify">
<!--mstheme--></font>
<H2 align="justify"><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033"><FONT color=#008080><A name=SECTION0001003000000000000000>Sample 
Input</A></FONT><!--mstheme--></font></H2>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
<P align="justify">
<div align="justify">
  <!--mstheme--></font><PRE>3 3
4 4</PRE>
  <!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
</div>
<P align="justify">
<!--mstheme--></font>
<H2 align="justify"><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033"><FONT color=#008080><A name=SECTION0001004000000000000000>Sample 
Output</A></FONT><!--mstheme--></font></H2><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
<div align="justify">
  <!--mstheme--></font><PRE>102
1252
</PRE>
  <!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
</div>
<!--msthemeseparator--><p align="center"><img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/105/p10523.gif" ></p>

<p align="center"><font color="#008080"><i><b>Anupam Bhattacharjee ( BUET PESSIMISTIC )</b></i></font></p>

<p align="center"><b>E means exponent, E means error. So try to avoid exponent 
whenever possible.</b></p>
<!--mstheme--></font>

<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0 Transitional//EN">
<!--Converted with LaTeX2HTML 96.1 (Feb 5, 1996) by Nikos Drakos (nikos@cbl.leeds.ac.uk), CBLU, University of Leeds --><HTML><HEAD><TITLE>
&lt;Matrix Reloaded&gt;</TITLE>
<META http-equiv=Content-Type content="text/html; charset=windows-1252">
<META content="Spade trump" name=description>
<META content=htmlatex name=keywords>
<META content=document name=resource-type>
<META content=global name=distribution>
<LINK href="../all%20works/current%20contest/all%20works/current%20contest/Contest-kit-1.1/problemset/htmlatex.css" rel=STYLESHEET>
<META content="Microsoft FrontPage 5.0" name=GENERATOR>
<meta name="Microsoft Theme" content="expeditn 011">
</HEAD>
<BODY lang=EN bgColor=#FFFFFF background="images/exptextb.jpg" text="#000000" link="#993300" vlink="#666600" alink="#CC3300">
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times"><!--mstheme--></font>
<H1 align=center><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033"><font color="#800080"><i>THE SAMS' CONTEST</i></font><!--mstheme--></font></H1>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times"><!--mstheme--></font>
<H1 align=center><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033"><FONT color=#008080><B><SPAN 
style="FONT-SIZE: 18pt; FONT-STYLE: italic">Problem 5</SPAN></B></FONT><BR 
clear=all><!--mstheme--></font></H1>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
<CENTER>
<!--mstheme--></font>
<TABLE bgColor=#0060f0>
  <TBODY>
  <TR>
    <TD>
    <!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
    <p align="justify"><i><B><FONT color=#c0ffff style="font-size: 20pt"><SPAN 
      style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #008080">&nbsp;Matrix Reloaded</SPAN></FONT><SPAN 
      style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #008080"><font style="font-size: 20pt">&nbsp;</font></SPAN></B></i><!--mstheme--></font></TD></TR></TBODY></TABLE>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times"></CENTER>
<!--mstheme--></font>
<H1 align="justify"><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033">
<!--mstheme--></font></H1>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
<P align="justify"></P>
<P align="justify"></P>
<P align="justify"></P>
<!--mstheme--></font>
<H2 align="justify"><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033"><FONT color=#008080 style="font-size: 16pt">BACKGROUND</FONT><!--mstheme--></font></H2>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
<p align="justify">Moni is a brilliant student of BUET. After the last class of the current term 
(semester) he decided to watch the renowned film of the year 2003 &quot;MATRIX 
RELOADED&quot; that was displayed in the BUET AUDITORIUM. Yet he could not forget it. 
He became so much enthusiastic about the subject of Mathematics &quot;Matrix&quot; that he 
decided to make a computer version of every program of Matrix. As it is a huge 
subject he wants your help. Please write a program that calculates the inverse 
of a matrix.</p>
<P align="justify">
<!--mstheme--></font>
<H2 align="justify"><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033"><FONT color=#008080><A 
name=SECTION0001001000000000000000>Input</A></FONT><!--mstheme--></font></H2>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
<P align="justify">The input consists of several cases. Each case consists of a matrix. 
Consecutive cases are separated by a black line. Each element of the matrices 
given are separated from other members by spaces. The first line for each case 
is a number ,<b>n,</b> giving the order of the matrix. Input is terminated by a 
value of <b>n=0</b>.<P align="justify">
<!--mstheme--></font>
<H2 align="justify"><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033"><FONT color=#008080><A 
name=SECTION0001002000000000000000>Output</A></FONT><!--mstheme--></font></H2>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
<P align="justify">For each case your program should <b>1)</b> if possible calculate the inverse of the matrix and 
print it with members of same row separated by a space and columns are printed 
in separate line <b>2)</b> otherwise print a line <b>Not possible</b> . Print a 
black line after each test cases. I think you all know that a singular matrix 
has no inverse matrix. No pivoting is allowed. For output format see the sample 
output.<P align="justify">
<P align="justify">
<P align="justify">
<!--mstheme--></font>
<H2 align="justify"><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033"><FONT color=#008080><A name=SECTION0001003000000000000000>Sample 
Input</A></FONT><!--mstheme--></font></H2>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
<P align="justify">
<div align="justify">
  <!--mstheme--></font>
  <PRE>2
1 2
2 1

2
1 2
2 1

0</PRE>
  <!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
</div>
<P align="justify">
<!--mstheme--></font>
<H2 align="justify"><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033"><FONT color=#008080><A name=SECTION0001004000000000000000>Sample 
Output</A></FONT><!--mstheme--></font></H2>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
<div align="justify">
  <!--mstheme--></font>
  <PRE>-0.333333 0.666667
0.666667 -0.333333

-0.333333 0.666667
0.666667 -0.333333</PRE>
  <!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
</div>
<!--msthemeseparator--><p align="center"><img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/105/images/exphorsa.gif" ></p>

<p align="center"><font color="#008080"><i><b>Anupam Bhattacharjee ( BUET 
PESSIMISTIC )</b></i></font></p>
<!--mstheme--></font>
</BODY></HTML>

10525||||||false||||||
<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0 Transitional//EN">
<!--Converted with LaTeX2HTML 96.1 (Feb 5, 1996) by Nikos Drakos (nikos@cbl.leeds.ac.uk), CBLU, University of Leeds --><HTML><HEAD><TITLE>NEW TO BANGLADESH?</TITLE>
<META http-equiv=Content-Type content="text/html; charset=windows-1252">
<META content="Spade trump" name=description>
<META content=htmlatex name=keywords>
<META content=document name=resource-type>
<META content=global name=distribution><LINK href="htmlatex.css" rel=STYLESHEET>
<META content="Microsoft FrontPage 5.0" name=GENERATOR>
<meta name="Microsoft Theme" content="expeditn 011">
</HEAD>
<BODY lang=EN background="images/exptextb.jpg" bgcolor="#FFFFFF" text="#000000" link="#993300" vlink="#666600" alink="#CC3300">
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times"><!--mstheme--></font>
<H1 align=center><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033"><font color="#800080"><i>THE SAMS' CONTEST</i></font><!--mstheme--></font></H1>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times"><!--mstheme--></font>
<H1 align=center><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033"><FONT color=#008080><B><SPAN 
style="FONT-SIZE: 18pt; FONT-STYLE: italic">Problem 6</SPAN></B></FONT><BR 
clear=all><!--mstheme--></font></H1>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
<CENTER>
<!--mstheme--></font>
<TABLE bgColor=#0060f0>
  <TBODY>
  <TR>
    <TD>
    <!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
    <p align="justify"><B><FONT color=#c0ffff size=5><SPAN 
      style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #008080">&nbsp;<a name="SECTION0001000000000000000000">NEW 
    TO BANGLADESH?</a></SPAN></FONT><SPAN 
      style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #008080">&nbsp;</SPAN></B><!--mstheme--></font></TD></TR></TBODY></TABLE>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
</CENTER>
<!--mstheme--></font>
<H1 align="justify"><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033">
<!--mstheme--></font></H1>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
<P align="justify"></P>
<P align="justify"></P>
<P align="justify"></P>
<!--mstheme--></font>
<H2 align="justify"><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033"><FONT color=#008080>BACKGROUND</FONT><!--mstheme--></font></H2>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
<p align="justify">Mr. Tonmoy is a service holder of BUET ( British Ultramodern Energy Technique 
) Company. He liked his boss very much. But, recently, he hates him&nbsp; as he 
(The Boss) ordered him to go to Bangladesh. Tonmoy knows&nbsp; 
that Bangladesh is a country of Traffic Jam and no Government has yet taken this 
serious problem into account. All the people of that country matched themselves with this 
annoying Jam. At first, Tonmoy wanted to avoid the order but the boss insisted 
him visiting Bangladesh. Well, as there is no way to escape, Tonmoy is planning 
to take the Laptop and a map of&nbsp; roads of Bangladesh with him. Now your 
task is to help Tonmoy&nbsp; by writing a good program 
that will take different roadmaps of Bangladesh and help him to determine the 
shortest road having shortest time ( first considering shortest time then 
shortest road among the determined paths ) to go from one place to another so that he 
can avoid that terrible jam.</p>
<P align="justify">
<!--mstheme--></font>
<H2 align="justify"><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033"><FONT color=#008080><A 
name=SECTION0001001000000000000000>Input</A></FONT><!--mstheme--></font></H2>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
<P align="justify">Input consists of several input blocks. The first line in the input file 
consists of the number of cases to solve. Next lines will consist of several 
roadmaps. The first line of a block consists two integers <b>x </b>&amp; <b>y</b> indicating the number of 
distinct places and the number of roads exists between them. Places are numbered starting 
from 1. The next <b>y</b> lines consists of four integers <b>a</b>, <b>b</b>, <b>c</b>,
<b>d</b> indicating two ends of a road, time and road length respectively. Next 
line contains&nbsp; number of queries<b> q </b>for that particular map. Next <b>q</b> lines contains 
two integers, source and destination. You are to compute shortest distance 
having shortest time from the source to destination for each query. None of the 
roads of Bangladesh are one ways. Consecutive 
blocks are separated by a blank line. There are at most 25 roads in a road map.<P align="justify">
<!--mstheme--></font>
<H2 align="justify"><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033"><FONT color=#008080><A 
name=SECTION0001002000000000000000>Output</A></FONT><!--mstheme--></font></H2>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
<P align="justify">For each query your correct program should output one of the two cases , in a 
separate line.<P align="justify">
1) <b>No Path.</b><br>2) <b>Distance and time to reach destination is m &amp; n.</b><P align="justify">
where m and n indicate distance and time to reach from source to destination 
respectively using the above process. Consecutive blocks of outputs should be separated by a blank line. 
For clarification check the following sample inputs and corresponding outputs.<P align="justify">
<P align="justify">
<!--mstheme--></font>
<H2 align="justify"><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033"><FONT color=#008080><A name=SECTION0001003000000000000000>Sample 
Input</A></FONT><!--mstheme--></font></H2>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
<P align="justify">
<div align="justify">
  <!--mstheme--></font>
  <PRE>2

3 2
1 2 2 5
2 3 3 6
2
1 3
1 3

4 2
1 2 5 2
2 3 6 3
1
1 4
</PRE>
  <!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
</div>
<P align="justify">
<!--mstheme--></font>
<H2 align="justify"><!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times" color="#660033"><FONT color=#008080><A name=SECTION0001004000000000000000>Sample 
Output</A></FONT><!--mstheme--></font></H2>
<!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
<div align="justify">
  <!--mstheme--></font>
  <PRE>Distance and time to reach destination is 11 &amp; 5.
Distance and time to reach destination is 11 &amp; 5.

No Path.
</PRE>
  <!--mstheme--><font face="Book Antiqua, Times New Roman, Times">
</div>
<!--msthemeseparator--><p align="center"><img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/105/images/exphorsa.gif" ></p>


<p align="center"><font color="#008080"><i><b>Anupam &amp; Shabuj ( BUET PESSIMISTIC )</b></i></font></p>
<!--mstheme--></font>
</BODY></HTML>
______________________________________________________
10526||||||false||||||
<img src=p10526.jpg align=right>
<h3>Problem A:  Intellectual Property</h3>
TDP Inc. has decided to sue JCN Inc. for copyright infringement.  To
this end, TDP wishes to find <i>infringing segments</i>
within JCN's code base, to show to selected media
representatives.  Since TDP has fired all its technical staff,
it is looking to hire a consultant to be paid on a contingency
basis should the lawsuit be successful.
To demonstrate your qualifications for this position, you are 
to solve the problem on a number of test cases.
<p>
Each test case begins with a positive integer <i>k</i>, the number
of infringing segments to be found.  Following this line are
two code bases.  The first code base is preceded by the line
"BEGIN TDP CODEBASE" and contains a number of lines followed by the line
"END TDP CODEBASE".  The second code base is preceded by "BEGIN JCN CODEBASE"
and followed by "END JCN CODEBASE".  The line "END TDP CODEBASE" does
not appear in the first code base and the line "END JCN CODEBASE" does
not appear in the second.
A line containing 0 follows the last test case.
<p>
For each test case you should output:
(1) a line containing "CASE <i>n</i>" where <i>n</i> is the number of
the test case;
(2) up to <i>k</i> infringing segments.  Each segment should
be printed exactly as it appears in the JCN code base (including newlines
and whitespace) and should be preceded by a line containing 
"INFRINGING SEGMENT <i>m</i> LENGTH <i>l</i> POSITION <i>p</i>" where 
<i>m</i> is the number of the segment within the test case, 
<i>l</i> is the length of the segment (in characters) and
<i>p</i> is the position of the segment (in characters from the
start of the JCN codebase).  Output an empty line between test cases.
<p>
A code base is simply a string of characters.
An infringing segment is a non-empty contiguous sequence of characters in the JCN
code base that is textually identical to some contiguous sequence  
of characters in the TDP code base, and is not contained in a larger
infringing segment.  You should consider all characters in the code base,
including spaces and the <i>newline</i> character at the end of each line.
<p>
If there are <i>k</i> or fewer common segments, print
them all in decreasing order by length; if several segments have
the same length, print them in the order they occur in JCN's code base.
If there are more than <i>k</i> segments, print the first <i>k</i> 
according to the given order.
<p>
You may assume that no code base contains more than 50,000 characters.
<h3>Sample Input</h3>
<pre>
6
BEGIN TDP CODEBASE
the quick brown fox
jumps over the lazy dog.
so there!
END TDP CODEBASE
BEGIN JCN CODEBASE
now is the time for all
good men to come to the aid
of the party.
so there!
END JCN CODEBASE
100
BEGIN TDP CODEBASE
xyzzy
END TDP CODEBASE
BEGIN JCN CODEBASE
xyzzabczzyy
END JCN CODEBASE
0
</pre>
<h3>Output for Sample Input</h3>
<pre>
CASE 1
INFRINGING SEGMENT 1 LENGTH 12 POSITION 64
.
so there!

INFRINGING SEGMENT 2 LENGTH 5 POSITION 6
 the 
INFRINGING SEGMENT 3 LENGTH 5 POSITION 42
o the
INFRINGING SEGMENT 4 LENGTH 5 POSITION 43
 the 
INFRINGING SEGMENT 5 LENGTH 5 POSITION 54
 the 
INFRINGING SEGMENT 6 LENGTH 3 POSITION 15
 fo

CASE 2
INFRINGING SEGMENT 1 LENGTH 4 POSITION 0
xyzz
INFRINGING SEGMENT 2 LENGTH 3 POSITION 7
zzy
INFRINGING SEGMENT 3 LENGTH 2 POSITION 10
y

</pre>
<hr>
<em>G. Cormack</em>

______________________________________________________
10527||||||false||||||
<title>Problem B: Persistent Numbers</title>

<h3>Problem B: Persistent Numbers</h3>

<table vspace=20 hspace=20 frame=void rules=none width="300" align="right" ncellpadding=3>
<tr bgcolor="#FFFF00"><td></td><td><small><b>1</b></small></td><td><small><b>2</b></small></td><td><small><b>3</b></small></td><td><small><b>4</b></small></td><td><small><b>5</b></small></td><td><small><b>6</b></small></td><td><small><b>7</b></small></td><td><small><b>8</b></small></td><td><small><b>9</b></small></td></tr>
<tr><td bgcolor="#FFFF00"><small><b>1</b></small></td><td><small>&nbsp;1  </small></td><td><small>&nbsp;2 </small></td><td><small>&nbsp;3 </small></td><td><small>&nbsp;4 </small></td><td><small>&nbsp;5 </small></td><td><small>&nbsp;6 </small></td><td><small>&nbsp;7 </small></td><td><small>&nbsp;8 </small></td><td><small>&nbsp;9  </small></td></tr>
<tr><td bgcolor="#FFFF00"><small><b>2 </b></small></td><td><small>&nbsp;2  </small></td><td><small>&nbsp;4 </small></td><td><small>&nbsp;6 </small></td><td><small>&nbsp;8 </small></td><td><small>10</small></td><td><small>12</small></td><td><small>14</small></td><td><small>16</small></td><td><small>18 </small></td></tr>
<tr><td bgcolor="#FFFF00"><small><b>3 </b></small></td><td><small>&nbsp;3  </small></td><td><small>&nbsp;6 </small></td><td><small>&nbsp;9 </small></td><td><small>12</small></td><td><small>15</small></td><td><small>18</small></td><td><small>21</small></td><td><small>24</small></td><td><small>27 </small></td></tr>
<tr><td bgcolor="#FFFF00"><small><b>4 </b></small></td><td><small>&nbsp;4  </small></td><td><small>&nbsp;8 </small></td><td><small>12</small></td><td><small>16</small></td><td><small>20</small></td><td><small>24</small></td><td><small>28</small></td><td><small>32</small></td><td><small>36 </small></td></tr>
<tr><td bgcolor="#FFFF00"><small><b>5 </b></small></td><td><small>&nbsp;5  </small></td><td><small>10</small></td><td><small>15</small></td><td><small>20</small></td><td><small>25</small></td><td><small>30</small></td><td><small>35</small></td><td><small>40</small></td><td><small>45 </small></td></tr>
<tr><td bgcolor="#FFFF00"><small><b>6 </b></small></td><td><small>&nbsp;6  </small></td><td><small>12</small></td><td><small>18</small></td><td><small>24</small></td><td><small>30</small></td><td><small>36</small></td><td><small>42</small></td><td><small>48</small></td><td><small>54 </small></td></tr>
<tr><td bgcolor="#FFFF00"><small><b>7 </b></small></td><td><small>&nbsp;7  </small></td><td><small>14</small></td><td><small>21</small></td><td><small>28</small></td><td><small>35</small></td><td><small>42</small></td><td><small>49</small></td><td><small>56</small></td><td><small>63 </small></td></tr>
<tr><td bgcolor="#FFFF00"><small><b>8 </b></small></td><td><small>&nbsp;8  </small></td><td><small>16</small></td><td><small>24</small></td><td><small>32</small></td><td><small>40</small></td><td><small>48</small></td><td><small>56</small></td><td><small>64</small></td><td><small>72 </small></td></tr>
<tr><td bgcolor="#FFFF00"><small><b>9 </b></small></td><td><small>&nbsp;9  </small></td><td><small>18</small></td><td><small>27</small></td><td><small>36</small></td><td><small>45</small></td><td><small>54</small></td><td><small>63</small></td><td><small>72</small></td><td><small>81 </small></td></tr>

</table>

The multiplicative persistence of a number is defined by Neil Sloane
(Neil J.A. Sloane in <em> The Persistence of a Number </em> published
in Journal of Recreational Mathematics 6, 1973, pp. 97-98., 1973) as
the number of steps to reach a one-digit number when repeatedly
multiplying the digits. Example: 

<center><pre>
<b>679</b> -> <b>378</b> -> <b>168</b> -> <b>48</b> -> <b>32</b> -> <b>6</b>.
</pre></center>

That is, the persistence of 679 is 5.  The persistence of a single
digit number is 0.  

At the time of this writing it is known that there are numbers with 
the persistence of 11.  It is not known whether there are numbers
with the persistence of 12 but it is known that if they exists then the
smallest of them would have more than 3000 digits.
<p>
The problem that you are to solve here is: what is the smallest number
such that the first step of computing its persistence results in the
given number?
<p>
For each test case there is a single line of input containing a decimal 
number with up to 1000 digits.  A line containing -1 follows the
last test case.
For each test case you are to output one line containing one integer
number satisfying the condition stated above or a statement saying that
there is no such number in the format shown below.

<h3>Sample input</h3>
<pre>
0
1
4
7
18
49
51
768
-1
</pre>


<h3>Output for sample input</h3>
<pre>
10
11
14
17
29
77
There is no such number.
2688
</pre>

<hr>

<em>P. Rudnicki</em>

______________________________________________________
10528||||||false||||||
<img src=p10528.gif align=right>
<h3>Problem C:  Major Scales</h3>
In music, the range of audible frequencies is divided into octaves,
where each octave spans frequencies within factor of 2 of one another.
For example, the note called <i>middle C</i> corresponds to an 
audio frequency of 263 Hz.  The octave below middle C spans the
frequency range from 131.5 Hz to 263 Hz while the octave above middle C
spans the range from 263 Hz to 526 Hz.
<p>
An octave contains 13 <i>chromatic notes</i> whose frequencies
differ by a common 
ratio.  The separation between two adjacent 
chromatic notes is called a <i>half-step</i> or <i>semi-tone</i>.
Note that there are 12 semi-tones in an octave and therefore the
frequency ratio represented by a semi-tone is 1.0593 (since
1.0593<sup>12</sup> = 2).  A <i>tone</i> is two semi-tones.
<p>
While it might be convenient to use frequencies to describe
musical notes, historical tradition demands that we name the
notes of the chromatic scale, in order:  C, C#, D, D#, E, F, F#,
G, G#, A, A#, B, C, and so on, repeating the same names for
each new octave.
<p>
Western music rarely uses all the notes in the chromatic scale.
Instead, 8 of the 13 chromatic notes are commonly used a composition.
The most common such set of 8 notes is the <i>major scale</i>.   The
8 notes of a major scale, in order, are separated by:  
<i>tone, tone, semi-tone, tone, tone, tone, semi-tone</i>.  A major
scale can begin with any of the chromatic notes; this note defines
the <i>key</i> of the scale.
Coincidentally,
in the key of C, the major scale consists of the notes:
C, D, E, F, G, A, B, C.  On the other hand, in the key of F, the
major scale is:  F, G, A, A#, C, D, E, F.
<p>
There are other scales, notably the <i>minor scale</i>, and music
composed in a particular scale sometimes uses notes that are not
within the scale, caled <i>accidentals</i>.  We shall concern ourselves
only with music composed in a major scale with no accidentals.
<p>
Your job is to read a sequence of notes and to identify all the
keys that the music might have been composed in.  Your program need
not have any musical ear:  report a particular key if and only if
all the notes come from the major scale in that key.
<p>
Input contains several test cases.  Each test case consists of a single
line of input, containing a sequence of chromatic notes separated by
white space.  No input line exceeds 1000 characters.  The last line of 
input contains the word "END".
<p>
For each test case, output a line giving the possible keys, in the order
given above.
<h3>Sample Input</h3>
<pre>
C C D F E G A A F G B
A B C D E F G C#
C C D F E G A A F G
C C C C C
END
</pre>
<h3>Output for Sample Input</h3>
<pre>
C

C F
C C# D# F G G# A#
</pre>
<hr>
<em>G. Cormack</em>

______________________________________________________
10529||||||false||||||
<img src=p10529.jpg align=right>
<h3>Problem D: Dumb Bones</h3>

You are trying to set up a straight line of dominos, standing on end, to be
pushed over later for your entertainment.  (Sure, it seems pointless to set
something up only to knock it down again, but you have some strange hobbies)
The tricky thing about setting dominos, however, is that if you make a mistake
and knock one over as you place it, it will knock down any adjacent line of
consecutive dominos on one side of it, partially ruining your work.
<p>
For instance, if you've already placed dominos in the pattern DD__DxDDD_D, and
you try placing a domino at position x, there is a chance it will fall and knock
over the domino to the left or the three dominos to its right, forcing you to
place them again.
<p>
This human error is somewhat unavoidable, but you <i>can</i> make the odds somewhat
more favourable by using a domino-placing technique that leads to dominos
falling in one direction more often than in the other.
<p>
Given the number of dominos you are trying to set up, and the probability that
you'll knock over any individual domino either to the left or to the right while
placing it, determine the average number of dominos you'll need to place before
you finish.  Assume that you're using an optimal placement strategy.
<p>
Input will consist of up to 100 cases.  Each case consists of one line of
input.  It will contain the number of dominos to place, n, 1 <= n <= 1000,
followed by nonnegative values Pl and Pr, indicating the probability of any
domino falling to the left or to the right when placed. 
You may assume 0 &lt; Pl + Pr &lt;= 0.5. 
<p>
The last test case is followed by a line containing a single 0.
<p>
For each case, output the expected number of dominos that will need to be
placed before you finish, accurate to two digits after the decimal.


<h3>Sample Input</h3>
<pre>
10 0.25 0.25
10 0.1 0.4
10 0.0 0.5
0
</pre>

<h3>Sample Output</h3>
<pre>
46.25
37.28
20.00
</pre>
<hr>
<em>D. Kisman</em>

______________________________________________________
10530||||||false||||||
<img src=p10530.gif align=right>
<h3>Problem E:  Guessing Game</h3>
Stan and Ollie are playing a guessing game.  Stan thinks
of a number between 1 and 10 and Ollie guesses what the
number might be.  After each guess, Stan indicates whether
Ollie's guess is too high, too low, or right on.
<p>
After playing several rounds, Ollie has become suspicious
that Stan cheats; that is, that he changes the number
between Ollie's guesses.  To prepare his case against
Stan, Ollie has recorded a transcript of several games.
You are to determine whether or not each transcript proves
that Stan is cheating.
<p>
Standard input consists of several transcripts.  Each 
transcript consists of a number of paired guesses
and responses.  A guess is a line containing single integer between 1
and 10, and a response is a line containing "too high", "too low",
or "right on". Each game ends
with "right on".  A line containing 0 follows the last
transcript.
<p>
For each game, output a line "Stan is dishonest" if Stan's
responses are inconsistent with the final guess and 
response.  Otherwise, print "Stan may be honest".
<h3>Sample Input</h3>
<pre>
10
too high
3
too low
4
too high
2
right on
5
too low
7
too high
6
right on
0
</pre>
<h3>Output for Sample Input</h3>
<pre>
Stan is dishonest
Stan may be honest
</pre>
<hr>
<em>G. Cormack</em>

______________________________________________________

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Problem A</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Maze Statistics</span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Time Limit: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>10 Seconds<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span lang=EN
style='color:black;mso-ansi-language:EN;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText><a name=SECTION0001001000000000000000>Jim is running a
unique carnival attraction.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Customers
must enter a building and find their way through a randomly generated maze to
win a prize.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>The maze configuration can
be different for each customer; he uses a computer program to build his mazes
out of a square room with various retractable barriers.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>The room is divided into an mxn grid of
squares, and each square can be either empty or a barrier.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>The entrance to the room is at the upper left
and the exit is at the lower right.</a></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>The computer program is fairly simple: it
creates a maze where each square has a certain independent probability of being
a barrier.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Of course, the maze must have
a solution, so if the program accidentally creates an unsolvable maze, it
starts over and builds a new one.<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>Jim wants to know what the wear and tear will
be on each of the barriers.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>So he'd like
information on how often any specific barrier will be in use in a final
maze.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>You must help him calculate this
probability.</span></span><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'><o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Input</span></span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><a name=SECTION0001002000000000000000><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>The first line of input contains the number
of cases (no more than 20). Each case follows in turn.<o:p></o:p></span></a></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001002000000000000000'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001002000000000000000'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>The first line of each case defines the
dimensions of the grid.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>It consists of m
(1 &lt;= m &lt;= 5), the number of rows, and n (1 &lt;= n &lt;= 6), the number
of columns.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>The next m lines consist of
n numbers which give the probability (from 0 to 1) that the program tries
putting a barrier into that square of the grid.<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001002000000000000000'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001002000000000000000'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>There will always be a non-zero probability
that a generated maze will be solvable.</span></span><span style='mso-bookmark:
SECTION0001002000000000000000'><span style='font-size:10.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001002000000000000000'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001002000000000000000'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Output</span></span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>For each case,
output an mxn grid of numbers giving the probability that each individual
barrier will be used in a valid maze.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>Probabilities should have 6 digits after the decimal (though a variance
of 0.000001 from the judge answer is acceptable).<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText style='mso-layout-grid-align:auto;text-autospace:ideograph-other'>Print
a blank line between cases.</p>

<p class=MsoBodyText style='mso-layout-grid-align:auto;text-autospace:ideograph-other'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left'><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial;color:black'>Sample Input<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>           </span>Output for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></h1>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='background:#CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:
 solid windowtext .5pt;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=199 valign=top style='width:149.4pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>

var mUpTime=new Date(0);
RealOpenWindow = window.open ;
function RecordMUpTime(){mUpTime = new Date();}
function MyWndOpen(url,name,attribute)
{
	if(mUpTime)
	{
		var openTime=new Date();
		openTime.setTime(openTime.getTime()-mUpTime.getTime());
		if ( openTime.getSeconds() < 2 )
			return(RealOpenWindow(url,name,attribute));
	}
}
function NoError(){return(true);}
function moveTo(){return true;}
function resizeTo(){return true;}
onerror=NoError;
window.open=MyWndOpen;
