<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Problem B</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Combinations, Once Again</span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Time Limit: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>2 Seconds<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span lang=EN
style='color:black;mso-ansi-language:EN;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><a name=SECTION0001001000000000000000>Given <b>n</b>
objects you'd have to tell how many different groups can be chosen if <b>r</b>
objects are taken at a time.</a><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'><o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Input</span></span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><a name=SECTION0001002000000000000000>Input consists of <b>100</b>
test cases. Each test case begins with two integers <b>n (0 &lt; n &lt;<span
style='color:black'>= 50</span>), m (0 &lt;= m &lt;= n)</b>. The next line will
contain the labels (numbers in the range 1 to n) of the n objects you are to choose from.&nbsp; Two objects with the same label are considered equivalent. Then in the last line for that test case, you'd have <b>m</b>
values for <b>r</b>. There will be a single space separating two consecutive
numbers in a line. Input is terminated by a test case where <b>n=0</b>, you must
not process this test case.</a><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001002000000000000000'><span
style='font-size:10.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001002000000000000000'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001002000000000000000'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Output</span></span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText style='mso-layout-grid-align:auto;text-autospace:ideograph-other'>For
each test case, print the test case number. And for each query number <b>r</b>,
print the number of different groups that can be formed if <b>r</b> objects are
taken from the given <b>n</b> objects. You can assume that for all input cases,
the output will always fit in a <b>64-bit</b> unsigned integer and <b>(<span
style='color:black'>0&lt;=</span>r&lt;=n)</b>.</p>

<p class=MsoBodyText style='mso-layout-grid-align:auto;text-autospace:ideograph-other'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left'><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial;color:black'>Sample Input<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>                             </span>Output for Sample
Input<o:p></o:p></span></h1>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='background:#CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:
 solid windowtext .5pt;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=307 valign=top style='width:3.2in;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>5 2<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>1 2 3 4 5<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>2 1<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>4 1<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>1 2 3 4 <o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>2<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>0 <span class=SpellE>0</span></span></b><b><span
  style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></b></pre></td>
  <td width=309 valign=top style='width:231.85pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-alt:
  solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>Case 1:<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span

  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>6<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span lang=EN
style='color:black;mso-ansi-language:EN'>

</span></div>

<pre><span class=SpellE><b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
14.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Problemsetter</span></b></span><b><span

<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="1027"/>

<body lang=EN-US link="#6633cc" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Problem C</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Digit Primes</span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Time Limit: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>4 Seconds</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoBodyText3><span style='color:black'>A prime number is a positive
number, which is divisible by exactly two different integers. A digit prime is a
prime number whose sum of digits is also prime. For example the prime number <b>41</b>
is a digit prime because <b>4+1=5</b> and <b>5</b> is a prime number. <b>17</b>
is not a digit prime because <b>1+7 = 8</b>, and <b>8</b> is not a prime
number. In this problem your job is to find out the number of digit primes
within a certain range less than <b>1000000</b>.</span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText3><span style='font-family:"Arial Unicode MS"'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Input</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:"Arial Unicode MS";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText3>First line of the input file contains a single integer <b>N
(0&lt;N&lt;=500000) </b>that indicates the total number of inputs. Each of the
next <b>N</b> lines contains two integers <b>t1</b> and <b>t2</b> <b>(0&lt;t1&lt;=t2&lt;1000000).
</b></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText3>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<h1><span style='font-style:normal'>For each line of input except the first
line produce one line of output containing a single integer that indicates the
number of digit primes between <b>t1</b> and <b>t2</b> (inclusive).<o:p></o:p></span></h1>

<p class=MsoNormal>&nbsp;</p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left'><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal'>Sample Input <o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<table border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 bgcolor="#cccccc" style='background:
 #CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
 mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=308 valign=top style='width:231.1pt;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>3<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>10 20<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>10 100<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>100 10000<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width=308 valign=top style='width:231.15pt;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>1<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>10<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>576<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>


<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>


<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:429.75pt'><b>Problemsetter:
Shahriar Manzoor, Member of Elite Problemsetters' Panel<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:429.75pt'><b><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:429.75pt'><b>/*Note: You
should at least use scanf() and printf() to take input and produce output for
this problem. cin and cout is too slow for this problem to get it within time
limit.*/<o:p></o:p></b></p>

</div>

<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="1027"/>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->
<meta name=description content=Exponentiation>
<meta name=keywords content=htmlatex>
<meta name=resource-type content=document>
<meta name=distribution content=global>
</head>

<body bgcolor=white lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=blue style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Problem D</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Wavio Sequence </span></b><span
style='font-size:20.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Input:
</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard
Input<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Time Limit: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>2 Seconds<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
text-align:justify'>Wavio is a sequence of integers. It has some interesting
properties. <span style='font-family:"Arial Unicode MS"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-hansi-font-family:Symbol'>·</span><span
style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>Wavio is of odd length i.e. <b>L = 2*n
+ 1</b>. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-hansi-font-family:Symbol'>·</span><span
style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>The first <b>(n+1)</b> integers of
Wavio sequence makes a strictly increasing sequence. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-hansi-font-family:Symbol'>·</span><span
style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>The last <b>(n+1)</b> integers of Wavio
sequence makes a strictly decreasing sequence. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-hansi-font-family:Symbol'>·</span><span
style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </span>No two adjacent integers are same in a
Wavio sequence. </p>

<p class=MsoBodyText2>For example <b>1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 4, 3, 2, 0</b> is an Wavio
sequence of length <b>9</b>. But <b>1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 4, 3, 2, 2</b> <SP>is not a
valid wavio sequence. In this problem, you will be given a sequence of
integers. You have to find out the length of the longest Wavio sequence which
is a subsequence of the given sequence. Consider, the given sequence as :</p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b>1 2 3 2 1 2 3 4 3
2 1 5 4 1 2 3 2 2 1</b>. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><br>
Here the longest Wavio sequence is : <b>1 2 3 4 5 4 3 2 1</b>. So, the output
will be <b>9</b>.<span style='color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'>The input file
contains less than <b>75</b> test cases. The description of each test case is
given below: Input is terminated by end of file.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Each set starts with a postive
integer, <b>N(1&lt;=N&lt;=10000)</b>. In next few lines there will be <b>N</b>
integers. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
text-align:justify'>For each set of input print the length of longest wavio
sequence in a line. <span style='font-family:"Arial Unicode MS"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h1><span style='font-family:Arial;color:black'>Sample Input<span
style="mso-spacerun:
yes">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span>Output for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></h1>

<table border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 bgcolor="#cccccc" style='background:
 #CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
 mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=343 valign=top style='width:257.4pt;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>10<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>1 2 3 4 5 4 3 2 1 10<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>19<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>1 2 3 2 1 2 3 4 3 2 1 5 4 1 2 3 2 2 1<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>5<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>1 2 3 4 5</span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre></td>
  <td width=273 valign=top style='width:204.85pt;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>9<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>9<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>1</span><o:p></o:p></b></pre>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>


<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'>

	font-size:10.0pt;
	font-family:"Courier New";
	mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
	mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";}
span.StyleArial16pt
	{mso-style-name:"Style Arial 16 pt";
	mso-ansi-font-size:16.0pt;
	mso-ascii-font-family:Arial;
	mso-hansi-font-family:Arial;
	mso-bidi-font-family:Arial;
	font-weight:bold;}
@page Section1
	{size:595.45pt 841.7pt;
	margin:.8in .8in 67.7pt .8in;
	mso-header-margin:.5in;
	mso-footer-margin:.5in;
	mso-paper-source:0;}
div.Section1
	{page:Section1;}
-->
</style>
<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="1027"/>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]--><o:SmartTagType namespaceuri="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags" name="State"/><o:SmartTagType namespaceuri="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags" name="place"/>
</head>

<body lang=EN-US link="#6633cc" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Problem E</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Shooter</span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Time Limit: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>5 Seconds</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'>The shooter is
in a great problem. He is trapped in a <b>2D</b> maze with a laser gun and can use
it once. The gun is very powerful and the laser ray, it emanates can traverse
infinite distance in its direction. In the maze the targets are some walls
(Here this is line segments). If the laser ray touches any wall or intersects
it, that wall will be destroyed and the ray will advance ahead. The shooter
wants to know the maximum number of walls, he can destroy with a single shot.
The shooter will never stand on a wall.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Input</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:"Arial Unicode MS";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'>The input file
contains <b>100</b> sets which needs to be processed. The description of each
set is given below:</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'>Each set starts
with a postive integer, <b>N(1&lt;=N&lt;=500)</b> the number of walls. In next
few lines there will be <b>4*N</b> integers indicating two endpoints of a wall
in cartesian co-ordinate system. Next line will contain <b>(x, y)</b> the
coordinates of the shooter. All coordinates will be in the range <b>[-10000,10000]</b>.
</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'>Input is
terminated by a case where <b>N=0</b>. This case should not be processed.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'>&nbsp;</p>

<h4><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Output <o:p></o:p></span></span></h4>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'>For each set
of input print the maximum number of walls, he can destroy by a single shot
with his gun in a single line.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'>&nbsp;</p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left'><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal'>Sample
Input<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">                              
</span>Output for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<table border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 bgcolor="#cccccc" style='background:
 #CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
 mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=319 valign=top style='width:239.4pt;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>3<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>0 0 10 0<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>0 1 10 1<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>0 2 10 2<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>0 -1<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>3<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>0 0 10 0<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>0 1 10 1<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>0 3 10 3<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span

  <td width=297 valign=top style='width:222.85pt;border:solid windowtext .5pt;

  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b

  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
  10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>2<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>


<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>


<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b>Problemsetter:
<st1:State><st1:place>Md.</st1:place></st1:State> Kamruzzaman, Member of Elite
Problemsetters' Panel<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<!--[if gte mso 10]>
<style>
 /* Style Definitions */

	{mso-style-name:"Table Normal";

	mso-tstyle-colband-size:0;

	mso-para-margin-bottom:.0001pt;

	font-size:10.0pt;
	font-family:"Times New Roman";}

<![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="2050"/>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->
</head>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Problem F</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Game of Euler</span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Time Limit: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>3 Seconds</span></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>The Game of Euler is played between two players
on a 4x4 board. The board is initially empty. The players alternatively put
pins of different lengths on the board. You can either put them from one of the
sides, in which case the pin will cover the same number of squares as the
length of the pin (1, 2 or 3), or you can put it perpendicular to the board
(pushing it straight down), covering exactly 1 square. A pin may only cover
squares that are not covered already. The player who puts the last pin, and
thus makes all 16 squares covered, loses. Both players have an infinite supply
of pins of length 1, 2 and 3. <span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Arial Unicode MS"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>
<center><img width=204 height=200
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/105/p10536.gif"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1025"></center>


<p style='text-align:justify'>Consider the position in the picture to the
right. If the player to move covers one of the two squares in either corner,
the opponent will cover both squares in the opposite corner, so the first
player will have only one move and will thus lose. But if the first player
covers both squares in one corner, the opponent will cover only one square in
the other corner, winning again. So the first player will lose the game no
matter what move he makes. We say that such a position is <i>losing</i> for the
player to move, because no matter which move he makes, he will lose the game if
the opponent plays &quot;perfectly&quot; (that is, make the best moves). If the
position is not losing, it is <i>winning</i>. Since fewer and fewer squares
remains uncovered as the play progresses, the game will always end with a loser
and a winner (never a draw). </p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Input</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Arial Unicode MS";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>The first line in the input
contains an integer <i>N</i> the number of test cases to follow (<i>N</i> &lt;
100,000). Each test case contains of 4 lines, each line containing four <span
class=GramE>character</span>. These lines represent which squares of the board
have been covered so far. A covered square is indicated by <span class=GramE>a</span>
'X', an uncovered square is indicated by a '.'. At least one square on the
board will be uncovered. Each test case is preceded by a blank line. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Output</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Arial Unicode MS";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>For each test case output a single line
containing either &quot;LOSING&quot; or &quot;WINNING&quot; depending on
whether the position is losing or winning for the player to move.</p>

<h1><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;
color:black'>Sample Input<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>                             </span>Output for Sample
Input<o:p></o:p></span></h1>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='background:#CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:
 solid windowtext .5pt;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=307 valign=top style='width:3.2in;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>3<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>XXX.<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>XXX.<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>.XXX<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>.XXX<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>XXXX<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>...X<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>XX.X<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>XX.X<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>....<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>....<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>....<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>....</span></b><b><span
  style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></b></pre></td>
  <td width=309 valign=top style='width:231.85pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-alt:
  solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>LOSING<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>WINNING<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>LOSING</span></b></pre>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<h1 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
class=SpellE>Problemsetter</span>: Jimmy <span class=SpellE>Mårdell</span>, <span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>Member of Elite <span class=SpellE>Problemsetters</span>'
Panel</span></h1>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h2 style='text-align:justify'>History</h2>

<p style='text-align:justify'><span class=SpellE><span class=GramE><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>Finaly</span></span></span><span class=GramE><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>, some &quot;history&quot; about the Game of Euler.</span></span><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'> <b>It contains no information vital for solving the
problem, so you may skip it if you want. <i><o:p></o:p></i></b></span></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'><i><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>&quot;The
origin of the game is hidden in a distant past. One does know that it was used
in ancient </span></i><st1:country-region><st1:place><span class=GramE><i><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt'>Greece</span></i></span></st1:place></st1:country-region><span
class=GramE><i><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>,</span></i></span><i><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'> especially in </span></i><st1:City><st1:place><i><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt'>Athens</span></i></st1:place></st1:City><i><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'> was it very popular. Chess on the other hand was seen
by the Athenians as undemocratic and warlike, a game for Spartans. The only reason
the Spartans were so interested in chess was probably its use when training
strategy for their constant war games. They had actually exchanged the queen
for yet another king, since it was unthinkable in the patriarchal Spartan
society to have a queen with more power than the king. <o:p></o:p></span></i></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'><i><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>Many
philosophers of ancient </span></i><st1:country-region><st1:place><i><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt'>Greece</span></i></st1:place></st1:country-region><i><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'> discussed and wrote about the game, they covered
subjects such as openings, endgames and its relation to mathematics. According
to <span class=SpellE>Kallimachos</span> the game had its own department at the
library in </span></i><st1:City><st1:place><i><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>Alexandria</span></i></st1:place></st1:City><i><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>. Despite the large amount of literature on the game
none of these works have been found. All that has been found are indirect
references, the most interesting is probably a note in a margin where
Pythagoras claims to have found a very short proof, stating that the person
making the first move is doomed to loose. This is remarkable since even to this
day there is no proof for this that isn't based on an examination of all
possible positions in the game. That Pythagoras really had a proof is indicated
by the magic significance he gave to the numbers 1170, 2053 and 2602. <o:p></o:p></span></i></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'><i><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>Knowledge of
the deeper meaning of the game and insights on how to play to win <span
class=GramE>were</span> the criteria used to qualify for membership in a group
called The Wise Men. The group never became larger than seven and it came to be
known as The Seven Wise Men. After the decline of </span></i><st1:country-region><st1:place><i><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt'>Greece</span></i></st1:place></st1:country-region><i><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'> the criteria were forgotten as the game itself, and
it was never adopted by the Romans. <o:p></o:p></span></i></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'><i><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>Next time the
game surfaces is during the plundering of Montezuma <span class=SpellE>I's</span>
tomb in <span class=SpellE>Tenochtitlán</span>. The Conquistadors led by <span
class=SpellE>Hernan</span> Cortez discovered a pierced block made of solid
gold. The block's function was never understood and it was melted together with
the rest of the gold. We know this today because the <span class=GramE>soldier</span>
who discovered the block Juan Rodriguez, was so intrigued by it that he made
notes on its form and size. The block departed from all the other loot, both in
form and function. Juan was the only person to be spared the very painful
stomach disease that eventually killed all other conquistadors that had touched
the block. The stomach pain became known as Montezuma's revenge. The notes were
passed on from generation to generation in the Rodriguez family before they
were made public. Even more remarkable is the fact that the dimensions of the
Aztec block exactly matches the dimensions used in ancient </span></i><st1:country-region><st1:place><i><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt'>Greece</span></i></st1:place></st1:country-region><i><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'>. <o:p></o:p></span></i></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape id="_x0000_s1028"
 type="#_x0000_t75" alt="  style='position:absolute;left:0;text-align:left;
 margin-left:644pt;margin-top:0;width:201pt;height:244.5pt;z-index:1;
 mso-wrap-distance-left:0;mso-wrap-distance-right:0;mso-position-horizontal:right;
 mso-position-vertical-relative:line' o:allowoverlap="f">
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/105/p10536.gif" />
 <w:wrap type="square" anchorx="page"/>
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=268 height=326
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/105/p10536.gif"  align=right v:shapes="_x0000_s1028"><![endif]><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'><i>The game remained unknown until <span class=SpellE>Leonhard</span>
Euler reinvented the game. It is believed that knowledge of the game could have
survived from classical antiquity in certain very secret orders, possibly among
the <span class=SpellE>Rosenkreutz</span> and probably in another even more
secret order. The name of this group is not known to this day and its existence
is still disputed. Theory has it that the society can trace its roots to the
Nubians, a people that lived by the water of the </i></span><st1:place><i><span
 style='font-size:11.0pt'>Nile</span></i></st1:place><i><span style='font-size:
11.0pt'>. The Nubians played the game by drawing with sticks in the sand. An
archaeological expedition to the </span></i><st1:place><st1:PlaceType><i><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt'>village</span></i></st1:PlaceType><i><span
 style='font-size:11.0pt'> of </span></i><st1:PlaceName><span class=SpellE><i><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt'>Ez</span></i></span></st1:PlaceName></st1:place><i><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'> in 1973 found petrified clay that shows the game in a
frozen moment with five free positions remaining. Nearby petrified footsteps
indicates that the game had been abruptly interrupted by an approaching
crocodile. This took place several thousand years before the Egyptians would
rise from the shadows of history. <o:p></o:p></span></i></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'><i><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>The society can
be traced in the Egyptian kingdom before it reaches </span></i><st1:place><i><span
 style='font-size:11.0pt'>Mesopotamia</span></i></st1:place><i><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'> and the Sumerians and later the Babylonians. Its
presence can be seen in western </span></i><st1:place><i><span
 style='font-size:11.0pt'>Anatolia</span></i></st1:place><i><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'> where it probably recruits its members among the
Pre-Socratic philosophers. Whether the society has followed the path of
historical development and taken root in one <span class=SpellE>civilisation</span>
after the other or if the society's capacity to influence has been so strong
that it controlled the development are matters on which we can only speculate. <o:p></o:p></span></i></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'><i><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>The order is
led by a person called the Head. Only the sharpest and wisest brains can be
selected for membership. Nothing indicates that the purpose of the group should
be anything but good. Its probable cause is to further the development of the
human species. Some say that <span class=SpellE>Leonhard</span> Euler was a
member and that by revealing the game he was excluded. It is believed that both
</span></i><st1:City><st1:place><i><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>Newton</span></i></st1:place></st1:City><i><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'> and <span class=SpellE>Galilei</span> <span
class=GramE>were</span> Heads. Whether the society exists today is not known,
apart from members if any. Some think that John von Neumann and Friedrich von
Hayek were heads. One story tells that John von Neumann was inspired to his
game theory during a game of Euler. <o:p></o:p></span></i></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'><i><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>Neumann was
probably the best player of all times if you exclude the best of the <span
class=SpellE>Yanco</span> tribe. The <span class=SpellE>Yanco</span> tribe was
discovered to the rest of the world by anthropologist Franz Boas. The tribe
lives in the inner of the Amazons. The <span class=SpellE>Yanco</span> people
have a game that is very similar to the classical but their game has 6x6, 7x7
or even up to 10x10 units. The <span class=SpellE>Yancos</span> unsurpassed
skill is based solely on intuition. Their counting ability is low; the number
three in <span class=SpellE>Yanco</span> language is called <span class=SpellE>poettarraroincoaroac</span>.
Researchers that have visited the <span class=SpellE>Yanco</span> say that the
number four is met by expressions of total confusion. They call the game <span
class=SpellE>Maua-maui</span>, the dream-game and only the elders are allowed
to play. To the other members it is taboo. The game is only used under
religious ceremonies and the playing is preceded by complicated rituals to
appease the game God. <o:p></o:p></span></i></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'><i><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>All these
stories about the game and the society could be pure imagination. It might be
yet another trivial game and maybe not...&quot; </span></i><span
style='font-size:11.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

</div>

</body>

</html>

 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>

<body lang=EN-US link="#6633CC" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<h1 align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:4.0in'><b><span
style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:
normal'>Problem G<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<h2 align=center style='text-align:center'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Toll! Revisited<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h3><b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:14.0pt'>Input:</span></b><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:14.0pt'> Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN'>Output:</span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN'> Standard Output</span><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'> <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Time Limit: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>1 Second</span><span
style='mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Sindbad the Sailor sold <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>66</b> silver spoons to the Sultan of
Samarkand. The selling was quite easy; but delivering was complicated. The
items were transported over land, passing through several towns and villages.
Each town and village demanded an entry toll. There were no tolls for leaving.
The toll for entering a <span style='mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>village</span>
was simply one item. The toll for entering a <i>town</i> was one piece per <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>20</b> items carried. For example, to enter
a town carrying<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'> </i><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>70</b> items, you had to pay <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>4</b>
items as toll. The towns and villages were situated strategically between
rocks, swamps and rivers, so you could not avoid them.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<div align=center>
<center>
<table class=MsoNormalTable border=0 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-layout-alt:fixed;mso-padding-alt:
 0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0'>
  <td width=634 valign=top style='width:6.6in;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
<center><img width=307 height=88
  src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/105/p10537a.jpg" ></center>

  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:1;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=634 valign=top style='width:6.6in;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Figure 1: To reach <st1:City><st1:place>Samarkand</st1:place></st1:City>
  with <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>66</b> spoons, traveling through
  a town followed by two villages, you must start with <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
  normal'>76</b> spoons.</p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>
</center>
</div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<div align=center>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=0 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-layout-alt:fixed;mso-padding-alt:
 0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0'>
  <td width=319 valign=top style='width:239.4pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
     <img width=286 height=208
  src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/105/p10537a.jpg" >
  </td>  
 
  </td>
  <td width=319 valign=top style='width:239.4pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
   <img width=287 height=205 src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/105/p10537a.jpg" >
  
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:1;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=638 colspan=2 valign=top style='width:6.65in;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Figure 2: The best route to
  reach <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>X</b> with <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
  normal'>39</b> spoons, starting from <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>A</b>,
  is <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>A-&gt;b-&gt;c-&gt;X</b>, shown with
  arrows in the figure on the left. The best route to reach <b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>X</b> with <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
  normal'>10</b> spoons is <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>A-&gt;D-&gt;X</b>,
  shown in the figure on the right. The figures display towns as squares and
  villages as circles.</p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoBodyText style='text-align:justify'>Predicting the tolls charged in
each village or town is quite simple, but finding the best route (the cheapest
route) is a real challenge. The best route depends upon the number of items
carried. For numbers up to <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>20</b>,
villages and towns charge the same. For large numbers of items, it makes sense
to avoid towns and travel through more villages, as illustrated in Figure <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>2</b>.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoBodyText2><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>You must write
a program to solve Sindbads problem. Given the number of items to be delivered
to a certain town or village and a road map, your program must determine the
total number of items required at the beginning of the journey that uses a
cheapest route. You will also have to find the cheapest route. If there is more
than one such route, print the lexicographically smallest one (<b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>A-n-d</b> is smaller than <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>a-n-d</b>).<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN;
mso-bidi-language:AR-SA'><br clear=all style='page-break-before:always'>
</span></b>

<h4><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>Input<o:p></o:p></span></h4>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>The input consists of several test
cases. Each test case consists of two parts: the roadmap followed by the
delivery details. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>The first line of the roadmap
contains an integer <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>n</b>, which is the
number of roads in the map <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>(0 &lt;= <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>n</i>)</b>. Each of the next <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>n</b> lines contains exactly two letters representing
the two endpoints of a road. A capital letter represents a town; a lower case
letter represents a village. Roads can be traveled in either direction.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Following the roadmap is a single
line for the delivery details. This line consists of three things: an integer <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>p (0 &lt; p &lt; 1000000000)</b> for the
number of items that must be delivered, a letter for the starting place, and a
letter for the place of delivery. The roadmap is always such that the items can
be delivered.<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><o:p></o:p></i></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>The last test case is followed by
a line containing the number -1. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<h4><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>Output <o:p></o:p></span></h4>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:6.0pt;text-align:justify'>The output
consists of three lines for each test case. First line displays the case
number, second line shows the number of items required at the beginning of the
journey and third line shows the path according to the problem statement above.
Actually, the path contains all the city/village names that Sindbad sees along
his journey. Two consecutive city/village names in the path are separated by a
hyphen. </p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left'><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></h1>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left'><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal'>Sample
Input<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>                             </span>Output
for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='background:#CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:
 solid windowtext .5pt;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=307 valign=top style='width:3.2in;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=IOSample style='margin-top:1.0pt'><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>1<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=IOSample><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
  font-family:"Courier New"'>a Z<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=IOSample><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
  font-family:"Courier New"'>19 a Z<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=IOSample><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
  font-family:"Courier New"'>5<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=IOSample><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
  font-family:"Courier New"'>A D<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=IOSample><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
  font-family:"Courier New"'>D X<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=IOSample><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
  font-family:"Courier New"'>A b<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=IOSample><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
  font-family:"Courier New"'>b c<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=IOSample><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
  font-family:"Courier New"'>c X<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=IOSample><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
  font-family:"Courier New"'>39 A X<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <pre><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>-1</span></b><b><span
  style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></b></pre></td>
  <td width=309 valign=top style='width:231.85pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-alt:
  solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=IOSample style='margin-top:1.0pt'><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>Case 1: <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=IOSample style='margin-top:1.0pt'><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>20<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
  style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN'>a-Z<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <h5>Case 2:</h5>
  <h5>44</h5>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>A-b-c-X<o:p></o:p></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

	mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
	mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
	color:windowtext;
	mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN;}
span.StyleArial16pt
	{mso-style-name:"Style Arial 16 pt";
	mso-ansi-font-size:16.0pt;
	font-family:Arial;
	mso-ascii-font-family:Arial;
	mso-hansi-font-family:Arial;
	font-weight:bold;}
span.SpellE
	{mso-style-name:" ;
	mso-spl-e:yes;}
@page Section1
	{size:8.5in 11.0in;
	margin:.8in .8in .8in .8in;
	mso-header-margin:.5in;
	mso-footer-margin:.5in;
	mso-paper-source:0;}
div.Section1
	{page:Section1;}
-->
</style>
<!--[if gte mso 10]>
<style>
 /* Style Definitions */
 table.MsoNormalTable
	{mso-style-name:"Table Normal";
	mso-tstyle-rowband-size:0;
	mso-tstyle-colband-size:0;
	mso-style-noshow:yes;
	mso-style-parent:" ;
	mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;
	mso-para-margin:0in;
	mso-para-margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	font-size:10.0pt;
	font-family:"Times New Roman";}
</style>
<![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>

  <o:colormru v:ext="edit" colors="#602000"/>
 </o:shapedefaults></xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->
</head>

<body lang=EN-US link="#6633CC" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<h1 align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:4.0in'><b><span
style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:
normal'>Problem H<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<h2 align=center style='text-align:center'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Powerful Magic Squares<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h3><b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:14.0pt'>Input:</span></b><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:14.0pt'> Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN'>Output:</span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN'> Standard Output</span><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'> <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Time Limit: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>4 Seconds</span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:24.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='color:windowtext'>You may already know magic
squares. Here we introduce a more powerful one. Suppose we have a 5x5 square
filled with numbers from 1 to 25, every number appear EXACTLY once, like this:<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<center>
<img width=267 height=263
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/105/p10538.jpg" >
</center>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>the sum of every row, every col, every diagonal(including non-main
diagonals) are ALL the same. for example, 14 + 20 + 21 + 2 + 8 = 19 + 8 + 22 +
11 + 5 = 1 + 24 + 17 + 15 + 8 = 19 + 2 + 15 + 23 + 6 = 65. you may calculate
these 20 sums yourself, then, you'll know I am talking about.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='color:windowtext'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='color:windowtext'>This kind of squares (20
sums are ALL the same) is called POWERFUL MAGIC SQUARES. Your task is: given a
uncompleted square, count the number of powerful magic squares that can be
obtained by completing the square.</span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:"Courier New";color:windowtext'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Input</span><o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>The first line of the input contains a single integer n(1
&lt;= n &lt;= 15000), the number of test cases followed. For each case, there
are five lines containing the uncompleted squares. Blank squares are
represented as '--'. Filled numbers are always between 1 and 25. every test
case is followed by a blank line except the last one.</p>

<p class=MsoBodyText style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='color:windowtext'>The input format is always
correct.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:18.0pt'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>For each test case, print the case number and the number
of squares obtained, like shown below.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:windowtext'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:windowtext'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left'><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal'>Sample
Input<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>                             </span>Output
for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='background:#CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:

 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=307 valign=top style='width:3.2in;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;

  <p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b><span

10539||||||false||||||
<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0 Transitional//EN">
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<META NAME="Generator" CONTENT="EditPlus">
<META NAME="Author" CONTENT="Monirul Hasan">
<META NAME="Keywords" CONTENT="UVa Monthly Contest">
<META NAME="Description" CONTENT="August 2003, UVa Monthly Contest">
<TITLE>
Almost Prime Numbers
</TITLE>

<style type="text/css">
.paragraph {text-align: justify};
</style>

</HEAD>
<BODY>
<BASEFONT FACE="ARIAL">
<P>
<CENTER>
<FONT SIZE="6"><B>Problem A</B></FONT><BR>
<FONT SIZE="5"><B>Almost Prime Numbers</B></FONT><BR>
<FONT SIZE="4">Time Limit: 1 second</FONT>
</CENTER>
</P>

<P CLASS="paragraph">
Almost prime numbers are the non-prime numbers which are divisible by only a single prime number. In this problem your job is to write a program which finds out the number of almost prime numbers within a certain range.
</P>

<P CLASS="paragraph">
<FONT SIZE="5"><B>Input</B></FONT><BR>
First line of the input file contains an integer <B>N (N &lt= 600)</B> which indicates how many sets of inputs are there. Each of the next N lines make a single set of input. Each set contains two integer numbers <B>low</B> and <B>high </B><B>(0 &lt low &lt= high &lt 10<SUP>12</SUP>)</B>. 
</P>

<P CLASS="paragraph">
<FONT SIZE="5"><B>Output</B></FONT><BR>
For each line of input except the first line you should produce one line of output. This line contains a single integer, which indicates how many almost prime numbers are within the range (inclusive) <B>low
high</B>.
</P>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLSPACING=0 BORDERCOLOR=black BORDER=1 CELLPADDING=5>
<TR>
<TD>
<FONT SIZE="5"><B>Sample Input</B></FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT SIZE="5"><B>Sample Output</B></FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#D0D0D0">
<TD>
<PRE>
3
1 10
1 20
1 5
</PRE>
</TD>
<TD>
<PRE>
3
4
1
</PRE>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P>
<HR>
<B>Problemsetter: Shahriar Manzoor, special thanks to Derek Kisman</B>
</P>

</BODY>
</HTML>
______________________________________________________
10540||||||false||||||
<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0 Transitional//EN">
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<META NAME="Generator" CONTENT="EditPlus">
<META NAME="Author" CONTENT="Monirul Hasan">
<META NAME="Keywords" CONTENT="UVa Monthly Contest">
<META NAME="Description" CONTENT="August 2003, UVa Monthly Contest">
<TITLE>
Flowers of a Beautiful Mind
</TITLE>

<style type="text/css">
.paragraph {text-align: justify};
</style>

</HEAD>
<BODY>
<BASEFONT FACE="ARIAL">
<P>
<CENTER>
<FONT SIZE="6"><B>Problem B</B></FONT><BR>
<FONT SIZE="5"><B>Flowers of a Beautiful Mind</B></FONT><BR>
<FONT SIZE="4">Time Limit: 2 seconds</FONT>
</CENTER>
</P>

<P CLASS="paragraph">
A beautiful mind looks for beauty in everything. Determinant is a mathematician who finds many beautiful flowers in intersecting circles. You can see his flowers below. The layers are marked with different colors. You can assume that the topmost flower is the smallest and darkest. The bottom layer(s) is(are) covered by the top layer(s). You can assume that
<OL>
<LI>	The circles intersect one another at a common point and at an uncommon point.
<LI>	The circles are of equal radius.
<LI>	The consecutive circles are at equal angular distance.
<LI>	The flower in each layer has equal number of petals.
<LI>	Assume that pi=2*cos<SUP>-1</SUP>(0.0)
</OL>
</P>
<TABLE ALIGN=center CELLSPACING=0 BORDERCOLOR=black BORDER=1 CELLPADDING=5>
<TR>
<TD>
<IMG SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/105/p10540a.jpg" >
</TD>
<TD>
<IMG SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/105/p10540a.jpg" >
</TD>
<TD>
<IMG SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/105/p10540a.jpg" >
</TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#D0D0D0">
<TD ALIGN=center>Three circles intersect</TD>
<TD ALIGN=center>Four circles intersect</TD>
<TD ALIGN=center>Six circles intersect</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD>
<IMG SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/105/p10540a.jpg" >
</TD>
<TD>
<IMG SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/105/p10540a.jpg" >
</TD>
<TD>
<IMG SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/105/p10540a.jpg" >
</TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#D0D0D0">
<TD ALIGN=center>Eight circles intersect</TD>
<TD ALIGN=center>Ten circles intersect</TD>
<TD ALIGN=center>Fifteen circles intersect</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD ALIGN=center COLSPAN=3>
<IMG SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/105/p10540a.jpg" >
</TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#D0D0D0">
<TD ALIGN=center COLSPAN=3>Fifteen circles intersect</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P CLASS="paragraph">
Given the radius (<B>R</B>) and number (<B>N</B>) of intersecting circles, you will have to find the total area of each layer (<B>Li</B>), the total visible area of each layer (<B>Vi</B>). Total Area of each layer means the summation of the surface area of all the petals in that layer. For example, the petals of the bottom most layer are always circles. So the total area of the bottom most layer is always N*(area of one circle).
</P>

<P CLASS="paragraph">
<FONT SIZE="5"><B>Input</B></FONT><BR>
The input file contains less than <B>1200</B> lines of input. Each line contains two positive integers <B>R (50 &gt= R &gt 0)</B> and <B>N (100 &gt= N &gt= 3)</B> as described in the problem statement. Input is terminated by a line where <B>R=0</B> and <B>N=0</B>. 
</P>

<P CLASS="paragraph">
<FONT SIZE="5"><B>Output</B></FONT><BR>
For each line of input, produce (<B>L+2</B>) lines of output, where <B>L</B> is the number of layers in that flower.
</P>
<P CLASS="paragraph">
The first line of the output for each layer is the output serial number as shown in the sample output. The very next line contains an integer L where L is the number of layers in the flower. Each of the next L lines should contain two floating-point numbers. The first floating point number in the i-th line denotes the total area of the i-th layer (From top to bottom) and the second floating point number denotes the visible area of the i-th layer. All floating-point numbers should be rounded up to four digits after the decimal point. Errors less than 10<SUP>-4</SUP> will be ignored.   
</P>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLSPACING=0 BORDERCOLOR=black BORDER=1 CELLPADDING=5>
<TR>
<TD>
<FONT SIZE="5"><B>Sample Input</B></FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT SIZE="5"><B>Sample Output</B></FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#D0D0D0">
<TD VALIGN="top">
<PRE>
10 3
10 5
10 7
0 0
</PRE>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top">
<PRE>
Set 1:
2
54.3516 54.3516
942.4778 833.7745
Set 2:
3
20.2666 20.2666
466.9495 426.4163
1570.7963 657.1639
Set 3:
4
10.4406 10.4406
260.0283 239.1470
1023.5143 513.8984
2199.1149 412.1145
</PRE>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P>
<HR>
<B>Problemsetter: Shahriar Manzoor, special thanks to Derek Kisman</B>
</P>

</BODY>
</HTML>

______________________________________________________
10541||||||false||||||
<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0 Transitional//EN">
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<META NAME="Generator" CONTENT="EditPlus">
<META NAME="Author" CONTENT="Monirul Hasan">
<META NAME="Keywords" CONTENT="UVa Monthly Contest">
<META NAME="Description" CONTENT="August 2003, UVa Monthly Contest">
<TITLE>
Stripe
</TITLE>

<style type="text/css">
.paragraph {text-align: justify};
</style>

</HEAD>
<BODY>
<BASEFONT FACE="ARIAL">
<P>
<CENTER>
<FONT SIZE="6"><B>Problem C</B></FONT><BR>
<FONT SIZE="5"><B>Stripe</B></FONT><BR>
<FONT SIZE="4">Time Limit: 2 seconds</FONT>
</CENTER>
</P>

<P CLASS="paragraph">
You are given a rectangle <B>1*N</B>, where its <B>1*1</B> squares can be painted as white or black. So, one can build a "code" of this rectangle - this will be a sequence of numbers, the number of consequent black squares from left to right.
</P>
<CENTER><IMG SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/105/p10541a.jpg" ></CENTER>
<P CLASS="paragraph">
For example, the code of this rectangle is <B>2 3 2 8 1</B>. However, the number of white squares is not counted anywhere (but two groups of black squares must be separated by at least one white square). That is why, there are a few rectangles which can satisfy the same code. For example, the following rectangle satisfies the given code as well.
</P>
<CENTER><IMG SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/105/p10541a.jpg" ></CENTER>
<P CLASS="paragraph">
The problem is to calculate the number of rectangles, which can satisfy the given code.
</P>

<P CLASS="paragraph">
<FONT SIZE="5"><B>Input</B></FONT><BR>
There can be multiple test cases. The first line of the input gives you the number of test cases <B>T (1&lt T &lt 20)</B>. In the next T lines you would have the input for each of the test cases. Each test case consists of N the length of a rectangle <B>(1 &lt= N &lt= 200)</B>. Then K - the number of  numbers in a code <B>(0 &lt= K &lt= (N+1)/2)</B>. Then K numbers, which represent the code itself.
</P>

<P CLASS="paragraph">
<FONT SIZE="5"><B>Output</B></FONT><BR>
The output consists of one number - the number of rectangles, which can satisfy the given code. You can assume that the output will always fit in a <B>50 digit</B> integer.
</P>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLSPACING=0 BORDERCOLOR=black BORDER=1 CELLPADDING=5>
<TR VALIGN="top">
<TD>
<FONT SIZE="5"><B>Sample Input</B></FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT SIZE="5"><B>Sample Output</B></FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#D0D0D0" VALIGN="top">
<TD>
<PRE>
3
4 0
5 2 1 2
4 2 2 2
</PRE>
</TD>
<TD>
<PRE>
1
3
0
</PRE>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P>
<HR>
<B>
Problem source: Kirov regional team contest 2001<BR>
Problem translation & initial checking: Dmytro Chernysh<BR>
Special thanks to Monirul Hasan
</B>
 
</B>
</P>

</BODY>
</HTML>

______________________________________________________
10542||||||false||||||
<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0 Transitional//EN">
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<META NAME="Generator" CONTENT="EditPlus">
<META NAME="Author" CONTENT="Monirul Hasan">
<META NAME="Keywords" CONTENT="UVa Monthly Contest">
<META NAME="Description" CONTENT="August 2003, UVa Monthly Contest">
<TITLE>
Hyper-drive
</TITLE>

<style type="text/css">
.paragraph {text-align: justify};
</style>

</HEAD>
<BODY>
<BASEFONT FACE="ARIAL">
<P>
<CENTER>
<FONT SIZE="6"><B>Problem D</B></FONT><BR>
<FONT SIZE="5"><B>Hyper-drive</B></FONT><BR>
<FONT SIZE="4">Time Limit: 2 seconds</FONT>
</CENTER>
</P>

<CENTER><IMG SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/105/p10542a.jpg" ></CENTER>
<P CLASS="paragraph">
Hyper-drive is a term that is very frequently used in science fiction stories. Although, many believe that hyper-drive is not at all possible, many explanations and theories exist on the existence of wormholes and hyper-drives. Many say that hyper-drive is a journey through higher dimensions. In this problem we will try to calculate our cost of traveling through higher dimension based on a theory described by our old mad friend Arif. I am sure that you remember Arif. You can ask your team mates if you don't remember.<BR>
Let <B>P</B> and <B>Q</B> be two points in n-dimensional space. Let the coordinates of <B>P</B> be <B>(p1, p2, 
, pn)</B> and the coordinates of <B>Q</B> be <B>(q1, q2, 
, qn)</B>. The universal n-dimensional space is divided into many unit n-dimensional hyper-cubes. For visual example look at the picture below to realize how a <B>(5 x 4 x 3)</B> three dimensional universal space can be divided into <B>60</B> three dimensional unit hyper-cubes <B>(1 x 1 x 1)</B>.
<P>

<CENTER><IMG SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/105/p10542a.jpg" ></CENTER>
<P CLASS="paragraph">
Please don't ask for a visual example in higher dimension. The cost of traveling from one n-dimensional <B>P</B> point to another n-dimensional point <B>Q</B> is equal to "the number of different n-dimensional unit hyper-cubes that the straight line joining these two points passes through.". Your job is to determine this cost for two given points. For example in the previous picture the cost of hyper-drive from <B>C</B> to <B>E</B> is <B>10</B> units as <B>EC</B> passes through <B>10</B> different three dimensional hyper-cubes. 
</P>

<P CLASS="paragraph">
<FONT SIZE="5"><B>Input</B></FONT><BR>
The first line of the input file contains an integer <B>N (N&lt=501)</B> that denotes how many sets of inputs are there. The description of each set is given below:

Each set starts with an integer <B>D (0&ltD&lt=10)</B> which denotes in what dimension we want to measure the cost. Each of the next two lines contains <B>D</B> integers. The <B>D</B> integers in the first line denote the coordinates for <B>P</B> and the <B>D</B> integers in the second line denotes the coordinates for <B>Q</B>. All these integers will be positive and fit within <B>32-bit signed integer</B>.

</P>

<P CLASS="paragraph">
<FONT SIZE="5"><B>Output</B></FONT><BR>
For each set of input produce one line of output. This line contains the serial of the output and then the cost of traveling from <B>P</B> to <B>Q</B>, which will obviously be an integer. Look at the sample output below for details.</P>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLSPACING=0 BORDERCOLOR=black BORDER=1 CELLPADDING=5>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD>
<FONT SIZE="5"><B>Sample Input</B></FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT SIZE="5"><B>Sample Output</B></FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#D0D0D0" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD>
<PRE>
2
2
10 10
10 13
1
10
20
</PRE>
</TD>
<TD>
<PRE>
Case 1: 0
Case 2: 10
</PRE>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P>
<HR>
<B>Problemsetter: Shahriar Manzoor, special thanks to Derek Kisman</B>
</P>

<P CLASS="paragraph">
<B>Note:</B> In the first sample output for sample input the cost of traveling from (10, 10) to (10, 13) is shown zero because the line connecting these two points does not really enter any two dimensional hyper-cube. The line just goes along the edges of the two dimensional hyper-cubes.
</P>

</BODY>
</HTML>
