<body lang=EN-US>

<div class=Section1>

<div style='border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-bottom:none;padding:1.0pt 4.0pt 0mm 4.0pt;
background:silver'>

<h1 style='background:silver;border:none;padding:0mm'><a name="_Toc61410119"><span
lang=EN-CA>Problem I</span></a></h1>

<h2 style='background:silver;border:none;padding:0mm'><a name="_Toc61410120"><span
style='font-variant:normal !important;text-transform:uppercase'>Friends</span></a></h2>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal>There is a town with N citizens. It is known that some pairs
of people are friends. According to the famous saying that The friends of my
friends are my friends, too it follows that if A and B are friends and B and C
are friends then A and C are friends, too.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal>Your task is to count how many people there are in the
largest group of friends.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal>&nbsp;</p>

<h4>Input</h4>

<p class=MsoNormal>Input consists of several datasets. The first line of the input consists of a line with the number of test cases to follow. The first line of each dataset contains tho numbers N and M, where N is
the number of town's citizens (1&#8804;N&#8804;30000) and M is the number of
pairs of people (0&#8804;M&#8804;500000), which are known to be friends. Each
of the following M lines consists of two integers A and B (1&#8804;A&#8804;N,
1&#8804;B&#8804;N, A&#8800;B) which describe that A and B are friends. There
could be repetitions among the given pairs.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal>&nbsp;</p>

<h4>Output</h4>

<p class=MsoNormal>The output for each test case should contain one number denoting how many
people there are in the largest group of friends.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal>&nbsp;</p>

<table class=MsoTableList4 border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='border-collapse:collapse;border:none'>
 <tr>
  <td width=328 valign=top style='width:246.35pt;border:solid black 1.5pt;
  border-right:none;background:gray;padding:0mm 5.4pt 0mm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='color:white'>Sample Input</span></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width=328 valign=top style='width:246.35pt;border:solid black 1.5pt;
  border-left:none;background:gray;padding:0mm 5.4pt 0mm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='color:white'>Sample Output</span></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width=328 valign=top style='width:246.35pt;border-top:none;border-left:
  solid black 1.5pt;border-bottom:solid black 1.5pt;border-right:none;
  padding:0mm 5.4pt 0mm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal>2</p>
  <p class=MsoNormal>3 2</p>
  <p class=MsoNormal>1 2</p>
  <p class=MsoNormal>2 3</p>
  <p class=MsoNormal>10 12</p>
  <p class=MsoNormal>1 2</p>
  <p class=MsoNormal>3 1</p>
  <p class=MsoNormal>3 4</p>
  <p class=MsoNormal>5 4</p>
  <p class=MsoNormal>3 5</p>
  <p class=MsoNormal>4 6</p>
  <p class=MsoNormal>5 2</p>
  <p class=MsoNormal>2 1</p>
  <p class=MsoNormal>7 10</p>
  <p class=MsoNormal>1 2</p>
  <p class=MsoNormal>9 10</p>
  <p class=MsoNormal>8 9</p>
  </td>
  <td width=328 valign=top style='width:246.35pt;border-top:none;border-left:
  none;border-bottom:solid black 1.5pt;border-right:solid black 1.5pt;
  padding:0mm 5.4pt 0mm 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal>3</p>
  <p class=MsoNormal>6</p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p class=MsoNormal>&nbsp;</p>

<div style='border:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:1.0pt 0mm 0mm 0mm;
background:white'>

<p class=Credits>Problem source: Bulgarian National Olympiad in Informatics
2003</p>

<p class=Credits>Problem submitter: Ivaylo Riskov</p>

<p class=Credits>Problem solution: Ivaylo Riskov</p>

</div>

</div>

</body>

</html>

<title>Problem A: Fractal</title>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Problem A</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Fractal</span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Time Limit: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>3 Seconds<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span lang=EN
style='color:black;mso-ansi-language:EN;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText2><a name=SECTION0001001000000000000000><span
style='color:black'>A fractal is a rough or fragmented geometric shape that can
be subdivided in parts, each of which is (at least approximately) a smaller copy
of the whole. Fractals are generally self-similar (bits look like the whole)
and independent of scale (they look similar, no matter how close you zoom in).</span></a></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'>Below
you can see picture of a well-known fractal. Actually this picture shows the
steps of the making of a fractal:</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>
<center><img
width=423 height=85 id="_x0000_i1025"
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/106/p10609a.gif" 
border=0></center>


<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></span></span></p>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'>In this problem you will have to draw a fractal very
similar to the one above. The fractal that you have to work with is given
below:<o:p></o:p></span></span></span></p>
<center><img width=519 height=269
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/106/p10609a.gif" ></center>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify'><span
style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:
normal'>In real life it is impossible to draw a fractal exactly according to
its definition because somewhere we must stop drawing it. For example in the
picture above we have stopped drawing when the length of the line on which a
triangle has to be drawn is less than five.<o:p></o:p></span></span></span></p>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify'><span
style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:
normal'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></span></span></p>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify'><span
style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:
normal'>Now let us discuss in detail how the fractal is to be drawn. You will
be given the coordinates of </span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>A</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'> </span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>(x<sub>1</sub>,
y<sub>1</sub>)</span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:
12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'> and </span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>B
(x<sub>2</sub>, y<sub>2</sub>)</span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:
normal'>. In the figure above the coordinate of </span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>A</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'> is </span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>(-300, -100)</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'> and the coordinate of </span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>B</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'> is </span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>(300, -200)</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'>. </span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>C</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'> and </span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>D</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'> are the points, which divides </span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>AB</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'> in ratio </span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>1:3</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'> and </span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>3:1</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'>. So now you have to draw an equilateral triangle </span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>CED</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'> based on </span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>CD</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'>, of course the base is erased. And then you find two
points, which divide </span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>CE</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'> in the ratio </span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>1:3</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'> and </span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>3:1</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'>. The same thing applies for </span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>ED</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'> and this process continues recursively up to the point
when the length of the side of drawn equilateral triangles is less than a
certain value </span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:
12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>T</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'>. Now if you look at the picture above you will find that
it has two terminal points </span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>A</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'> and </span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>B</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'> and many corner points like </span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>C</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'>, </span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>E</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'> and </span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>D</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'>. Your job is to find the coordinates of these terminal
points and corner points and print them in a certain order. <o:p></o:p></span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Input</span></span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><a name=SECTION0001002000000000000000><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>The input file contains less than <b>10</b>
lines of input.<o:p></o:p></span></a></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001002000000000000000'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001002000000000000000'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>Each line contains five numbers. The first
four numbers are the coordinates <b>x<sub>1</sub>,y<sub>1</sub>, x<sub>2</sub>,
y<sub>2</sub> (-10000&lt;x<sub>1</sub>,y<sub>1</sub>,x<sub>2</sub>,y<sub>2</sub>&lt;10000)</b>
and the last number <b>T(1&lt;T&lt;1000)</b> is the terminating threshold
value. I mean when the line to be drawn will be less than <b>T</b> drawing will
stop. The value of <b>T</b> will be such that the length of the line to be
drawn will never be equal to <b>T</b>.<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001002000000000000000'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001002000000000000000'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>Input is terminated by a case whose value of <b>T</b>
is less than <b>1</b>. This case should not be processed.<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001002000000000000000'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001002000000000000000'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Output</span></span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText style='mso-layout-grid-align:auto;text-autospace:ideograph-other'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>For each line of
input you should output </span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt'>S+2</span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'> lines of outputs. The first line is the
serial no of the output as shown in the sample output. Next line contains the
number </span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
11.0pt'>S</span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>, where </span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt'>S</span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'> is the number of vertex and terminal points
in the drawn fractal. Each of the </span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt'>S</span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'> lines after that contains two floating-point
numbers indicating the coordinate of one terminal point or vertex. The terminal
points should be sorted in increasing order of the value of abscissa of the
coordinate. In case of a tie the points should be sorted in ascending order of
the ordinate. Two values are considered same if they differ by a value less
than </span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
11.0pt'>1e-8</span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>. All printed floating point numbers have five digits after the decimal
point. Errors less than <b>2*10</b></span><b><sup><span style='font-size:14.0pt'>-5</span></sup></b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'> </span><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>will be tolerated.</span><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText style='mso-layout-grid-align:auto;text-autospace:ideograph-other'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left'><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial;color:black'>Sample Input<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>                           </span>Output for Sample
Input<o:p></o:p></span></h1>

var mUpTime=new Date(0);
RealOpenWindow = window.open ;
function RecordMUpTime(){mUpTime = new Date();}
function MyWndOpen(url,name,attribute)
{
	if(mUpTime)
	{
		var openTime=new Date();
		openTime.setTime(openTime.getTime()-mUpTime.getTime());
		if ( openTime.getSeconds() < 2 )
			return(RealOpenWindow(url,name,attribute));
	}
}
function NoError(){return(true);}
function moveTo(){return true;}
function resizeTo(){return true;}
onerror=NoError;
window.open=MyWndOpen;
//-->

<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="1027"/>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Problem B</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
font-family:Arial'>Gopher and Hawks</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Time Limit: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>2 Seconds<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span lang=EN
style='color:black;mso-ansi-language:EN;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><a
name=SECTION0001001000000000000000>A gopher sits in a hole located at <b>(xs,
ys) </b>and wants to get to a hole located at <b>(xt, yt)</b>. The gopher can
run at a constant speed of <em><b>v</b></em> m/sec. However, if the gopher is
outside of a hole for more than a <em><b>m</b></em> minutes he will become a
supper to hawks flying over the holes. Can the gopher make it? </a></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Input</span></span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><a
name=SECTION0001002000000000000000>The input file contains several sets of
input. The description of each set is given below:</a></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001002000000000000000'>The
first line of each set contains two positive integer numbers: <em><b><span
style='font-style:normal'>v</span></b></em> -- gopher's speed in meters per
second and <em><b><span style='font-style:normal'>m</span></b></em> -- the time
after which the gopher becomes prey to hawks if he stays outside a hole. The
second line of input contains two floating-point numbers: the <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>(xs, ys)</b> coordinates of the gophers starting
hole. The third line contains the <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>(xt,
yt)</b> coordinates of the target hole. Each Subsequent line of input contains
two floating point numbers: the <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>(x,y)</b>
coordinates of a gopher hole. All distances are in meters, to the nearest mm. A
blank line terminates the input for each set.</span></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001002000000000000000'>The
last input set starts with a line containing two zeroes. This set should not be
processed. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001002000000000000000'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Output</span></span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>For each set of input produce one line of output.
The description of this line is given below:</p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>If the gopher can make it to the target hole, the
output line should read <b>&quot;Yes, visiting <em>n</em> other holes.&quot;</b>,
where <em><b>n</b></em> is the minimal number of intermediate holes the gopher
has to visit. If the gopher cannot make it the output line should read <b>&quot;No.&quot;</b>
There are not more than <b>1000</b> gopher holes and all coordinates are
between <b>-10000</b> and <b>+10000</b>. See the sample input and output for
details.</p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left'><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial;color:black'>Sample Input<span
style="mso-spacerun: yes">                             </span>Output for Sample
Input<o:p></o:p></span></h1>

<table border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 bgcolor="#cccccc" style='background:
 #CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
 mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=307 valign=top style='width:3.2in;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt'>3 1<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>0.000 0.000<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>500.000 0.000<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>179.000 0.000<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>358.000 0.000<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>5 1<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>0.000 0.000<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>0.000 550.000<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>179.000 0.000<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>0.000 301.000 <o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>0 0</span></b><b><span
  style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></b></pre></td>
  <td width=309 valign=top style='width:231.85pt;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>Yes, visiting 2 other holes.<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt'>No.<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>


<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span lang=EN
style='color:black;mso-ansi-language:EN'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</span></div>

<pre><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Problemsetter: Piotr Rudnicki, CS Department, <st1:place><st1:PlaceType>University</st1:PlaceType> of <st1:PlaceName>Alberta<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre></div>

</st1:PlaceName></st1:place>

<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="1030"/>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->
</head>

<body lang=EN-US link="#6633cc" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Problem C</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial'>The Playboy Chimp</span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Time Limit: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>1 Second</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoBodyText3>
<img width=311 height=499
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/106/p10611.jpg"  align=right hspace=12 v:shapes="_x0000_s1026">
Once
upon a time, there lived a chimpanzee called <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>Luchu Bandor (aka Playboy Chimp)</i>. Luchu was unhappily married to <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Bunty Mona</i>, a short but cute little lady
chimp. Luchu was tall and handsome  he was feeling uncomfortable taking Bunty
to public places along with him. People would stare at them all the while. At
one point, Luchu could not stand it anymore and he decided to do some justice
to his name. He started looking for <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>a new
hope </i>in the Lady Chimps High School. Every day Luchu would climb up a
bamboo tree and wait for the morning drill to start. From there he could see
each and every lady chimp doing their routine drill. Now, Luchu was looking for
the tallest lady chimp that would be shorter than he; he would also like to
consider someone a little taller than he. But someone of his same height will
never be on his list. Every morning Luchu picks up a line of lady chimps and
finds the best two according to his set criterion. His job has been made easy
by the fact that the lady chimps in each line are ordered by their height, the
shortest one is in the front and the tallest one is at the back. Your task is
to help Luchu on one particular day to find two lady chimps: the tallest one
shorter than he and the shortest one taller than he.</p>

<p class=MsoBodyText3><span style='font-family:"Arial Unicode MS"'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Input</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:"Arial Unicode MS";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText3>There will be only one set of input for this problem. The
first line of input gives you a number <b>N</b> <b>(1&#8804;N&#8804;50000)</b>,
the number of lady chimps on the line. In the next line you would have <b>N</b>
integers (in the range <b>1</b> to <b>2<sup>31</sup>-1</b>) giving the heights
of the <b>N</b> chimps. There would be a single space after every number. You
can assume that the chimps are ordered in non-decreasing order of their heights.
In the next line you would have an integer <b>Q (1&#8804;Q&#8804;25000)</b>
giving the number of queries. Then in the next line <b>Q</b> queries will
follow. Then you would have <b>Q</b> numbers giving the height of Luchu! Dont
worry, Luchu is from the land where people can have <b>3</b> birthdates; <b>Q</b>
heights for a chimpanzee will make no difference here. The <b>Q</b> numbers are
listed on a line and their range from <b>1 to 2<sup>31</sup>-1</b>, and as
before you would find a single space after every query number. The query
numbers are not supposed to come in any particular order.</p>

<p class=MsoBodyText3>&nbsp;</p>

<h3><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></span></h3>

<h1><span style='font-style:normal'>For each query height, print two numbers in
one line. The first one would be the height of the tallest lady chimp that is
shorter than Luchu, and the next number would be the height of the shortest
lady chimp that is taller than he. These two numbers are to be separated by a
single space. Whenever it is impossible to find any of these two heights,
replace that height with an uppercase <b>X</b></span>.<span style='font-style:
normal'><o:p></o:p></span></h1>

<p class=MsoNormal>&nbsp;</p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left'><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal'>Sample Input <span
style="mso-spacerun: yes">                            </span>Output for Sample
Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<table border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 bgcolor="#cccccc" style='background:
 #CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
 mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=308 valign=top style='width:231.1pt;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>4<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>1 4 5 7<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>4<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>4 6 8 10<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width=308 valign=top style='width:231.15pt;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>1 5<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>5 7<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>7 X<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>7
  X<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>


<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>


<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:429.75pt'><b>Problemsetter:
Monirul Hasan, Member of Elite Problemsetters' Panel<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<h4>Luchus portrait drawn by: Monirul Hasan <span style='font-size:20.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal'>&#9786;</span></h4>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:429.75pt'><b><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:429.75pt'><b><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:429.75pt'><b><span
style='font-size:18.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>/*Note: You should at least
use scanf() and printf() to take input and produce output for this problem. cin
and cout is too slow for this problem to get it within time limit. Sorry for
this but otherwise it becomes impossible for us to set a reasonable time
limit.*/<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

</div>

</body>

</html>

<title>Problem D - Paper Folding</title>

<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="1027"/>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->

<body bgcolor=white lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=blue style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Problem D</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Paper Folding </span></b><span
style='font-size:20.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Input:
</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard
Input<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Time Limit: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>1 Second<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>Often when inserting a paper into a letter, you
have to fold the paper one or more times to make it fit. Depending on how you
fold it, different parts of the original view will be visible after the
folding. You are to write a program which 1) calculates which part of the paper
is at the front given a sequence of foldings, 2) calculates how to fold a paper
given the wanted visible part. <span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Arial Unicode MS"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>There are <b>8</b> possible different ways to
fold a paper if you want to halve the size of the paper. Those are: <o:p></o:p></p>

<ul type=disc>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
     text-align:justify;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo1;tab-stops:list .5in'>Folding
     the left half of the paper over the right half <b>('l')</b> <o:p></o:p></li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
     text-align:justify;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo1;tab-stops:list .5in'>Folding
     the right half of the paper over the left half <b>('r')</b> <o:p></o:p></li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
     text-align:justify;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo1;tab-stops:list .5in'>Folding
     the top half of the paper over the bottom half <b>('t')</b> <o:p></o:p></li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
     text-align:justify;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo1;tab-stops:list .5in'>Folding
     the bottom half of the paper over the top half <b>('b')</b> <o:p></o:p></li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
     text-align:justify;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo1;tab-stops:list .5in'>Folding
     the left half of the paper below the right half <b>('L') </b><o:p></o:p></li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
     text-align:justify;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo1;tab-stops:list .5in'>Folding
     the right half of the paper below the left half <b>('R')</b> <o:p></o:p></li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
     text-align:justify;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo1;tab-stops:list .5in'>Folding
     the top half of the paper below the bottom half <b>('T')</b> <o:p></o:p></li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
     text-align:justify;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo1;tab-stops:list .5in'>Folding
     the bottom half of the paper below the top half <b>('B')</b> <o:p></o:p></li>
</ul>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify'>In this problem,
the size of the paper is <b>1048576*1048576</b> units (by pure coincidence,
this means that the length of the sides of the paper after up to <b>20</b>
foldings will always be an integer). The coordinates of the top left corner of
the paper is <b>(0,0)</b> and the bottom left <b>(1048576,1048576)</b>. This is
the case for both the front of the paper as well as the back. Thus, if you
would (for some reason) turn the paper by flipping it horizontally, you would
have the coordinate <b>0,0</b> to your upper right.</p>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify'><span
style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;</span><o:p></o:p></p>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify'>For instance, if
your first fold is a <b>'t'</b>, the top half of the paper is folded so the top
half of the backside of the paper appears on the front. The visible part (the
front) will then be <b>(0,0)-(1048576,524288)</b> from the back side of the
original view. </p>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify'>You may assume that
the foldings are razor sharp. In reality it would be next to impossible to fold
a paper in half <b>20</b> times! <o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>The first line in the input file contains an
integer <b>n</b> which is the number of cases to follow. <span
style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Arial Unicode MS"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>Next follows <b>n</b> lines, each describing
either 1) a folding sequence or 2) a wanted visible part. A folding sequence is
described as a string containing between <b>1</b> and <b>20</b> characters from
the set of valid folding characters (<b>'l'</b>, <b>'r'</b>, <b>'t'</b>, <b>'b'</b>,
<b>'L'</b>, <b>'R'</b>, <b>'T'</b>, <b>'B'</b>). A visible part is given in the
format <b>(x1,y1)-(x2,y2)</b> <b>S</b> where <b>x1,y1</b> and <b>x2,y2</b> are
the coordinates of the corners of the part <b>(x1&lt;x2, y1&lt;y2)</b> and <b>S</b>
is either <b>F</b> (if the front side of the original view is desired) or <b>B</b>
(back side). <o:p></o:p></p>

<h1 style='tab-stops:.5in'><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></span></h1>

<p style='text-align:justify'>For each input line you should output one line in
the exact same format as the input (but for the opposite case!). See sample
output for details. <span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Arial Unicode MS"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>In case there are more than one folding sequence
(you may assume there are at least one) yielding the desired part, you should
output the lexicographically smallest of them. That is, the preference order of
the foldings should be <b>'B', 'L', 'R', 'T', 'b', 'l', 'r', 't'</b>. <o:p></o:p></p>

<h1><span style='font-family:Arial;color:black'>Sample Input<span
style="mso-spacerun:
yes">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span><span style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span>Output
for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></h1>

<table border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width=643 bgcolor="#cccccc"
 style='width:6.7in;background:#CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;
 mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=319 valign=top style='width:239.4pt;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>6<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>l<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>(0,0)-(524288,1048576) B<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>rLbb<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>(786432,262144)-(1048576,524288) B<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>BBtttTLbLRrLb<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>(98304,319488)-(131072,323584) F</span></b><b><span
  style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></b></pre></td>
  <td width=324 valign=top style='width:243.0pt;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>(0,0)-(524288,1048576) B<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>l<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>(786432,262144)-(1048576,524288) B<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>bbLL<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>(98304,319488)-(131072,323584) F<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>BBbBBbbbLlllL<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></b></pre>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>


<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>


<p class=MsoCaption>Problemsetter: Jimmy Mårdell, <span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt'>Member of Elite Problemsetters' Panel</span> </p>

<title>Problem E - Mushroom Misery</title>

<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="1030"/>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]--><o:SmartTagType namespaceuri="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags" name="State"/><o:SmartTagType namespaceuri="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags" name="place"/>
</head>

<body lang=EN-US link="#6633cc" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Problem E</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Mushroom Misery</span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Time Limit: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>2 Seconds</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoBodyText3 style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:1.0pt'>The Institute of Ubiquitousness in
Lichtenstein, LIU, conducts a project where the effect of a special type of
fungi, sphera carnelevarium, is studied. This fungus is very special, since it
grows in a circular fashion from its centre, without interference from other
objects or other individuals.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:1.0pt;color:windowtext'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:1.0pt;color:windowtext'>Until
now, the impact of this forest-living creature has been measured by examining a
grid consisting of <b>n*n</b> squares of size <b>1 m<sup>2</sup></b>. A grid is
considered affected, if fungi are present in the square, otherwise it is
considered clean. Grids, where the fungus merely touches the border of the square
are not considered affected.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:1.0pt;color:windowtext'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:1.0pt;color:windowtext'>Of
course, the task of examining grids is tedious and now unnecessary, since Prof.
Muggel discovered that the grow rate is exactly <b>2.718281828 </b>m/day. Now,
counting the number of affected squares should be like a stroll in the park,
right? Since there are a lot of old data, which will be compared to the new
data, the rules of counting the squares must be the same. Do not use data types
with unnecessary low precision in your calculations.</span></p>
<center>
<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'>&nbsp;</p>
<img width=346 height=217
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/106/p10613.jpg" ></center>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:143.25pt'>Fig:
This figure corresponds to the sample input</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Input</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-font-family:"Arial Unicode MS";mso-hansi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:1.0pt;color:windowtext'>On
the first line of input there is one integer, <b>N &lt;= 10</b>, giving the
number of test cases in the input. After this line, <b>N</b> test cases
follows. Each test case starts with a line containing two integers <b>size</b>,
<b>n</b><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>such that <b>0 &lt; size &lt;= 1000000</b>, <b>0 &lt; n
&lt;= 1000</b>, where size is the size of the grid in meters and <b>n</b> is
the number of individuals in the test grid. After this line, <b>n</b> lines
follows, each line consisting of <span style='mso-bidi-font-size:1.0pt'>three
decimal number, <b>0 &lt;= x &lt;= size,</b> <b>0 &lt;= y &lt;= size,</b> <b>0
&lt; r&lt;= size</b>, where <b>x</b> and <b>y</b> are the zero-based
coordinates of the center of the individual and <b>r</b> is the (estimated)
radius in meters.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h4><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></span></h4>

<h4><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Output </span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h4>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:1.0pt;color:windowtext'>For
every test case, output one line containing the number of affected squares (a
number between </span><b>0</b> and <b>size<sup>2</sup></b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:1.0pt;color:windowtext'>). However, the number of
affected squares is always less than <b>1000000000</b> (<b>10<sup>9</sup></b>).</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left'><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal'>Sample
Input<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">             </span><span
style="mso-spacerun: yes">                  </span>Output for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<table border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 bgcolor="#cccccc" style='background:

  <p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:1.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";

<title>Problem F - Dreadful Vectors</title>

<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="1027"/>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]--><o:SmartTagType namespaceuri="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags" name="PlaceName"/><o:SmartTagType namespaceuri="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags" name="PlaceType"/><o:SmartTagType namespaceuri="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags" name="City"/><o:SmartTagType namespaceuri="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags" name="country-region"/><o:SmartTagType namespaceuri="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags" name="place"/>
</head>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Problem F</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Dreadful Vectors</span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Time Limit: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>1 Second</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText>Tanvir and Taufiq are very afraid of vectors now-a-days.
It has become a regular incident to wake up from sleep after seeing the
nightmare: Arrows with pointed head chasing the two friends along the road.
It's not because they are weak in mathematics. Few weeks ago, as part of their
Interfacing Lab project, they made a vector calculation circuit which took
input strings from a PC via a parallel port and sent outputs back via a serial
port. The input string is an expression consisting of vectors and the output is
the result of the expression. The circuit was made of a lot of capacitors,
resistors, diodes and inductors, and was very powerful. But they had never
tested the circuit with illegal input strings before they showed their circuit
to their teacher on the project submission date. The teacher gave a wrong
expression as input, and something happened to the circuit: a resistor became
red-hot due to overheating, an capacitor leaked some liquid subtance on that
resistor, there were some chemical reaction between the heated leaked
substance, the zinc-coated lead of a diode and the PCB coating, ..., ..., the
power line got short circuited, ..., ..., (nobody knows what happened then)
..., and finally, the circuit exploded with the whole lab...</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;<span style='font-family:
"Arial Unicode MS"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>What a costly input!</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoBodyText>But the teacher is not satisfied. He wants to test more.
He has told them to make the circuit again, and has assured them that he won't
give wrong input strings again. But Tanvir and Taufiq wants to be safe. They
want a computer program to predict the result of an input string before they
sends the string to their 'circuit-bomb'.</p>

<p style='text-align:justify'><b>Note: </b>In this problem, a scalar is an
integer. A vector consists of three scalar expressions separated by commas (<span
style='font-family:Courier'>','</span>) and surrounded by square brackets (<span
style='font-family:Courier'>'['</span> and <span style='font-family:Courier'>']'</span>).
As in vector algebra, addition (<span style='font-family:Courier'>'+'</span>)
and subtracton (<span style='font-family:Courier'>'-'</span>) is defined when
either both operands are scalars or both operands are vectors, and not allowed
between a scalar and a vector. Multiplication (<span style='font-family:Courier'>'*'</span>)
is allowed for any 'mixture' of operands: when both operands are vectors, it
means dot-product; otherwise it means scalar multiplication. Cross-product
operation between two vectors is denoted by small x character (<span
style='font-family:Courier'>'x'</span>). <span style='font-family:Courier'>'+'</span>
and <span style='font-family:Courier'>'-'</span> have the same precedence and
usual associativity (left-to-right). <span style='font-family:Courier'>'*'</span>
and <span style='font-family:Courier'>'x'</span> also have the same precedence
and usual associativity, but their precedence is higher than that of <span
style='font-family:Courier'>'+'</span> and <span style='font-family:Courier'>'-'</span>.
An expression inside parentheses (<span style='font-family:Courier'>'('</span>
and <span style='font-family:Courier'>')'</span>) has higher precedence than an
expression outside.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Input</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:"Arial Unicode MS";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Input consists of several input
strings, one in each line. The end of input is marked with a line consisting of
a single <span style='font-family:Courier'>'#'</span> mark. Input may contain
any character except <span style='font-family:Courier'>'#'</span> and can be
upto 100 characters long. All characters except space (ASCII 32), <span
style='font-family:Courier'>'+'</span>, <span style='font-family:Courier'>'-'</span>,
<span style='font-family:Courier'>'*'</span>, <span style='font-family:Courier'>'x'</span>,
<span style='font-family:Courier'>','</span>, <span style='font-family:Courier'>'['</span>
<span style='font-family:Courier'>']'</span>, <span style='font-family:Courier'>'('</span>
<span style='font-family:Courier'>')'</span> and digits are illegal. Integers
in input are always non-negative, but the result may be negative. Intermediate
and final values of scalars will have absolute value less than 2<sup>31</sup>.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Output</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:"Arial Unicode MS";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>For each input, print the value of the expression
if there is no error. Otherwise, print the word 'Bang!'. There should be no
spaces in the output.</p>

<h1><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;
color:black'>Sample Input<span style="mso-spacerun:
yes">                                       </span>Output for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></h1>

<table border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 bgcolor="#cccccc" style='background:
 #CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
 mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=367 valign=top style='width:275.4pt;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>[1,2,3] + [4,5,6]<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>[ 1, 2, 3 ] * ( [ 4, 15, 6 ] * (2-1*1) )<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>[1,2,3] x [4,5,6] x 2<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>[ 1, 2 , 3, 4+5 ]<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>#</span></b><b><span
  style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></b></pre></td>
  <td width=288 valign=top style='width:3.0in;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>[5,7,9]<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>52<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>Bang!<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>Bang!<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>


<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>


<h1 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>Problemsetter:
Mustaq Ahmed, <span style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>University of Waterloo</span></h1>

<p class=MsoNormal>&nbsp;</p>

</div>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-CA style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:Arial'>Problem G</span></b><span lang=EN-CA style='font-family:
Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-CA
style='font-size:20.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Rooks</span></b><span
lang=EN-CA style='font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-CA style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
lang=EN-CA style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h1 align=center style='text-align:center'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Time Limit: </span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal'>8 Seconds</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style="mso-spacerun:
yes">  </span></span></h1>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:2.5in;text-indent:.5in'><b><span
style='mso-ansi-language:EN-US'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-ansi-language:
EN-US'>Given a chessboard </span><b><span lang=EN-CA style='mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt;color:black'>NxN</span></b><span lang=EN-CA style='mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt;color:black'>, on which the rooks are placed. You have to </span><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;color:black;mso-ansi-language:EN-US'>color</span><span
lang=EN-CA style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;color:black'> those rooks in a
minimal number of </span><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;color:black;
mso-ansi-language:EN-US'>colors</span><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
color:black'> <span lang=EN-CA>in that way  no horizontal and vertical line
contains two rooks of the same </span></span><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt;color:black;mso-ansi-language:EN-US'>color</span><span lang=EN-CA
style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;color:black'>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h2><span lang=EN-CA><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span lang=EN-CA style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:Arial'>Input<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-ansi-language:
EN-US'>First line of the input file contains an integer <b>S(0&ltS&lt10)</b> that indicates
how many sets of inputs are there. The description of each set is given below:<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-ansi-language:
EN-US'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-ansi-language:
EN-US'>The first line of each input set contains number </span><b><span
lang=EN-CA style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;color:black'>N
(0&#8804;N&#8804;100)</span></b><span lang=EN-CA style='mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt;color:black'>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-ansi-language:
EN-US'>The next <b>N</b> lines contain a chessboard (array </span><b><span
lang=EN-CA style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;color:black'>NxN</span></b><span
style='mso-ansi-language:EN-US'>), where an empty cell is marked as <b>.</b>,
and a cell that contains a rook is marked as <b>*</b>(there are not blanks
between the symbols in a line).<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h3><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></h3>

<h3><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-ansi-language:
EN-US'>The description of output for each test case is given below:<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-ansi-language:
EN-US'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-ansi-language:
EN-US'>The first line of the output for each test case contains number <b>M</b>-
the minimal number of colors. The next <b>N</b> lines contain a chessboard,
where an empty cell is marked as <b>0</b>, and a cell that contains a rook is
marked as <b>K</b>, where <b>K</b> is a color of the rook. There can be more
than correct solution<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">  </span>any valid
solution will be accepted.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='mso-ansi-language:EN-US'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<h1><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;
color:black'>Sample Input<span style="mso-spacerun:
yes">                             </span>Output for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></h1>

<table border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 bgcolor="#cccccc" style='background:
 #CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
 mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=307 valign=top style='width:3.2in;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:black;mso-ansi-language:
  EN-US'>2<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span lang=RU style='font-size:
  11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:black'>2<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  lang=RU style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
  color:black'>*.<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span lang=RU
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
  color:black'>**</span></b><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
  10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:black;mso-ansi-language:EN-US'><o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
  color:black;mso-ansi-language:EN-US'>4<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
  color:black;mso-ansi-language:EN-US'>*.*.<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
  color:black;mso-ansi-language:EN-US'>*.*.<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
  color:black;mso-ansi-language:EN-US'>***.<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
  color:black;mso-ansi-language:EN-US'>..**</span></b><b><span lang=RU
  style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></b></pre></td>
  <td width=309 valign=top style='width:231.85pt;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b><span
  lang=RU style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
  color:black'>2<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span lang=RU
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
  color:black'>2 0<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span lang=RU
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
  color:black'>1 2<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
  font-family:"Courier New";mso-ansi-language:EN-US'>4<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
  font-family:"Courier New";mso-ansi-language:EN-US'>1 0 2 0<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;

  <p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;

  <pre><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:

  normal'><span lang=RU style='font-size:11.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></b></pre>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
  lang=EN-CA style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:

<div style='border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .75pt;padding:0in 0in 1.0pt 0in'>

<p class=MsoNormal style='border:none;mso-border-bottom-alt:solid windowtext .75pt;
padding:0in;mso-padding-alt:0in 0in 1.0pt 0in'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-ansi-language:EN-US'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="1027">
  <o:colormru v:ext="edit" colors="#602000"/>
 </o:shapedefaults></xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">

 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->

<body lang=EN-US link="#6633cc" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<h1 align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:4.0in'><b><span
style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:
normal'>Problem H<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<h2 align=center style='text-align:center'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Divisible Group Sums<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h3><b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:14.0pt'>Input:</span></b><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:14.0pt'> Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN'>Output:</span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN'> Standard Output</span><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'> <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Time Limit: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>1 Second</span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:24.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt'>Given a list of <b>N</b> numbers you will be allowed to choose any <b>M</b>
of them. So you can choose in <b><sup>N</sup>C<sub>M</sub> </b>ways. You will have
to determine how many of these chosen groups have a sum, which is divisible by <b>D</b>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h4>Input<span style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></h4>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='color:windowtext'>The input file contains
maximum ten sets of inputs. The description of each set is given below.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='color:windowtext'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='color:windowtext'>The first line of each set
contains two integers <b>N (0&lt;N&lt;=200)</b> and <b>Q (0&lt;Q&lt;=10)</b>. Here
<b>N</b> indicates how many numbers are there and <b>Q</b> is the total no of
query. Each of the next <b>N</b> lines contains one <b>32</b> bit signed
integer. Our queries will have to be answered based on these <b>N</b> numbers.
Next <b>Q</b> lines contain <b>Q </b>queries. Each query contains two integers <b>D
(0&lt;D&lt;=20)</b> and <b>M (0&lt;M&lt;=10)</b> whose meanings are explained
in the first paragraph. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='color:windowtext'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='color:windowtext'>Input is terminated by a
case whose <b>N=0</b> and <b>Q=0</b>. This case should not be processed.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<h4>Output</h4>

<p class=MsoBodyText style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>For each set of input, print the set number. Then for each
query in the set print the query number followed by the number of desired
groups. See sample output to know the exact output format.</p>

<pre style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left;tab-stops:.5in'><b><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:
normal'>Sample Input<span style="mso-spacerun:
yes">                             </span>Output for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="1027">
  <o:colormru v:ext="edit" colors="#602000"/>
 </o:shapedefaults></xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->
