<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="1027"/>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Problem E</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Stretching Geometry </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Time Limit: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>2 Seconds<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span lang=EN
style='color:black;mso-ansi-language:EN;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText style='mso-layout-grid-align:auto;text-autospace:ideograph-other'><a
name=SECTION0001001000000000000000><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'>A square shaped garden is marked with
integer coordinates. The area of the garden is infinite. The lower left corner
of the garden is </span></span></a><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>O (0,0)</span></span></span><span
style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'> and the coordinate system is like normal
Cartesian coordinate system. A mad problem setter has planted </span></span></span><span
style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>(15001*15001)</span></span></span><span style='mso-bookmark:
SECTION0001001000000000000000'><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'> trees in </span></span></span><span
style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>15001</span></span></span><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'> rows and </span></span></span><span
style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>15001</span></span></span><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'> columns. So the
area where trees are planted is also a square. Trees are planted in a
coordinate </span></span></span><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>(p,q)</span></span></span><span
style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'> iff the following two conditions are
true:<o:p></o:p></span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText style='margin-left:60.0pt;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:

<p class=MsoBodyText style='margin-left:60.0pt;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'><span

"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'> below the value of </span></span><span

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:

"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></span></span></p>

<p><center><img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/106/p10636.jpg" ></p></center>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify'><span
style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'>The mad problem setter has drawn a </span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>2D</span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'> image of this garden, which looks somewhat like </span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>figure 1</span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'> but a lot larger. But the problem is that while
manipulating the image with a high precision imaging software he has stretched
the image </span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:
12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>b(b&gt;0)</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'> times along </span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>x</span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";

font-weight:normal'>-axis and </span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>a(a&gt;0)</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'> times along </span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>y</span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'>- axis. For example </span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Figure 2</span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'> is found by stretching </span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>figure-1,</span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'> </span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>3</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:

"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'> times along </span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>x</span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'>-axis and </span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>2</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'> times along </span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>y</span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'>- axis. The trees in the pictures can be considered point
objects. So they remain point objects after any sort of stretching. Before or
after this stretching not all trees are visible from the origin </span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:

mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'> due to some other trees, which are on the same line with
respect to </span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:
12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>O</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'>. In the above pictures the visible trees
are shown with red. You will be given the coordinate of one of the visible
trees in this </span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:
12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>stretched figure</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:

"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'> </span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>A (x1, y1)</span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span

font-weight:normal'>. There will always be a tree at position </span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:

mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'> in this stretched figure that is visible from </span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>O</span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'> and whose angular distance </span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>&#966;</span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'> from </span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>A</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'> with respect to </span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>O</span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'> is minimum (I mean angle </span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>AOB</span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'> is minimum) and in the positive direction (Counter
clockwise). Your job is to determine the coordinate of </span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>B (x2,y2)</span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'>. Of course, the mad problemsetter is looking for a very
efficient solution.<o:p></o:p></span></span></span></p>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Input</span></span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText><a name=SECTION0001002000000000000000>The input file
contains less than <b>10001</b> lines of input. Each line contains four
integers <b>x1</b> <b>(0&lt;=x1&lt;=15000*d*b)</b>, <b>y1 (0&lt;=y1&lt;=15000*d*a)</b>,
<b>d (0&lt; d&lt;11),</b><span style="mso-spacerun: yes">  </span><b>ab </b>(<b>0&lt;ab&lt;=100000000,
ab</b> means <b>a*b</b>) and <span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:
12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>&#966; </span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'>(expressed in degree). The meanings of
these symbols are described in the problem statement. Input is terminated by a
line where the value of </span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>x1</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'> is </span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>1</span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'>. This line should not be processed. </span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>&#966; </span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'>will always be in the format </span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>D.DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDeN</span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'>, here </span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>D</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'> denotes any decimal digit and </span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>N</span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'> is an integer </span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>(-4&gt;N&gt;-16)</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'>. (If you are intelligent and use
floating-point number with reasonable precision (Such as </span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>double </span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'>in </span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>C/C++</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'>) then you should not have any
trouble.)<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">  </span></span></span></a></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001002000000000000000'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<h4><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001002000000000000000'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Output</span></span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></span></h4>

<p class=MsoBodyText style='mso-layout-grid-align:auto;text-autospace:ideograph-other'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>For each line of
input except the last one produce one line of output which contains two
integers which are the values of </span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt'>x2</span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'> and </span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt'>y2</span></b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText style='mso-layout-grid-align:auto;text-autospace:ideograph-other'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left'><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial;color:black'>Sample Input<span
style="mso-spacerun: yes">                                   </span>Output for
Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></h1>

<pre><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:Arial'>Problemsetter: Shahriar Manzoor, Member of Elite Problemsetters' Panel<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre
style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:30.25pt;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:27.0pt;

style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></b></pre>

<p class=MsoBlockText style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>What
makes these students outstanding?&nbsp; The answer is simple.&nbsp; They
do!&nbsp;&nbsp; But, they can't do it alone.&nbsp; The ICPC community bands
together universities, faculty, government&nbsp;and industry to create an
environment where students set performance standards for each other.&nbsp; It
is the willingness to challenge the norm and to take the challenge that sets
these students apart.&nbsp; The ICPC community is set apart because the
challenge is to become great problem solvers!</p>

<p class=MsoBlockText style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

&amp; Marsha</p>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Problem F</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Coprimes</span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Time Limit: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>2 Seconds<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span lang=EN
style='color:black;mso-ansi-language:EN;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText3>How many times must a man look up<br>
Before he can see the sky?<br>
Yes, 'n' how many ears must one man have<br>
Before he can hear people cry?<br>
Yes, 'n' how many deaths will it take till he knows<br>
That too many people have died?<br>
The answer, my friend, is blowin' in the wind,<br>
The answer is blowin' in the wind.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
style='font-family:Courier'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

</div>

<span lang=EN style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:black;mso-ansi-language:EN;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;
mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><br clear=all
style='page-break-before:auto;mso-break-type:section-break'>
</span>

<div class=Section2>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><a
name=SECTION0001001000000000000000><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'>Another gloomy day has begun for Shahriar but as usual his
CD player is singing a song of hope. He has a large piece of paper in front of
him on which he is trying to partition a number into some co-prime numbers by
hand in as many ways as possible and surely things are getting out of his
control. He wants to write a program to do this but his limited programming
ability is not helping his cause. He has already thought about asking Mr.
Kisman to write a code for him but as he has already asked too many favors from
him he is looking for help from another source. Can you help him? A group of
numbers is co-prime when the </span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>GCD</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'> of any two of them is </span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>1</span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal'>.<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">  </span><o:p></o:p></span></span></a></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'>Shahriar has decided to give a party to
all those who will solve this problem so he definitely wants an efficient and
intelligent solution so that number of people in the party is small and of
course his budget is limited :).<o:p></o:p></span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Input</span></span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><a name=SECTION0001002000000000000000><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>The first line of the input file is an
integer <b>N (0&lt;N&lt;40)</b>, which indicates how many sets of inputs are
there. Each of the next <b>N</b> lines contains one set of input. Each line
contains two integers <b>S (0&lt;S&lt;=100)</b> and <b>t (0&lt;t&lt;=30)</b>.
So your job is to partition <b>S</b> into <b>t</b> co-prime numbers.<o:p></o:p></span></a></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001002000000000000000'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001002000000000000000'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Output</span></span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText style='mso-layout-grid-align:auto;text-autospace:ideograph-other'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>For each line of
input you should give several lines of outputs. The description of output for
each line of input is given in the paragraph below:<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText style='mso-layout-grid-align:auto;text-autospace:ideograph-other'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText style='mso-layout-grid-align:auto;text-autospace:ideograph-other'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>First line should
be the serial of the output. Next lines should contain all possible partitions
of </span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
11.0pt'>S</span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'> into </span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt'>t</span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'> co-prime numbers. Each line should contain
one possible partition. In a partition the printed numbers should be ordered in
non-decreasing order and two consecutive numbers should be separated by a
single space. The partitions should be printed in ascending order. Let say one
partition is </span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt'>P<sub>1</sub>=a<sub>1</sub>, a<sub>2</sub> 
,
a<sub>n</sub></span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'> and another partition is </span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt'>P<sub>2</sub>=b<sub>1</sub>, b<sub>2</sub>,

, b<sub>n</sub></span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>. </span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
11.0pt'>a<sub>k</sub></span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'> and </span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt'>b<sub>k</sub></span></b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'> are not equal and
for all value of </span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt'>i(0&lt;i&lt;k)</span></b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'> </span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt'>a<sub>i</sub>=b<sub>i</sub></span></b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>. Then partition </span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt'>P1&gt;P2</span></b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'> iff </span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt'>a<sub>k</sub>&gt;b<sub>k</sub></span></b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'> and </span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt'>P1&lt;P2</span></b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'> iff </span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt'>a<sub>k</sub>&lt;b<sub>k</sub></span></b><sub><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>. </span></sub><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>There can be around
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
11.0pt'>15000</span></b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'> lines in the output file in total.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText style='mso-layout-grid-align:auto;text-autospace:ideograph-other'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left'><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial;color:black'>Sample Input<span
style="mso-spacerun: yes">                           </span>Output for Sample
Input<o:p></o:p></span></h1>

  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>1
  1 5 9 11 13<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>1
  3 5 7 11 13<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>Case
  2:<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>1
  1 6<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>1
  2 5<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>1
  3 4<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>


<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span lang=EN
style='color:black;mso-ansi-language:EN'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</span></div>

<pre><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:Arial'>Problemsetter: Shahriar Manzoor, Member of Elite Problemsetters' Panel<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Special Thanks:</span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
Arial'> Jimmy M</span><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>å</span></b><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>rdell, </span></b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Member of Elite Problemsetters' Panel (Alternate Soln)</span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
Arial'><o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></b></pre>

<p class=MsoBlockText style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>I
like to mess with things. I used to garden, but my traveling resulted in the
demise of all but my peach trees. I can fix a car, but I won't fix yours. I
like to write software, but I don't like to read yours. I can say &quot;Please
put down your pencils!&quot; in several languages. After thirty years, I can
still play a trumpet well enough to know that some practice would do wonders. I
have no idiosyncrasies.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:30.25pt;margin-bottom:
0in;margin-left:27.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=right style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:30.25pt;
margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:27.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:right;
tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>-
Bill Poucher</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

font-family:"Times New Roman"'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></b></pre></div>

<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="1030"/>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">

<body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-CA style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:Arial'>Problem G</span></b><span lang=EN-CA style='font-family:
Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-CA
style='font-size:20.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial'>The Trip
</span></b><span lang=EN-CA style='font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span lang=EN-CA style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
lang=EN-CA style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h1 align=center style='text-align:center'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Time Limit: </span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal'>6 Seconds</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style="mso-spacerun:
yes">  </span></span></h1>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:2.5in;text-indent:.5in'><b><span
style='mso-ansi-language:EN-US'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText><span lang=EN-CA>A number of students are members of a
club that travels annually to exotic locations. Since their very successful
trip to Eindhoven, their destinations have included Orlando, Vancouver, Honolulu,
and Beverly Hills. This spring they are planning a trip to Prague.</span><span
lang=EN-CA style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></p>
<center><p><img width=320 height=240 src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/106/p10638.jpg" ></p></center>


<p class=MsoBodyText><span lang=EN-CA>The group agrees in advance to share
expenses equally, but it is not practical to have them share every expense as
it occurs. So individuals in the group pay for particular things, like meals,
hotels, taxi rides, plane tickets, etc. After the trip, each student's expenses
are tallied and money is exchanged so that the net cost to each is the same, to
within one cent. In the past, this money exchange has been tedious and time consuming.
Since the Eindhoven trip the club has used a scheme that, for a given list of
expenses, ensures that the minimum amount of money changes hands in order to
equalize (within a cent) all the students' costs.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-CA><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-CA>The students
have not found the scheme to be completely satisfactory. Instead of minimizing
the amount of money that changes hands, the students now wish to minimize the
total number of payments that must be made between individuals. After all it is
easier to pay <b>$10.00</b> to one person than to pay <b>$3.33</b> to each of
three people.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-CA><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h2><span lang=EN-CA style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:Arial'>Input<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-CA>Standard input
will contain the information for several trips. The information for each trip
consists of a line containing a positive integer, <b>n</b>, the number of
students on the trip, followed by <b>n</b> lines of input, each containing the
amount, in dollars and cents, spent by a student. There are no more than <b>10</b>
students and no student spent more than <b>$10,000.00</b>. A single line
containing <b>0</b> follows the information for the last trip.</span><span
style='mso-ansi-language:EN-US'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h3><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></h3>

<h3><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-CA>For each trip,
output a line stating the total number of payments that must be made between
individuals to equalize the students' costs within one cent.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='mso-ansi-language:EN-US'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<h1><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;
color:black'>Sample Input<span style="mso-spacerun:
yes">                             </span>Output for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></h1>

<table border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 bgcolor="#cccccc" style='background:
 #CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
 mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=307 valign=top style='width:3.2in;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b><span lang=RU style='font-size:11.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>3<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  lang=RU style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>10.00<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  lang=RU style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>20.00<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  lang=RU style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>30.00<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  lang=RU style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>4<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  lang=RU style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>15.00<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  lang=RU style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>15.01<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  lang=RU style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>3.00<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  lang=RU style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>3.01<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  lang=RU style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>4<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  lang=RU style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>15.00<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  lang=RU style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>15.00<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  lang=RU style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>15.00<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  lang=RU style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>10.00<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  lang=RU style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>2<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  lang=RU style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>0.95<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  lang=RU style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>0.93<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  lang=RU style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>0</span></b><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
  mso-ansi-language:EN-US'><o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><b><span
  style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN-US'><o:p></o:p></span></b></pre></td>
  <td width=309 valign=top style='width:231.85pt;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b><span
  lang=RU style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>1<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  lang=RU style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>2<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  lang=RU style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>3<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  lang=RU style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>1<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=RU style='font-size:11.0pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></b></pre>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
  lang=EN-CA style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
  "Courier New"'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<div style='border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .75pt;padding:0in 0in 1.0pt 0in'>

<p class=MsoNormal style='border:none;mso-border-bottom-alt:solid windowtext .75pt;
padding:0in;mso-padding-alt:0in 0in 1.0pt 0in'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-ansi-language:EN-US'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-CA
style='font-family:Arial'>Problemsetter:<span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>
Gordon Cormack</span>, Reviewer of Elite Problemsetters' Panel<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-CA style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Special Thanks to</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
lang=EN-CA style='font-family:Arial'> Derek Kisman </span></b><span lang=EN-CA
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>and </span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span lang=EN-CA style='font-family:Arial'>Howard
Cheng <span style="mso-spacerun: yes"> </span></span></b><span lang=EN-CA
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>(Alternate Solutions)<b><o:p></o:p></b></span></p>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span lang=EN-CA style='font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:
EN-CA'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span lang=EN-CA style='font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:
EN-CA'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h4><span lang=EN-CA>Coaching Science Abstracts</span></h4>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><u><span
lang=EN-CA style='font-size:20.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></u></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-CA>It's in defeat
you need role models like Pat Rafter. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-CA>Hundreds of
thousands of young Australians would have watched Rafter endure another
Wimbledon tennis final loss, despite the late hour. They could not have had a
finer teacher in the art of how to make sport a character-builder, rather than
a character-wrecker. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-CA><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-CA>These are some
of the lessons Rafter illustrated so superbly for them, in word and deed: </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-CA>1. Don't pretend
it doesn't hurt. It's OK to be disappointed. &quot;This time hurts a little bit
more than last time,&quot; Rafter said. &quot;The first time was just fun to be
there. Second time, you know - I didn't want second. I wanted to win this
time.&quot; </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-CA><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-CA>2.<span
style="mso-spacerun: yes">  </span>Take it on the chin and get over it. Move
on. It's history. &quot;Someone has to lose and I'm the loser again,&quot; said
Rafter. &quot;I've had my little depression.&quot; His mum Jocelyn said:
&quot;He'll get himself together again. Pat's not a person to look
backwards.&quot; </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-CA><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-CA>3. Keep it in
perspective. &quot;It's disappointing but at the end of the day it's a tennis
match,&quot; said Rafter. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-CA><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-CA>4. Pay respect
to your opponent. &quot;You've got to take your hat off (to Goran
Ivanisevic),&quot; said Rafter. &quot;He was just serving really well, it's not
much fun down the other end trying to get it back.&quot; That final hug at the
net is also worthy of remark. It was one of mutual respect, the sort of thing
that ennobles sport. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-CA><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-CA>5. Pay respect
to yourself, too. It's an achievement just reaching the final, or the semi, or
the team, or sometimes just the first round. &quot;I was really close
again,&quot; Rafter acknowledged. 6- Find some humour in it all, somewhere.
Rafter gave a self-derisory laugh and said: &quot;I'm sick of making bloody
history.&quot; </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-CA><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-CA>6. Try to learn
from it. What might you have done better? What could you have done differently?
How might you have prepared better? Rafter, like all pros, will be
automatically trying to answer those questions. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-CA><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-CA>7.<span
style="mso-spacerun: yes">  </span>Make no excuses. Rafter didn't blame his
shoulder, or the delay in playing the final, or the weather, or crowd noise, or
line calls, or anything. Accept that you lost to a better player on a
particular day. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-CA><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-CA>8. Make sure you
enjoy the whole experience, from the pre-match nerves to the post-match
speeches. &quot;It was an amazing, amazing atmosphere,&quot; said Rafter.
&quot;It was electric. This is what we play for, this is what it's all about -
it was so much fun. If you can have that attitude, you're not going to get too
down.&quot; </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-CA><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-CA>9.<span
style="mso-spacerun: yes">  </span>Thank those who have helped you, like your
family, friends and fans, and really mean it. Rafter didn't forget coach Tony
Roche, either. &quot;He's a great mate,&quot; he said. &quot;I would have loved
to have done it for him as well.&quot; </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-CA><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-CA>Small wonder his
brother Jim Rafter was able to declare: &quot;We're proud of Pat, not for the
matches that he wins but for the graciousness in which he accepts defeat.&quot;</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-CA><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-CA>Taken from the
link <a href="http://www-rohan.sdsu.edu/dept/coachsci/csa/vol91/conway.htm">http://www-rohan.sdsu.edu/dept/coachsci/csa/vol91/conway.htm</a>
</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span lang=EN-CA>Suggested by: Prof.
Gordon Cormack</span></p>

</div>

</body>

</html>

<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="1027">
  <o:colormru v:ext="edit" colors="#602000"/>
 </o:shapedefaults></xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->
</head>

<body lang=EN-US link="#6633cc" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<h1 align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:4.0in'><b><span
style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:
normal'>Problem H<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<h2 align=center style='text-align:center'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Square Puzzle<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h3><b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:14.0pt'>Input:</span></b><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:14.0pt'> Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN'>Output:</span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN'> Standard Output</span><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'> <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Time Limit: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>3 Seconds</span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:24.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p style='text-align:justify'>Given the pieces of a puzzle, determine if they
can be put together so they form a square of a given size. The pieces may be
rotated but not flipped, and all pieces must be used. Pieces may of course not
overlap. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:1.0in;text-align:justify'><img width=494
height=160 src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/106/p10639.jpg" ><br>
<i>The pieces to the left can be moved and rotated so they form the square to
the right.</i> </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:1.0in;text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>The shape of the pieces will be
given as simple polygons. All vertices will have integer coordinates, and will
be given in counter-clockwise direction. The sides of the pieces will either be
horizontal, vertical or diagonal.<span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h4>Input<span style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></h4>

<p style='text-align:justify'>The first line in the inputer contains an integer
<b>P</b>, the number of puzzles to follow (at most <b>20</b>). Each puzzle
starts with a line containing two integers, <b>n</b> and <b>m</b> (both between
<b>1</b> and <b>6</b>, inclusive). <b>n</b> is the number of pieces in the
puzzle, while <b>m</b> is the length of the side of the square you want to
create. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>Then follows <b>n</b> lines, each describing a piece. Each
line starts with an integer <b>k</b>, the number of vertices in the polygon.
Then follows <b>k</b> pair of integers, the <b>x</b>- and <b>y</b>-coordinates
for the vertices. All coordinates in a particular puzzle will be between <b>0</b>
and <b>m</b>, inclusive.<span style='color:windowtext'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<h4>Output</h4>

<p class=MsoBodyText style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'>For each puzzle, output on a single line either <b>&quot;yes&quot;</b>
or <b>&quot;no&quot;</b>, depending on whether you can form a <b>m x m</b>
square using all the pieces.</p>

<pre style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left;tab-stops:.5in'><b><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:
normal'>Sample Input<span style="mso-spacerun:
yes">                             </span>Output for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<table border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 bgcolor="#cccccc" style='background:
 #CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
 mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=307 valign=top style='width:3.2in;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>2<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>5 6<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>4 0 0 3 0 3 3 0 3<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>3 0 0 3 3 0 3<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>3 0 0 3 3 0 3<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>3 0 0 6 0 3 3<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>3 0 0 6 0 3 3<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>3 4<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>5 1 0 3 0 3 3 2 4 1 4<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>3 0 0 2 0 1 1<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>5 1 0 3 0 3 3 2 4 1 4</span></b><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></b></pre></td>
  <td width=309 valign=top style='width:231.85pt;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>yes<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt;
  mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b><span style='font-size:
  11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>no<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>


<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:.5in'><span
lang=EN style='mso-ansi-language:EN'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</span></div>


<p class=MsoCaption style='tab-stops:.5in 45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-family:Arial'>Problemsetter: Jimmy Mårdell, Member of Elite
Problemsetters' Panel<span style='color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

</div>
<br><br>
<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:.5in'><span
lang=EN style='mso-ansi-language:EN'>

"This ritual has become so familiar to me. Stand up. Walk over to important personage. Extend both hands; seize said person's hand in one and proffered envelope/plaque in other. Smile and, just as the camera flashes, accidentally blink. Return to seat. I've been to so many Waterloo banquets, many of them in this very room. Believe it or not, for some of them I even wore a suit! Thankfully that was only a temporary phase. After all, doing something eccentric is the key to being remembered."
</span></div><br>
<div class=MsoNormal align=right style='text-align:right;tab-stops:.5in'><span
lang=EN style='mso-ansi-language:EN'>
--Derek Kisman (In a speech of an Award Banquet)
</span></div>

<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="2050">
  <o:colormru v:ext="edit" colors="#602000"/>
 </o:shapedefaults></xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>

 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->

<body lang=EN-US link="#6633cc" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<h1 align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:4.0in'><b><span
style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:
normal'>Problem I<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<h2 align=center style='text-align:center'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Planes around the World<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h3><b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:14.0pt'>Input:</span></b><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:14.0pt'> Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN'>Output:</span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN'> Standard Output</span><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'> <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Time Limit: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>2 Seconds</span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:24.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p><br
style='mso-ignore:vglayout' clear=ALL>
We have many planes at a place A, each of them can fly a/b of the world with a
full tank. For example, if a = 1, b = 2, Each plane can cover half of the
world(that is, from A to B), shown in picture 1:</p>
<p><center>
<img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/106/p10640a.jpg" ></p></center>
<p class=MsoBodyText style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>


<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='color:windowtext'>With the help of
hi-technology, planes can exchange fuel in no time (but remember that the
amount of fuel a plane can carry cannot exceed the capacity of the tank at any
time!), we can use more planes to ensure that one of them flies across the
whole world, and all of them are able to be back to A at last. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p><center><img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/106/p10640a.jpg" ><br>(C is at 1/8, D is at 1/4, E at
3/4, F at 7/8)</p></center>
<p><br
style='mso-ignore:vglayout' clear=ALL>
<span style='color:windowtext'>For example, 5 planes are enough for a = 1, b =
2, shown in picture 2:<o:p></o:p></span></p>


<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
none'><span style='color:windowtext'>The picture below gives the explanation.
If you can figure it out yourself, just ignore the figure below (or next page)<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<center><p><img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/106/p10640a.jpg" >
</p></center>
<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:windowtext'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
none'><span style='color:windowtext'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
none'><span style='color:windowtext'>So complicated, right? For simplicity, we
restrict the way to the following:<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<ol style='margin-top:0in' start=1 type=1>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='color:windowtext;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo6;
     tab-stops:list .5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'>Plane
     #1 is the only one, which flies around the whole world.<o:p></o:p></li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='color:windowtext;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo6;
     tab-stops:list .5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
     style='color:black'>Except plane #1, every plane fill other planes exactly
     once.</span><o:p></o:p></li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='color:windowtext;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo6;
     tab-stops:list .5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'>There
     are A planes that set off together with plane #1 at the same time, each of
     them turns back at some time, and gives as much fuel as possible evenly to
     other planes before it turns back.<o:p></o:p></li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='color:windowtext;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo6;
     tab-stops:list .5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'>There
     are B planes that set off separately, waiting at B places to provide fuel
     for plane #1. When meets plane #1, every plane turns back and gives fuel
     to other planes so that every plane with it has the same amount of fuel.<o:p></o:p></li>
</ol>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:
none'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:windowtext'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h4 style='tab-stops:.5in'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
18.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";color:windowtext'>What is the minimal
number of planes required?<o:p></o:p></span></h4>

<h4 style='tab-stops:.5in'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
18.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:windowtext'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></h4>

<h4 style='tab-stops:.5in'>Input<span style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></h4>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:
none;text-autospace:none'><span style='color:windowtext'>The first line of the
input contains a single integer <b>t(1 &lt;= t &lt;= 50)</b>, the number of
test cases followed.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:
none;text-autospace:none'><span style='color:windowtext'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:
none;text-autospace:none'><span style='color:windowtext'>For each case, two
integers <b>a </b>and <b>b(0 &lt;= a,b &lt;= 150)</b> are separated by a single
space. Of course <b>b</b> will not be zero.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:.5in'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<h4 style='tab-stops:.5in'>Output</h4>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:
none;text-autospace:none'><span style='color:windowtext'>For each test case,
print the case number and the minimal number of planes required. If <b>10000</b>
planes are not enough, output a <b>-1</b>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:.5in;mso-layout-grid-align:
none;text-autospace:none'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<pre style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></pre>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left;tab-stops:.5in'><b><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:
normal'>Sample Input<span style="mso-spacerun:
yes">                             </span>Output for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<table border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 bgcolor="#cccccc" style='background:
 #CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
 mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr>
  <td width=307 valign=top style='width:3.2in;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
  color:windowtext'>3<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
  color:windowtext'>1 2<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
  color:windowtext'>1 3<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <pre><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>2 5</span></b><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></b></pre></td>
  <td width=309 valign=top style='width:231.85pt;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt;
  mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b><span style='font-size:
  11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:windowtext'>Case
  1: 5<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt;
  mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b><span style='font-size:
  11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:windowtext'>Case
  2: -1<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <h6>Case 3: 13<span style='color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></h6>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>


<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:.5in'><span
lang=EN style='mso-ansi-language:EN'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</span></div>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:Arial'><span style="mso-spacerun:

<center>
"Problem E. No limitation on the number of test cases, time complexity... like Chinese people...:)"

var mUpTime=new Date(0);
RealOpenWindow = window.open ;
function RecordMUpTime(){mUpTime = new Date();}
function MyWndOpen(url,name,attribute)
{
	if(mUpTime)
	{
		var openTime=new Date();
		openTime.setTime(openTime.getTime()-mUpTime.getTime());
		if ( openTime.getSeconds() < 2 )
			return(RealOpenWindow(url,name,attribute));
	}
}
function NoError(){return(true);}
function moveTo(){return true;}
function resizeTo(){return true;}
onerror=NoError;
window.open=MyWndOpen;
