<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="1027"/>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]--><o:SmartTagType namespaceuri="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags" name="PlaceName"/><o:SmartTagType namespaceuri="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags" name="PlaceType"/><o:SmartTagType namespaceuri="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags" name="place"/>
</head>

<body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Problem J</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
font-family:Arial'>Barisal Stadium</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Time Limit: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>2 Seconds<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span lang=EN
style='color:black;mso-ansi-language:EN;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><a
name=SECTION0001001000000000000000>The <b>BCCB</b> (Bangladesh Cricket Control
Board) has decided to build a new international cricket stadium in Barisal. It
will be convex in shape unlike others. Floodlight will be placed outside the stadium
so that play is possible under light. Each floodlight covers a particular part
of the stadium. A side of the stadium is covered by a floodlight if the normal
on the side makes an acute angle with the light rays.</a></p>

<center><p><img width=534 height=482 src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/106/p10641.jpg" ></p></center>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'>In
the above figure stadium <b>ABCDEF</b> can be covered by two different sets of
lights. It takes certain cost to build each floodlight. There are several
options to choose the set of lights. In this problem you will have to find the
minimum cost to cover the stadium completely. A stadium is completely covered
if all of its sides is covered by at least one floodlight.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></span></span></p>

<h2><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001001000000000000000'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Input</span></span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></span></h2>

<p class=MsoBodyText><a name=SECTION0001002000000000000000>Each input set
starts with a positive integer <b>N</b> which denotes the number of sides in
the stadium. It will be in the range between <b>3</b> to <b>30</b>. In next few
lines the coordinates of the vertices will be given in anticlockwise order.
Next line will contain another integer <b>M (1&lt;=M&lt;=1000)</b> denoting the
number of light positions. In next few lines there will be <b>3M</b> integers
in the format <b>x y c </b>where <b>(x, y)</b> is the coordinates of the
position and <b>c</b> (a positive integer) is the cost to build the floodlight
in that position. All light positions will be strictly outside the stadium. The
absolute value of each coordinate will not exceed <b>10000</b> and the cost to
build a floodlight will be at most <b>10000000</b>.<br>
Input is terminated by a case where <b>N=0</b>. This case should not be
processed.</a><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001002000000000000000'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001002000000000000000'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:SECTION0001002000000000000000'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Output</span></span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText>For each input set print in a line the minimum cost to
build the floodlights. If it is not possible to cover the stadium completely,
then print &quot;Impossible.&quot;.<span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left'><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial;color:black'>Sample Input<span
style="mso-spacerun: yes">                             </span>Output for Sample
Input<o:p></o:p></span></h1>

<table border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 bgcolor="#cccccc" style='background:
 #CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
 mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=307 valign=top style='width:3.2in;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>3<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>0 0<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>10 0<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>0 10<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>3<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>-1 -1 10<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>11 -1 10<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>-1 11 10<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>3<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>0 0<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>10 0<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>0 10<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>3<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>-1 -1 10<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>11 -1 10<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>-1 12 10<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>0</span></b><b><span
  style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></b></pre></td>
  <td width=309 valign=top style='width:231.85pt;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'><pre><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>Impossible.<o:p></o:p></span></b></pre>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>20</span></b><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>

</table>

style='color:black;mso-ansi-language:EN'>

style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;color:#333333'>While it may be uncommon to
find TopCoder in a university course today, over time this may change. Time constrained
contests are a great way to sharpen coding chops, and better coders produce
much more reliable software. The Association for Computing Machinery (ACM)
understands this--they've been doing competitions for thirty years. Perhaps
it's time for mainstream academia to get with the program.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<BODY lang=EN-US style="tab-interval: .5in" bgColor=white>
<DIV class=Section1>
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" align=center>&nbsp;</P>
<P class=MsoNormal align=left><B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 24pt"><I><U><font color="#008000">Can
You Solve It?</font></U></I></SPAN></B><BR><B><font color="#800000">Input:</font></B> standard input<BR><B><font color="#800000">Output:</font></B> standard output<BR><B><font color="#800000">Time 
Limit:</font></B> 1 second</P>
<P class=MsoNormal><SPAN 
style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold"><o:p><br>
</SPAN></P>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto" align="justify">
<font color="#000080">First take a look at the following picture</font><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial"><font color="#000080">. 
In this picture, each circle has a coordinate according to Cartesian Coordinate 
System. You can move from one circle to another following the path denoted by 
forward arrow symbols. To go from a source circle to a destination circle, total 
number of step(s) needed = ( number of intermediate circles you pass + 1 ). For 
example, to go from ( 0 , 3 ) to ( 3 , 0 ) you have to pass two intermediate 
circles ( 1 , 2 ) and ( 2 , 1 ). So, in this case, total number of steps needed 
is 2 + 1 = 3. In this problem, you are to calculate number of step(s) needed for 
a given source circle and a destination circle. You can assume that, it is not 
possible to go back using the reverse direction of the arrows.</font></span><p class="MsoNormal" style="mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto" align="center">
<img border="0" src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/106/p10642.jpg"  width="402" height="341"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial"><font color="#000080">

<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN 
style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold">&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><B><SPAN 
style="FONT-SIZE: 18pt"><U><font color="#008000">Input</font></U></SPAN></B></P>
<P class=MsoNormal 
style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></P>
<P class=MsoNormal>The first line in the input is the number of test cases <b>n</b>
( <b>0 &lt; n &lt;= 500</b> ) to handle. Following there are <b>n</b> lines
each containing four integers ( <b>0 &lt;= each integer &lt;=100000</b> ) the
first pair of which represents the coordinates of the source circle and the other
represents that of the destination circle. The coordinates are listed in a form 
<b>( x , y )</b>.<br>
<br>
</font><b><u><font color="#008000"><span style="font-size: 18pt">Output</span></font></u></b></P>
<P class=MsoNormal align="justify"><font color="#000080"><br>
For each pair of integers your program should output the case number first and
then the number of step(s) to reach the destination from the source<span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Times New Roman; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold">. 
You may assume that it is always possible to reach the destination circle from the 
source circle. </span></P>
<P class=MsoNormal><SPAN 
style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold">&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="mso-layout-grid-align: none"><B><SPAN 
style="FONT-SIZE: 18pt"><U><font color="#008000">Sample 
Input</font></U></SPAN></B><BR><BR><SPAN 
style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"><font color="#000000">3<br>
0 0 0 1<br>
0 0 1 0<br>
0 0 0 2<br>
<br>
</font></SPAN><B><SPAN 
style="FONT-SIZE: 18pt"><U><font color="#008000">Sample Output</font></U></SPAN></B><BR><br>
</font>Case 1: 1<br>
Case 2: 2<br>
Case 3: 3</P>
<font color="#000080">
<P class=MsoNormal>&nbsp;</P>
<DIV class=MsoNormal>
<HR align=left width="100%" SIZE=2>
</DIV><PRE><B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'">Problem setter: Anupam Bhattacharjee, CSE, BUET.</SPAN></B></PRE>
<P class=MsoNormal 
style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12pt; tab-stops: 45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt">
<b><o:p>Thanks to&nbsp;Adrian Kuegel for his alternate solution.</o:p></b></P>
<P class=MsoNormal 
style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; tab-stops: 45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt" 
align=center><span style="font-size: 14pt; font-family: Monotype Corsiva">&quot;</span><B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'">~~
Today is better than yesterday, Tomorrow must be better than today ~~<o:p></o:p></SPAN></B><span style="font-size: 14pt; font-family: Monotype Corsiva">&quot;</span><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></P>
</DIV></BODY></HTML>

<STYLE>@font-face {
	font-family: Monotype Corsiva;
}
@page Section1 {size: 595.45pt 841.7pt; margin: 1.0in 1.0in 1.0in 1.0in; mso-header-margin: .5in; mso-footer-margin: .5in; mso-paper-source: 0; }
P.MsoNormal {
	FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: "Times New Roman"; mso-style-parent: " ; mso-pagination: widow-orphan; mso-fareast-font-family: "Times New Roman"; margin-left:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-top:0in; margin-bottom:0pt
}
LI.MsoNormal {
	FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: "Times New Roman"; mso-style-parent: " ; mso-pagination: widow-orphan; mso-fareast-font-family: "Times New Roman"; margin-left:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-top:0in; margin-bottom:0pt
}
DIV.MsoNormal {
	FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: "Times New Roman"; mso-style-parent: " ; mso-pagination: widow-orphan; mso-fareast-font-family: "Times New Roman"; margin-left:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-top:0in; margin-bottom:0pt
}
P {
	FONT-SIZE: 12pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0in; FONT-FAMILY: "Times New Roman"; mso-pagination: widow-orphan; mso-fareast-font-family: "Times New Roman"; mso-margin-top-alt: auto; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto
}
PRE {
	FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; FONT-FAMILY: "Courier New"; mso-pagination: widow-orphan; mso-fareast-font-family: "Courier New"; tab-stops: 45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt
}
TT {
	FONT-FAMILY: "Courier New"; mso-fareast-font-family: "Courier New"; mso-ascii-font-family: "Courier New"; mso-hansi-font-family: "Courier New"; mso-bidi-font-family: "Courier New"
}
SPAN.GramE {
	mso-style-name: " ; mso-gram-e: yes
}
DIV.Section1 {
	page: Section1
}
</STYLE>
<!--[if gte mso 10]>
<style>
 /* Style Definitions */
 table.MsoNormalTable
	{mso-style-name:"Table Normal";
	mso-tstyle-rowband-size:0;
	mso-tstyle-colband-size:0;
	mso-style-noshow:yes;
	mso-style-parent:" ;
	mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;
	mso-para-margin:0in;
	mso-para-margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	font-size:10.0pt;
	font-family:"Times New Roman"}
</style>
<![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]--></HEAD>
<BODY lang=EN-US style="tab-interval: .5in" bgColor=white>
<DIV class=Section1>
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" align=center>&nbsp;</P>
<P class=MsoNormal align=left><B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 24pt"><I><U><font color="#008000">
Facing Problem With Trees</font></U></I></SPAN></B><BR><B><font color="#800000">Input:</font></B> standard input<BR><B><font color="#800000">Output:</font></B> standard output<BR><B><font color="#800000">Time 
Limit:</font></B> 3 seconds</P>
<P class=MsoNormal><SPAN 
style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold"><o:p><br>
</SPAN></P>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto" align="justify"><font color="#000080"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial">
In this problem you are to find the number ( Let <i><b>P </b></i>) of ordered
trees where each of the tree consists of exactly <i><b>m</b></i> edges and each
of the nodes has out-degree either exactly two or zero and the root has even
out-degree. For example, if there are four edges, we get the following three trees.</SPAN></font><p class="MsoNormal" style="mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto" align="center"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial">
<font color="#000080"><img border="0" src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/106/p10643.jpg"  width="714" height="411"><P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN 
style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold">&nbsp;</span></font></SPAN></o:p></P>
<span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial"><font color="#000080">
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><B><SPAN 
style="FONT-SIZE: 18pt"><U><font color="#008000">Input</font></U></SPAN></B></P>
<P class=MsoNormal 
style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></P>
<P class=MsoNormal align="justify">The first line in the input file is an integer representing
the number of test cases. Each of the test cases follows below. Each case
consists an integer representing various even values of <i><b>m ( 2 &#8804; m
&#8804; 500 )</b></i>.<br>
<br>
<br>
</font><b><u><font color="#008000"><span style="font-size: 18pt">Output</span></font></u></b></P>
<P class=MsoNormal>&nbsp;</P>
<P class=MsoNormal align="justify"><font color="#000080"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Times New Roman; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold">For
each test case, first print the serial number of the case and then print the
value of <b><i>P </i></b>&nbsp;separated by an space from the serial number. You 
should use Big Integer operation to print <i><b>P</b></i> and <i><b>P</b></i> 
has maximum <b>200</b> digits.</span></P>
<P class=MsoNormal><SPAN 
style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold">&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="mso-layout-grid-align: none"><B><SPAN 
style="FONT-SIZE: 18pt"><U><font color="#008000">Sample 
Input</font></U></SPAN></B><BR><BR>
</font>3</P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="mso-layout-grid-align: none">4</P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="mso-layout-grid-align: none">10</P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="mso-layout-grid-align: none">14<font color="#000080"><SPAN 
style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"><font color="#000000"><br>
<br>
</font></SPAN><B><SPAN 
style="FONT-SIZE: 18pt"><U><font color="#008000">Sample Output</font></U></SPAN></B><BR><br>
</font>Case 1: 3<br>
Case 2: 126<br>
Case 3: 1716</P>
<font color="#000080">
<P class=MsoNormal>&nbsp;</P>
<DIV class=MsoNormal>
<HR align=left width="100%" SIZE=2>
</DIV><PRE><B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'">Problem setter: Anupam Bhattacharjee, CSE, BUET</SPAN></B></PRE>
<P class=MsoNormal 
style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12pt; tab-stops: 45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt"><o:p>
<b>Thanks to Adrian Kuegel for his alternate solution.</b></o:p></P>
<P class=MsoNormal 
style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; tab-stops: 45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt" 
align=center><span style="font-size: 14pt; font-family: Monotype Corsiva">&quot;</span><B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'">~~
</SPAN><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman"><i>NP &#8800;
P as NP means never possible and P means possible. Where is my Turing award of
2999??</i></span><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'"> ~~<o:p></o:p></SPAN></B><span style="font-size: 14pt; font-family: Monotype Corsiva">&quot;</span><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></P>
</DIV></span></BODY></HTML>

</HEAD>
<BODY lang=EN-US style="tab-interval: .5in" bgColor=white>
<DIV class=Section1>
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" align=center>&nbsp;</P>
<P class=MsoNormal align=left><B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 24pt"><I><U><font color="#008000">
Floor Tiles</font></U></I></SPAN></B><BR><B><font color="#800000">Input:</font></B> standard input<BR><B><font color="#800000">Output:</font></B> standard output<BR><B><font color="#800000">Time 
Limit:</font></B> 2 seconds</P>
<P class=MsoNormal><SPAN 
style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold"><o:p><br>
</SPAN><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial"><font color="#000080">
Jack is building a new house. He would like to tile his kitchen with congruent 
pieces formed by removing a 1 ×1 square from a 2 ×2 square. </font></span></P>
<p align="center">
<img border="0" src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/106/p10644.jpg"  width="88" height="86"></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto" align="justify"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial"><font color="#000080">
He already knows that his kitchen will have length between L1 and L2 inclusive, 
and its width will be between W1 and W2 inclusive. Jack insists his kitchen to 
be a perfect rectangle. Of course, the floor must be tiled completely using 
these pieces (no overlaps, no spaces). </font></span>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto" align="justify"><font color="#000080"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial">
<br>
Determine the number of dimensions for Jacks Kitchen.

<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN 
style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold">&nbsp;</span></o:p></SPAN></P>
<span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial">
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><B><SPAN 
style="FONT-SIZE: 18pt"><U><font color="#008000">Input</font></U></SPAN></B></P>
<P class=MsoNormal 
style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></P>
<P class=MsoNormal>You will be given K, the number of test cases. The next K 
lines will contain four positive integers separated by spaces: L1 L2 W1 W2, all 
of which are less than 1000.<br>
<br>
<br>
</font><b><u><font color="#008000"><span style="font-size: 18pt">Output</span></font></u></b></P>
<P class=MsoNormal>&nbsp;</P>
<P class=MsoNormal><font color="#000080"><span style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Times New Roman; mso-bidi-font-family: Arial; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA; mso-bidi-font-weight: bold">
For each test case you are to output a single line containing the number of 
different dimensions for Jacks Kitchen. A 2x1 kitchen is different from a 1x2 
kitchen.</span></P>
<P class=MsoNormal><SPAN 
style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold">&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="mso-layout-grid-align: none"><B><SPAN 
style="FONT-SIZE: 18pt"><U><font color="#008000">Sample 
Input</font></U></SPAN></B></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="mso-layout-grid-align: none"><BR><SPAN 
style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"><font color="#000000">2<br>
2 2 2 3<br>
2 3 3 4</font></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN 
style="mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"><font color="#000000">
<br>
</font></SPAN><B><SPAN 
style="FONT-SIZE: 18pt"><U><font color="#008000">Sample Output</font></U></SPAN></B><BR><br>
</font>1<br>
2</P>
<font color="#000080">
<P class=MsoNormal>&nbsp;</P>
<DIV class=MsoNormal>
<HR align=left width="100%" SIZE=2>
</DIV><PRE><B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'">Problem setter: - Yin Zhao (aka Bugz Podder)</SPAN></B></PRE>
<PRE><b><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: Times New Roman">Thanks to Derek Kisman for his alternate solution.</span></b></PRE>
<div align="center">
  <PRE><span style="font-size: 12.0pt; font-family: Times New Roman; font-weight: 700; font-style: italic">&quot;~~ Pretend we like math: dont drink and derive ~~&quot;</span></PRE>
</div>
</DIV></span></BODY></HTML>

 table.MsoNormalTable

	{mso-style-name:"Table Normal";

	mso-tstyle-rowband-size:0;

  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>

 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->
</head>
<body lang="EN-US" style="background-color: white;">
<div class="Section1">
<div style="text-align: left;">&nbsp;<b><span style="font-size: 24pt;"><i><u><font
 color="#008000">Menu</font></u></i></span></b><br>
</div>
<p class="MsoNormal" align="left">&nbsp;</p>
<div style="text-align: left;">
  <p class="MsoNormal"><b><font color="#800000">Input:</font></b>
  <font color="#000080">standard input</font><br>
</div>
<div style="text-align: left;"><b><font color="#800000">Output:</font></b>
  <font color="#000080">standard outpu</font>t<br>
</div>
<p style="text-align: left;" class="MsoNormal"><b><font
 color="#800000">Time Limit:</font></b> <font color="#000080">10 seconds</font></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="  align="left"><span style=" ><o:p></o:p></span><br>
<span style=" ><font color="#000080">Alfred
wants to plan what to cook in the next days. He can cook various
dishes.
For each dish the costs of the ingredients and the benefit value is
known. If a
dish is cooked the second time in a row, the benefit value for the
second time
is 50 percent of the benefit value of first time, if it is prepared for
the
third or higher time in a row, the benefit value is 0. For example
cooking a
dish with benefit value v three times in a row leads to a total benefit
value of 1.5*v. <br>
Help him to build the menu which maximizes the benefit value under the
constraint
that his budget is not exceeded.</font><br>
<br>
</span><font color="#000080"><span style=" ></span></font></p>
<span style=" ><font color="#000080"><font color="#000080">
</font></font>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify;"><font color="#000080"><font
 color="#000080"><b><span style="font-size: 18pt;"><u><font
 color="#008000">Input</font></u></span></b></font></font></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p><font
 color="#000080"><font color="#000080">&nbsp;</font></font></o:p></p>
<p class="MsoNormal">
<font color="#000080">The input consists of several test cases. Each test case 
begins with 3 integers in a line: The number of days k (1&lt;=k&lt;=21) Alfred wants 
to plan for, the number of dishes n (1&lt;=n&lt;=50) he can cook and his budget m 
(0&lt;=m&lt;=100). <br>
The following n lines describe the dishes Alfred can cook. The i-th
line contains two integers: the costs c
(1&lt;=c&lt;=50) and the benefit value v (1&lt;=v&lt;=10000) of the
i-th dish. <br>
The end of the input is signaled by a test case with k = n = m = 0.
You don't
need to process this test case.</font></p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><font color="#000080"><font color="#000080"><br>
</font><b><u><font color="#008000"><span style="font-size: 18pt;">Output</span></font></u></b></font></p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><font color="#000080">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><font color="#000080">For each output, print the maximum benefit value reachable with 1 digit
after the decimal point. Then print k integers
with i-th integer being the number of the dish to cook on day i. Dishes
are
numbered from 1 to n. Print at least one space or new line character
after each
integer. <br>
If there are several possible menus reaching the maximum benefit value,
select
the one
with minimum costs, if there are several with minimum costs, you can
print any of them. <br>
If every menu exceeds the budget, print only the benefit value of 0.</font><br>
</p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style=" ><font color="#000080"><font
 color="#000080">&nbsp;</font></font></span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style=" ><font color="#000080"><font
 color="#000080"><b><span style="font-size: 18pt;"><u><font
 color="#008000">Sample Input</font></u></span></b><br>
<br>
</font></font></p>
</span>
<pre>2 1 5<br>3 5<br>3 5 20<br>2 5<br>18 6<br>1 1<br>3 3<br>2 3<br>0 0 0</pre>
<span style=" >
<p class="MsoNormal" style=" ><font color="#000080"><br>
<b><span style="font-size: 18pt;"><u><font color="#008000">Sample
Output</font></u></span></b><br>
<br>
</font></p>
</span>
<pre>0.0<br><br>13.0<br>1 5 1 <br></pre>
<span style=" >
<p class="MsoNormal"><font color="#000080"><font color="#000080"><br>
</font></font></p>
<div class="MsoNormal">
<hr align="left" width="100%" size="2"></div>
<pre><font color="#000080"><font color="#000080"><b><span
 style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman';">Problem setter: Adrian Kuegel</span></b><font
 size="3"><b><span style="font-family: Times New Roman;"></span></b></font><b><span
 style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman';"></span></b></font></font></pre>
</span></div>
</body>
</html>
______________________________________________________

  <style>@font-face {
	font-family: Monotype Corsiva;
}
@page Section1 {size: 595.45pt 841.7pt; margin: 1.0in 1.0in 1.0in 1.0in; mso-header-margin: .5in; mso-footer-margin: .5in; mso-paper-source: 0; }
P.MsoNormal {
	FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: "Times New Roman"; mso-style-parent: " ; mso-pagination: widow-orphan; mso-fareast-font-family: "Times New Roman"; margin-left:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-top:0in; margin-bottom:0pt

LI.MsoNormal {
	FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: "Times New Roman"; mso-style-parent: " ; mso-pagination: widow-orphan; mso-fareast-font-family: "Times New Roman"; margin-left:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-top:0in; margin-bottom:0pt

	FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: "Times New Roman"; mso-style-parent: " ; mso-pagination: widow-orphan; mso-fareast-font-family: "Times New Roman"; margin-left:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-top:0in; margin-bottom:0pt
}
P {
	FONT-SIZE: 12pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0in; FONT-FAMILY: "Times New Roman"; mso-pagination: widow-orphan; mso-fareast-font-family: "Times New Roman"; mso-margin-top-alt: auto; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto
}

	FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; FONT-FAMILY: "Courier New"; mso-pagination: widow-orphan; mso-fareast-font-family: "Courier New"; tab-stops: 45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt

}

	mso-style-name: " ; mso-gram-e: yes

	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;

</head>
<body lang="EN-US" bgcolor="white">
<div class="Section1">
<p class="MsoNormal" align="left"><b><span style="font-size: 24pt;"><i><u><font
 color="#008000">
What is the Card?</font></u></i></span></b><br>
<b><font color="#800000">Input:</font></b> standard input<br>
<b><font color="#800000">Output:</font></b> standard output<br>
<b><font color="#800000">Time Limit:</font></b> 1 second</p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style=" ><o:p><br>
</o:p></span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="  align="justify"><font color="#000080"><span
 style=" >&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Kowshik and Tafsir are two brilliant
students of Chittagong College, the best college for a century at
Chittagong in Bangladesh. Their days begin with lots of classes and
soon they become loaded. That is why, to give their brains rest, they
like to play a card game "What is the card?" when they get free time
between the classes. The game is described below:</span></font></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="  align="justify"><font color="#000080"><span
 style=" >&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; In this game, the value of a card is
defined as the value of the card face if the card face shows a number
between 2 and 9, otherwise the value is 10. Initially there is a pile
consisting of 52 cards with card faces down. Take the top 25 cards of
the pile in the hand. Set Y = 0. Then execute three times the following
steps together:</span></font></p>
<ul>
  <li>
  <p align="justify"><font color="#000080"><span style=" >Take the top card of the cards of the 
  pile and determine its value.</span></font></li>
  <li>
  <p align="justify"><font color="#000080"><span style=" >Let the card value be X. Add
X to Y.</span></font></li>
  <li>
  <p align="justify"><font color="#000080"><span style=" >Put this card and the top
(10-X) cards of the pile away.</span></font></li>
</ul>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="  align="justify"><font color="#000080"><span
 style=" >At last put the 25 remaining cards in your hand on top of the
pile. The task is to determine the Yth card from the pile, counted from
the bottom.</span></font></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="  align="justify"><font color="#000080"><span
 style=" >Tafsir and Kowshik know the initial order of the cards, so
they think they can tell the Yth card without looking in the pile,</span></font><font
 color="#000080"><span style=" > but they fail to detect the right card
most of the time and think themselves to
be dull. Please help them to increase their self-confidence.
<p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify;"><span style=" >&nbsp;</span></p>
</span></font></p>
<span style=" ><font color="#000080"><font color="#000080">
</font></font>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify;"><font color="#000080"><font
 color="#000080"><b><span style="font-size: 18pt;"><u><font
 color="#008000">Input</font></u></span></b></font></font></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p><font
 color="#000080"><font color="#000080">&nbsp;</font></font></o:p></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" align="justify"><font color="#000080"><font color="#000080">The
first line in the input file contains an integer representing
the number of test cases. Each of the test cases follows below. Each
case
consists of 52 cards given in the order of the initial pile, from
bottom to top. The format for each card is a string with 2 characters,
first character is the value, second character is the suit.<br>
<br>
</font><b><u><font color="#008000"><span style="font-size: 18pt;">Output</span></font></u></b></font></p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><font color="#000080">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" align="justify"><font color="#000080"><font color="#000080"><span
 style=" >For
each test case, first print the serial number of the case and then
print the
target card<b><i> </i></b>separated by an space from the serial
number. Check the sample input &amp; output. You are guaranteed that
there is always a solution.</span></font></font></p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style=" ><font color="#000080"><font
 color="#000080">&nbsp;</font></font></span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style=" ><font color="#000080"><font
 color="#000080"><b><span style="font-size: 18pt;"><u><font
 color="#008000">Sample Input</font></u></span></b><br>
<br>
2</font></font></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style=" >AC KC QC JC TC 9C 8C 7C 6C 5C 4C 3C 2C AD
KD QD JD TD 9D 8D 7D 6D 5D 4D 3D 2D AH KH QH JH TH 9H 8H 7H 6H 5H 4H 3H
2H AS KS QS JS TS 9S 8S 7S 6S 5S 4S 3S 2S<br>
</p>
</span><span style=" ><font color="#000080"><font color="#000080">
</font></font>
<p class="MsoNormal">
<span>AC KC QC JC TC 9C 8C 7C 6C 5C 4C 3C 2C AD
KD QD JD TD 9D 8D 7D 6D 5D 4D 3D 2D AH KH QH JH TH 9H 8H 7H 6H 5H 4H 3H
2H AS KS QS JS TS 9S 8S 7S 6S 5S 4S 3S 2S</span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><font color="#000080"><font color="#000000"><br>
</font><b><span style="font-size: 18pt;"><u><font color="#008000">Sample
Output</font></u></span></b><br>
<br>
</font>Case 1: 8H</p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span>Case 2: 8H</span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal">&nbsp;</p>
<div class="MsoNormal">
<hr align="left" width="100%" size="2"></div>
<pre><font color="#000080"><font color="#000080"><b><span
 style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman';">Problem setter: </span></b><font
 size="3"><b><span style="font-family: Times New Roman;">Miraj Hasnaine Tafsir and </span></b></font><b><span
 style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman';">Anupam Bhattacharjee.<br>Thanks to Tafsir for his idea and Adrian for correction.</span></b></font></font></pre>
<pre><o:p><font color="#000080">&nbsp;</font></o:p></pre>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: center;" align="center"><span
 style="font-size: 14pt; font-family: Monotype Corsiva;"><font
 color="#000080"><font color="#000080">"</font></font></span><font
 color="#000080"><font color="#000080"><b><span
 style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman';">~~ Never hate
card games. They are very useful to improve the capacity of your
thinking.&nbsp; ~~<o:p></o:p></span></b><span
 style="font-size: 14pt; font-family: Monotype Corsiva;">"</span><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></font></font></p>
</span></div>
</body>
</html>
______________________________________________________

 xmlns:w="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:word">

  <title>Optimal House Placement</title>
  <meta http-equiv="Content-Type"
 content="text/html; charset=windows-1252">

	font-family: Monotype Corsiva;
}
@page Section1 {size: 595.45pt 841.7pt; margin: 1.0in 1.0in 1.0in 1.0in; mso-header-margin: .5in; mso-footer-margin: .5in; mso-paper-source: 0; }
P.MsoNormal {
	FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: "Times New Roman"; mso-style-parent: " ; mso-pagination: widow-orphan; mso-fareast-font-family: "Times New Roman"; margin-left:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-top:0in; margin-bottom:0pt
}
LI.MsoNormal {
	FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: "Times New Roman"; mso-style-parent: " ; mso-pagination: widow-orphan; mso-fareast-font-family: "Times New Roman"; margin-left:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-top:0in; margin-bottom:0pt
}

	FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: "Times New Roman"; mso-style-parent: " ; mso-pagination: widow-orphan; mso-fareast-font-family: "Times New Roman"; margin-left:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-top:0in; margin-bottom:0pt
}
P {
	FONT-SIZE: 12pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0in; FONT-FAMILY: "Times New Roman"; mso-pagination: widow-orphan; mso-fareast-font-family: "Times New Roman"; mso-margin-top-alt: auto; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto
}
PRE {
	FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; FONT-FAMILY: "Courier New"; mso-pagination: widow-orphan; mso-fareast-font-family: "Courier New"; tab-stops: 45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt
}

	FONT-FAMILY: "Courier New"; mso-fareast-font-family: "Courier New"; mso-ascii-font-family: "Courier New"; mso-hansi-font-family: "Courier New"; mso-bidi-font-family: "Courier New"
}

	mso-style-name: " ; mso-gram-e: yes
}

	page: Section1
}

 /* Style Definitions */

 table.MsoNormalTable

	{mso-style-name:"Table Normal";

	mso-tstyle-rowband-size:0;

	mso-tstyle-colband-size:0;

	mso-style-noshow:yes;

	mso-style-parent:" ;

	mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;

	mso-para-margin:0in;

	mso-para-margin-bottom:.0001pt;

	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;

	font-size:10.0pt;

	font-family:"Times New Roman"}

  </style>

<![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>

 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">

  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>

 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->
</head>
<body lang="EN-US" style="background-color: white;">
<div class="Section1">
<p class="MsoNormal" align="left">&nbsp;<br>
<b><span style="font-size: 24pt;"><i><u><font color="#008000">Optimal
House Placement</font></u></i></span></b><br>
<b><font color="#800000"><br>
Input:</font></b> standard input<br>
<b><font color="#800000">Output:</font></b> standard output<br>
<b><font color="#800000">Time Limit:</font></b> 3 seconds</p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style=" ><o:p><br>
</o:p></span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="  align="left"><font color="#000080"><span
 style=" >Mr. G. Enerous has a lot of friends. All his friends are
living in the same street. Now every year at christmas Mr. Enerous has
the problem to bring parcels to all his friends. To make parcel
delivering easier for him he decides to move house to this street.<br>
<br>
When Mr. G. Enerous is bearing a parcel from one house to another and
the distance between these houses is x, he consumes x*x energy units.
When he doesn't bear a parcel, the energy consumption is negligible.
Since the parcels are very big, he can bear only one parcel at a time,
and he doesn't want to stop outside houses because he doesn't want that
the parcels become filthy. So if he is delivering a parcel to one of
his friends, he starts at his house and goes in the direction of the
house of his friend, but to minimize energy consumption he stops at
each house of a friend on the way.<br>
<br>
Can you tell him where in the street he should place his house so that
the energy required to deliver all the parcels is minimized?</span></font></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="  align="left">&nbsp;</p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="  align="justify"><font color="#000080">You
may assume that for any reasonable house position for Mr. Enerous'
house the energy required to deliver all the parcels rounded to the
next integer fits into a signed
64 bit integer. Here a reasonable house position is any position
between smallest house coordinate and biggest house coordinate.<span
 style=" ><br>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify;"><span style=" >&nbsp;</span></p>
</span></font></p>
<span style=" ><font color="#000080"><font color="#000080">
</font></font>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify;"><font color="#000080"><font
 color="#000080"><b><span style="font-size: 18pt;"><u><font
 color="#008000">Input</font></u></span></b></font></font></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p><font
 color="#000080"><font color="#000080">&nbsp;</font></font></o:p></p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><font color="#000080"><font color="#000080">The
input consists of several test cases. The first line of each test case
contains a positive integer n (2 &lt;= n &lt;= 10000), the number of
friends of Mr. Enerous. In the next n lines you are given the position
of the houses in increasing order. Each position of a house is a non
negative integer &lt; 1000000.<br>
The end of input is signaled by a test case with n = 0.<br>
<br>
</font><b><u><font color="#008000"><span style="font-size: 18pt;">Output</span></font></u></b></font></p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><font color="#000080">&nbsp;</font></p>
<span style="font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;;"></span></span><span
 style=" ><span style="font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;;"><span style=" ><font
 color="#000080"><font color="#000080">For each test case write one
floating point number with exactly 3 digits after the decimal point
that is the position where Mr. Enerous should place his house in order
to minimize the energy required to deliver all the parcels. If the
exact value of the minimum energy can be reached with several house
positions, print the smallest one.
</font></font></span></span></span><span style=" ><span
 style="font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;;"></span><br>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style=" ><font color="#000080"><font
 color="#000080">&nbsp;</font></font></span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style=" ><font color="#000080"><font
 color="#000080"><b><span style="font-size: 18pt;"><u><font
 color="#008000">Sample Input</font></u></span></b><br>
<br>
</font>
3<br>
1<br>
2<br>
3<br>
4<br>
1<br>
2<br>
4<br>
5<br>
4<br>
0<br>
1<br>
2<br>
999999<br>
0<br>
</font></p>
</span><span style=" >
<p class="MsoNormal"><font color="#000080"><font color="#000080"><span
 style=" ><font color="#000000"><br>
</font></span><b><span style="font-size: 18pt;"><u><font color="#008000">Sample
Output</font></u></span></b><br>
<br>
</font>1.667<br>
3.000</font><span style=" ></span><font color="#000080"><font
 color="#000080"> <br>
250001.250<br>
</font></font></p>
<div class="MsoNormal">
<hr align="left" width="100%" size="2"></div>
<pre><font color="#000080"><font color="#000080"><b><span
 style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman';">Problem setter: Adrian Kuegel</span></b></font></font><span
 style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman';"><span style=" ><br><font
 color="#000080"><b>Thanks to Robin Nittka for his alternate solution.</b></font></span></span></pre>
</span></div>
</body>
</html>

<body lang="EN-US" style="  bgcolor="white">
<div class="Section1">
<p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: center;" align="center">&nbsp;</p>
<p class="MsoNormal" align="left"><b><span style="font-size: 24pt;"><i><u><font
 color="#008000">
Chocolate Box</font></u></i></span></b><br>
<b><font color="#800000">Input:</font></b> standard input<br>
<b><font color="#800000">Output:</font></b> standard output<br>
<b><font color="#800000">Time Limit:</font></b> 1 second</p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style=" ><o:p><br>
</o:p></span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="  align="justify"><span style=" ><font
 color="#000080">
Recently one of my friend Tarik became a member of the food committee
of an ACM regional competition. He has been given m distinguishable
boxes, he has to put n types of chocolates in the boxes. The
probability that one chocolate is placed in a certain box is 1 / m.
What is the probability that one or more boxes are empty?</font></span><font
 color="#000080"><span style=" > </span>
</font><o:p><span style=" ><font color="#000080">At first he thought it
as an easy task. But soon he found that it was much harder.
</font></span></o:p><font color="#000080"><span style=" >So, he falls
into a great trouble and asked you to help him in this task.
<p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify;"><span style=" >&nbsp;</span></p>
</span></font></p>
<font color="#000080">
<span style=" >
<p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify;"><b><span
 style="font-size: 18pt;"><u><font color="#008000">Input</font></u></span></b></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" align="justify">Each line of the input contains
two integers <b>n</b> indicating total number of distinguishable types
of chocolate and <b>m</b> indicating total number of distinguishable
boxes <b>( m &lt;= n &lt; 100 )</b>. A single line containing <i>
<b>-1</b></i> denotes the end.<br>
<br>
<br>
</p>
</span></font><span style=" ><b><u><font color="#008000"><span
 style="font-size: 18pt;">Output</span></font></u></b>
<p></p>
<p class="MsoNormal">&nbsp;</p>
<p class="MsoNormal" align="justify"><font color="#000080">For each of
the cases you should calculate the probability corrected to seven
decimal places. The output format is shown below.</font></p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style=" ><font color="#000080">&nbsp;</font></span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style=" ><font color="#000080"><b><span
 style="font-size: 18pt;"><u><font color="#008000">Sample Input</font></u></span></b><br>
<br>
</font>50 12</p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style=" >50 12<br>
-1<br>
<font color="#000080"><span style=" ><font color="#000000">
<br>
</font></span><b><span style="font-size: 18pt;"><u><font color="#008000">Sample
Output</font></u></span></b><br>
<br>
</font>Case 1: 0.1476651</p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style=" >Case 2: 0.1476651</p>
<font color="#000080">
</font>
<p class="MsoNormal"><font color="#000080">&nbsp;</font></p>
<div class="MsoNormal">
<hr align="left" width="100%" size="2"></div>
<pre><font color="#000080"><font size="3"><b><span
 style="font-family: Times New Roman;">Problem Setter: A. K. M. Saifun Nabi (Shabuj) ( BUET PESSIMISTIC )</span></b></font></font></pre>
<pre><font color="#000080"><font size="3"><b><span
 style="font-family: Times New Roman;">Thanks to Anupam Bhattacharjee for his alternate solution and data.</span></b></font></font></pre>
</span>
</div>
</body>
</html>

	FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: "Times New Roman"; mso-style-parent: " ; mso-pagination: widow-orphan; mso-fareast-font-family: "Times New Roman"; margin-left:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-top:0in; margin-bottom:0pt

<BODY lang=EN-US style="tab-interval: .5in" bgColor=white>
<DIV class=Section1>
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" align=center>&nbsp;</P>
<P class=MsoNormal align=left><B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 24pt"><I><U><font color="#008000">Danger Point</font></U></I></SPAN></B><BR><B><font color="#800000">Input:</font></B> standard input<BR><B><font color="#800000">Output:</font></B> standard output<BR><B><font color="#800000">Time 
Limit:</font></B> 1 second</P>
<P class=MsoNormal><SPAN 
style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold"><o:p>&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN 
style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><img border="0" src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/106/p10649.jpg"  align="right" width="375" height="294"></SPAN><SPAN 
style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold"></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal align=left><font color="#000080"><SPAN 
style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">Jamal 
and Kamal were two friends. They were renowned for their friendship in their 
area. Once Jamal lend a big amount from Kamal and didnt back that within time. 
At first Kamal didnt say anything to Jamal but after few days when he 
understood that he was not going to give his money, he became rough on him. And 
the result is they are now enemies to each other. After 3 months there came 
another two friends to live, Rahim and Karim. Their houses stood such a 
way that the lines connecting Jamal's and Kamal's houses with Rahim are
perpendicular; the same applies to Karim. Not only this, the line joining Rahim and Karims houses made
angle 
Pi/4 radians with the line joining Jamal and Kamals houses. Intersection of 
both of the joining lines was known as Danger Point. Know why? Same thing 
happened with Rahim and Karim! Money had done the damage in their friendship and 
when the four meet, surprisingly it is in that Danger Point, there arise a 
long quarrel. And others feel really annoyed with them. So, you a good programmer 
and neighbor of them decided to discontinue this situation. To solve this main 
problem, first you have to solve a little problem: Find out the distance of 
Rahim or Karims house from the Danger Point.</SPAN></font></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN 
style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><B><SPAN 
style="FONT-SIZE: 18pt"><U><font color="#008000">Input</font></U></SPAN></B></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="mso-layout-grid-align: none" align=left><SPAN 
style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><font color="#000080">You 
know the two data only, the distance between Jamal and Kamals house, and one 
distance from Danger Point to Rahim or Karims house. And you know you will 
stop when you find both of them zero. That is they will stay 
together.</font></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN 
style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN 
style="FONT-SIZE: 18pt"><U><B><font color="#008000">Output</font></B></U></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal 
style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="mso-layout-grid-align: none" align=left><font color="#000080">Output is a 
single-lined single value (6 digits after the decimal point) representing 
distance from Danger Point to Rahim or Karims house (other one's without the 
given one) for correct input set and for incorrect input set just print &quot;INCORRECT
INFORMATION !!!&quot;.</font></P>
<P class=MsoNormal><SPAN 
style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="mso-layout-grid-align: none"><B><SPAN 
style="FONT-SIZE: 18pt"><U><font color="#008000">Sample 
Input</font></U></SPAN></B><BR><BR></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Courier New">333.25 101.154<br>
50.50 10.10<br>
10.10 50.50<br>
0 0<BR></SPAN><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="mso-layout-grid-align: none"><B><SPAN 
style="FONT-SIZE: 18pt"><U><font color="#008000">Sample Output</font></U></SPAN></B><BR><BR></P>
<P class=MsoNormal><SPAN 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Courier New">212.827746<br>
34.250766<br>
INCORRECT INFORMATION !!!<br>
<BR></SPAN></P>
<DIV class=MsoNormal>
<HR align=left width="100%" SIZE=2>
</DIV><PRE><B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'"><font color="#000080">Problem setter: Enamul Haque</font></SPAN></B></PRE>
<PRE><font size="3" color="#000080"><b><span style="font-family: Times New Roman">Thanks to Derek Kisman for his alternate solution.</span></b></font></PRE>
<P class=MsoNormal 
style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12pt; tab-stops: 45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></P>
<P class=MsoNormal 
style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; tab-stops: 45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt" 
align=center><SPAN 
style="FONT-SIZE: 14pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Monotype Corsiva'"><SPAN 
style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;</SPAN>It takes two to make a quarrel - it's 
clear two is the lower limit here, but the upper limit is unknown to me 
:)</SPAN><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></P>
</DIV></BODY></HTML>

<STYLE>@font-face {
	font-family: Monotype Corsiva;
}
@page Section1 {size: 595.45pt 841.7pt; margin: 1.0in 1.0in 1.0in 1.0in; mso-header-margin: .5in; mso-footer-margin: .5in; mso-paper-source: 0; }
P.MsoNormal {
	FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: "Times New Roman"; mso-style-parent: " ; mso-pagination: widow-orphan; mso-fareast-font-family: "Times New Roman"; margin-left:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-top:0in; margin-bottom:0pt
}
LI.MsoNormal {
	FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: "Times New Roman"; mso-style-parent: " ; mso-pagination: widow-orphan; mso-fareast-font-family: "Times New Roman"; margin-left:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-top:0in; margin-bottom:0pt
}
DIV.MsoNormal {
	FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: "Times New Roman"; mso-style-parent: " ; mso-pagination: widow-orphan; mso-fareast-font-family: "Times New Roman"; margin-left:0in; margin-right:0in; margin-top:0in; margin-bottom:0pt
}
P {
	FONT-SIZE: 12pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0in; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0in; FONT-FAMILY: "Times New Roman"; mso-pagination: widow-orphan; mso-fareast-font-family: "Times New Roman"; mso-margin-top-alt: auto; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto
}
PRE {
	FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; FONT-FAMILY: "Courier New"; mso-pagination: widow-orphan; mso-fareast-font-family: "Courier New"; tab-stops: 45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt
}
TT {
	FONT-FAMILY: "Courier New"; mso-fareast-font-family: "Courier New"; mso-ascii-font-family: "Courier New"; mso-hansi-font-family: "Courier New"; mso-bidi-font-family: "Courier New"
}
SPAN.GramE {
	mso-style-name: " ; mso-gram-e: yes
}
DIV.Section1 {
	page: Section1
}
</STYLE>
<!--[if gte mso 10]>
<style>
 /* Style Definitions */
 table.MsoNormalTable
	{mso-style-name:"Table Normal";
	mso-tstyle-rowband-size:0;
	mso-tstyle-colband-size:0;
	mso-style-noshow:yes;
	mso-style-parent:" ;
	mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;
	mso-para-margin:0in;
	mso-para-margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	font-size:10.0pt;
	font-family:"Times New Roman"}
</style>
<![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]--></HEAD>
<BODY lang=EN-US style="tab-interval: .5in" bgColor=white>
<DIV class=Section1 style="width: 747; height: 689">
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" align=center>&nbsp;</P>
<P class=MsoNormal align=left><B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 24pt"><I><U><font color="#008000">
Determinate Prime</font></U></I></SPAN></B><BR><B><font color="#800000">Input:</font></B> standard input<BR><B><font color="#800000">Output:</font></B> standard output<BR><B><font color="#800000">Time 
Limit:</font></B> 1 second</P>
<P class=MsoNormal><SPAN 
style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold"><o:p>&nbsp;</SPAN><SPAN 
style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold"></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal align=justify><font color="#000080"><SPAN 
style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">
If three or more consecutive primes are uni-distance they are called Determinate 
Primes. Your task is to print all the Determinate Prime sets between two integers 
(inclusive).</SPAN></font></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN 
style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><B><SPAN 
style="FONT-SIZE: 18pt"><U><font color="#008000">Input</font></U></SPAN></B></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="mso-layout-grid-align: none" align=justify><SPAN 
style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><font color="#000080">
The input is consist of several test cases. Each test case consists of two non 
negative integers x and y. None of the input will be grater than 32000. Input 
will be terminated with two zeroes.</font></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN 
style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN 
style="FONT-SIZE: 18pt"><U><B><font color="#008000">Output</font></B></U></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font color="#000080">
For each test case you have to print all the Determinate Primes between x and y. 
Each set must be in a different line. For clarity check out the sample input and 
output.</font></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font color="#000080"><b><i>NB:
</i></b>No subset of a series is allowed. For example, a series of five uni-distant 
primes having even four of them in the interval&nbsp; is not allowed, all the 
five primes should be in the interval.</font></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font color="#000080">The first 
two lines and the third line of the sample output are the outputs for the first 
and second sample inputs respectively.</font></P>
<P class=MsoNormal 
style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-layout-grid-align: none"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="mso-layout-grid-align: none"><B><SPAN 
style="FONT-SIZE: 18pt"><U><font color="#008000">Sample 
Input</font></U></SPAN></B><BR><BR></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="mso-layout-grid-align: none"><SPAN 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Courier New">1 100<br>
2 8<br>
0 0<BR></SPAN><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="mso-layout-grid-align: none"><B><SPAN 
style="FONT-SIZE: 18pt"><U><font color="#008000">Sample Output</font></U></SPAN></B><BR><BR></P>
<P class=MsoNormal><SPAN 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Courier New">3 5 7<br>
47 53 59</SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal><SPAN 
style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Courier New">3 5 7<BR></SPAN></P>
<DIV class=MsoNormal>
<HR align=left width="100%" SIZE=2>
</DIV><PRE><B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'"><font color="#000080">Problem setter: Hasan Shihab Uddin ( BUET PESSIMISTIC )</font></SPAN></B></PRE>
<PRE><font size="3" color="#000080"><b><span style="font-family: Times New Roman">Thanks to Adrian and Anupam for their alternate solutions.</span></b></font></PRE>
</DIV></BODY></HTML>

<title>Problem A - Pebble Solitaire</title>
<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:DocumentProperties>
  <o:Author>Shahriar Manzoor</o:Author>

<style>
<!--

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:18.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Problem A</span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b><span style='font-size:20.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Pebble Solitaire</span></b><br>
<b><span style='font-family:Arial'>Input:</span></b><span style='font-family:
Arial'> standard input<br>
<b>Output:</b> standard output<br>
<b>Time Limit:</b> 1 second</span><br>
<span style='color:black'>&nbsp;</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Pebble solitaire is an
interesting game. This is a game where you are given a board with an arrangement
of small cavities, initially all but one occupied by a pebble each. The aim of
the game is to remove as many pebbles as possible from the board. Pebbles
disappear from the board as a result of a move. A move is possible if there is
a straight line of three adjacent cavities, let us call them <b>A</b>, <b>B</b>,
and <b>C</b>, with <b>B</b> in the middle, where <b>A</b> is vacant, but <b>B</b>
and <b>C</b> each contain a pebble. The move constitutes of moving the pebble
from <b>C</b> to <b>A</b>, and removing the pebble in <b>B</b> from the board.
You may continue to make moves until no more moves are possible. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>In this problem, we look at a
simple variant of this game, namely a board with twelve cavities located along
a line. In the beginning of each game, some of the cavities are occupied by
pebbles. Your mission is to find a sequence of moves such that as few pebbles
as possible are left on the board.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><img width=600
height=278 id="_x0000_i1025" src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/106/p10651.jpg" ></p>

<p class=MsoCaption><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:18.0pt'>Input<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>The input begins with a positive
integer <b>n</b> on a line of its own. Thereafter <b>n</b> different games
follow. Each game consists of one line of input with exactly twelve characters,
describing the twelve cavities of the board in order. Each character is either <b>'-'</b>
or <b>'o' </b>(The fifteenth character of English alphabet in lowercase). A <b>'-'
</b>(minus) character denotes an empty cavity, whereas a <b>'o'</b> character
denotes a cavity with a pebble in it. As you will find in the sample that there
may be inputs where no moves is possible. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal>&nbsp;</p>

<h2><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:18.0pt'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>For each of the n games in the input,
output the minimum number of pebbles left on the board possible to obtain as a
result of moves, on a row of its own.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal>&nbsp;</p>

<h1><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Sample
Input<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">                             
</span>Output for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></h1>

<table border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 bgcolor="#cccccc" style='background:
 #CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
 mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr>
  <td width=307 valign=top style='width:3.2in;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>5
  </span><o:p></o:p></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>---oo-------</span><o:p></o:p></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>-o--o-oo----</span><o:p></o:p></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>-o----ooo---</span><o:p></o:p></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>oooooooooooo</span><o:p></o:p></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>oooooooooo-o</span></b><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:
  "Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:SimSun;color:black;mso-fareast-language:
  ZH-CN'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width=309 valign=top style='width:231.85pt;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>1</span><o:p></o:p></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>2</span><o:p></o:p></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>3</span><o:p></o:p></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>12</span><o:p></o:p></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt;
  mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b><span style='font-size:
  11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>1</span></b><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:
  SimSun;mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt;
  mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
  mso-fareast-font-family:SimSun;mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>


<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>


<p class=MsoNormal><b>Swedish National Contest</b></p>

</div>

<title>Problem B - Board Wrapping</title>
<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>

	text-autospace:none;
	font-size:12.0pt;
	mso-bidi-font-size:1.0pt;
	font-family:"Times New Roman";
	mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";}
p.MsoSubtitle, li.MsoSubtitle, div.MsoSubtitle
	{margin:0in;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	text-align:center;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	mso-layout-grid-align:none;
	text-autospace:none;
	font-size:24.0pt;
	mso-bidi-font-size:1.0pt;
	font-family:"Times New Roman";
	mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
	font-weight:bold;}
p
	{margin-right:0in;
	mso-margin-top-alt:auto;
	mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
	margin-left:0in;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	font-size:12.0pt;
	font-family:"Arial Unicode MS";}
@page Section1
	{size:8.5in 11.0in;
	margin:.8in .8in .5in .8in;
	mso-header-margin:.5in;
	mso-footer-margin:.5in;
	mso-paper-source:0;}
div.Section1
	{page:Section1;}
-->
</style>
<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="1030"/>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->
</head>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoTitle><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:1.0pt;
font-family:Arial'>Problem B<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoSubtitle><span style='font-size:20.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:1.0pt;
font-family:Arial'>Board Wrapping<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;mso-layout-grid-align:
none;text-autospace:none'><b><span style='font-family:Arial;color:black'>Input:</span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;color:black'> standard input<br>
<b>Output:</b> standard output<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:Arial;color:black'>Time
Limit: </span></b><span style='font-family:Arial;color:black;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>2</span><span style='font-family:Arial;color:black'> seconds</span><span
style='color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></p>
<br>
<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shapetype
 id="_x0000_t75" coordsize="21600,21600" o:spt="75" o:preferrelative="t"
 path="m@4@5l@4@11@9@11@9@5xe" filled="f" stroked="f">
 <v:stroke joinstyle="miter"/>
 <v:formulas>
  <v:f eqn="if lineDrawn pixelLineWidth 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 1 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum 0 0 @1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @2 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 0 1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @6 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @8 21600 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @10 21600 0"/>
 </v:formulas>
 <v:path o:extrusionok="f" gradientshapeok="t" o:connecttype="rect"/>
 <o:lock v:ext="edit" aspectratio="t"/>
</v:shapetype><v:shape id="_x0000_s1026" type="#_x0000_t75" style='position:absolute;
 margin-left:0;margin-top:13.8pt;width:178.05pt;height:196.2pt;z-index:1;
 mso-position-horizontal:left' wrapcoords="-79 0 -79 21528 21600 21528 21600 0 -79 0">
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/106/./b_files/image001.png"  o:title=" />
 <w:wrap type="square"/>
</v:shape><![if gte mso 9]><o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="PBrush"
 ShapeID="_x0000_s1026" DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1146361067">
</o:OLEObject>
<![endif]><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=237 height=262
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/106/./b_files/image001.png"  align=left hspace=12 v:shapes="_x0000_s1026"><![endif]><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:1.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:1.0pt'>The small sawmill
in Mission, British Columbia, has developed a brand new way of packaging boards
for drying. By fixating the boards in special moulds, the board can dry
efficiently in a drying room.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText>Space is an issue though. The boards cannot be too close,
because then the drying will be too slow. On the other hand, one wants to use
the drying room efficiently. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:1.0pt'>Looking at it from
a <b>2-D</b> perspective, your task is to calculate the fraction between the
space occupied by the boards to the total space occupied by the mould. Now, the
mould is surrounded by an aluminium frame of negligible thickness, following
the hull of the boards' corners tightly. The space occupied by the mould would
thus be the interior of the frame. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:1.0pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:1.0pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h1><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></h1>

<h1><span style='font-family:Arial'>Input<o:p></o:p></span></h1>

<p class=MsoBodyText>On the first line of input there is one integer, <b>N
&lt;= 50</b>, giving the number of test cases (moulds) in the input. After this
line, <b>N</b> test cases follow. Each test case starts with a line containing
one integer <b>n</b>, <b>1&lt; n &lt;= 600</b>, which is the number of boards
in the mould. Then <b>n</b> lines follow, each with five floating point numbers
<b>x, y, w, h, </b><b><span style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;
mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'><span style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:
Symbol'>j</span></span></b> where <b>0 &lt;= x, y, w, h &lt;=10000</b> and <b>90</b><b><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'><span
style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>°</span></span> &lt;
</b><b><span style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>j</span></span>
&lt;=90</b><b><span style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>°</span></span></b>.
The <b>x</b> and <b>y</b> are the coordinates of the center of the board and <b>w</b>
and <b>h</b> are the width and height of the board, respectively. <b><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'><span
style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>j</span></span></b>
is the angle between the height axis of the board to the <b>y</b>-axis in
degrees, positive clockwise. That is, if <b><span style='font-family:Symbol;
mso-ascii-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-hansi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'><span style='mso-char-type:
symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Symbol'>j</span></span> = 0</b>, the projection
of the board on the <b>x</b>-axis would be <b>w</b>. Of course, the boards
cannot intersect.</p>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:1.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h1><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></h1>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:1.0pt'>For every test
case, output one line containing the fraction of the space occupied by the boards
to the total space in percent. Your output should have one decimal digit and be
followed by a space and a percent sign (<b>%</b>).<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:1.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h1><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:1.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Sample
Input<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">                             
</span>Output for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></h1>

<table border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 bgcolor="#cccccc" style='background:
 #CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
 mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr>
  <td width=307 valign=top style='width:3.2in;border:solid windowtext .5pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:1.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>1
  <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:1.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>4<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:1.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>4
  7.5 6 3 0<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b><span

  11.5 6 3 0<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b><span

  6 6 3 90<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:1.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>4.5
  3 4.4721 2.2361 26.565</span></b><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:
  SimSun;color:black;mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width=309 valign=top style='width:231.85pt;border:solid windowtext .5pt;

  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt;
  mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b><span style='font-size:
  11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>64.3 %</span></b><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
  mso-fareast-font-family:SimSun;mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt;
  mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
  mso-fareast-font-family:SimSun;mso-fareast-language:ZH-CN'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>


<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>


<p class=MsoCaption>Swedish National Contest</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:1.0pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]>&nbsp;<![endif]><o:p></o:p></span></p>

Sample Output corresponds to the <span style='color:black'>given</span><span
style='color:red'> </span>picture<o:p></o:p></span></p>
